label: 预言破灭之年怪物图鉴 Lost Omens Bestiary

Wine-Soaked.name: 溺酒 Wine-Soaked
Wine-Soaked.description: 当生物在被活化酒器活吞时结束回合，它必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:19]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

Construct Armor (Hardness 4).name: 构装护甲 Construct Armor (硬度 4)
Construct Armor (Hardness 4).description: 与普通的物体一样，活化酒器同样拥有硬度。硬度可以减少其所受到的任何伤害，其数值等同于硬度的数值。一旦活化酒器的生命值降低至一半以下，或是受到重击伤害后，其构装护甲将会破损，其AC降低至17。

Spit Wine.name: 喷酒 Spit Wine
Spit Wine.description: 酒器张开嘴，朝@Template[line|distance:15]范围喷出一股酒水，造成@Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。

Animated Wine Vessel.name: 活化酒器 Animated Wine Vessel
Animated Wine Vessel.publicNotes: 精美的酒器是饮酒者身份的象征，更不用说能自己斟酒的活化酒器了。虽然这些酒器通常是无害的仆人，但它们也会按照指示快速吞下入侵者，将其淹没在烈酒中。

Peng.name: 鹏 Peng

Cloud Cover.name: 云层掩蔽 Cloud Cover
Cloud Cover.description: 鹏呼出一片密云，把自己笼罩在云雾中。鹏获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W直到其下回合结束。

Flap Wings.name: 振翅 Flap Wings
Flap Wings.description: 鹏拍打翅膀，创造出一股强大的寒气，将敌人推开。鹏10尺内的每个生物受到4d6钝击和@Damage[4d6[cold]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic]豁免）。豁免失败的生物会被推离10尺；大失败则被推离20尺并被击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

Calm Weather Aura.name: 天朗灵光 Calm Weather Aura
Calm Weather Aura.description:
1英里。

一头鹏周围的天气总是略有云彩、微风怡人，气温总是处于本季节中温暖的水平。尝试在此光环中改变天气的生物（例如使用操控天气 仪式或造风术等局部效果）必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:32]豁免。否则效果就会被打断。鹏可以通过具有专注特征的单动作启动或关闭灵光。

Windslice.name: 乘风 Windslice
Windslice.description: 鹏能在任何风中从容不迫地飞行。鹏忽视由风引起的困难地形，也不需要在大风中进行空中机动。

Peng.publicNotes:
鹏是一种巨大的鸟类，能毫不费力地飞翔在最高的云层间。它们明亮的羽毛让人很难在蔚蓝的空中瞥见它们的身形，但只要有耐心，观测者就可能注意到一些速度快到不可能是云的移动物。

美丽且优雅的鹏有着最不可思议的起源：残忍的鲲，一条充满怨恨的鱼怪，其对大海深处的偏好与鹏对明亮、开阔的天空的热爱互相对照。在鲲为获得一颗高贵的心而通过沐浴于阳光下来牺牲自己的力量后，它们变成了这种壮丽的鸟，其会尽力避免暴力，除非它们必须战斗以保持自由。鹏不求危险或刺激；他们只想继续自己的漫长旅行，并不受干扰地飞翔。

鹏不追求危险或刺激；它们只想不受干扰地进行远航和飞行。然而，它们有时会与会狩猎它们或阻挡其道路的龙和其他高空飞行的生物发生冲突。虽然凡人不清楚鹏的旅行有什么目的，但与气或自由有关的天界势力有时会要求他们的凡人追随者帮助鹏完成旅程。

鹏那冷静与平和的天性是如此强大，以至于仅是它的存在就能平息风暴与狂风。水手和领航员们认为，看到鹏是好运的象征。每当天空湛蓝、天气在很长一段时间都很温和的时候，人们就会把这种好海况归功于一位看不见的鹏。
Peng.privateNotes:
明确的方向 Clear Direction

格拉利昂上的大多数鹏都出现于天夏南部的天空中。鹏从不筑巢，甚至也不停下休息，并且它们被看到的时候总是朝着南方飞。据鹏自己说，它们并没有目的地：它们的确在朝南飞，但就连它们自己也不知道为什么。一些异想天开的鹏则声称，它们是在追寻自己在很久以前的另一辈子中曾经拥有的梦想。

Collapsing Structure.reset: The building becomes susceptible to Shake Apart again [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} after it's stabilized.

Shake Apart.name: Shake Apart
Shake Apart.description:
Trigger Ebeshra applies any amount of force to the structure

Effect The building trembles. The floors of the building and the streets within 30 feet of the building become difficult terrain; creatures on this difficult terrain take a -2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, AC, and skill checks. The hazard rolls initiative.

Collapsing Structure.name: Collapsing Structure
Collapsing Structure.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:43|name:Brace Building (Athletics)|traits:complex,environmental,kaiju,hazard] (master), @Check[crafting|dc:43|name:Brace Building (Crafting)|traits:complex,environmental,kaiju,hazard] (master), or @Check[engineering|dc:43|name:Brace Building (Engineering)|traits:complex,environmental,kaiju,hazard]{Engineering Lore} (master) to brace the structure to reduce the risk of collapse until the end of the creature's next turn. The DC of the flat check for this round (see Routine) is increased by 4 on a success, or by 8 on a critical success. Increasing the flat check DC to 21 or higher stabilizes the structure, ending this hazard.
Collapsing Structure.hazarddescription: Ebeshra brushes against a structure, possibly causing it to collapse.
Collapsing Structure.routine: The GM rolls a @Check[flat|dc:9|showDC:owner] to determine if the building partially collapses, increasing the DC as listed above. On a successful check, dust and debris fall within the building and 30 feet around it, providing concealment and dealing @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]] damage to [[/r 1d4 #Targets]] randomly chosen targets (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic|name:Falling Debris|traits:hazard,complex,environmental,kaiju] save; on a critical failure, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}). On a critical success, the effect is the same, but the debris deals @Damage[12d6[bludgeoning]] damage to [[/r 2d4 #Targets]] randomly chosen targets instead (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic|name:Falling Debris|traits:hazard,complex,environmental,kaiju] save; on a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by rubble until freed [[[/act force-open dc=38]], [[/act escape dc=35]]]).
Collapsing Structure.stealthdetails: (master) to notice cracks forming in the walls of the structure as Ebeshra approaches

Spectral Devil.name: Spectral Devil
Spectral Devil.allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Accursed Shriek.name: Accursed Shriek
Accursed Shriek.description:
The Spectral Devil unleashes a terrifying whinny in a @Template[cone|distance:30] that deals @Damage[5d10[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:29|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save.

The Spectral Devil can't use Accursed Shriek for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Accursed Shriek]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} by the eerie noise.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage, is frightened 2, and becomes cursed. The victim's mind echoes with the sound of the whinny, impairing concentration. The cursed creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} until the curse is removed.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: Destroying the Spectral Devil releases its pure, evil essence into the world, where it can find a new body and re-form. When the Spectral Devil is destroyed, its essence finds the remains of a dead horse and rebuilds its physical body over the course of [[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}. Only completing a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dbd5W6G8U2vzWolN]{Consecrate} ritual heightened to at least 6th level, which consecrates the site of the Spectral Devil's destruction to a good deity, can prevent the Spectral Devil from returning and haunting the world once more.

Benthic Reaver.name: 底栖掠夺者 Benthic Reaver
Benthic Reaver.publicNotes: 底栖掠夺者是一个50尺高的不死巨怪，它的肋弯曲的肋骨如同巨大的拱门，连接肋骨的脊柱向后延申，分出了三条尾巴。

Intense Chill.name: 极度深寒 Intense Chill
Intense Chill.description: 30尺。@Damage[5d6[cold]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic]豁免）。豁免失败时，该生物的速度承受-15尺状态减值，持续1轮。

Tail Sweep.name: 尾扫 Tail Sweep
Tail Sweep.description: 底栖掠夺者对触及内的所有生物进行一次尾巴打击。这些打击计入底栖掠夺者的多重攻击减值，但多重攻击减值直到底栖掠夺者完成本能力所有打击后才会增加。

Numbing Ice.name: 麻木冰寒 Numbing Ice
Numbing Ice.description: 受到底栖掠夺者幽眼射线打击伤害的生物必须通过@Check[fortitude|dc:41]豁免，否则因寒冷麻木了肢体而获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 2}。正在飞行的生物在此豁免失败还会安全地降落到地面，这是一个强迫移动效果。

Song of the Lost.name: 迷失者之歌 Song of the Lost
Song of the Lost.description:
底栖掠夺者发出一声悲鸣。60尺内所有生物必须进行@Check[will|dc:41]豁免来抵抗它。底栖掠夺者在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Song of the Lost]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用本能力。

大成功 该生物不受影响

成功 生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}

失败 生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}

大失败 如同失败，但该生物还因为同情而陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}

Stone Sister.name: 石姐妹 Stone Sister

Stone Flesh.name: 石质血肉 Stone Flesh
Stone Flesh.description:
构成石姐妹的岩石十分诡异，她们“皮肤”上的无数道裂痕无时无刻不在渗出血液。她对某些法术会有独特的反应，具体如下。

  • 能够变易土石的法术，例如塑石术，会造成@Damage[3d10]伤害或回复@Damage[3d10[healing]]生命，由法术施展者决定。若该法术对岩石极其有害或是有益，GM可裁定该法术只能对石姐妹造成伤害或恢复生命。
  • 解除石化不会将石姐妹变回肉身，而是会削弱她。她在1分钟内会失去对物理伤害的抗力。若她在这段时间内HP降至0，她会被永久摧毁，再不得重组。

Reconstitution.name: 重组 Reconstitution
Reconstitution.description: 除非盖布的诅咒被解除，否则任何石姐妹被摧毁后都会逐渐变回原状。HP降至0的石姐妹需要24小时重组，而破碎成石子或尘埃的石姐妹则可能需要一年或更长时间才能恢复原样。被带出少女之原的石姐妹在重组时总会试图回到少女之原。

Curse of Stone.name: 岩石诅咒 Curse of Stone
Curse of Stone.description:
受影响的生物必须成功通过@Check[fortitude|dc:21]豁免，否则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}（大失败则为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 3}），他们的皮肤会变得如石头般坚韧并因此而在AC上获得+1的状态加值。该状态永久持续，且不会降低。对受诅咒者施展解除石化可暂时缓解诅咒，解除他的笨拙状态，持续24小时，但只有移除诅咒才能永久去除这个诅咒（和它带来的状态）；在诅咒缓解的时间内，受诅咒者会同时失去AC的加值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.UgoM6FBiZfc7KqCV]

Statue.name: 雕像 Statue
Statue.description: 直到她下次行动前，石姐妹看上去都是一尊普通的雕像。她在伪装成一尊雕像的欺骗检定结果与欺骗DC上皆自动取34。由于少女之原到处都是数以千计和她们一样的雕像，且其中大部分都不是石姐妹，因此想要认出哪个是“活的”非常困难。

Stone Sister.hp: 虚能治疗，重组，石质血肉

Harvesting Limbs.name: 收获之肢 Harvesting Limbs
Harvesting Limbs.description: 螳螂进行两次腿攻击。如果两次攻击均命中，螳螂获得10点临时生命值，且目标必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:27]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}（大失败时为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2}）。流失状态会在螳螂降至0生命值时结束。

Sudden Strike.name: 突袭 Sudden Strike
Sudden Strike.description: 在战斗第一轮，尚未行动的敌人对兰花螳螂@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。

Floral Camouflage.name: 花朵迷彩 Floral Camouflage
Floral Camouflage.description: 当躲藏时，五彩兰花螳螂可以从任意数量的叶子和花瓣处获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]，即便这些叶子和花瓣的厚度不足以使其他生物隐蔽。

Elemental Expulsion.name: 元素斥逐 Elemental Expulsion
Elemental Expulsion.description:
需求 螳螂从色彩变幻中获得一种元素特征

触发 其被某个武器打击伤害

效果 元素能量反击这一攻击，使攻击者在攻击掷骰上承受-2状态减值，直到其下回合开始。如果武器包含有与螳螂特征相符的材料（例如土对应投石，火对应火把），则螳螂对此次打击获得全伤害抗力10。

Color Shift.name: 色彩变幻 Color Shift
Color Shift.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 螳螂与五行之一相适应，并相应地改变颜色（土为黄色，火为红色，金为白色，水为黑色，木为绿色）。它获得对应的特征，以及在对抗具有此特征的效果时豁免上+2状态加值，直到其下回合开始。如果螳螂在下回合使用色彩变幻，它必须选择一种不同的颜色。

Five-Color Orchid Mantis.name: 五彩兰花螳螂 Five-Color Orchid Mantis
Five-Color Orchid Mantis.publicNotes:
很少有生物像兰花螳螂一样美丽。它们优雅的外形和颜色都很像花朵，许多人把这种娇嫩的生物当做短命的宠物。虽然这些普通的昆虫对类人生物而言并不危险，但它们仍能捕食比自己大好几倍的猎物。兰花螳螂在花丛中展开身姿，以令人目眩的速度，甚至能用它们锋利的牙齿和强力的撕咬追赶觅食的蝴蝶。

兰花螳螂的寿命自然很短，没有大量的时间来积聚精魂能量。但是，螳螂在足够丰富的环境中可以延长它们的寿命，并逐渐学会理解元素。这些生物成为五彩兰花螳螂，尽管它们性格暴戾，但被认为对齐仲来说尤其神圣。因此，在采集草药时，人们通常会避开或安抚这些危险的螳螂，而不是驱赶它们。

Bul-Gae.name: 天蚀狗 Bul-Gae
Bul-Gae.publicNotes:
天蚀狗是日月蚀的化身。它们看起来像大型犬科动物，不过它们的颜色和特征会随着它们操控热和冷的力量的发挥而改变。根据它们最近释放的是月蚀还是日蚀的力量，天蚀狗分别像一条浑身燃烧着火焰的深红色猎犬或一只碧蓝色的霜冻狐狸。

传说中，第一只天蚀狗试图从天上偷走太阳。当它们咬住燃烧的天体时，天蚀狗被严重烧伤。失败后，他们又试图夺取月亮，但当他们触碰到月亮时，天蚀狗被冻得结结实实，掉到了地上。天蚀狗的后代永远磨练着他们的火和冰的力量，以便有一天他们能在祖先失败的地方取得成功。

传说中，天蚀狗是第一只天蚀狗那古老而阴暗的主人的忠实伙伴。这些故事声称，阴影之主可以透过所有天蚀狗扭曲的光观察世间，并利用猎犬监视物质宇宙以达到未知的目的。

Eclipse Aura.name: 蚀刻灵光 Eclipse Aura
Eclipse Aura.description:
100尺。

天蚀狗周围的光线奇异地变幻着。灵光范围内的非魔法明亮光照减弱为昏暗光照。当生物尝试在灵光范围内使用具有光亮特征的动作时，它必须尝试一次@Check[will|dc:34]豁免。失败时，该动作被打断。

Solar Flare.name: 太阳耀斑 Solar Flare
Solar Flare.description:
触发 天蚀狗受到伤害

效果 天蚀狗在@Template[emanation|distance:30]范围内施放出一道太阳耀斑。区域内每个生物受到@Damage[6d8[fire]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。大失败时，生物还将受到@Damage[2d10[persistent,fire]]伤害。在使用此能力后，天蚀狗的火焰冷却，它无法再次使用太阳耀斑，直到其使用了月爆能力。

Lunar Burst.name: 月爆 Lunar Burst
Lunar Burst.description: 天蚀狗释放出一道异界霜寒，对@Template[emanation|distance:10]范围内每个生物造成@Damage[6d8[cold]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。大失败时，生物还将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 2}一轮。在使用此能力后，天蚀狗的火焰升温，它无法再次使用月爆，直到其使用了太阳耀斑反应动作。

Shadow Leap.name: 影跃 Shadow Leap
Shadow Leap.description:
需求 天蚀狗处于昏暗光照或黑暗中

效果 天蚀狗遁入阴影，然后在40尺内的阴影中重新出现。

Thermal Mastery.name: 热能掌控 Thermal Mastery
Thermal Mastery.description: 天蚀狗能够完全掌控寒冷与火焰的力量。它每次使用颚咬进行攻击时，它可以选择额外伤害造成寒冷伤害还是火焰伤害。

Bul-Gae.privateNotes:
Eclipsed Light

Bul-gaes bring with them the distorted light of an eclipse wherever they go. This distorted light favors blue hues and skews the spectrum of visible colors, giving the world an eerie, muted ambience.

Coordinated Actions.description: 相柳的多个头允许他以两个独立的先攻行动，掷骰两次先攻，以两个结果分别行动。他不能进行延迟。在每个回合开始时，他获得两个动作（反应动作见下文多重反应）。只要相柳还剩余至少一颗头，任何斩下他一颗头的能力都不会导致其立即死亡，但这会导致他失去由被斩断的头所提供的额外反应动作。
Coordinated Actions.name: 协调动作 Coordinated Actions

Bitter Breath.name: 苦涩呼吸 Bitter Breath
Bitter Breath.description:
90尺。

在灵光范围内结束回合的生物，将承受相柳的相柳毒息疾病。

Multiple Reactions.name: 多重反应 Multiple Reactions
Multiple Reactions.description: 相柳九颗头每一颗每轮都会提供一个额外反应动作，这些反应动作只能用于进行颚咬的反应打击。他不能在同一个触发动作上使用超过一个反应动作，即便某个生物离开了相柳触及范围内的多个方格，他只会在每轮第一个回合获得反应动作。

Flood Breath.name: 相柳毒息 Flood Breath
Flood Breath.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:42]

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}（1天）

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2}（1天）

阶段3 流失2和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}（1天）

阶段4 你死亡，身体破碎，释放出一团毒云。你死时@Template[emanation|distance:10]{10尺}范围内任何生物都将承受相柳毒息。（1天）

Great Wave.name: 巨涛 Great Wave
Great Wave.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 相柳汇聚周围所有的水，淹没1英里爆发范围。区域内任何生物必须成功通过一次@Check[reflex|dc:42]豁免，否则朝由相柳选择的方向移动至多60尺。该区域将被30尺深的水淹没，持续1小时或直到相柳死亡，随后自然排干。

Nine-Jawed Frenzy.name: 九颚狂咬 Nine-Jawed Frenzy
Nine-Jawed Frenzy.description:
需求 这是相柳每轮的第二个回合（见协调动作）

效果 相柳行走或游泳两次，可以随意移动穿越更小体型生物所处空间。每个被移动穿越或相邻的生物受到@Damage[(4d8+20)[piercing]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic]豁免）。豁免失败的生物还将承受相柳毒息。

The Great Flood.name: 相柳 The Great Flood
The Great Flood.publicNotes:
很少有生物会像相柳一样在破坏生态的同时还能保持幽默轻松。相柳有着巨大的蛇类身躯，和九颗类人头，每颗头都有着不同的性格，但他们全部都有着一个共同目的，消灭所有不应存在的生命。该生物的目的是为了维持物质宇宙的平衡，确保没有任何事物占据不必要的空间。不幸的是，相柳只会靠他那18只眼睛来判断权衡某人或某物应该存在于何处，甚少考虑凡人的意见。

相柳是一名不朽者，至少不会衰老，他一次冬眠会持续12年。到了第十三年，他就会从海洋深处浮出水面，开始权衡世界的状况，以及其休眠地周围的环境：是否应该毁灭他在陆地上看到的第一件事物？相柳的每颗头都会在此次商议中提供自己的见解和想法，在达成共识后，他要么继续前往下一个地点，要么淹没陆地，将数英里的旱地浸没在海洋的咸水中。如果他认为过剩的生命特别有问题，他甚至会决定用苦涩的呼吸毒化海水，以确保没有任何生命能在他的审判中存活下来。虽然相柳极具破坏性，但他其实并不嗜血，而且常常会给可怜的镇民以供机会，让他们陈述自己的情况，以求拯救镇中的生命。虽然相柳有商量和考虑的余地，但他一旦做出决定，这个似神的生物便会坚持己见。其中一两颗头可能会感到一阵内疚，于是在杀害整个村庄前，他们会给村民讲个小笑话，减轻自己的心理压力。

这个蛇形生物的九个人格经常相互发生争执，一个完美主义，一个冷漠；一个自信，一个贪玩；一个多变，一个多疑；一个富有野性，一个兼爱于人；最后一个则安静而神秘，只对最靠近他的人低语。虽然这些头像兄弟姐妹一样争吵不休，但他们最终总会达成妥协。
The Great Flood.privateNotes:
Passing Judgment

There are no exact criteria or written rules that drive the Great Flood's decisions. It's a matter of aesthetics, opinion, and which head ends up leading the discussion. Generally, however, settlements at odds with their natural surroundings will be treated more harshly.

A Terrible Sense of Humor

A scholar who debated the Great Flood once recorded the following deadpan exchange, serving more as an example of the creature's infamous jokes than providing any actual knowledge.

Scholar: "What lord or power do you answer to?"

The Great Flood: "We don't have a lord."

Scholar: "Then which of your nine faces is your leader?"

The Great Flood: "We don't have a leader."

Scholar: "Then how do you resolve your disputes?"

The Great Flood: "We don't have disputes."

Easy to Call.name: 易于召唤 Easy to Call
Easy to Call.description: 遗忘魔在被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vgy00hnqxN9VoeoF]{异界侍从 Planar Servitor}仪式（也可能是其他仪式，由GM判断）召唤时，等级视作低两级，但他们总是可以自由攻击或离开，而不是进行谈判，除非主要施法者的检定为大成功。

Swipe Countenance.name: 偷窃面容 Swipe Countenance
Swipe Countenance.description:
需求 遗忘魔前一个动作为对目标的成功爪抓打击

效果 遗忘魔复制目标的面容，将其完美地印在自己空白的脸上。虽然他只有脸会改变，但生物必须@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{搜索 Seek}他，并成功通过一次@Check[will|dc:34]豁免，才能将他与原生物区分开。恐亡魔会保持同一张面孔24小时，或直到他们偷走另一个面容。

Forgotten Presence.name: 遗忘威压 Forgotten Presence
Forgotten Presence.description:
触发 遗忘魔在对抗法术的豁免上大成功

效果 遗忘魔将触发法术反射向施法者外的另一个目标。如果遗忘魔戴着目标的脸，新目标在此豁免上承受-2环境减值。

Overwrite Memory.name: 复写记忆 Overwrite Memory
Overwrite Memory.description:
遗忘魔修改30尺内一个目标的记忆，将他们无脸的面孔植入其中。目标必须尝试一次@Check[will|dc:34]豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}，且处于惊惧状态时无法将任何人视作盟友。

失败 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}，且处于惊惧状态时还将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused}。

大失败 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 4}，且处于惊惧状态时还将陷入困惑。如果目标为黄泉使者，其会改为意识到被遗忘的恐惧，变为遗忘魔。

Ijhyeojin.name: 遗忘魔 Ijhyeojin
Ijhyeojin.publicNotes:
遗忘魔曾经是黄泉使者，是引导死者前往骨园的招魂者，作为对他们罪孽的神罚。着时间的推移，他们放弃了自己的角色，成了恐亡魔。有些遗忘魔这样做是因为对必须在来世赎罪感到不公，但所有遗忘魔这样做的部分原因都是急切地想要找回自己的记忆。他们捕食那些因环境而与世隔绝的人或那些执着于自己遗产的人，慢慢切断受害者与朋友，同事和家人的联系。遗忘魔尤其喜欢潜入医疗机构，捕食那些害怕死后被遗忘的病人，夺走他们或探望他们的亲人的重要记忆。通过这种方式进行狩猎也为遗忘魔提供了理想的位置，以引诱黄泉使者走向消逝。

遗忘魔貌似他们曾经作为的苍白皮肤的招魂者，除了其面部没有明显的五官，就像头骨上蒙了一层光滑的皮肤。他们的身体不断扭曲，且活得越久长得越长。
Ijhyeojin.privateNotes:
Fatal Feud

Ijhyeojins regard all joseung sajas as brainwashed servants of the Boneyard who need to be "awakened" from their sense of duty through fear. Despite their perception of themselves as liberators, ijhyeojins delight in watching a joseung saja unravel completely as they become consumed and reborn as faceless sakhils by their own fear.

Pixiu.name: 貔貅 Pixiu

Goldsense (Precise) 120 feet.name: 黄金感知 (精确) 120 尺
Goldsense (Precise) 120 feet.description: 貔貅可以侦测到120尺内黄金的存在，位置，和大致价值。

Good Fortune.name: 好运 Good Fortune
Good Fortune.description:
触发 貔貅，或30尺内一名盟友，将要尝试一次豁免骰但还未掷骰

频率 每小时一次

效果 该生物掷骰触发豁免两次，并采用较好的结果。

Stored Wealth.name: 敛财 Stored Wealth
Stored Wealth.description: 貔貅可以吃下黄金和宝石而不产生不良影响。貔貅的肚子里能够容纳任意数量的金币，通常在100枚左右。每当它受到挥砍或穿刺伤害，等同于伤害数量的金币就会从它的肚子里掉落到所处方格中。

Devour Wealth.name: 吞财 Devour Wealth
Devour Wealth.description:
需求 貔貅前一个动作为成功命中的颚咬打击

效果 貔貅吞掉目标身上至多[[/r 2d12]]枚金币，并获得等同于吞下金币数量的临时生命值。这些临时生命值持续1分钟。

Pixiu.publicNotes:
亲眼目睹貔貅确实是一件幸事——也是一道风景。这种长着翅膀的龙头狮子有着威猛的外表，却掩盖不了它少年般的精力充沛。传说中，正是因为这种过度的贪玩，它们中的第一位被逐出了天堂，并被诅咒要聚敛财富，永不散去。无论如何，每只貔貅都有一种神奇的能嗅出它们爱吃的金子的嗅觉。奇怪的是，貔貅的触摸还能消除诅咒和惩戒恶灵，这也许是它失去的神性的残余。

由于貔貅具有天族的背景和驱除诅咒的能力，人们还认为貔貅是繁荣的带来者和保护者，能招来好运，抵御邪灵。貔貅出身于天庭，喜欢财富，这可能是自古以来帝龙对貔貅关爱有加，将其视为守护者和忠实伙伴的原因。伏藏龙尤其会雇佣貔貅来扩大自己的囤积，许多君龙也将貔貅视为身份的象征。在天夏各地由龙统治的国度中，一个社区里有一只貔貅，就代表着其龙君的认可和善意。

尽管有帝龙的保护，但财富的诱惑仍然足以驱使一些人攻击貔貅。虽然貔貅很少会原谅攻击者，但它也更愿意从那些它认为心地善良但绝望的人身边和平地离开。然而貔貅的龙主人并不总是选择原谅。
Pixiu.privateNotes:
Pixiu Dimorphism

Male and female pixius have notable differences (though, just like natural animals, individuals with the traits of both exist). Males have a golden coat and mane, while females have a blue overcoat. While most pixius have one horn, females with two horns aren't uncommon; curiously, no male pixius with two horns have ever been documented.

Cursed King.name: 受诅君王 Cursed King

Deadly Pursuit.name: 致命追击 Deadly Pursuit
Deadly Pursuit.description:
触发 在受诅君王触及范围内的一个生物试图移动离开

效果 受诅君王行走至多它速度的距离，确保该生物处于自己的触及范围内，直到该生物停止移动，或受诅君王的移动距离达到速度上限。若在移动结束后该生物仍在受诅君王触及范围内，受诅君王可对该生物进行一次双颚打击。

False Authority.name: 伪权威 False Authority
False Authority.description: 30尺。当一个生物进入受诅君王的灵光范围或在其范围内结束回合时，他必须进行@Check[will|dc:26]豁免检定。若检定失败，该生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。若大失败，该生物还会被吓到臣服；除了获得惊惧2外，他还必须使用其回合中的第一个动作向受诅君王下跪或逃离受诅君王。豁免成功的生物将在24小时内对受诅君王的伪权威免疫。

Usurper's Curse.name: 篡位者的诅咒 Usurper's Curse
Usurper's Curse.description: @Check[will|dc:30]豁免骰。豁免失败后，杀死受诅君王的生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}。大失败则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}。只要该生物还被诅咒，它就无法以任何方式移除或降低呆滞状态值。承受诅咒的生物每24小时必须再次进行一次豁免检定，失败呆滞状态值+1，大失败+2。若呆滞状态值超过@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 4}，受诅咒者身体和心灵都被变形为与受诅君王的头颅相同的动物，如同法术@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]豁免大失败的效果。

Berserk.name: 狂怒 Berserk
Berserk.description: 在受诅君王战斗时，每当它的回合开始，它都必须进行@Check[flat|dc:2]检定。若检定成功通过，则DC+1。若它检定失败，则会立刻陷入狂怒，在该回合的剩余时间内陷入无心智的状态，并攻击能够到的最近的生物。在受诅君王狂怒时，它所有的无武装打击获得致命d8特征。在它检定失败的那回合结束时，或是战斗遭遇结束的那一刻，狂怒的检定DC重置为2。

Cursed King.publicNotes:
受诅君王的存在乃是对心怀大志之人的怪诞嘲弄。当叛国的谋士、伪先知和叛军头领被邪恶的统治者抓获后，他们在处决前往往会遭受各种酷刑和羞辱。但受诅君王甚至连死后的尊严都保不住，在被斩首后，他们的断颈被缝上了一个干瘪的动物头颅。然后，这些恐怖的木乃伊会被人披上精美的亚麻布衣，戴上与皇族相称的珠宝——成为一个“鲜活”的案例，永远的警示着妄图僭越自己地位的人会落得何种下场。

受诅君王被他们生前对抗的君王所奴役，被迫为后者充当保镖。哪怕它们的创造者身故也不得解脱，它们注定永世守护正统君主的陵墓。

Imugi.name: 螭龙 Imugi
Imugi.publicNotes:
螭龙是有着巨大魔法潜能的类龙巨蛇，能够飞升成另一种形态。虽然有些帝龙生来便是帝龙了，但目前游荡在天夏的许多帝龙都是飞升而来的螭龙——尽管他们会攻击任何如此声称的人。

要变成帝龙，螭龙必须照顾一枚锦鲤卵一千年。来自被培育的卵的力量足以驱动龙族飞升仪式，而剩余的力量会将锦鲤转化为螭龙，继续循环。螭龙会变成哪种帝龙取决于他们在何处培育的锦鲤卵。螭龙尤其喜欢鱼鳍长的锦鲤，而天夏的锦鲤养殖户已经学会将这些蝴蝶锦鲤鱼其他锦鲤分开饲养，因为螭龙扑下来抢走想要的卵时，往往会带走大量的水——还有锦鲤。

虽然螭龙对降雨和风暴有一定的掌控力，但大多数螭龙的力量还不足以真正控制天气。许多螭龙都以善行著称，有些村庄甚至会依赖螭龙在溪流和湖泊中觅食，在生长季节带来降雨。螭龙的脾气就像他们化成的龙一样千差万别，一些螭龙因其急躁的脾气演变成暴躁或傲慢，而把人当成虫子一样撵到一边。虽然有些人可能会认为刻薄的螭龙已经堕落，并声称他们可以通过某种方式得到净化，但螭龙只是把自己看得比普通生物更高，认为没有理由向他们认为低人一等的人隐瞒自己的本性。

Nesting.name: 筑巢 Nesting
Nesting.description: 在蝴蝶锦鲤卵周围盘绕1分钟，螭龙就会指定它为自己选定的继承者，这会授予螭龙对这枚卵的常驻关照术效果。如果鱼卵被毁坏或无法存活，该螭龙在一周后可以用此能力选择一枚新锦鲤卵。

Parental Wrath.name: 家长之怒 Parental Wrath
Parental Wrath.description:
触发 某个生物对螭龙选定的锦鲤卵造成伤害，或在卵40尺内结束回合

效果 螭龙朝触发生物行走或游泳。如果他在移动结束时处于该生物的触及范围内，他对其尝试一次近战打击。

Floodwaters.name: 洪水 Floodwaters
Floodwaters.description: 水流冲向前方@Template[line|distance:60]范围，造成@Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。豁免失败且未@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于螭龙的生物被推离10尺。

Storm Veil.name: 风暴帷幕 Storm Veil
Storm Veil.description: 螭龙将附近的降水扭转成冻雨与风的旋涡状帷幕。他在任何形式的雾和雨中都会获得隐蔽。

Imugi.privateNotes:
Imperial Ascension

The ritual an imugi undergoes to become a true dragon releases a burst of overwhelming magic. Characters exposed to this burst might find their minds filled with lost techniques or abilities that the imugi has encountered over its long life, allowing them to gain access to uncommon or rare character options, suddenly understand formulas to craft items, or immediately retrain along a new path

Ablative Adaptation.name: Ablative Adaptation
Ablative Adaptation.description:
Frequency once per minute

Trigger The Grand Defender's resistance to physical damage is overcome by the resistance's exception

Effect The Grand Defender sheds the outer layer of its body, altering its material composition and general appearance. The material that overcomes the Grand Defender's resistance changes to adamantine, cold iron, dawnsilver, or silver (Grand Defender's choice).

Vulnerable to Rust.name: Vulnerable to Rust
Vulnerable to Rust.description: Magical rusting effects, like a rust monster's antennae, affect the Grand Defender normally.

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by acid (@Damage[8d10[untyped]], @Damage[2d10[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by fire (area @Damage[2d10[healing]] HP); slowed by electricity

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

Hammer Storm.name: Hammer Storm
Hammer Storm.description: The Grand Defender unleashes a volley of warhammers that deal @Damage[12d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:50] (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic|options:area-effect] save). The Grand Defender can exclude any number of squares from the cone's area, preventing damage to creatures in those squares. Creatures that critically fail their save are pushed 10 feet away from the Grand Defender and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The storm creates 24 Medium @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.rXt4629QSg7KDTgJ]{warhammers} that persist after the attack and can be used by creatures. The Grand Defender can't use Hammer Storm for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hammer Storm]]{1d4 rounds}.

Grand Defender.name: Grand Defender
Grand Defender.publicNotes: Hand-carved by the Father of Creation himself and strengthened by the souls of history's most heroic dwarves, the Grand Defender serves as Torag's herald across the planes. While a true messenger of a deity, the Grand Defender manifests itself in a unique way to other heralds. The chassis of the Grand Defender exists within Forgeheart, Torag's subterranean realm in Heaven. This frame is empty, however, and can only serve basic functions, much like a golem. When faithful call upon the Grand Defender, Torag rouses the construct with spirits. As the might of the Grand Defender comes from Torag's will and the power of the souls within, the Grand Defender can take on any number of forms. Torag can send these spirits to alter any sufficiently sized statue of a dwarven ancestor. This process temporarily converts the carving into the Grand Defender itself, complete with its abilities and equipment.

Toolbreaker.description: Temteki can only target worked or crafted items with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter}, not natural objects.
Toolbreaker.name: Toolbreaker

Imposing Mien.name: Imposing Mien
Imposing Mien.description: Temteki can use Intimidation to Coerce or Demoralize up to four targets instead of one, rolling separate Intimidation checks against the Will DCs of each target. In addition, since Temteki Demoralizes using its appearance alone, it doesn't take a penalty to Intimidation checks to Demoralize for not speaking a language.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: Temteki can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, it moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnel or sign of its passing.

Interposing Earth.name: Interposing Earth
Interposing Earth.description:
Trigger Temteki is targeted with a melee or ranged attack from an attacker it can see

Effect Temteki raises earth to block, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Earthen Cypress.name: Earthen Cypress
Earthen Cypress.description:
Requirements Temteki is standing on the ground

Effect Temteki draws up the earth around itself into the shape of a cypress tree. While in this stance, Temteki's reach for spike Strikes increases to 15 feet, but Temteki can't move except to Burrow into the ground using Earth Glide. Doing so causes Temteki to leave this stance and creates a heap of earth in the square Temteki left, making the square difficult terrain.

Temteki.name: Temteki
Temteki.publicNotes: Though it superficially resembles a cypress tree and is easily mistaken for an arboreal or other similar plant creature, Temteki is actually an earth elemental, a creature of living earth and stone. In normal situations, Temteki is content to remain still and blend into the jungle when observing other creatures, using its natural camouflage to assist in harrying those it considers interlopers disturbing its home. Temteki usually dissuades such intruders with a combination of surprise attacks and nonlethal snares; the elemental is more interested in getting them to leave than in dealing them any permanent harm. However, to those who prove determined to harm Temteki or its home, Temteki can be an implacable foe. Temteki's asymmetrical gait and appearance often alarm and confuse creatures who aren't expecting to spot it, especially since it's surprisingly stealthy for its size and appearance.

Reap Memory.name: 收割记忆 Reap Memory
Reap Memory.description:
黄泉使者凝视30尺内一个生物的眼睛，移除阻碍其走向死亡的不便或痛苦的记忆。目标会意识到黄泉使者在试图改变它的记忆，并可以尝试意志豁免进行抵抗。自愿目标受到大失败效果。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 目标受到@Damage[2d10[mental]]伤害，并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}，持续1轮。

失败 目标受到@Damage[4d10[mental]]伤害，并陷入呆滞2，持续1周。

大失败 目标失去所有痛苦的情绪和记忆，只留下一片模糊不清的阴霾。如果目标是遗忘魔，那么其所有记忆都将被收割，然后变为黄泉使者。

Reap Souls.name: 收割灵魂 Reap Souls
Reap Souls.description:
触发 黄泉使者使目标降至0生命值，或成功打击一个具有濒死状态的目标

效果 目标必须成功通过一次@Check[will|dc:34]豁免，否则立即死亡。被收割的生物不能复活或成为不死生物，除非通过不低于9环级的仪式。

Shifting Form.name: 变幻形态 Shifting Form
Shifting Form.description: 黄泉使者成为虚体直到其下回合结束。当其成为虚体时，他获得全伤害抗力10（力场，虚能，幽冥武器除外）。

Spirit Touch.name: 精魂之触 Spirit Touch
Spirit Touch.description: 黄泉使者所有攻击都具有幽冥性能符文效果，并对所有活物造成额外@Damage[3d6[void]]伤害，对所有不死生物造成额外@Damage[3d6[vitality]]伤害。

Joseung Saja.name: 黄泉使者 Joseung Saja
Joseung Saja.publicNotes:
黄泉使者是有时候赋予给生前犯下严重罪孽的转世生物的名字。这些面色苍白、眼睛凹陷的生物亦被称作死神，他们是招魂者——引导亡者灵魂前往骨园的存在。没有人知道成为黄泉使者的具体标准，但那些被选中的人会被抹除记忆，必须作为黄泉使者工作，直到他们被认为完全赎罪。

来自不同时代的黄泉使者在世界上游荡，当一个生物濒临死亡时，就会出现一名黄泉使者，作为目标来世的向导，等待其死亡。必要时，他们甚至会篡改目标人物的记忆，消除可能将他们束缚在凡间的痛苦情绪，让他们安详地死去。这一职责可以防止那些悲惨或暴力死亡的人变成幽灵而被束缚在这个世界上——这是一种慈悲，虽然经常不受黄泉使者的监护所赏识。如果被黄泉使者盯上的生物变成了不死生物或以其他方式逃避死亡，这位死神就必须履行他的职责，赋予该生物真正的死亡。

因为黄泉使者会在人间徘徊，以旅行他们的职责，他们也是最常见的招魂者之一。
Joseung Saja.privateNotes:
Death-long Career

Even after atoning for their sins and regaining their memories, some souls choose to retain their titles as joseung sajas. These experienced reapers hunt ijhyeojin, former joseung sajas who have abandoned their posts. To joseung sajas, an ijhyeojin is no more than just another soul overstaying its welcome in the world of the living.

Animated Bamboo Figurine.name: 活化竹人 Animated Bamboo Figurine
Animated Bamboo Figurine.publicNotes: 编织成复杂图案的柔软而结实的竹条，构成了活化竹人的底座。这些材料来源丰富，容易获得，虽然制作过程需要极大的细心和耐心，但它们是偏远社区的理想守护者。这些中空柔韧的手工艺品可以拉伸或压缩，跳跃和弹跳的距离比大多数类人生物都要远。

Construct Armor (Hardness 3).name: 构装护甲 Construct Armor (硬度 3)
Construct Armor (Hardness 3).description: 与普通的物体一样，活化竹人同样拥有硬度。硬度可以减少其所受到的任何伤害，其数值等同于硬度的数值。一旦活化竹人的生命值降低至一半以下，或是受到重击伤害后，其构装护甲将会破损，其AC降低至16。

Spring Forward.name: 弹跳冲击 Spring Forward
Spring Forward.description: 活化竹人跳跃至多30尺，然后对不同目标进行两次拳头打击。它可以在此行动之后使用击倒，对每个被打击的生物尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{摔绊 Trip}。

Rompo.publicNotes:
Rompos are unusual creatures that feed on corpses. They have thin, almost-skeletal bodies with strong rear legs that resemble a bear's, front legs like a badger's, and a head like a hare's with humanoid ears. A rompo tends to be timid on its own; it avoids other creatures and typically flees in the presence of larger animals. Though no more intelligent than any other beast, it usually acts with extreme paranoia, dodging traps or ambushes with an uncanny acumen. When danger is present, a rompo utters a loud cry to afford itself space to run and hides by using its body's natural color-shifting fur as camouflage.

Although rompos sport the perfect physical features to act as predators, they tend to live their lives as solitary scavengers of leftover corpses. Rompos prefer to avoid hunting for themselves since they risk sustaining injuries in the process. It's not uncommon for rompos to follow other predators for hours, waiting for an opportunity to feast on the leftover remains of a hunt.

Once a rompo gains access to a meal, it takes several minutes circling the corpse to make sure the area is clear. As it begins to feast, it lets out a whimpering cry that fascinates and compels other creatures to keep away so that the rompo can feed in peace. Due to its constant feeding on decaying flesh, a rompo's mouth is filled with rot, parasites, and deadly pathogens. Its bite can impart these combined infections as a dangerous disease known as rompo chills. The disease causes its victim to tremble uncontrollably, lightly at first but eventually developing into a violent shaking that ends with the victim's death. Despite their cautious nature, rompos always seem to linger close to creatures they infect with rompo chills; though they remain unseen while the victim lives, they emerge when that victim finally succumbs, in order to feed on the corpse.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: The rompo can change its coloration to match its surroundings. It doesn't need cover to attempt to Hide with a Stealth check.

Crooning Cry.name: Crooning Cry
Crooning Cry.description:
60 feet. The rompo hums in a low voice. Each creature within the emanation must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:19] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} and compelled to move away from the rompo, traveling to the furthest edge of the emanation. Fascinated creatures are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.

The effect lasts for 1 round, but if the rompo spends a single action on subsequent rounds, it can extend the duration by 1 round for all affected creatures. If the rompo attacks, the fascinated condition ends only for the creature that is attacked.

On a successful save, a creature is temporarily immune to Crooning Cry for 24 hours.

Rompo Chills.name: Rompo Chills
Rompo Chills.description:
The target can't reduce its sickened condition while affected by rompo chills

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 Clumsy 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead

Rompo.name: Rompo

Spell Pitchers.name: Spell Pitchers
Spell Pitchers.stealthdetails: (trained) to recognize the plant among others
Spell Pitchers.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:15] (trained) to safely trigger the plant's reflexes, causing it to close and become dormant for one day, or @Check[nature|dc:17] (trained) to carefully coax the pitcher into quiescence
Spell Pitchers.hazarddescription: A large pitcher plant occupying a 5-foot space sits seemingly dormant with its dull petals open.
Spell Pitchers.reset: Once the pitcher has eaten a spell, its petals turn dark pink and green before it closes. It goes dormant for one day per spell rank of the spell consumed. Once the pitcher finishes digesting, it opens again and slowly wilts. A second pitcher branches into an adjacent square when the first pitcher opens again.

Devour Magic.name: Devour Magic
Devour Magic.description:
Trigger A spell's direct line of effect passes within a 5-foot-radius of the plant

Effect The pitcher attempts to counteract the spell (counteract rank 1, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+10 #Counteract]]{+10}). On a success, the pitcher immediately consumes the spell as it passes over the plant.

Viper Tail.name: 蛇尾 Viper Tail
Viper Tail.description:
触发 鵺15尺内一个生物在所使用的一次移动动作中离开或进入一个会使鵺陷入夹击的方格

效果 鵺鞭笞周围，对触发生物尝试一次尾打击。此打击既不累计也不应用鵺的多重攻击减值。

Cloud Form.name: 云团形态 Cloud Form
Cloud Form.description: 鵺变形成为一团黑色的风暴云。处于云团形态时，鵺获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]，以及60尺飞行速度，在阻止其他人看穿其伪装的欺骗DC上获得+4状态加值，并无法攻击，但可以使用其嚎叫能力。鵺可以解消此效果。

Monstrous Howl.name: 怪物嚎叫 Monstrous Howl
Monstrous Howl.description:
鵺发出阴森恐怖的嚎叫，让生物的灵魂发颤。60尺内的生物必须尝试一次@Check[will|dc:27]豁免（在夜间DC29）。他们随后临时免疫怪物嚎叫10分钟。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物受到@Damage[2d8[persistent,void]]伤害。

失败 同成功，外加目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}。

大失败 同成功，外加目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2}与@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。

Thundering Howl.name: 雷霆嚎叫 Thundering Howl
Thundering Howl.description: 鵺向天空发出嚎叫，召唤一道闪电束打击离鵺最近的生物，最大射程60尺。闪电束造成@Damage[12d6[electricity]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic]豁免）。鵺不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}内再次使用雷霆嚎叫。

Nue.name: 鵺 Nue
Nue.publicNotes:
鵺是一种古老的生物，体型巨大，破坏力极强。虽然很稀有，但它被描述为有猴子的头，狸猫的身体，老虎的四肢，和蛇的尾巴。与这种魔兽怪异的身体相符合的是，它能仅靠嚎叫便能消耗周围的生命力。

根据某些传说，在远古时代，鵺会肆意恐吓王国，给受害者带来噩梦。它最初表现为巨大的风暴云，然后变成有毒的黑色。被激怒时，鵺可以召唤闪电，造成巨大的附带伤害。听到鵺的嚎叫被认为是不祥之兆。
Nue.privateNotes:
鵺的诅咒 Curse of the Nue

即使在死后，鵺的灵魂也会给周围的人带来灾难。压制诅咒的一种方法是举行埋葬仪式，并在鵺的坟墓上方垒起封土。另一种完全避免诅咒的方法是让尸体沿江顺流而下，或将它埋得远远的。据说诅咒本身是通过附身来发泄愤怒的；有些人认为这就是鵺诞生的方式。

Jelly Sense.name: Jelly Sense
Jelly Sense.description: Taljjae has scent as a precise sense out to 120 feet, but only to detect buckwheat jelly, the only food Taljjae loves more than flesh.

Change Characters.name: Change Characters
Change Characters.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Taljjae removes its current mask and dons a new one. The change refreshes Taljjae, restoring 25 Hit Points. Once Taljjae has removed a mask, it can't Change Characters back to that mask until it has worn all of its unbroken masks at least once, after which the cycle starts again. Taljjae can't don a broken mask.

When Taljjae Changes Characters, it gains access to the listed abilities. Any items (such as weapons) associated with its previous mask immediately disappear and are replaced by fresh ones for its new mask, but the effects of any mask abilities it has active persist. Removing a mask and later reapplying it doesn't restore any limited-use abilities.

Prop Master.name: Prop Master
Prop Master.description: Taljjae has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields from one of its masks.

Exit Stage.name: Exit Stage
Exit Stage.description:
Trigger Taljjae is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect Taljjae retains 1 Hit Point and teleports to an empty space within 30 feet. One of its masks remains behind and is broken.

Jelly Gluttony.name: Jelly Gluttony
Jelly Gluttony.description: If Taljjae detects buckwheat jelly with its jelly sense, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the food and the creature possessing it (if applicable) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to all other creatures for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, or until it uses an appropriate number of Interact actions to consume the jelly (generally 2: 1 to take the jelly, and another to eat it). If there's more than one helping of jelly, the condition ends once Taljjae consumes the jelly once.

Second Act.name: Second Act
Second Act.description:
Trigger Taljjae's turn begins Requirements Taljjae has 200 or fewer Hit Points

Effect Taljjae's dance reaches a frantic climax, allowing it to change personas rapidly. Taljjae Changes Characters.

Taljjae (The Beast).name: Taljjae (The Beast)
Taljjae (The Beast).publicNotes:
The form of Taljjae's body can vary from visit to visit or even moment to moment, but it's easily recognized due to its signature cloak and masks. So long as Taljjae's mood is placid, it can be approached safely, but its mercurial temperament can be hard to predict.

With this mask, Taljjae assumes a low stance and gathers power.

Lizard Poison.name: Lizard Poison
Lizard Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and clumsy 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 2d6 poison damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Draft Lizard.name: Draft Lizard
Draft Lizard.publicNotes:
Stout reptiles with scales in a checkered gold and white pattern, draft lizards sport powerful jaws and even stronger backs capable of hauling loads four times their own weight. Native to the underground tunnels of the Five Kings Mountains, the reptiles have been domesticated to serve as beasts of burden within the Depths and sprawling web of passages beyond. Zoologists theorize that they are a part of the same reptile family as zetogekis, as the two share a similar build and other physical characteristics.

Draft lizards within the vicinity of Highhelm have adapted their diet to feed mainly on grindlegrubs. However, residual behavior suggests in lean times or before domestication they would devour stones for sustenance. The animals can still be observed habitually gnawing on boulders or large stones, cracking them with their powerful jaws and seeming to savor the taste as they roll the debris around in their mouths. Overworked draft lizards will stray from their handler's control in order to consume rocks, only to return back to their path with a new undercurrent of purpose.

Normally as docile as any other beast of burden, the draft lizards of Highhelm will defend themselves if attacked by predators from the Darklands. Curiously, the lizards have an intense hatred for hryngars, attacking them without any prompting or hesitation. No dwarven records indicate teaching this behavior during the domestication of the animals, leaving its origins a mystery. Some caravanners even claim that the reptiles can sense the presence of hryngars, giving advanced warning of attacks by hissing menacingly into the darkness.

Though too large to be exceptionally dexterous, with careful training some draft lizards can be taught performative tricks. The Rolling Wheel is particularly known for a trio of reptiles that balance on their tails, catch hurled boulders in their jaws, and other stunts. The spectacle is well known in Highhelm, considered one of the big acts that the group performs. This has led to some younger dwarves attempting to teach their animals the same feats, mostly resulting in failure and light property damage in the Depths.

Spellscar Fext.name: Spellscar Fext

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Unstable Feedback.name: Unstable Feedback
Unstable Feedback.description:
Trigger A creature Casts a Spell on the spellscar fext, and the spellscar fext either succeeds at its saving throw versus the spell or the caster fails the spell attack roll against the spellscar fext

Effect The caster of the triggering spell undergoes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.N0pDFNCffTe2Du39]{Wellspring Surge}. Even if several spellscar fexts use this reaction after succeeding at a save against the same spell, the spellcaster undergoes only one wellspring surge.

Grasp Power.name: Grasp Power
Grasp Power.description:
Requirements The spellscar fext's last action was a successful fist Strike

Effect The spellscar fext attempts a counteract check against a single spell affecting the creature (counteract rank 4, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+17 #Counter]]{+17}). If the check is successful, the creature also takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:25|basic]).

Spellscar Fext.publicNotes:
Spellscar fexts are spellcasters who were destroyed by wild magic or wellspring surges they tried—and failed—to control. The magical feedback that snuffed out their life warped and animated their flesh, twisting them into shambling undead. Spellscar fexts stand 6 feet tall with disproportionately long arms that end in clusters of waving magical tendrils.

Almost all who became spellscar fexts entered the Mana Wastes to harness the power of the area's wild magic. Once transformed, the desire for magical power becomes a spellscar fext's singular motivation. The creatures focus their attacks on magic users they encounter, attempting to kill them and strip their magic. Unfortunately for a spellscar fext, their transformation makes their entire being inimical to magic. They're unable to cast even the simplest of spells. They grasp destructively at magic they can never hold.

Difficult for the unprepared to destroy permanently, spellscar fexts harry trade routes known for shipping magical goods and repeatedly attack arcane workshops on the borders of the Mana Wastes. They're particularly dangerous to spellcasters traveling alone, as battling the creatures might trigger a wellspring surge that could destroy the lone magic user.

As the fext's vulnerability to glass weapons has become more well known, enterprising gunsmiths in Alkenstar have begun crafting glass ammunition, an uncommon item that costs the same as cold iron ammunition.

Caterpillar Carriage.name: 毛虫车 Caterpillar Carriage

Like Clockwork.name: 宛如发条 Like Clockwork
Like Clockwork.description:
触发 毛虫车获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]状态

效果 毛虫车获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]状态，持续1轮。

Rescue.name: 救援 Rescue
Rescue.description: 毛虫车吸收触及范围内一个自愿构装体。该构装体不再独立存在，直到毛虫车以一个交互动作释放它，或毛虫车被摧毁。

Rock Tunneler.name: 穿岩者 Rock Tunneler
Rock Tunneler.description: 毛虫车可以用20尺速度掘地穿越坚固岩石。如果它愿意的话还能留下一条隧道，并且它通常也会这么做。

Caterpillar Carriage.publicNotes:
The constructs of the Clicking Caverns all have similar designs, being made of clockwork. The most unusual feature of them is that they're self-replicating, or perhaps self-reincarnating, since the animation of a haunted construct requires a soul.

The haunted construct known as the caterpillar carriage is composed of armored segments that flow over one another as the carriage inches forward. It has two forelegs that dig grooves into the ground, making way for the many wheels situated along its underside.

Asanbosam.name: 铁牙懒 Asanbosam
Asanbosam.publicNotes:
铁牙懒是一种巨大的、毛茸茸的类人生物，拥有一幅寒铁牙齿和强壮的长着钩状尖爪的四肢。他们喜欢躲在树顶，从上方割开不幸的猎物的喉咙，让其流血致死。附近地区的人们流传着这些关于“吸血的树上人”的恐怖故事，经验丰富的丛林探险家在途径铁牙懒的地盘时会时刻密切关注每棵树的树梢。

铁牙懒的饮食需要大量的铁（通常以血液的形式来摄入），以此来维持它那副寒铁牙齿的完整性。在不狩猎也不交配的时候，铁牙懒会通过花费时间咀嚼某种岩石来磨利自己的牙齿。

一些民间传说表明，铁牙懒存在的历史非常悠久，几乎和寒铁的起源一样古老，并且地下的寒铁矿脉其实就是古代铁牙懒的埋葬坑。勇敢或愚蠢的偷猎者常常潜入铁牙懒的领土捕猎这些怪物，希望能收获成袋的珍贵牙齿。

Attack from Above.name: 上方攻击 Attack from Above
Attack from Above.description:
需求 铁牙懒位于目标正上方的位置；

效果 他进行一次触及增加到15尺的爪抓打击。此打击造成额外@Damage[1d6[slashing]]伤害，如果命中的话，铁牙懒可以擒获目标并且将其拉到自己相邻的空间。

这在计算铁牙懒的多重攻击减值时视为2次攻击。

Drink Blood.name: 吸血 Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description:
需求 一个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]或自愿的生物位于铁牙懒的牙咬触及范围内。

效果 铁牙懒用牙齿咬住该生物，吸食它的血液。如果受害者被擒抱，则自动成功，否则铁牙懒必须尝试一次@Check[athletics|defense:fortitude]检定来对抗受害者的强韧DC。受害者陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}，铁牙懒获得10 HP，超过生命值上限的部分将转化为临时生命值。

对已经陷入流失状态的受害者进行吸血会增加流失状态值1点，但是铁牙懒本身不会获得更多的生命值。

受害者的流失状态值每周减少1点。如果有献血者或者足够的血浆，通过@Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Drink Blood Treatment]检定对受害者进行输血，可以在10分钟后减少受害者的流失状态值1点。

Anadi Hunter.name: 半蛛人猎手 Anadi Hunter
Anadi Hunter.publicNotes:
半蛛人猎手是部落的耳目，警戒周围区域，提防可能的入侵者。

半蛛人是爱好和平、避世隐居的类人生物，生活在森林、丛林和其他未被征服的荒野深处。它们的真实形态很像半人半蜘蛛，身上有五颜六色的美丽而独特的斑纹。这些图案就像别的类人生物的面部、胎记等其他特征一样独特。

半蛛人天生就具有制造幻觉和变形的天赋。它们很久以前就知道自己的真实形态会遭到其它类人生物的厌恶，因此常常以类人生物的形态示人。当他们伪装成类人生物的时候，他们漆黑的眼睛里会闪烁一种奇怪的、可爱的光泽，以及下意识的小动作会暗示他们并非表面看起来的那样简单。由于他们已经习惯了类人生物对蜘蛛的敏感态度，大多数半蛛人都觉得向陌生人展示自己的真实形态是不礼貌的表现。

大多数半蛛人只有在面临危险时才会变为蜘蛛形态，并将此作为一种吓退敌人的策略。如果被迫进入战斗——大多数半蛛人都不愿如此——他们会尽快变成真实形态，这样就能对敌人施加毁灭性的毒液。

Anadi Venom.name: 半蛛人毒液 Anadi Venom
Anadi Venom.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

最大持续时间 4轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]（1轮）

阶段2 @Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害，措手不及和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}（1轮）

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
半蛛人将自己变形为真实形态、蜘蛛形态、或人类形态。上面的数据是真实形态下的数据。当他们在人类形态下时，他们失去尖牙打击能力和攀爬速度。在蜘蛛形态下时，他们不能使用武器。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Spin Silk.name: 吐丝 Spin Silk
Spin Silk.description: 通过花费几分钟时间，半蛛人能通过吐丝来制造纺织品。一个半蛛人在一天内能吐出的丝足够制造一件衣服。

Inkdrop.name: 墨滴 Inkdrop
Inkdrop.publicNotes: 并非所有手工艺品都用于战争。墨滴是一种被施法者使用的潜入者，用来了解秘密或篡改文件。墨滴能化身成拳头大小的一滴墨，在一页纸上滑行，改变文字或将其完全删除，从而对国政造成毁灭性的影响。

Perfect Memory.name: 完美记忆 Perfect Memory
Perfect Memory.description: 墨滴可以记住它物理移动通过时所有墨水的确切图案。

Blotting.name: 擦除墨迹 Blotting
Blotting.description: 当生物使墨滴受擒或被束缚，它能够通过一个交互动作来抹掉墨滴从而摧毁它。

Blinding Ink.name: 致盲墨 Blinding Ink
Blinding Ink.description: 被墨滴的伪足重击的生物会因墨汁陷入目盲，直到其使用一个交互动作擦干眼睛。

Ink Blot.name: 墨迹 Ink Blot
Ink Blot.description: 墨滴在一平方尺的表面上留下它记住的图案。如果表面上已存在非魔法墨水，墨滴会擦除掉非魔法墨水。

Taljjae.publicNotes: The form of Taljjae's body can vary from visit to visit or even moment to moment, but it's easily recognized due to its signature cloak and masks. So long as Taljjae's mood is placid, it can be approached safely, but its mercurial temperament can be hard to predict.

Exit Stage.name: Exit Stage
Exit Stage.description:
Trigger Taljjae is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect Taljjae retains 1 Hit Point and teleports to an empty space within 30 feet. One of its masks remains behind and is broken.

Prop Master.name: Prop Master
Prop Master.description: Taljjae has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields from one of its masks.

Second Act.name: Second Act
Second Act.description:
Trigger Taljjae's turn begins Requirements Taljjae has 200 or fewer Hit Points

Effect Taljjae's dance reaches a frantic climax, allowing it to change personas rapidly. Taljjae Changes Characters.

Jelly Gluttony.name: Jelly Gluttony
Jelly Gluttony.description: If Taljjae detects buckwheat jelly with its jelly sense, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the food and the creature possessing it (if applicable) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to all other creatures for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, or until it uses an appropriate number of Interact actions to consume the jelly (generally 2: 1 to take the jelly, and another to eat it). If there's more than one helping of jelly, the condition ends once Taljjae consumes the jelly once.

Jelly Sense.name: Jelly Sense
Jelly Sense.description: Taljjae has scent as a precise sense out to 120 feet, but only to detect buckwheat jelly, the only food Taljjae loves more than flesh.

Change Characters.name: Change Characters
Change Characters.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Taljjae removes its current mask and dons a new one. The change refreshes Taljjae, restoring 25 Hit Points. Once Taljjae has removed a mask, it can't Change Characters back to that mask until it has worn all of its unbroken masks at least once, after which the cycle starts again. Taljjae can't don a broken mask.

When Taljjae Changes Characters, it gains access to the listed abilities. Any items (such as weapons) associated with its previous mask immediately disappear and are replaced by fresh ones for its new mask, but the effects of any mask abilities it has active persist. Removing a mask and later reapplying it doesn't restore any limited-use abilities.

Taljjae.name: Taljjae

Fear Scent (Precise) 120 feet.name: Fear Scent (Precise) 120 feet
Fear Scent (Precise) 120 feet.description: Desert's Howl can observe any frightened creatures within 120 feet using an incredibly accurate sense of psychic smell as a precise sense. However, its fear scent extends further if the creature was frightened by Desert's Howl. The taste of such a bouquet of fear in the air becomes irresistible and easy for Desert's Howl to detect, like a shark smelling blood in water. Desert's Howl can sense a creature frightened by its own fear effects as an imprecise sense at a distance of up to 1 mile away.

Illusory Ambush.name: Illusory Ambush
Illusory Ambush.description: Desert's Howl shimmers with illusions and devastates a foe who lost track of its position. Desert's Howl Strides up to twice its Speed. If it ends its movement within its melee reach of at least one enemy to which it's undetected, it can attempt two claw Strikes against that enemy. These attacks count toward Desert's Howl's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after Desert's Howl makes both of these attacks. Desert's Howl remains undetected to the creature it's attacking until after resolving both of the claw attacks.

Nightmare Fuel.name: Nightmare Fuel
Nightmare Fuel.description: Desert's Howl's claws are infused with some of the nightmares that make up Desert's Howl's being, and they infect victims with lasting fear, cycling their victims' fears and anxieties in a horrific loop that takes time and rest to break. A creature that takes damage from Desert's Howl's claw Strike while frightened no longer reduces its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition at the end of each turn. Instead, the creature can only decrease its frightened condition by 1 after each full night's rest or with magical effects counteracting the fear, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EfFMLVbmkBWmzoLF]{Clear Mind}.

Paralytic Secretion.name: Paralytic Secretion
Paralytic Secretion.description: Desert's Howl's saliva is a potent paralytic substance that drains the energy from prey. A creature hit by its spit Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} as well as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round. If the target was already drained, it instead increases the condition's value by 1, to a maximum of drained 4.

Profane Feast.name: Profane Feast
Profane Feast.description:
Requirements Desert's Howl has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect Desert's Howl begins to consume the creature, dealing @Damage[(2d12+15)[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:41|basic] save) and exposing the creature to its paralytic secretion.

Aura of Agony.name: Aura of Agony
Aura of Agony.description: 10 miles. Desert's Howl exudes a massive psychic disturbance many miles away from its location, assaulting the minds and spirits of those who dare to sleep within the unsettling bounds of its aura of agony. Creatures that attempt to rest while they're within this emanation are beset by disturbing nightmares and hallucinations, regardless of whether they're aware of Desert's Howl's presence. This restlessness causes creatures to wake up @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}, and they don't recover from fatigue by resting. Creatures affected by aura of agony don't reduce their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition by resting as long as they remain within the area of the aura.

Putrid Evanescence.name: Putrid Evanescence
Putrid Evanescence.description:
Frequency once per minute

Trigger Desert's Howl is damaged by another creature

Effect Desert's Howl bursts into a cloud of putrid smoke, ash, and nightmares, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} and teleporting up to 100 feet away to an unoccupied space it can see. It remains invisible until the end of its next turn or until it uses a hostile action, whichever comes first.

Forlorn Howl.name: Forlorn Howl
Forlorn Howl.description:
Desert's Howl vents a long and desolate wail full of nightmares and despair. The devastating howl can be heard up to 1 mile away under the open sky. Any creature who hears it experiences a sudden sinking in its stomach and heart palpitations, its hair stands on end, and it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Desert's Howl.name: Desert's Howl
Desert's Howl.publicNotes:
Desert's Howl is a towering, gray abomination with a shape vaguely similar to that of a bearded man with glowing yellow eyes, long ibex horns, deadly black claws, and cloven hooves. These features have sometimes caused those who encounter it to mistake it for some kind of fiend, a fatal mistake likely to lead to their demise, as Desert's Howl is in truth a twisted aberration composed of a disgusting mix of nightmares, smoke, and ash. As such, holy water and other measures that might be effective against fiends have no effect on Desert's Howl.

According to the oral histories of the people who have survived in the Thuvian desert the longest, when Desert's Howl first appeared, it was in much the same shape but no larger than a human. Over time, its proportions lengthened and grew, as did its frightening abilities and appetite for suffering.

Given the incredible range on Desert's Howl's namesake desolate exclamation, creatures are much more likely to hear Desert's Howl than see it. Though such forewarning potentially gives distant creatures additional time to prepare to face or escape the creature, Desert's Howl enjoys the steady build-up of fear that this approach allows, potentially breaking its victims' resolve long before it even appears. Besides, a creature of its power has little to fear from travelers, or even most adventurers, regardless of how much time they have to prepare. In the end, a greater struggle just makes destroying them all the sweeter.

Anadi Elder.name: 半蛛人长老 Anadi Elder
Anadi Elder.publicNotes:
半蛛人长老通常必须做出艰难的选择，是继续谈判，还是将分歧升级为彻底的冲突。

半蛛人是爱好和平、避世隐居的类人生物，生活在森林、丛林和其他未被征服的荒野深处。它们的真实形态很像半人半蜘蛛，身上有五颜六色的美丽而独特的斑纹。这些图案就像别的类人生物的面部、胎记等其他特征一样独特。

半蛛人天生就具有制造幻觉和变形的天赋。它们很久以前就知道自己的真实形态会遭到其它类人生物的厌恶，因此常常以类人生物的形态示人。当他们伪装成类人生物的时候，他们漆黑的眼睛里会闪烁一种奇怪的、可爱的光泽，以及下意识的小动作会暗示他们并非表面看起来的那样简单。由于他们已经习惯了类人生物对蜘蛛的敏感态度，大多数半蛛人都觉得向陌生人展示自己的真实形态是不礼貌的表现。

大多数半蛛人只有在面临危险时才会变为蜘蛛形态，并将此作为一种吓退敌人的策略。如果被迫进入战斗——大多数半蛛人都不愿如此——他们会尽快变成真实形态，这样就能对敌人施加毁灭性的毒液。

Anadi Venom.name: 半蛛人毒液 Anadi Venom
Anadi Venom.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

最大持续时间 4轮

阶段1 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]（1轮）

阶段2 @Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害，措手不及和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}（1轮）

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
半蛛人将自己变形为真实形态、蜘蛛形态、或人类形态。上面的数据是真实形态下的数据。当他们在人类形态下时，他们失去尖牙打击能力和攀爬速度。在蜘蛛形态下时，他们不能使用武器。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Spin Silk.name: 吐丝 Spin Silk
Spin Silk.description: 通过花费几分钟时间，半蛛人能通过吐丝来制造纺织品。一个半蛛人在一天内能吐出的丝足够制造一件衣服。

Charau-ka Acolyte of Angazhan.name: 查咯安加赞助祭 Charau-ka Acolyte of Angazhan
Charau-ka Acolyte of Angazhan.publicNotes:
即便猩猩王已经陨落，一些查咯猿人依然崇拜着安加赞。

传说表示查咯猿人与恶魔领主安加赞（Angazhan）有着共同的祖先，安加赞改造了哪些曾经试图反抗其邪教的人类的身体，由此创造了第一只查咯猿人。有传言说，查咯猿人的祭司们为了纪念这个古老的起源，改进了某种可怕的仪式，迫使哪些被其杀死的凡人转化为新的查咯猿人。其他的故事表明，某种用来敬拜安加赞的强大图腾拥有这样的力量，在这些魔法神器前面进行祭祀仪式，就能让死者的灵魂作为野蛮和毁灭之主安加赞的暴力信徒复活。

不久前，大多数查咯猿人还团结在猩猩王鲁萨泽克（Ruthazek the Gorilla King）的旗下。鲁萨泽克是个强大的军阀，是安加赞的忠实信徒，统治着乌萨罗（Usaro）。但当冒险者挑战并打败了鲁萨泽克之后，查咯猿人分裂了，各个氏族分散在丛林各处，各自都由一个强大的军阀领导。

Shrieking Frenzy.name: 暴怒尖啸 Shrieking Frenzy
Shrieking Frenzy.description:
触发 查咯猿人的回合开始。

频率 每小时一次

效果 查咯猿人获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]状态，直到它的下一回合结束，并且他可以用此额外动作打击或行走。

在狂怒生效期间，由于查咯猿人不断大声嚎叫，因此无法说话，隐秘检定也会自动失败。

Thrown Weapon Mastery.name: 精通投掷武器 Thrown Weapon Mastery
Thrown Weapon Mastery.description:
查咯猿人的投掷武器获得“致命D6”特征。

此外，如果查咯猿人投掷一件临时武器，既不会因此受到-2减值，也不会因为投掷一件具有非致命特征的临时武器来造成致命伤害而受到减值。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Water.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Water

Exoskeletal Armory.name: Exoskeletal Armory
Exoskeletal Armory.description: At the beginning of each day, Tehialai can molt to change the morph of her two massive striking claws. She chooses two morphs and adds their Strikes and Release Claw effects to the stat block presented here. Tehialai can molt two different claws or two copies of the same claw.

Ship Armor.name: Ship Armor
Ship Armor.description: Tehialai hides within a shell made of all the ships she has stolen. This ship armor reduces any damage Tehialai takes by an amount equal to its Hardness. Once Tehialai is reduced to fewer than half her Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, her ship armor breaks, removing her Hardness and reducing her Armor Class to 32.

Capsize.name: Capsize
Capsize.description: Tehialai attempts to capsize an aquatic vessel of her size or smaller that she's adjacent to. She must succeed at a @Check[athletics|dc:33] check (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is) or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

Move Home.name: Move Home
Move Home.description:
Requirements Tehialai is adjacent to a broken ship, and her ship armor is broken

Effect Tehialai claims nearby ship pieces to rebuild her home. She destroys the adjacent ship and rebuilds her ship armor, restoring her Hardness and increasing her AC back to 36.

Pressurize Claw.name: Pressurize Claw
Pressurize Claw.description:
Requirements Tehialai's claw isn't currently Pressurized

Effect Tehialai draws water into the base of one of her claws, building immense hydraulic pressure as she prepares to attack. The claw remains loaded until she Releases that Claw or 1 minute has passed, whichever comes first. While the claw is Pressurized, Tehialai can't use that claw to Strike. If Tehialai isn't at least partially within a body of water when she Pressurizes her Claw, she takes a -2 penalty to any attack rolls and DCs when she Releases that Claw.

Release Claw.name: Release Claw
Release Claw.description:
Requirements Tehialai has Pressurized a Claw

Effect Tehialai lashes out with the force of the sea. See each claw for its released effect; the DC for any effect is 33. After Releasing a Claw, the claw depressurizes.

Release Claw (Barbed Spear).name: Release Claw (Barbed Spear)
Release Claw (Barbed Spear).description:
Requirements Tehialai has Pressurized a Claw

Tehialai's spear shoots out, impaling prey and reeling them back. All creatures in a @Template[line|distance:40] take @Damage[8d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save); creatures that critically fail are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} until the end of Tehialai's next turn.

After Releasing a Claw, the claw depressurizes.

Release Claw (Boiling Club).name: Release Claw (Boiling Club)
Release Claw (Boiling Club).description:
Requirements Tehialai has Pressurized a Claw

The impact of Tehialai's claw begets a burning vacuum. Tehialai makes a boiling club Strike against one target within 15 feet. If she hits, a shock wave booms out, dealing @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage and @Damage[3d6[sonic]] damage to all creatures except her within @Template[burst|distance:15]{15 feet of the target}, including the target itself (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic] save). If the Strike was a critical hit, the target uses the degree of success one lower than it rolled on its save. Unlike most fire abilities, this ability can be used underwater, and the typical 5 fire resistance for being underwater doesn't apply.

After Releasing a Claw, the claw depressurizes.

Release Claw (Salt Darts).name: Release Claw (Salt Darts)
Release Claw (Salt Darts).description: Tehialai launches a flurry of darts. She makes two salt dart Strikes against two different creatures. Both attacks count towards her multiple attack penalty, but she doesn't increase her penalty until after she has made both attacks.

Release Claw (Tidal Gourd).description: Tehialai atomizes the water in her claw to create a mist that fills a @Template[emanation|distance:40] centered on her and that lasts until the end of her next turn or until dispersed by a strong wind. All creatures within the mist become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the mist become concealed to creatures within it. Wavesense functions through the mist and ignores the concealment.
Release Claw (Tidal Gourd).name: Release Claw (Tidal Gourd)

Release Claw (Toothed Shredder).name: Release Claw (Toothed Shredder)
Release Claw (Toothed Shredder).description: Tehialai's claw whirs and spins to cut through armor and ship hulls. Tehialai makes a toothed shredder Strike. On a hit, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of Tehialai's next turn and takes @Damage[2d12[bleed]].

Tehialai-Thief-of-Ships.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. water
Tehialai-Thief-of-Ships.name: Tehialai-Thief-of-Ships
Tehialai-Thief-of-Ships.publicNotes: Though her current form is but a small and pale shell of her former glory, Tehialai is a legend even in her waning days. The titanic crustacean wears the hulls of ruined ships as her shell, ripped into shape by vessel-rending claws, as nothing else in Golarion's oceans is large enough to shield her body-or perhaps nothing else will satisfy her. Few ships can withstand her might, and fewer still are prepared for her appearance. Those who don't know of the thief of ships won't know to watch for her coming, and those who do know Tehialai offer her tribute to ward off her predation.

Disharmonious Decay.name: Disharmonious Decay
Disharmonious Decay.description: When a spawn dies, its foulness seeps into the land in a @Template[burst|distance:100]{100-foot radius}. Non-magical plant life in the area decays within 1 hour, and new non-magical growth can't sprout for 1 month. A creature can act on the spawn's corpse within 1 minute of its death to limit this decay to a 10-foot square by succeeding at a @Check[medicine|dc:22|name:Prevent Spread of Decay (Medicine)], @Check[nature|dc:22|name:Prevent Spread of Decay (Nature)], or @Check[occultism|dc:22|name:Prevent Spread of Decay (Occultism)] check.

Fusing Spit.name: Fusing Spit
Fusing Spit.description: The spawn retches up thick, caustic sludge and spits it at a creature within 60 feet, causing equipment and flesh to melt and partially fuse together. The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:23] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 minute.

Spawn Of Kothogaz.name: Spawn Of Kothogaz
Spawn Of Kothogaz.publicNotes: Kothogaz's presence causes the land to sprout festering hives. Insectile, acid-drooling spawn slither from these growths as lesser versions of their creator.

Augdunar.name: Augdunar

Back Kick.name: Back Kick
Back Kick.description: The augdunar whirls around, delivering a powerful kick with both its hind legs. The augdunar makes a hoof Strike. If the Strike hits, the augdunar deals an extra 1d10 bludgeoning damage. This counts as two attacks when calculating the augdunar's multiple attack penalty.

Determined Trudge.name: Determined Trudge
Determined Trudge.description: The augdunar Strides at a –5 foot circumstance penalty to its Speed, ignoring difficult terrain.

Augdunar.publicNotes:
Selectively bred over the course of centuries to be as strong, tough, and grouchy as the dwarves of Highhelm themselves, augdunars are a unique breed of mule favored by the merchants of the Sky Citadel for transporting goods and assisting with manual labor. Unlike mules found elsewhere on Golarion, augdunars are capable of producing offspring—though significantly fewer than ordinary equines. This has led to a steady, but controlled, stock of the creatures, allowing for the population to be selfsustaining. Augdunars are smaller than typical mules to accommodate dwarven height, measuring about four and a half feet tall and weighing between 400 and 600 pounds.

Because of their ability to carry loads beyond that of the traditional mule, in addition to the ability to breed amongst themselves, augdunars are a frequent target of thieves or opportunistic merchants. No Highhelm citizen worth their stone willingly sells an augdunar to outsiders, so attempted thefts on the road are common. Unfortunately for these robbers, the mules are quite loyal to their owners and bray loudly whenever a stranger handles their leads. Combined with a heavy kick to the skull from the animal, any attempts to make off with an augdunar have low odds of succeeding.

While rare, small groups of the augdunar have broken away from dwarven control over the years and created feral colonies in the Five Kings Mountains. These colonies are largely safe from ordinary predators, such as wolves, and graze on mountainside plants. Due to their low birthrate, feral augdunars don't need to have their population controlled, though caravanners do attempt to capture and redomesticate them in an effort to increase profit.

Despite being natural beasts of burden, dwarves don't often use augdunars as mounts. The mules seem to have an instinctive dislike of riders, to which the deep bite marks and hoofprints left in those who try can attest. That's not to say that some haven't succeeded, however. Those who put forth the effort required to create a bond with an augdunar find that their persistence can pay off. Augdunar loyalty is unparalleled and even thieves know to not attempt to steal an augdunar that's carrying a rider.

Spite.name: 恶意 Spite
Spite.description:
触发 在鲲的尾触及范围内的生物使用动作治疗或帮助另一个生物

效果 鲲用它的尾巴拍打触发生物，对触发生物进行一次尾扫打击。若命中，触发动作被打断，该生物则被推离10尺。

Funnel.name: 汇吸 Funnel
Funnel.description:
鲲猛吸一口气，吞没@Template[cone|distance:60]范围内的生物与热量。生物受到@Damage[10d8[cold]|options:area-damage]伤害且必须尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:33|options:area-effect,damaging-effect]豁免。鲲在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Funnel]]{1d4轮}内不能再次使用汇吸。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物受到一半伤害。

失败 生物受到全额伤害，并被拉向鲲30尺。

大失败 生物受到双倍伤害，并被拉向鲲60尺。

Heart of Darkness.name: 黑暗之心 Heart of Darkness
Heart of Darkness.description: 每当鲲在黑暗区域内进行颚咬打击时，其颚咬打击会额外造成2d6精魂伤害并获得邪秽特征。

Kun.name: 鲲 Kun
Kun.publicNotes:
饥肠辘辘又满腔怒火，恶毒的鲲是神话中的鱼形怪物，栖息于最遥远、最寒冷的深海。倘若它们愿意，这些无比强大的生物能轻易统治一片水下领土，但鲲也以其绝对的自我专注与对其他生命形态的矛盾心理而著称。一头鲲能离其他生物多远就有多远，只和自己冰冷的仇恨一起过活。它们能进食并消化猎物，但这通常出于偶然。大多数鲲保持无知与冷漠，将自己隐藏于黑暗中，无视周围任何的生命迹象，除了偶尔在受到惊扰时会发怒。

鲲在冰冷黑暗的海底狩猎。但是，如果它照到阳光，鲲就会开始明白，它生活在一个不同的，更大的世界里。当群鸟或鱼群投下斑驳的光影时，鲲可能会对自己的孤独感到厌倦，或者对上方的世界感到好奇。
Kun.privateNotes:
Change of Heart

In extremely rare circumstances and for their own mysterious reasons, a kun might sacrifice some of their power to undergo a permanent, onetime transformation. In a final dramatic act, the kun flings themself up and out of the ocean, allowing the sun to fully wash over them. In the process, the kun transforms from a hateful fish into a noble and curious bird called a peng.

Crystal Pin.name: Crystal Pin
Crystal Pin.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:48|name:Earn Ebeshra's Favor (Occultism)|traits:abjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,hazard] (legendary) or @Check[religion|dc:48|name:Earn Ebeshra's Favor (Religion)|traits:abjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,hazard] (legendary) to earn Ebeshra's favor and allow safe travel or @Check[deception|dc:51|name:Divert Ebeshra's Attention|traits:abjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,hazard] (master) to momentarily divert Ebeshra's attention
Crystal Pin.hazarddescription: Ebeshra fires a crystal at a creature to pin them onto the Material Plane.
Crystal Pin.reset: Ebeshra waits [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]] rounds to break off another crystal.

Fire Pin.name: Fire Pin
Fire Pin.description:
Trigger A creature Ebeshra can see begins to use a teleportation effect or an effect that would move any number of targets to a different plane

Effect Ebeshra hurls a crystal at the triggering creature. The triggering creature and all creatures within 50 feet of the creature take @Damage[16d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic|traits:abjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,hazard] save) and additional effects based on the result of their save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The effect is counteracted, and the creature can't use teleportation effects or planar travel effects for 1 minute.

Failure As success, but for 1 day instead of 1 minute.

Critical Failure As success, but for 1 week instead of 1 minute. Additionally, the creature becomes pinned under the crystal and must succeed at 3 total DC 45 checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} from under the crystal.

Malicious Stab.name: 恶毒之刺 Malicious Stab
Malicious Stab.description: 弹簧腿杰克对陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]的生物造成额外1d6精准伤害（对同时处于措手不及和惊惧的生物造成2d6精准伤害）。

Vault.name: 大跳 Vault
Vault.description: 弹簧腿杰克朝任意方向跳跃至多20尺，包括垂直方向。这次移动不会触发基于移动的反应动作。

Breath Weapon.name: 吐息 Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
弹簧腿杰克呼出一道明亮的蓝色火焰，对@Template[cone|distance:15]范围造成@Damage[4d6[fire]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。

他不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4轮}内再次使用吐息。

Spring-Heeled Jack.name: 弹簧腿杰克 Spring-Heeled Jack
Spring-Heeled Jack.publicNotes:
名为弹簧腿杰克的凶残骗子其最大的秘密是，他并非独特的生物。相反，他是第一世界本土的一种稀有精类，喜欢在物质位面制造血腥的混乱。这些精类是如此的稀有，彼此之间如此不信任，以至于两个杰克从不会见面；因此只存在一个弹簧腿杰克的误解也完全可以理解。目击报告发生在整个乌斯塔拉夫（以及其外），横贯许多个世纪，这都归因于这种骗子的长寿和快速旅行的神秘能力，或则还有人相信根本不存在这种生物，只是扭曲思想的都市传说，是通过变装，魔法以及一系列谋杀和混乱来使其变为现实。哪怕是在被恐惧浸透的乌斯塔拉夫，也没有人猜测会有多个弹簧腿杰克存在，或则假设某些人可以驱使他们克服相互间的蔑视，来聚集成一个谋杀集团，这远比其单打独斗强大。

弹簧腿杰克是冷眼的多毛精类，有着模糊的人形外貌和其他体貌特征，使其很容易被误认为是恶魔或魔鬼。发光的眼睛，裂开的蹄子，凶险的角，和尖头的尾巴，结合起来就构成了一个邪恶小魔鬼的形象；他对突然而肆虐的暴力的热爱也加强了这种印象。几乎所有杰克都有着深黑色的皮肤和毛发，尽管也可能存在一些例外。

弹簧腿杰克通常会用破烂的斗篷隐藏其体貌特征，在他们喜欢的夜间装成一个驼背的老者或年轻人。这种伪装很少能经得起任何审查，但那对弹簧腿杰克而言无关紧要，他只需要给目标提供一些足够引起怀疑的东西，就能移动进打击范围，这会比大多数其他生物所认为的要远得多。一旦足够近了，弹簧腿杰克就能在眨眼间跳跃惊人的距离，轻松砍向受害者，而直到那一刻之前，受害者都回以为自己是安全的。

Pygmy Kaava.name: Pygmy Kaava
Pygmy Kaava.publicNotes:
An unusually large number of kaava living in the Kaava Lands are relatively small, standing about 3 feet tall and weighing about 30 pounds. Pygmy kaava openly show their disdain for larger kaava, and the two groups rarely get along. Pygmy kaava often hunt alongside trained bush vipers or black mamba snakes.

Kaava are stealthy, jungle-dwelling humanoids with short down feathers that can easily be mistaken for fur from a distance. Kaava have tough scales beneath these feathers. Both the scales and feathers have mutable pigmentation that allows a kaava to blend into surrounding foliage like a chameleon.

Trackless.name: Trackless
Trackless.description: A kaava moving at half their Speed or less steps so lightly that they leave virtually no trace. The DCs of checks to Track a kaava are increased by 10.

Woodland Stride.name: Woodland Stride
Woodland Stride.description: A kaava ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from non-magical foliage.

Dipteric Dread.name: 战栗双翼 Dipteric Dread
Dipteric Dread.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:29]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[2d6[piercing],2d6[poison]]伤害（1轮）

阶段2 @Damage[2d6[piercing],3d6[poison]]伤害（1轮）

阶段3 @Damage[2d6[piercing],5d6[poison]]伤害

Terror From Within.name: 内生恐惧 Terror From Within
Terror From Within.description: 蚊女巫的力量靠恐惧获得滋养。当一个生物因蚊女巫的噬咬和战栗双翼而受到流血或穿刺伤害时，还要受到2倍于其惊惧值的额外伤害。

Swarmsense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: 集群感官（模糊）30 尺
Swarmsense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: 蚊女巫可以从附近的昆虫处不断接受信息。只要周围有昆虫引导她，她就可以使用触觉作为一种模糊感官，范围为所标注的距离。

Wild Empathy.name: 野性认同 Wild Empathy
Wild Empathy.description: 蚊女巫可以使用交涉技能对节肢动物（昆虫、蜘蛛和类似的无脊椎动物，例如蚊幅）进行[[/act make-an-impression]]和[[/act request]]。大部分节肢动物对蚊女巫的初始态度都是不关心。

Haunting Gaze.name: 慑人凝视 Haunting Gaze
Haunting Gaze.description: 30尺。当一个生物在灵光范围内结束回合时，必须进行@Check[will|dc:29]豁免。如果检定失败，则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}若其已经陷入惊惧，则惊惧值上升1（最多@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3}），并且在其下一回合结束时惊惧值不会下降1。如果在豁免失败之前该生物的惊惧值已为3或更高，则其@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]1轮。

Mosquito Witch (The Legion Leech).name: 蚊女巫-吸血军团 Mosquito Witch (The Legion Leech)
Mosquito Witch (The Legion Leech).publicNotes:
蚊女巫外表类似人形，有着令人不舒服的蜡黄皮肤。她似乎总是低着头，耸着肩膀，一头蓬乱的黑发遮住整个脸，只能看见一双一眨不眨的红眼睛和一条又长又尖的舌头，舌头僵硬突出就像个长长的鼻子，背后长着有血肉和骨头的蚊子翅膀。她有六条胳膊，但胳膊上没有长手，而是逐渐变细形成畸形的尖端，像虫蛹的腿一样紧紧抱在胸前。她细长的双腿也逐渐变尖；当她吃饱而肿胀起来之后，就必须用全部八条肢体行走，这八条肢体会在地面上留下小孔一样的足迹。

吸血军团 The Legion Leech

蚊子是一种寄生虫。正如其名字一样，蚊女巫在世界上漫游，来到某个毫无防备的地方，将这个地方的生命和幸福汲取殆尽。感到餍腻后，她就会离开，去消化她盗取的生命力。

吸血军团往往伴随着难以解释的消耗性疾病、足以掳走羊羔的巨大蚊幅和瞬间吸干一头公牛血液的饥饿蚊群。蚊女巫的其他形态有时会乐于助人或表现得十分好奇，但吸血军团一心只想消灭任何生命。

Sarkorian Wolf.name: Sarkorian Wolf
Sarkorian Wolf.publicNotes:
To survive living in the Worldwound, Sarkorian wolves developed defenses against the Abyss. They've become symbols for Mendevian crusaders who struggled to adapt to the world after the war ended.

Wolves roam forests, hills, and other wild lands, where they hunt in packs to beleaguer and surround their prey before going in for the kill. Like most predatory animals, wolves prefer to attack the weakest or most vulnerable prey they can find.

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: The wolf's Strikes deal 1d4 extra damage to creatures within reach of at least two of the wolf's allies.

Spike Rend.name: Spike Rend
Spike Rend.description:
Requirements The pagulin has a creature impaled on its tail;

Effect The pagulin violently pulls its tail out of the creature, dealing @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage to the creature.

Tail Impalement.name: Tail Impalement
Tail Impalement.description: A creature hit by a pagulin's tail becomes impaled on one of the tail's spikes. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. If the pagulin moves, it brings the grabbed creature along with it. The pagulin doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the creature grabbed; the creature remains grabbed as long as it's impaled. The grabbed creature can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} as normal. Large and larger creatures are immune to a pagulin's Tail Impalement.

Blinding Spittle.name: Blinding Spittle
Blinding Spittle.description:
A creature hit by a pagulin's spit must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round. It can use an Interact action to wipe away the spittle and remove the dazzled condition.

Failure As success, except the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round instead of dazzled.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is blinded for 1 minute. The creature needs 2 total Interact actions to wipe away the spittle.

Pagulin.name: Pagulin
Pagulin.publicNotes:
Pagulins are massive, multi-legged lizards that stalk the mountain passes of the Five Kings Mountains. These reptiles hunt elk and augdunars by lying in wait behind rock formations or within the openings of caves. Pagulins produce a mildly acidic saliva that they spit at prey to temporarily blind them before moving in for the kill. A pagulin's tail features a deadly thagomizer, four large spikes that it uses to impale prey to prevent their escape. Five Kings citizens know that pagulins are much smarter than they look, with many reports of pagulins intentionally allowing prey to escape, only to follow a creature to its den and feast on its entire family.

Though pagulins are deadly, most in the Five Kings Mountains are indifferent to them. Pagulins tend to rest for days at a time after a hunt, spending time to digest their massive kills. They're particularly territorial, however, and will gladly rouse from a post-meal stupor to defend their lairs. The lizards are also known to attack anything that interrupts a hunt or scares off prey. Many merchant caravans have dealt with an unexpected pagulin attack after riding past a herd of startled deer.

Mana Whorl.name: Mana Whorl
Mana Whorl.hazarddescription: This 15-foot-wide patch of destabilized sand attempts to submerge creatures who wield magic. A desert tree with dense bright green foliage, pale pink blooms, and at least one carnivorous red-chested magpie is always nearby.
Mana Whorl.reset: The hazard continues to suck in anyone with magic until it is satiated (see Disable above). Magpies leave any satiated whorls.
Mana Whorl.stealthdetails: (trained) to identify as dangerous quicksand; +20 (expert) to recognize its magical properties

Submerge.name: Submerge
Submerge.description:
Trigger A creature who can cast spells, or who is wielding a magic item, walks into the mana whorl

Effect The triggering creature sinks into the whorl to its waist. The whorl rolls initiative if it hasn't already.

Mana Whorl.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:26] (expert) to feed magic into the whorl and temporarily stabilize it for a few minutes; feed the whorl a number of spellcasters and magic items with a combined 10 levels (for instance, a 4th-level cleric with two 3rd-level magic items) to stabilize it for 1 week; or feed the whorl a number of spellcasters and magic items with a combined 20 levels to stabilize it permanently. Spellcasters and magic items fed to the whorl are devoured whole.
Mana Whorl.routine: (1 action) On its initiative, the whorl pulls down any creature within it that can cast spells or that is wielding a magic item. A creature submerged to the waist becomes submerged to the neck, and a creature submerged to the neck is pulled under and must hold its breath to avoid suffocation. If a creature has no spells or magic items, the mana whorl is merely difficult terrain. A creature caught in a mana whorl can attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:23] check to Swim to either raise itself by one step if submerged to the neck or worse, or to move 5 feet if submerged only to the waist. On a critical failure, the creature is pulled down by one step. A creature that Swims out of the whorl escapes the hazard and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in a space adjacent to the whorl.
