Other creatures can Aid the creature, typically by using a rope or similar aid, or attempt to pull the creature out with their own @Check[athletics|dc:23] check, with the same results as if the creature attempted the check. If a creature has only magic items and no ability to cast spells, dropping all the items releases that creature, and it can move through the mana whorl as normal difficult terrain.

Animated Kite.name: 活化风筝 Animated Kite
Animated Kite.publicNotes: 活化风筝非常适合做间谍，可以从极远处进行观察，尽管许多风筝更像是宠物。风筝本身是一种简单的手工艺品，很容易制作和销毁，使用盖在精致竹框上附魔纸张制成。更高级的风筝可以装饰上各种符文，使施法者可以看到或听到远处的声音。

Construct Armor (Hardness 1).name: 构装护甲 Construct Armor (硬度 1)
Construct Armor (Hardness 1).description: 与普通的物体一样，活化风筝同样拥有硬度。硬度可以减少其所受到的任何伤害，其数值等同于硬度的数值。一旦活化风筝的生命值降低至一半以下，或是受到重击伤害后，其构装护甲将会破损，其AC降低至13。

Attach Line.name: 连线 Attach Line
Attach Line.description: 活化风筝将它的线交给一名有一只空手的相邻盟友。风筝会一直保持连接，直到该生物松手或风筝飞离60尺外。在他们之间的生物可以通过成功命中的造成任意数量挥砍伤害的打击，对抗AC 13来切断连线。

Sawing Line.name: 锯线 Sawing Line
Sawing Line.description:
需求 活化风筝与一名盟友连线

效果 风筝与其盟友之间连线中的每个生物受到@Damage[1d6[slashing]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic]豁免）。

Melfesh Monster.name: Melfesh Monster

Reactive Growth.name: Reactive Growth
Reactive Growth.description:
Trigger The Melfesh Monster takes physical damage

Effect The Melfesh Monster shifts plant matter to blunt the attack. It gains resistance 5 against the triggering physical damage.

Sporesight.name: Sporesight
Sporesight.description: If a creature has inhaled any of the Melfesh Monster's spores, the Melfesh Monster can sense the creature at the listed range.

Terrorspores.name: Terrorspores
Terrorspores.description:
60 feet. A creature that enters the emanation must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save. Regardless of outcome, the creature is temporarily immune to terrorspores for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and inhales spores that remain in its body for 1 minute.

Failure As success, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and the spores remain for 1 hour.

Critical Failure As success, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}, the spores remain for 1 hour, and the creature's frightened condition can't be reduced below 1 as long as spores remain in its body.

Fulminate.description:
Requirements The Melfesh Monster has created a spore cloud, and the cloud is within range of one of the Melfesh Monster's fire abilities

Effect The Melfesh Monster targets the cloud with one of its abilities with the fire trait. The spore cloud explodes, dealing @Damage[4d10[fire],4[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage]{4d10 fire damage and 4 persistent fire damage} in a @Template[burst|distance:40] originating from a single square within the cloud (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect] save).
Fulminate.name: Fulminate

Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud
Spore Cloud.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The Melfesh Monster conjures a cloud of spores within 60 feet in a @Template[burst|distance:20]. The cloud lasts 1 minute. Creatures that enter or begin their turn within the cloud must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21|options:area-effect,damaging-effect,inflicts:sickened] save or take @Damage[3d8[poison]|options:area-damage] damage, be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}, and inhale spores that remain in their bodies for 1 minute (on a critical failure, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} and an additional @Damage[4[persistent,poison]] damage).

Envelop.name: Envelop
Envelop.description: The Melfesh Monster attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature within reach. On a success, the creature is pulled into the Monster's body. The Melfesh Monster is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} while it envelops a creature, and this otherwise has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]{Swallow Whole} (the Melfesh Monster's size or smaller, @Damage[1d10[bludgeoning],1d12[poison]]{1d10 bludgeoning and 1d12 poison}, Rupture 15).

Melfesh Monster.publicNotes:
Each Melfesh Monster is unique at any given time since the parent fungus only gives birth to a single monster at once, and each of these creations works a little differently and looks a little different from the last. However, their forms all bear similarities. A twisting mass of creeping vines creates the bulk of a Melfesh Monster's body, sculpted into a towering figure that can glide effortlessly across the ground. Mossy growths and trumpeting fungi cover the creature like matted fur, dripping from its back and shoulders in excess. A hood of dampened bark and thick moss covers its face, revealing only a crusty wooden jaw and a pair of gleaming red eyes. An acrid stench of burning manure follows the creature, often serving as the only warning that anyone gets before it attacks.

Despite their fungal nature, Melfesh Monsters are undamaged by their own jets of flame and resistant to fires set by others, often surprising hunters who paid too little attention to the legends before encountering the creature. Their terrifying spores also mean that most survivors of their attacks tend to be disoriented and delirious, relating accounts of the monster that are distorted by confusion and fear. This, along with the natural variance between different Melfesh Monsters, means that even the most diligent of researchers will come across contradictory evidence. Even if they learn from all the prior information collected over the years, they're still often caught off guard when trying to hunt down and fell the threat since the new Melfesh Monster might have an ability never seen before. The canniest researchers, when faced with the seemingly contradictory evidence, speculate that the creature might evolve or change over time, which is closer to the truth but still falls short.

Manananggal.name: 马纳南加尔 Manananggal
Manananggal.publicNotes:
马纳南加尔是一种白天像类人生物生活而半夜却吸食他们的邪恶怪物。为了隐藏自身的邪恶，这些生物会伪装成普通人——一般是隐士或者怪人——然后从他们身边社区中挑选出下一个在夜幕降临时袭击的目标。马纳南加尔使用它们细长、中空的舌头从受害者的重要器官，例如肝脏，吸食受害者的血液，因此留下的奇怪血痕使得人们难以断定死者死亡的具体原因。这一般会导致疑惑、猜疑与不信任在社区蔓延，其也正是马纳南加尔所乐于见到的。当他们飞行时，马纳南加尔会发出独特的声音，人们因此也将其称为“滴答-滴答”，而深受其害的社区会一听到这种提示音就陷入恐惧的混乱中。

马纳南加尔和其他种类的分体怪 ，例如庞南加兰一样具有食人、躯体分离的特性，但一些特性让他们与众不同。例如，庞南加兰喜欢醋味甚至用醋洗澡，而马纳南加尔却对醋味深恶痛绝。

Blood Drain.name: 饮血 Blood Drain
Blood Drain.description:
需求@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于马纳南加尔

效果 马纳南加尔驱动它的舌头去吸取被擒抱生物的鲜血。造成@Damage[4d6]伤害，并且马纳南加尔获得等同于所造成伤害数值的临时生命值。被马纳南加尔吸取血量的生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}直到它得到治疗（任何方式和数值）。

Separated Body.name: 躯体分离 Separated Body
Separated Body.description:
马纳南加尔一般会模仿活着的类人生物。在第一眼看来，其外形不像异怪并且在他模仿时他的欺骗技能 DC 获得+4状态加值。但是在夜晚时，马纳南加尔可以使用一个具有操作特征的3动作行动，将他上半身与下半身撕裂开来，遗留的下半身失去力量不能自理，但是使得上半身可以自由飞行。马纳南加尔可以在任何时候分离躯体，但是它在白天时分离会有被进一步伤害的风险。

马纳南加尔的上下半身具有同样数值的 HP。如果他的下半身受到伤害，马纳南加尔会立刻察觉到攻击。在日出后日落前，马纳南加尔每保持分离状态一分钟，下半身受到@Damage[2d6]伤害直到它上下半身重新结合或者被摧毁，以先满足为准。

Manananggal.privateNotes:
Grim Blades

Minatan folktales have it that a forgotten demigod created the first manananggals by bisecting the torso of a human with a divine knife. The demigod then cut into the human's shoulders and drove a pair of bat wings into their back, birthing the first manananggal. The divine power of the demigod's knife still resonates in every manananggal and makes each of the aberrations susceptible to cuts from similar weapons. Communities dealing with a manananggal's terror train with light blades and other slashing weapons to cut the monsters from the sky.

Quantium Golem (Acid).name: Quantium Golem (Acid)

Defender's Link.name: Defender's Link
Defender's Link.description: Each Quantium golem automatically knows the Hit Points, conditions, afflictions, and location of the other.

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by sonic (@Damage[9d10[untyped]], @Damage[3d10[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by fire (area @Damage[3d10[healing]] HP); slowed by cold

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

Paired Reconstruction.name: Paired Reconstruction
Paired Reconstruction.description: When reduced to 0 HP, the Quantium golem is destroyed; however, it magically reforms 24 hours later at full HP and free of all conditions and afflictions unless its twin golem is also destroyed.

Lambent Beam.name: Lambent Beam
Lambent Beam.description: The Quantium golem's eyes take on a brilliant glow and it unleashes an arc of destruction dealing @Damage[10d6[fire],10d6[acid]]{10d6 fire damage and 10d6 acid damage} to creatures in a @Template[line|distance:120] (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic]). The Quantium golem can't use Lambent Beam for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Lambent Beam]]{1d4 rounds}.

Vulnerable to Banishment.name: Vulnerable to Banishment
Vulnerable to Banishment.description: Casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.bay4AfSu2iIozNNW]{Banishment} spell on a Quantium golem disrupts its connection to the Crux of Nex. If targeted by such a spell, the golem is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Twin Defenders.name: Twin Defenders
Twin Defenders.description: The Quantium golems were created by Nex as a matched set: one of crimson and one of emerald, each a unique entity. The crimson golem is imbued with blazing fire and crackling lightning; its eye beam and Lambent Beam abilities deal fire and electricity damage. The emerald golem is charged with caustic power and flame; its eye beam and Lambent Beam abilities deal acid and fire damage.

Quantium Golem (Acid).publicNotes:
The long war between Nex and Geb spawned many animate weapons, but while a citizen of Quantium might run screaming from any product of the fleshforges, they barely bat an eyelash at the ground-shaking stomp of the two titanic, deadly constructs that stride outside their city walls. Crafted by the wizard-king Nex ages ago after a devastating attack by Geb's undead forces, including the harrowing benthic reaver, the Quantium golems are meant to protect the capital in case of Nex's absence. These twin golems ceaselessly keep vigil over the city, ready to cut down any invaders that menace Quantium.

Twenty feet tall and crafted from a supernaturally smooth material, the two guardians are a matched set, one of crimson and one of emerald. Wielding swords the size of giants, the guardians relentlessly destroy anything that threatens the city, particularly any undead that might invade the country from Geb. With the mythic Crux of Nex as a power supply, the golems are inexhaustible and nearly indestructible.

Sound Imitation.name: Sound Imitation
Sound Imitation.description: A karina who succeeds at a Deception check to Lie can mimic any voice they have heard. They have a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

Grave Blight.name: Grave Blight
Grave Blight.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage, every hour the victim must succeed at another Fortitude save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 day)

Mocking Cry.name: Mocking Cry
Mocking Cry.description:
The Karina mimics a voice and mocks a creature within 30 feet. They attempt a Deception check to Demoralize the creature.

Regardless of whether the check succeeds, the target creature is temporarily immune to the Karina's Mocking Cry for 1 hour.

Karina.name: Karina
Karina.publicNotes:
Karinas-also known as plague birds-are large owl-like creatures with dark red feathers, powerful talons, and unsettling eyes. Their broad wings conceal a pair of wiry humanoid arms that end in clawed fingers, which they use to dig through burial sites in search of corpses. The fell purpose of this is still a mystery, though most believe that karinas make off with these dead bodies to consume them in the safety of their lairs. The difficulty of tracking the beasts, as well as the danger, makes it difficult to know for sure.

A karina's terrifying appearance suggests that they're not natural creatures. Many legends claim that karinas first flew out of Abaddon to the Material Plane to consume the corpses of the first mortals, while others state that the first karina was born from the soul of the first mortal who partook in cannibalism. The power of good repulses karinas, suggesting an evil or fiendish origin.

Karinas are plague carriers and intentionally attack creatures to spread their own personal pestilence. The supernatural disease they carry, known as grave blight, causes fever, disorientation, and (at later stages) an innate desire to attack others and spread the disease. Karinas revel in the slow collapse of villages, lurking in the surrounding jungle to observe every miserable moment. As the locals bury their dead, the karinas swoop in to steal the corpses.

In addition to carrying a terrible disease, karinas also have the ability to mimic voices. They typically repeat phrases they've heard, but twist the voice into a fiendish corruption of the original. Intelligent enough to recognize the friends and family of a possible target, a karina will use the mocking voice of a loved one to frighten them. When terrorizing a village, they generally work together in groups of two or three.

Taljjae (The Wanderer).name: Taljjae (The Wanderer)

Exit Stage.name: Exit Stage
Exit Stage.description:
Trigger Taljjae is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect Taljjae retains 1 Hit Point and teleports to an empty space within 30 feet. One of its masks remains behind and is broken.

Jelly Sense.name: Jelly Sense
Jelly Sense.description: Taljjae has scent as a precise sense out to 120 feet, but only to detect buckwheat jelly, the only food Taljjae loves more than flesh.

Circling the Kingdom.name: Circling the Kingdom
Circling the Kingdom.description: Taljjae Strides twice and makes two quarterstaff Strikes at any point along its movement.

Jelly Gluttony.name: Jelly Gluttony
Jelly Gluttony.description: If Taljjae detects buckwheat jelly with its jelly sense, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the food and the creature possessing it (if applicable) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to all other creatures for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, or until it uses an appropriate number of Interact actions to consume the jelly (generally 2: 1 to take the jelly, and another to eat it). If there's more than one helping of jelly, the condition ends once Taljjae consumes the jelly once.

Change Characters.name: Change Characters
Change Characters.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Taljjae removes its current mask and dons a new one. The change refreshes Taljjae, restoring 25 Hit Points. Once Taljjae has removed a mask, it can't Change Characters back to that mask until it has worn all of its unbroken masks at least once, after which the cycle starts again. Taljjae can't don a broken mask.

When Taljjae Changes Characters, it gains access to the listed abilities. Any items (such as weapons) associated with its previous mask immediately disappear and are replaced by fresh ones for its new mask, but the effects of any mask abilities it has active persist. Removing a mask and later reapplying it doesn't restore any limited-use abilities.

Prop Master.name: Prop Master
Prop Master.description: Taljjae has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields from one of its masks.

Second Act.name: Second Act
Second Act.description:
Trigger Taljjae's turn begins Requirements Taljjae has 200 or fewer Hit Points

Effect Taljjae's dance reaches a frantic climax, allowing it to change personas rapidly. Taljjae Changes Characters.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Taljjae deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} foes.

Waypoints.name: Waypoints
Waypoints.description: Taljjae leaves behind images of itself as it travels. Whenever it makes a Strike, it leaves behind a ghostly image of itself that lasts until the beginning of its next turn. These images block movement for Taljjae's enemies, and they provide flanking to Taljjae and its allies.

Taljjae (The Wanderer).publicNotes:
The form of Taljjae's body can vary from visit to visit or even moment to moment, but it's easily recognized due to its signature cloak and masks. So long as Taljjae's mood is placid, it can be approached safely, but its mercurial temperament can be hard to predict.

The slightly upturned smile of this mask depicts a sense of joy and wonder at travel and new experiences.

Somnalu Oculus.publicNotes: When Somnalu is defeated, its central eye abandons its dying body to create an ethereal body from the wisps of dreams. Over centuries-or sooner, if it can find a powerful source of nightmares-it can re-form a full body and return to its corporeal self.

Scrutinizing Presence.description: 60 feet. The Somnalu Oculus scrutinizes creatures around it, causing them to falter with nervousness and self-doubt. Upon entering the emanation, a creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:34] save. On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to scrutinizing presence for 1 minute.
Scrutinizing Presence.name: Scrutinizing Presence

Clearing Blink.name: Clearing Blink
Clearing Blink.description:
Trigger The Somnalu Oculus would be affected by a condition

Effect The Somnalu Oculus rapidly blinks, using dream wisps as an eyelid. The Somnalu Oculus attempts to counteract the source of the condition with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+24 #Counteract]]{+24} and a counteract rank of 8.

It can't use Clearing Blink again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Clearing Blink]]{1d4 rounds}.

Somnalu Oculus.name: Somnalu Oculus

Oderless.description: The graul exudes no natural aroma, rendering it undetectable to creatures using the scent ability.
Oderless.name: Oderless

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description: A living creature struck by a graul's jaws attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new check at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such check. A creature paralyzed by this ability is also affected by the graul's darkvision invisibility for as long as the effect persists.

Darkvision Invisibility.name: Darkvision Invisibility
Darkvision Invisibility.description: The graul's rubbery flesh is saturated with a unique biochemical compound that renders it undetectable by any form of darkvision. In dim or bright light, the creature can be perceived normally by any kind of vision.

Seize.name: Seize
Seize.description:
Requirements The graul has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its tentacle

Effect The graul pulls the creature toward itself. The graul attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC. With a success, the graul pulls the creature 15 feet closer to it.

Tentacle Grab.name: Tentacle Grab
Tentacle Grab.description: A creature hit by the graul's tentacle becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the graul. The creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the graul's tentacle. A creature can sever the tentacle with a Strike against AC 18 that deals at least @Damage[10[slashing]] damage. This deals no damage to the graul but prevents it from using its tentacle Strike until it regrows the tentacle, which takes 1 round. The graul can move without ending the Grab as long as the creature remains within the tentacle's reach.

Sound Mimicry.name: Sound Mimicry
Sound Mimicry.description: The graul can perfectly imitate the sounds and speech of other creatures by attempting a @Check[deception|against:will] check against a listener's Will DC. The graul doesn't need to understand the language it's mimicking, but when speaking a language it doesn't know, the creature can only repeat specific words and phrases it has heard in the past 24 hours. The graul can't use this ability to duplicate voice-based abilities or spells.

Graul.name: Graul
Graul.publicNotes: The labyrinthine caverns and tunnels beneath Highhelm are home to many dangers, with the insidious graul being one of the more notable native species. These highly specialized ambush predators possess a natural camouflage that renders them completely imperceptible to all forms of darkvision as they float silently through the darkness, allowing them to hunt creatures that rely on specialized senses to navigate their lightless domain. Surprisingly cunning, grauls are adept at using their magical talents for illusion and mimicry to separate potential prey from allies and light sources alike.

Taljjae (The Hero).name: Taljjae (The Hero)

Exit Stage.name: Exit Stage
Exit Stage.description:
Trigger Taljjae is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect Taljjae retains 1 Hit Point and teleports to an empty space within 30 feet. One of its masks remains behind and is broken.

Jelly Gluttony.name: Jelly Gluttony
Jelly Gluttony.description: If Taljjae detects buckwheat jelly with its jelly sense, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the food and the creature possessing it (if applicable) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to all other creatures for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, or until it uses an appropriate number of Interact actions to consume the jelly (generally 2: 1 to take the jelly, and another to eat it). If there's more than one helping of jelly, the condition ends once Taljjae consumes the jelly once.

Prop Master.name: Prop Master
Prop Master.description: Taljjae has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields from one of its masks.

Jelly Sense.name: Jelly Sense
Jelly Sense.description: Taljjae has scent as a precise sense out to 120 feet, but only to detect buckwheat jelly, the only food Taljjae loves more than flesh.

Change Characters.name: Change Characters
Change Characters.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Taljjae removes its current mask and dons a new one. The change refreshes Taljjae, restoring 25 Hit Points. Once Taljjae has removed a mask, it can't Change Characters back to that mask until it has worn all of its unbroken masks at least once, after which the cycle starts again. Taljjae can't don a broken mask.

When Taljjae Changes Characters, it gains access to the listed abilities. Any items (such as weapons) associated with its previous mask immediately disappear and are replaced by fresh ones for its new mask, but the effects of any mask abilities it has active persist. Removing a mask and later reapplying it doesn't restore any limited-use abilities.

Cometfall Arrow.name: Cometfall Arrow
Cometfall Arrow.description:
Taljjae fires an arrow that could shoot a star from the sky. All creatures in a @Template[line|distance:120] take @Damage[10d12[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect] save); on a critical failure, the target falls to the ground without taking falling damage, and it can't Fly, Leap, levitate, or otherwise leave the ground until the end of Taljjae's next turn.

Taljjae then can't use Cometfall Arrow for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Cometfall Arrow]]{1d4 rounds}.

Double Shot.name: Double Shot
Double Shot.description: Taljjae fires two shots, making two Strikes, each against a separate target and with a -2 penalty. Both attacks count toward its multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it makes both attacks.

Second Act.name: Second Act
Second Act.description:
Trigger Taljjae's turn begins Requirements Taljjae has 200 or fewer Hit Points

Effect Taljjae's dance reaches a frantic climax, allowing it to change personas rapidly. Taljjae Changes Characters.

Taljjae (The Hero).publicNotes:
The form of Taljjae's body can vary from visit to visit or even moment to moment, but it's easily recognized due to its signature cloak and masks. So long as Taljjae's mood is placid, it can be approached safely, but its mercurial temperament can be hard to predict.

The eyes of this female face seem to glint with determination.

Anadi Sage.name: 半蛛人贤者 Anadi Sage
Anadi Sage.publicNotes:
半蛛人贤者和大自然沟通，并不断磨练自己的魔法技艺。

半蛛人是爱好和平、避世隐居的类人生物，生活在森林、丛林和其他未被征服的荒野深处。它们的真实形态很像半人半蜘蛛，身上有五颜六色的美丽而独特的斑纹。这些图案就像别的类人生物的面部、胎记等其他特征一样独特。

半蛛人天生就具有制造幻觉和变形的天赋。它们很久以前就知道自己的真实形态会遭到其它类人生物的厌恶，因此常常以类人生物的形态示人。当他们伪装成类人生物的时候，他们漆黑的眼睛里会闪烁一种奇怪的、可爱的光泽，以及下意识的小动作会暗示他们并非表面看起来的那样简单。由于他们已经习惯了类人生物对蜘蛛的敏感态度，大多数半蛛人都觉得向陌生人展示自己的真实形态是不礼貌的表现。

大多数半蛛人只有在面临危险时才会变为蜘蛛形态，并将此作为一种吓退敌人的策略。如果被迫进入战斗——大多数半蛛人都不愿如此——他们会尽快变成真实形态，这样就能对敌人施加毁灭性的毒液。

Anadi Venom.name: 半蛛人毒液 Anadi Venom
Anadi Venom.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

最大持续时间 4轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]（1轮）

阶段2 @Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害，措手不及和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}（1轮）

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
半蛛人将自己变形为真实形态、蜘蛛形态、或人类形态。上面的数据是真实形态下的数据。当他们在人类形态下时，他们失去尖牙打击能力和攀爬速度。在蜘蛛形态下时，他们不能使用武器。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Spin Silk.name: 吐丝 Spin Silk
Spin Silk.description: 通过花费几分钟时间，半蛛人能通过吐丝来制造纺织品。一个半蛛人在一天内能吐出的丝足够制造一件衣服。

Luminous Lure.name: Luminous Lure
Luminous Lure.description:
30 feet. The mamlambo emits dim light from its skin. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] save. Humanoids take a -2 penalty to this saving throw.

Regardless of the save's result, the creature is temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, and for as long as it is in the aura it must spend at least 1 of its actions on each of its turns to move closer to the mamlambo as expediently as possible, while avoiding obvious dangers. If the creature ends its movement or turn adjacent to the mamlambo, it is Slowed 1 until it is out of the aura or until the mamlambo makes a Strike against it.

The target can attempt a new Will save at the beginning of each of their subsequent turns, and on a success, the effect ends.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature must spend each of its actions moving closer to the mamlambo, and if it ends its movement or turn adjacent to the mamlambo, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} until it is out of the aura or until the mamlambo makes a Strike against it.

Face Eater.name: Face Eater
Face Eater.description:
Requirements The mamlambo has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, or there is a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature within the mamlambo's reach

Effect The mamlambo deals @Damage[(2d8+11)[piercing]] damage to the creature (@Check[fortitude|dc:28|basic] save).

On a failure, the creature also takes an additional @Damage[2d6[bleed]], or @Damage[4d6[bleed]] on a critical failure.

Mamlambo.name: Mamlambo
Mamlambo.publicNotes:
Mamlambos are river predators with hypnotic, bioluminescent skin. They appear similar to crocodiles, but the narrow head at the end of their long necks resembles a horse's skull, and their four legs are stubby and inefficient for land movement. Their skin's green glow is only barely visible in daylight or when underwater, though the glow is difficult to resist. As a result, they're frequently trailed by fish, birds, or other river creatures ensnared by the alluring radiance.

Humanoids are mamlambos' favorite prey, particularly humans, although they strangely prefer to only eat their victims' faces and brains. Mamlambos are dim-witted but sly, and sometimes hide their victims under submerged rocks or logs to make their discovery less likely. A mamlambo might be active in a region for days or even weeks before its presence is discovered.

Jelly Sense.name: Jelly Sense
Jelly Sense.description: Taljjae has scent as a precise sense out to 120 feet, but only to detect buckwheat jelly, the only food Taljjae loves more than flesh.

Covetous Confiscation.description: Taljjae holds out a hand and attempts to take something that doesn't belong to it. It telekinetically attracts an unattended, unsecured object of up to 5 Bulk within 100 feet. If the object is in a creature's possession, Taljjae must critically succeed at an attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} that creature, but it can't critically fail.
Covetous Confiscation.name: Covetous Confiscation

Second Act.name: Second Act
Second Act.description:
Trigger Taljjae's turn begins Requirements Taljjae has 200 or fewer Hit Points

Effect Taljjae's dance reaches a frantic climax, allowing it to change personas rapidly. Taljjae Changes Characters.

Exit Stage.name: Exit Stage
Exit Stage.description:
Trigger Taljjae is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect Taljjae retains 1 Hit Point and teleports to an empty space within 30 feet. One of its masks remains behind and is broken.

Jelly Gluttony.name: Jelly Gluttony
Jelly Gluttony.description: If Taljjae detects buckwheat jelly with its jelly sense, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the food and the creature possessing it (if applicable) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to all other creatures for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, or until it uses an appropriate number of Interact actions to consume the jelly (generally 2: 1 to take the jelly, and another to eat it). If there's more than one helping of jelly, the condition ends once Taljjae consumes the jelly once.

Change Characters.name: Change Characters
Change Characters.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Taljjae removes its current mask and dons a new one. The change refreshes Taljjae, restoring 25 Hit Points. Once Taljjae has removed a mask, it can't Change Characters back to that mask until it has worn all of its unbroken masks at least once, after which the cycle starts again. Taljjae can't don a broken mask.

When Taljjae Changes Characters, it gains access to the listed abilities. Any items (such as weapons) associated with its previous mask immediately disappear and are replaced by fresh ones for its new mask, but the effects of any mask abilities it has active persist. Removing a mask and later reapplying it doesn't restore any limited-use abilities.

Parasitic Healing.name: Parasitic Healing
Parasitic Healing.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet regains Hit Points

Effect Taljjae takes what should belong to another. The triggering creature regains only half the number of Hit Points, and Taljjae regains the full amount.

Prop Master.name: Prop Master
Prop Master.description: Taljjae has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields from one of its masks.

Taljjae (The Nobleman).name: Taljjae (The Nobleman)
Taljjae (The Nobleman).publicNotes:
The form of Taljjae's body can vary from visit to visit or even moment to moment, but it's easily recognized due to its signature cloak and masks. So long as Taljjae's mood is placid, it can be approached safely, but its mercurial temperament can be hard to predict.

This twisted mask mocks members of the nobility for their parasitic greed.

Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 水波感知（模糊）60尺 Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet

Frozen Contemplation.name: Frozen Contemplation
Frozen Contemplation.description: Being frozen stops the constant pain Ulgrem-Axaan has experienced since its death. Ulgrem-Axaan has fast healing 5 while in severe cold or colder environments, or for 1 round after taking cold damage.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Non-primal Em.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Non-primal Emotion Effects

Baleful Glare.name: Baleful Glare
Baleful Glare.description: 15 feet. Creatures entering or starting their turn in the emanation that can see Ulgrem-Axaan must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure). A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to baleful glare for 1 minute.

Territorial Rage.name: Territorial Rage
Territorial Rage.description:
Trigger A creature comes within melee reach of Ulgrem-Axaan while it's burrowed underground or underwater

Effect Ulgrem-Axaan lunges and makes a jaws Strike against the creature, which is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the attack and takes an additional [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 damage} on a hit.

Unnatural Vengeance.name: Unnatural Vengeance
Unnatural Vengeance.description: Ulgrem-Axaan gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack and damage rolls against undead.

Voltaic Blow.name: Voltaic Blow
Voltaic Blow.description:
Requirements Ulgrem-Axaan has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its tail

Effect An electric shock passes through Ulgrem-Axaan's tail, dealing @Damage[(2d4+8)[electricity]] damage to the creature (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save).

Ulgrem-Axaan.name: Ulgrem-Axaan
Ulgrem-Axaan.allSaves: +2 status to all non-primal emotion effects

Defensive Curl.name: Defensive Curl
Defensive Curl.description: The ugvashi coils into a ball to defend itself. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC. Any creatures who make unarmed attacks against the ugvashi while it's in its Defensive Curl are exposed to its serrated plates, as if they'd taken damage from the ugvashi's body. The ugvashi can't move while in its Defensive Curl, but it can unfurl as an action.

Serrated Plates.name: Serrated Plates
Serrated Plates.description: Creatures who take damage from an ugvashi's body must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save or take @Damage[1d4[bleed]] damage (@Damage[2d4[bleed]] damage on a critical failure).

Ugvashi.name: Ugvashi
Ugvashi.publicNotes:
These razor-plated pangolins—about the size of small ponies—are the traditional pack animals of halflings from Casmaron, though the ugvashi's serrated plates and tendency to curl up make them ill-suited as mounts. Ugvashi first arrived in the Impossible Lands onboard the Thousand and One ships of Maharajah Khiben-Sald, alongside peafowl, giant squirrels, and other fauna from Vudra. In the modern day, ugvashi are such a recognized sight that many people forget they aren't a native species. Though some feral populations exist, mainly on the island of Jalmeray, the hostile environs of Nex and the Mana Wastes mean ugvashi mainly appear in domestic settings, usually as working beasts among the Nearic halflings of western Nex.

Though ugvashi are mostly harmless, they're somewhat more dangerous than their smaller cousins, causing a stir when reckless citizens attempt to pet the creatures. Ugvashi scales are razor sharp, and their large and blunted digging claws can be deadly due to their size. People who attempt to steal the animals or ride them without training often receive moderate cuts for their trouble. However, ugvashi are generally curious and very friendly, and more than one visitor or wilderness explorer has found a baby ugvashi toddling after them and pawing at their boots.

Nearic halflings also paint their ugvashi with distinctive warding patterns and sigils, some of which are actually effective and provide a surprise for opportunistic thieves or predators. Though due consideration is spent on protecting an ugvashi's cargo, the animals themselves have proven to be tempting targets as well, especially for their meat. With blighted landscapes making animal husbandry impractical and magical pollution leaving local seafood with a distinct aftertaste, a number of Nexian and Mana Wastes peoples have developed a taste for ugvashi. Since the animals lack an aggressive temperament, it often falls to their caretakers to discourage such predations through whatever means necessary.

Ugvashi shed their scales each winter, allowing for the plates to be collected safely and turned into quality armor and other pieces of craftwork. Nearic halflings rarely trade or sell these items, however, out of fear that they might lead to more people trying to steal their ugvashi.

Bump in the River.name: Bump in the River
Bump in the River.description: An Ulgrem-Lurann can pretend to be a floating log while in water by attempting a Stealth check. It has a +2 circumstance bonus to its checks and DCs to do so. While using Stealth this way, creatures see the log but don't realize it's an Ulgrem-Lurann.

Nurtured Loathing.name: Nurtured Loathing
Nurtured Loathing.description: An Ulgrem-Lurann gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack and damage rolls against creatures with the undead trait.

Sparking Bite.name: Sparking Bite
Sparking Bite.description:
Requirements The Ulgrem-Lurann has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its jaws

Effect Electricity courses through its body and mouth, dealing an additional @Damage[(1d4+6)[electricity]] damage to the grabbed target with a @Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic] save.

Voltaic Blow.name: Voltaic Blow
Voltaic Blow.description:
Requirements The Ulgrem-Lurann has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its jaws

Effect Electricity courses through its body and mouth, dealing an additional @Damage[(1d4+6)[electricity]] damage to the creature (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic|name:Sparking Bite] save).

Conformance.name: Conformance
Conformance.description: The conformer contorts and reshapes their body into a desired form. The conformer takes on the specific appearance of any Small, Medium, or Large humanoid or animal that they've observed and whose appearance they remember. This doesn't change the conformer's Speed or their attack and damage bonus with their Strikes, but might change the damage type their Strikes deal.

Surgical Detachment.name: Surgical Detachment
Surgical Detachment.description: The conformer detaches part of their body to serve them as an autonomous organism. For the next 24 hours, the conformer gains the loyal service of a fleshforged @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.lost-omens-bestiary.Actor.LVY9JAhTnBC2SeqZ]{Skinskitter}. As long as they remain within 1 mile of each other, the conformer can use the Surgical Detachment action again to empathically direct the actions of their skinskitter servant as well as perceive through its senses. Due to how taxing this process is, the conformer can have only one skinskitter servant at a time.

Tissue Siphon.name: Tissue Siphon
Tissue Siphon.description:
Requirements The conformer is within reach of an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or willing creature, or a creature taking persistent bleed damage

Effect The conformer touches and absorbs some of the creature's flesh. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save; on a failure, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and take damage from their persistent bleed damage, even though it isn't the end of their turn.

Wear Flesh.name: Wear Flesh
Wear Flesh.description:
Requirements The conformer has used Tissue Siphon to absorb flesh within the last hour

Effect The conformer expends the flesh they've absorbed to transform their body, reproducing the effects of one of the following spells: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GUnw9YXaW3YyaCAU]{Adapt Self}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzctak6BxOW8xvFV]{Enlarge}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SDkIFrrO1PsE02Kd]{Shifting Form}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i8PBZsnoCrK7IWph]{Tentacular Limbs}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ddKBoCjmSyPSHcws]{Unusual Anatomy}. The Wear Flesh action gains the traits of the spell it's reproducing, and the conformer can Sustain a Spell on these effects.

Fleshforged Conformer.name: Fleshforged Conformer
Fleshforged Conformer.publicNotes:
Shapeshifting fleshforged conformers have adapted to survive Ecanus's high-magic, population-dense sprawl. Resembling blocky humanoid skeletons splotched in uneven layers with cartilage and muscle, conformers are capable of attaching and detaching flesh from their bodies, often sending autonomous gobbets of fat and ligament to observe living creatures and harvest biological material.

Fleshforged conformers use their resources to augment and change their bodies, which helps them infiltrate Nexian society to better understand the arcane principles and occult secrets behind their creation. Some assume the guises of humans and animals to lead quiet, settled lives in Nex, but most are discovered and summarily exterminated as defects and threats to public safety.

Water-Bound Curse.name: 困水诅咒 Water-Bound Curse
Water-Bound Curse.description: 水鬼被束缚在其死亡的水体中。它无法移动超出水体边缘120尺。

Rejuvenation.name: 复生 Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: 当水鬼被摧毁时，它会在[[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4天}后于其束缚的水体中重构，被完全治疗。如果能找到最初死在水中的水鬼尸体并将之安葬，水鬼便能被永久摧毁。

Ti Shõn.name: 替死 Ti Shõn
Ti Shõn.description:
触发@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于水鬼的生物因窒息死亡

效果 水鬼将溺死受害者的灵魂从身体中剥离，然后进入尸体中取代原主人的位置。水鬼会在水体边缘复活，如同成为成功的起死回生仪式的目标，除了它会获得目标的外观而非原本的身体。一周后，溺死生物的精魂将成为一只水鬼。新的精魂无法通过普通的魔法手段从死亡中唤起，直到他以水鬼的身份被摧毁。

Drag Under.name: 拽入水下 Drag Under
Drag Under.description: 水鬼带着@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]的生物，以一半速度游泳。

Drown the Living.name: 溺死生者 Drown the Living
Drown the Living.description:
需求 目标必须屏住呼吸或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]于水鬼

效果 水鬼收紧抓握。目标必须成功通过一次DC 24的强韧豁免，否则立即失去价值[[/gmr 1d4 #actions]]{1d4动作}的空气（大失败时失去两倍）。

Ghostly Grasp.name: 幽灵抓握 Ghostly Grasp
Ghostly Grasp.description: 水鬼虽然是虚体，但是可以@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{擒拿 Grapple}有实体的生物。水鬼可以如常使用运动检定进行擒拿，但不能使用运动来执行其他需要实体接触的动作，例如@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{破拆 Force Open}或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{摔绊 Trip}。

Shui Gui.name: 水鬼 Shui Gui
Shui Gui.publicNotes:
When a person drowns in a body of water, there's a chance that their spirit will be trapped and unable to reincarnate. Twisted with anger, spite, and malice, the spirit transforms into a shui gui.

If someone sees a shui gui from shore, they'll often see only the top part of a head with two pinprick reflections of light from its eyes. Lurking under docks and near the water's edge, the shui gui calls out to people or makes disturbances to draw them within reach of the water. Once the unsuspecting victim is close enough, the spirit pulls them underwater, drowns them, and possesses their body in a process known as ti sh-on. Once the spirit successfully inhabits the vacant body, they escape their curse and live a new life; however, their victim's spirit remains trapped in the water until, at last, they too drown a hapless passerby, thus continuing a never-ending cycle.

A shui gui is terrified of fire, and those who camp by water or travel by boat are advised to always keep a lantern handy. Charms and amulets can also keep the shui gui at bay, but the spirit is generally weakest after being goaded onto land.

Vandal.name: Vandal
Vandal.description: Whenever the Krampus celebrant deals damage to an object, it ignores the first 10 points of the object's Hardness.

Snowstride.name: Snowstride
Snowstride.description: The Krampus celebrant ignores difficult terrain caused by snow and ice, and it treats greater difficult terrain caused by snow and ice as difficult terrain.

Frightful Parade.name: Frightful Parade
Frightful Parade.description: The Krampus celebrant Strides up to its Speed and attempts a birch bundle Strike against one creature within its reach at any point during that movement.

Relentless Torment.name: Relentless Torment
Relentless Torment.description:
Trigger The Krampus celebrant hits a frightened creature with its birch bundle Strike

Effect The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save to resist the effects of the fearful assault.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[1d8[mental]] damage. At the end of the creature's next turn, its frightened condition doesn't decrease by 1.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[2d8[mental]] damage, and its frightened condition increases by 1 (maximum 4). At the end of its next turn, its frightened condition doesn't decrease by 1.

Subsumed Traits.name: 归属特征 Subsumed Traits
Subsumed Traits.description: 在完全消化一顿饱餐之后，空心熊会从该生物上获得一个特征，直到其下一次饱腹。获得动物特征的空心熊会获得60尺的灵敏嗅觉作为模糊感官，而获得两栖或水栖特征的空心熊获得25尺游泳速度。类人特征的空心熊获得反应打击反应动作。如火焰这样的特征会给空心熊的抗力添加该伤害类型。其他特征具有的效果由GM决定。

Ambush.name: 伏击 Ambush
Ambush.description:
需求 空心熊正在躲藏，且一个未侦测到它的生物处于其20尺内

效果 空心熊朝该生物行走。一旦生物处于触及范围内，空心熊对其进行一次打击。对于此次攻击目标生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。

Devour.name: 吞噬 Devour
Devour.description:
需求 空心熊上一个动作为成功的颚咬打击

效果 目标受到@Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]]伤害。空心熊从该生物的血液中获得一些知识，教会它理解和说出该生物掌握的所有语言，持续1分钟，它会用目标声音的扭曲版说话。在此期间，空心熊在对该生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{挫败士气 Demoralize}的威吓检定上获得+2环境加值。

Full Belly.name: 饱腹 Full Belly
Full Belly.description: 当空心熊吃饱时，这需要吃下一整只中型生物或6负载的肉，它就会变得平和，甚至贪玩。它在伪装成普通太阳熊的欺骗检定和DC上自动取33的结果，但会失去其抗力。空心熊可以保持饱腹状态8小时。

Reactive Strike (Humanoid Subsumed Trait.name: 反应打击 Reactive Strike (仅限类人归属特征)

Gau Cho Rong.name: 空心熊 Gau Cho Rong
Gau Cho Rong.publicNotes: 篝火故事里空心熊起源于偷猎者猎物的幽灵前来复仇，是鬼婆捏造的爪牙，或是被诅咒的野兽，对在不该去的地方乱逛的小孩的肉上了瘾。它们有个令人不安的绰号“空心熊”，很容易被误认为它们善良的表亲，太阳熊。它们身高只有 3 英尺多一点，舌头又长又软，吃饱时像可爱的小熊，但当它们开始饥饿和空虚时，就会变成骇物。饥饿的空心熊皮毛会变得松弛，直到看起来只剩下一袋皮毛中的脆弱骨骼，就像一个被剥去填充物的旧玩偶。空心熊会蠕动和呜咽，引诱同情的受害者或投机的猎人。当这些目标靠近时，其他空心熊就会从树枝上落下来，扑向猎物的背部和脸部，当它们用钩状长爪攻击猎物时，松软的皮毛会使大多数攻击变得迟钝。吃饱喝足后，空心熊又恢复了可爱的样子。就这样，它们继续着嬉戏、狩猎、偷懒、杀戮、玩闹和撕咬的生活。
Gau Cho Rong.privateNotes:
Subsumed Traits

Physical changes from creatures they've devoured are visible in markings on the gau cho rong's loose hide and even in the shape of its bony frame, granting different hollow bears slightly different abilities even among the same group. It's possible that unique, older, or more powerful gau cho rongs might gain permanent abilities from digesting certain creatures.

Limited Immortality.name: Limited Immortality
Limited Immortality.description:
Though Krampus still needs to eat, drink, and sleep, he doesn't age and can't die of old age. If Krampus is killed, a new Krampus forms elsewhere in the world after a year's time.

The new Krampus retains the memories of the previous iteration and likely holds a grudge against whoever killed him the year before. If a method to disrupt this cycle exists, it has yet to be discovered by mortals.

Capture.name: Capture
Capture.description:
Requirements Krampus has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect Krampus attempts to stuff the grabbed creature into his basket, attempting an @Check[athletics|against:reflex] check against the target's Reflex DC. If he succeeds, the creature is shoved into Krampus's basket and Krampus's spiked chain or claw is freed for future Strikes.

The captured creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, and subjected to Krampus's regression ability (see below) at the start of each round it is captured.

If the victim [[/act escape dc=48]]{Escapes}, it climbs out of the basket. A captured creature can attack the interior of the basket, but only with unarmed attacks or weapons of light Bulk or less, against an AC of 40. If the captured creature deals 40 slashing or piercing damage, the basket is broken and all the creatures inside spill out. A creature that gets free by either Escaping or by someone breaking the basket is deposited in a square of their choosing adjacent to Krampus.

The basket is an extradimensional space, so the weight of the creatures within doesn't count against Krampus's Bulk limit. Up to four Small creatures or two Medium creatures can fit in the basket at one time.

Krampus can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repair} the basket as a 2-action activity that doesn't require tools. If the basket is lost or destroyed, Krampus can create a new one with 1 hour of work. The basket functions as a normal sack if used by anyone other than Krampus.

Crushing Avarice.name: Crushing Avarice
Crushing Avarice.description:
Krampus's greed is so great that expending any of his wealth causes him to become physically ill and potentially nauseous. Whenever Krampus uses a consumable item from his bountiful bag, or when he witnesses one of his possessions stolen, he must attempt a @Check[will|dc:44] save.

Success Krampus is unaffected.

Failure Krampus becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure Krampus becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Punish the Naughty.name: Punish the Naughty
Punish the Naughty.description:
Requirements Krampus can sense the target with his thief scent.

Krampus designates a single target he can see as "naughty" He gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when he Seeks the naughty target and a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks to Track the naughty target.

On melee attacks against the naughty target, Krampus's spiked chain gains the agile trait. In addition, when Krampus Grabs the naughty target, he can attempt to Capture them as a free action. Krampus can have only one naughty target at a time.

Snowstep.name: Snowstep
Snowstep.description: Krampus ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain caused by snow and ice, and he leaves no tracks when moving through areas of snow or ice.

Thief Scent.name: Thief Scent
Thief Scent.description: Krampus can perceive anyone who has ever stolen or moved one of his possessions, using scent as an imprecise sense with a range of 1 mile.

Bountiful Bag.name: Bountiful Bag
Bountiful Bag.description:
Krampus carries a large bag brimming with barely contained gifts and trinkets, including one of every common item with the consumable trait of levels 1 to 20, at least 20 golden rod mementos, and an assortment of food and valuables. Once every 24 hours, the bag's contents magically regenerate, replacing any of these items that have been removed. Krampus can Interact with the bag to stow or withdraw items, always finding the desired stored item at the top of the bag. The bag is an extradimensional space, so the weight of its contents doesn't count against Krampus's Bulk limit. The bag functions as a normal sack if used by anyone other than Krampus, and if the bag is stolen or Krampus is slain, the bag retains only [[/r 2d4]] random common consumable items of 16th level or higher.

A creature can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} to extract a consumable item from Krampus's bag. As part of the action, the creature can envision a specific item it wants to extract. On a success, the creature Disarms or Steals the object and rolls a @Check[flat|dc:13|name:Stealing from Krampus' Bag|showDC:owner] check.

Success The creature Disarms or Steals the envisioned object. If the creature didn't envision an object, it Disarms or Steals a random common consumable item of a level at least half the creature's level.

Failure The creature Disarms or Steals a random common consumable item of a level at least half the creature's level.

Critical Failure The creature Disarms or Steals a golden rod memento instead of a consumable item.

Blizzard Sight.name: Blizzard Sight
Blizzard Sight.description: Krampus ignores circumstance penalties to visual Perception checks due to ice or snow, as well as concealment due to ice or snow.

Krampus (The Horned Miser).name: Krampus (The Horned Miser)
Krampus (The Horned Miser).publicNotes:
Krampus is a tall, goatlike humanoid with a pointed nose, swept-back horns, and hooved feet. His long, greasy tongue continually flickers out from his mouth, occasionally licking droplets of spittle from his dark brown fur. He wields a set of iron chains that act as an extension of his will. Krampus is never seen without a wicker basket draped over one shoulder, its bottom often stained with the blood of his victims. Krampus stands a little over 14 feet tall and weighs nearly 1,000 pounds.

Krampus's origin is unknown; residents of the small towns and villages he terrorizes in northern Irrisen believe the creature has always existed, coming forth once a year to punish those he deems wicked. While many legends have been told about Krampus's beginning, the most popular of them starts with a handful of mountain towns under the protection of a circle of druids. After a series of harsh winters that the townsfolk barely survived, they began to doubt the power of the druids and their rituals. As the villagers grew more resentful, the druid circle took drastic action. Under the light of a blue moon, the druids opened an imperfect portal to the primal realm of the fey and called forth the most powerful spiritual essence they could, and a new creature was born-Krampus. However, unknown to the druids, the portal had been corrupted by the villagers' bitter resentment and doubt. Instead of a central figure to lead them in winter celebrations, as they had hoped, the druids had spawned a monster who sought to punish those who had behaved selfishly during lean times.

Recognizing their error, the druids sought to banish their creation. They tracked Krampus down as he slept and shackled him in cold iron chains, hoping to subdue him and force him back to the First World. But Krampus was no fey, and cold iron held no power over him. When he awoke, he ripped the chains free, claimed them as his own, and tracked down the druids who had dared try to capture him. After their betrayal, Krampus can see no good in any mortal and longs only to punish the wicked for their selfish misdeeds.

To this day, Krampus takes vicious delight in transforming his victims into the petulant children before killing them, and no manner of sacrifice can appease him. Luckily for any nearby villages, Krampus stalks their streets but once a year.

Locals believe that Krampus makes his lair among the deep crevasses of ice somewhere within the Winterwall Glacier, which lines Avistan's northernmost reaches. No adventurer has yet braved the treacherous expanse to find and defeat him.

While Krampus is most infamous for tracking and punishing the naughty, his own sins often inform his vindictive responses to others' misdeeds. An incarnation of Krampus who arose from irrepressible greed might possess abilities that better reflect his fierce miserly behavior, emphasizing less the abduction of miscreants and more the disproportionate punishment of thieves and robbers. Such a variant Krampus might arise in different cultures that tell different stories about Krampus, or Krampus's powers and nature might drift between incarnations each time he is defeated and arises anew elsewhere in the world the following year. In these cultures or incarnations, Krampus represents a remorseless yet generous spirit who's willing to grant boons to the truly worthy while tormenting any who fail his morality tests.

Unfortunately for people in regions terrorized by this Krampus, his definition of "any who fail his morality tests" tend to be nearly everyone but the most innocent and generous of people.

Mosquito Witch.name: 蚊女巫 Mosquito Witch
Mosquito Witch.publicNotes: 蚊女巫外表类似人形，有着令人不舒服的蜡黄皮肤。她似乎总是低着头，耸着肩膀，一头蓬乱的黑发遮住整个脸，只能看见一双一眨不眨的红眼睛和一条又长又尖的舌头，舌头僵硬突出就像个长长的鼻子，背后长着有血肉和骨头的蚊子翅膀。她有六条胳膊，但胳膊上没有长手，而是逐渐变细形成畸形的尖端，像虫蛹的腿一样紧紧抱在胸前。她细长的双腿也逐渐变尖；当她吃饱而肿胀起来之后，就必须用全部八条肢体行走，这八条肢体会在地面上留下小孔一样的足迹。

Swarmsense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: 集群感官（模糊）30 尺
Swarmsense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: 蚊女巫可以从附近的昆虫处不断接受信息。只要周围有昆虫引导她，她就可以使用触觉作为一种模糊感官，范围为所标注的距离。

Wild Empathy.name: 野性认同 Wild Empathy
Wild Empathy.description: 蚊女巫可以使用交涉技能对节肢动物（昆虫、蜘蛛和类似的无脊椎动物，例如蚊幅）进行[[/act make-an-impression]]和[[/act request]]。大部分节肢动物对蚊女巫的初始态度都是不关心。

Haunting Gaze.name: 慑人凝视 Haunting Gaze
Haunting Gaze.description: 30尺。当一个生物在灵光范围内结束回合时，必须进行@Check[will|dc:29]豁免。如果检定失败，则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}若其已经陷入惊惧，则惊惧值上升1（最多@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3}），并且在其下一回合结束时惊惧值不会下降1。如果在豁免失败之前该生物的惊惧值已为3或更高，则其@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]1轮。

Dipteric Dread.name: 战栗双翼 Dipteric Dread
Dipteric Dread.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:29]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[2d6[piercing],2d6[poison]]伤害（1轮）

阶段2 @Damage[2d6[piercing],3d6[poison]]伤害（1轮）

阶段3 @Damage[2d6[piercing],5d6[poison]]伤害

Terror From Within.name: 内生恐惧 Terror From Within
Terror From Within.description: 蚊女巫的力量靠恐惧获得滋养。当一个生物因蚊女巫的噬咬和战栗双翼而受到流血或穿刺伤害时，还要受到2倍于其惊惧值的额外伤害。

Storm Discharge.disable: @Check[nature|dc:45|name:Balance the Electrical Charges|traits:divine,electricity,environmental,evocation,kaiju,hazard] (master) to balance the electrical charges in the area or @Check[deception|dc:48|name:Divert Ebeshra's Attention|traits:divine,electricity,environmental,evocation,kaiju,hazard] (expert) to momentarily divert Ebeshra's attention
Storm Discharge.name: Storm Discharge
Storm Discharge.hazarddescription: Ebeshra aligns its crystalline form to produce a blast of lightning that charges the surrounding area with electrical energy.
Storm Discharge.reset: Ebeshra waits [[/gmr 1d4 #Lightning Blast Wait]] rounds before another blast.

Lightning Blast.name: Lightning Blast
Lightning Blast.description:
Trigger A creature takes a hostile action against Ebeshra, produces a visible area effect, or flies within 120 feet of Ebeshra

Effect Ebeshra unleashes a @Template[line|distance:240] of electricity toward the triggering creature. Creatures in the line take @Damage[16d8[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect] save). The electricity creates a static field in all squares that the line passed through and all adjacent squares. For 1 round, any creatures that enter a space in the static field take @Damage[4d8[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic|name:Static Field|options:area-effect] save).

Somnalu.name: Somnalu

Baleful Gaze.name: Baleful Gaze
Baleful Gaze.description:
Trigger A creature within 100 feet makes a ranged attack or uses an action that has the concentrate trait

Effect Somnalu fixes its central eye upon the triggering creature in an attempt to frighten it, jolting it and disrupting its action. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save; on a failure, Somnalu disrupts the triggering action and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Corrosive Wounds.name: Corrosive Wounds
Corrosive Wounds.description: The acid that coats the skin of Somnalu eats away at a weapon that Strikes it. As long as Digestive Secretions is active on Somnalu, whenever a creature hits Somnalu with a metal or wooden weapon, the creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:33|traits:damaging-effect] save or else the weapon takes @Damage[2d8[acid]] damage (after dealing damage to Somnalu as normal). Thrown weapons and ammunition take this damage automatically with no saving throw.

Acid Spew.description: Somnalu jets acid from its skin, dousing all creatures in a @Template[line|distance:60|width:15]{15-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line}. Each creature in this area takes @Damage[10d8[acid]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect] save). It can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Acid Spew]]{1d4 rounds}.
Acid Spew.name: Acid Spew

Sleep Scent (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: Sleep Scent (Imprecise) 60 feet
Sleep Scent (Imprecise) 60 feet.description:
Somnalu can smell creatures that are asleep, as the scent ability.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Scent]

Caustic Trench.name: Caustic Trench
Caustic Trench.description: Somnalu Burrows three times. It digs a trench along its path, filling the trench with acid pumped from its skin. The trench is hazardous terrain, and any creature that moves into it takes @Damage[4d6[persistent,acid]] damage. While Burrowing, if Somnalu would move through a space occupied by another creature, that creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:36] save to avoid falling into the trench and taking the acid damage. The acid remains for 1 minute.

Digestive Secretions.name: Digestive Secretions
Digestive Secretions.description: Somnalu secretes acid for 1 round. Whenever it makes a melee Strike, it deals an additional @Damage[(2d8[splash])[acid]]{2d8 acid splash damage}. Like most splash damage, this damage applies to the target and adjacent creatures and applies even on a failure, though not on a critical failure.

Drain Nutrients.name: Drain Nutrients
Drain Nutrients.description: Somnalu targets a creature with a claw Strike. On a success, Somnalu drains the creature's life through its skin. The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} on a success, no effect on a critical success). Somnalu gains temporary Hit Points equal to the amount of Hit Points the creature loses from this Strike.

Vent Fumes.name: Vent Fumes
Vent Fumes.description: Somnalu blasts poison gas in a @Template[burst|distance:30]{30-foot radius}. The gas lingers for 1 round, and all creatures that begin their turn in the gas or enter the gas take @Damage[4d8[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic|options:area-effect] save). Any creature in the gas is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and other creatures are concealed to all creatures in the gas. However, Somnalu can see through this concealment.

Somnalu.publicNotes: With its lithe, sinuous body and a flexible, twisting spine, Somnalu bears a resemblance to a giant lizard, save for its striking visage. Spiny frills run down the creature's mottled black back, interlaced with dull red stripes that streak from head to tail. Its two sets of forelimbs are bound to each other by small webs of skin. Its distinctive face lacks any visible mouth, nose, or ears, instead possessing only a huge red eye surrounded by six smaller, secondary eyes.

Fleshforged Dreadnought.name: Fleshforged Dreadnought

Caustic Leak.name: Caustic Leak
Caustic Leak.description:
Frequency once per turn

Trigger The fleshforged dreadnought is damaged by a non-reach piercing or slashing melee Strike

Effect Corrosive fluid sprays the attacker, dealing @Damage[8d6[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic]).

Scaling Spikes.name: Scaling Spikes
Scaling Spikes.description: A fleshforged dreadnought is covered in handholds and footholds that make it easy to climb. Creatures of Medium or smaller size can Climb the dreadnought, sharing one of its spaces as they do so. The DC to Climb a fleshforged dreadnought is 15, and creatures move 5 more feet on a success and 10 more feet on a critical success, to a maximum of their Speed when Climbing the construct.

Destructive Charge.name: Destructive Charge
Destructive Charge.description: The fleshforged dreadnought Strides up to twice its speed and makes a battering ram Strike against a structure or unattended object. The Strike ignores 20 points of the target's Hardness.

Drown in Ichor.name: Drown in Ichor
Drown in Ichor.description: The fleshforged dreadnought releases a wave of caustic fluid from vents in its sides. Creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:20] take @Damage[8d6[acid]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect]). Creatures who fail their saves also take @Damage[3d6[persistent,acid]] damage.

Fleshforged Dreadnought.publicNotes:
Created in the arcane fleshforges of Nex, this creature was spawned as the ultimate brute-force tool for urban assaults against the cities of Geb. At 30 feet tall, the dreadnought easily tops most city walls, and Nexian infantry forces would scramble up the spikes on the creature's back to penetrate defensive fortifications. Every detail of the creature's physiology was fashioned for the battlefield, from the ballista of bone and sinew integrated into its torso to the bulky ram on the crest of its head. The fleshforged's acidic blood not only serves an important hydraulic function but also deters city defenders who might attempt to strike down the creature.

During the war between Nex and Geb, fleshforged dreadnoughts most often appeared as part of a coordinated assault and typically replaced or augmented an army's compliment of siege weaponry. Common tactics employed by Nex's generals would direct the dreadnought to crush all opposition standing in front of a city's gate and then smash through it. Should the city's defenses prove resilient, invading troops would scale the creature to get over the city walls, relying on the dreadnought's regenerative properties to ensure it wouldn't be destroyed while helping them bypass the defensive barriers.

Fleshforged dreadnoughts all but vanished after the disappearance of the archmage Nex, but tales of their destructive power have been preserved.

Horn Toss.name: 角抛 Horn Toss
Horn Toss.description: 獓因行走并进行一次角抵打击。如果此次打击命中，目标被向獓因所选方向抛投20尺。

Bloodsense (Precise) 60 feet.name: 血液感知 (精确) 60 尺
Bloodsense (Precise) 60 feet.description: 獓因可以用精确感官侦测到所列范围内暴露的血液，包括受到持续流血伤害的生物。

Driven by Hunger.name: 饥饿驱使 Driven by Hunger
Driven by Hunger.description:
触发 獓因在对抗情绪效果的豁免上失败或成功

效果 獓因的饥饿感强到足以掩盖其他任何情绪。獓因改为在豁免上大成功。如果40尺内有生物受到持续流血伤害，獓因还可以行走至多其速度，向目标直线前进，以寻找最近的食物来源。

Mountain Stride.name: 山地行走 Mountain Stride
Mountain Stride.description: 獓因不会因为雪地或山地地形导致的困难地形阻碍，它也不需要@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{保持平衡 Balance}来移动通过这些条件所创造的不稳表面。

Aoyin.name: 獓因 Aoyin
Aoyin.publicNotes: 獓因看起来像是牛，身体苍白，长着四只角，毛发像稻草一样粗糙。虽然这种独居的大型野兽与普通的耕牛有几分相似，但它是一种极具攻击性和领地意识的食肉动物，会跟踪并吞食猎物。獓因栖息在高山上，很少被普通人目击。不过在寒冷的冬天，獓因可能会下山寻找食物，从而与附近的聚居地发生可怕的遭遇。据说一头獓因便能消灭整座村庄的人口，而它的饥饿一旦得到满足，就会退回到附近的山中。一头獓因，甚至一群这种生物，主要受到饥饿和其他本能冲动的驱使。在它的自然栖息地之外，偶尔也会被那些嗜血成性的人豢养。即使有魔法控制，被圈养的獓因更有可能背叛饲养者，而不是服从命令。然而，作为一种不受控制的武器，饥饿的獓因会对大多数社区构成可怕的威胁。某些偏远地区的传说称，獓因的咆哮能会让那些不幸听到的人陷入饥饿和暴力的狂热之中。村庄会被内讧所吞噬，甚至没有任何迹象表明有獓因进入其边界。虽然这种生物的强大变种可能拥有这种能力，这些故事的灵感大多来自于那些了解獓因秘密的人所掌握的可怕魔法，并在村庄被魔法蛊惑或普通的内讧而崩溃时传播开来。
Aoyin.privateNotes:
Aoyin Horns

The horns of an aoyin are a potent material for crafting magical items that induce a frenzied state or blood loss, much like in tales about the beast's calls. Each horn, of which an aoyin normally has four, can be used as 60 gp worth of materials for items like a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.fo6Yhq5mbQXsnZs0]{Wounding rune}.

Vengeful Bite.name: Vengeful Bite
Vengeful Bite.description:
Trigger A creature critically hits the mutant with a melee unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike

Effect The mutant makes a maw Strike against the triggering creature.

Rugged Travel.description: A gnoll ignores the first square of difficult terrain it moves into each time it Steps or Strides.
Rugged Travel.name: Rugged Travel

Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
Pack Attack.description: A Mana Wastes mutant gnoll hulk deals 1d4 extra damage to any creature who's within reach of at least two of the Mana Wastes mutant gnoll hulk's allies.

Mutant Gnoll Hulk.name: Mutant Gnoll Hulk
Mutant Gnoll Hulk.publicNotes:
Separated from their pack during a prolonged storm of wild magic, the Mana Wastes mutant gnoll hulk transformed into a gigantic, ravenous creature.

The erratic magical energies of the Mana Wastes can warp and twist creatures foolish or unlucky enough to be trapped in them. The physiological effects of this exposure vary in scope from grotesque full-body transformations to more subtle changes to the skin or senses, and they're frequently accompanied by changes in disposition, motivation, or temperament.

Searing Skin.name: Searing Skin
Searing Skin.description: 5 feet. Cuetzmonquali's flesh burns as hot as flame. Creatures that end their turn in the emanation take @Damage[4d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:35|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Follower of the Flame.name: Follower of the Flame
Follower of the Flame.description: Cuetzmonquali recognizes the might of the wielder of the Spear of the Destroyer's Flame. Out of its respect for that strength, it follows the commands of the spear's wielder and can understand the wielder, regardless of the language the wielder speaks.

Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair Cuetzmonquali's vision; it ignores concealment from smoke.
Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description: Cuetzmonquali unleashes a blast of fire that deals @Damage[12d10[fire]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:50] (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail their saves catch on fire and take @Damage[1d12[persistent,fire]] damage. Cuetzmonquali can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Burning Venom.name: Burning Venom
Burning Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[4d6[poison],2d10[fire]]{4d6 poison plus 2d10 fire}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison],3d10[fire]]{6d6 poison plus 3d10 fire}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[8d6[poison],4d10[fire]]{8d6 poison plus 4d10 fire}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 round)

Impaling Charge.name: Impaling Charge
Impaling Charge.description: Cuetzmonquali charges forward and attempts to gore a foe. It Strides and attempts a horn Strike. On a hit, the target becomes impaled on one of Cuetzmonquali's horns. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. If Cuetzmonquali moves, it brings the grabbed creature along with it. Cuetzmonquali doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the creature grabbed; the creature remains grabbed as long as it's impaled. The grabbed creature can attempt to Escape as normal, but the DC to do so is 40, rather than Cuetzmonquali's Athletics DC. If Cuetzmonquali critically hit the creature to impale it, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} for 1 round, in addition to being grabbed and impaled as per a success.

Constrict.name: 紧勒 Constrict
Constrict.description:
@Damage[(2d6+8)[bludgeoning],2d10[fire]]{2d6+8 bludgeoning damage plus 2d10 fire damage}, @Check[fortitude|dc:38|basic] save

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

Double Sting.name: Double Sting
Double Sting.description: Cuetzmonquali makes two tail Strikes, each targeting a different creature. These attacks count toward Cuetzmonquali's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

Cuetzmonquali.name: Cuetzmonquali
Cuetzmonquali.publicNotes:
Though stories call it the Burning Dragon, Cuetzmonquali is a unique creature with no draconic heritage. Cuetzmonquali resembles an enormous reptile with large frills, two tails ending in massive stingers, and scales that appear to be made of burning flame. Cuetzmonquali is capable of growing any number of horns from its head, on which it can impale and trap its enemies. Each horn grows in a burst of searing flame that burns flesh and scales and results in a blackened obsidian spike jutting from its forehead. These horns molt off occasionally, leaving behind warnings of the beast's presence.

In combat, Cuetzmonquali is a terrifying foe who uses its horns to skewer foes, unleashes white-hot blasts of flame to devastate those who don't approach, and injects a potent burning venom that ignites a foe from within their own body, sapping their strength. Against groups of weaker foes, it simply tramples them to death underfoot. Anyone courageous enough to face Cuetzmonquali and powerful or cunning enough to slay the creature can lay claim to the treasure that lies in its belly: the legendary artifact known as the Spear of the Destroyer's Flame.

A Taste for Skin.name: A Taste for Skin
A Taste for Skin.description: A skinskitter tastes skin (including leather), hair, claws, and nails within 60 feet.

Shuddering Skitter.name: Shuddering Skitter
Shuddering Skitter.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The skinskitter is reduced to 0 HP

Effect The fear of death agitates the skinskitter, precipitating a sudden existential awakening of consciousness. The skinskitter is reduced to 1 HP, loses the mindless trait and immunity to mental effects for the next 24 hours, gains the ability to speak one language (typically Osiriani or Vudrani), and takes two of the following actions in any order: Hide, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}, Step, Stride, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover}. In addition, the square occupied by the skinskitter before using Shuddering Skitter becomes difficult terrain, as they disgorge a shower of half-digested calluses, chewed nails, and entangled hair in their skittering wake.

Share the Skin.name: Share the Skin
Share the Skin.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the skinskitter's reach

Effect The skinskitter scrapes and shears away large sheets of the victim's skin. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions. The massive pain causes the victim to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute, and the skinskitter drapes itself in the flapping skin, granting it 10 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute.

Skinskitter.name: Skinskitter
Skinskitter.publicNotes:
These elusive oddments resemble discarded hides of butchered animals and fleshwarping experiments, floating like so much meaty detritus in the bloody filth of Ecanus's charnel-clogged sewers. Skinskitters, named for their fluid, erratic movements, scavenge the city for leavings of fleshy waste. They prefer discreet, non-violent ways of procuring these biological materials and shy from combat, seemingly possessed of a nervous temperament. Nexian fleshforgers quip this is entirely reasonable, as skinskitters are little more than nervous systems wrapped in dying skin. Nexian guards who actually have to hunt these fleshforged pests aren't quite as jocular; confronted by the oddly childlike pleas of these cornered puddles of flesh, hair, and eyes, many recruits simply choose to leave the city watch.

On occasion, curious scholars or soldiers have questioned why skinskitters pursue organic tissue, and whether this is a simple instinct or in pursuit of a grander purpose. Most fleshforgers assume that skinskitters consume organic matter to repair themselves in a process similar to eating, and give the matter no further thought, showing no more interest in the creatures than a smith might show in a bead of melted slag. The most paranoid Nexians claim that skinskitters are attempting to build something out of their collections of cast-off skin, perhaps even reconstructing themselves into fleshforged conformers. There is no recorded evidence of this ever occurring, however—if the creatures have any awareness at all, it's more likely that skinskitters are driven by the basest of instincts to better themselves through the same methods used in their creation but lack the understanding and self-direction to ever succeed.

The Bloodstorm.name: The Bloodstorm

Bloodsense 120 feet.name: Bloodsense 120 feet
Bloodsense 120 feet.description: The Bloodstorm can precisely sense bleeding creatures within 120 feet.

Biting Constrict.name: Biting Constrict
Biting Constrict.description:
Requirements The Bloodstorm is in Demon Shape and has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The writing mass of the Bloodstorm's pincer bites the grabbed creature, dealing @Damage[(3d8+8)[piercing]] damage (basic Fortitude save). On a failure, the creature also takes @Damage[1d8[persistent,bleed]] damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

Biting Swarm.name: Biting Swarm
Biting Swarm.description: Each creature in the Bloodstorm's space takes @Damage[3d6[piercing],3d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:31|basic] save). Creatures that fail their saving throw also take @Damage[1d8[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Demon Shape.name: Demon Shape
Demon Shape.description: The swarm condenses into the solid shape of a shemhazian demon. While in this form, it's a gargantuan creature, cannot share the space of another creature, and can use its pincer attack. It loses its resistance to physical damage as well as its weaknesses to area and splash damage. Any creatures sharing a space with the Bloodstorm when it transforms are pushed into the nearest empty space. The Bloodstorm can use this action again to revert to its swarm shape.

Feeding Frenzy.description:
Requirements There are bleeding creatures in the Bloodstorm's space

Effect The bleeding creatures take @Damage[3d8[piercing],3d8[slashing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:34|basic] save). The Bloodstorm gains temporary Hit Points equal to half of the damage dealt this way.
Feeding Frenzy.name: Feeding Frenzy

The Bloodstorm.publicNotes:
A hundred thousand leeches, mosquitos, and parasites form a roiling mass of hunger and malice. It moves like a storm through the tunnels and caverns of the Emperor's Peak, constantly in search of its next meal. Though it has many bodies, it has just one, startlingly clever mind. The flames and smoke of the cities keeps it at bay, but in the darkness, it is at home. The dwarves of Highhelm have learned how to live with the threat, but those traveling deeper into the mountain must always remain vigilant.

In the swamps of the Tanglebriar, food is difficult to come by.
