Their intellectual approach to problems can make ratajin especially useful in situations requiring delicate words, and their quick thinking serves them well as adventurers when the time comes for action. These same characteristics also make them capable merchants and scholars.

Earning a ratajin's trust can prove difficult. Their large-scale communities often collaborate to devise clever solutions that ensure equitable treatment among people, but each community varies greatly due to the different needs of the inhabitants. Outsiders who require too much help too quickly might cause a ratajin to withdraw, believing their guest incapable of adjusting to life's many hurdles. Poorly chosen words of pity or meaningless sympathy toward the nature of a ratajin's unique sensory experience can also cause lingering resentment.

Taljjae (The Hermit).name: Taljjae (The Hermit)

Exit Stage.name: Exit Stage
Exit Stage.description:
Trigger Taljjae is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect Taljjae retains 1 Hit Point and teleports to an empty space within 30 feet. One of its masks remains behind and is broken.

Flexible Counterspell.name: Flexible Counterspell
Flexible Counterspell.description:
Trigger A creature Casts a Spell of the same or lower level as one of Taljjae's unexpended spell slots

Effect Taljjae expends any prepared spell of the same or higher level, losing a spell slot as if it had Cast the triggering Spell. Taljjae then attempts to counteract the spell with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+27 #Counteract]]{+27}.

Jelly Gluttony.name: Jelly Gluttony
Jelly Gluttony.description: If Taljjae detects buckwheat jelly with its jelly sense, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the food and the creature possessing it (if applicable) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to all other creatures for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, or until it uses an appropriate number of Interact actions to consume the jelly (generally 2: 1 to take the jelly, and another to eat it). If there's more than one helping of jelly, the condition ends once Taljjae consumes the jelly once.

Jelly Sense.name: Jelly Sense
Jelly Sense.description: Taljjae has scent as a precise sense out to 120 feet, but only to detect buckwheat jelly, the only food Taljjae loves more than flesh.

Change Characters.name: Change Characters
Change Characters.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Taljjae removes its current mask and dons a new one. The change refreshes Taljjae, restoring 25 Hit Points. Once Taljjae has removed a mask, it can't Change Characters back to that mask until it has worn all of its unbroken masks at least once, after which the cycle starts again. Taljjae can't don a broken mask.

When Taljjae Changes Characters, it gains access to the listed abilities. Any items (such as weapons) associated with its previous mask immediately disappear and are replaced by fresh ones for its new mask, but the effects of any mask abilities it has active persist. Removing a mask and later reapplying it doesn't restore any limited-use abilities.

Prop Master.name: Prop Master
Prop Master.description: Taljjae has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields from one of its masks.

Second Act.name: Second Act
Second Act.description:
Trigger Taljjae's turn begins Requirements Taljjae has 200 or fewer Hit Points

Effect Taljjae's dance reaches a frantic climax, allowing it to change personas rapidly. Taljjae Changes Characters.

Taljjae (The Hermit).publicNotes:
The form of Taljjae's body can vary from visit to visit or even moment to moment, but it's easily recognized due to its signature cloak and masks. So long as Taljjae's mood is placid, it can be approached safely, but its mercurial temperament can be hard to predict.

This wizened male face draws upon the powers of a true sage

K'nonna.name: K'nonna

Half-Speaker.description:
A k'nonna can communicate easily with other k'nonna, but when communicating with other creatures, only half of the spoken words make sense.

In order to convey information to a k'nonna or understand what they're saying, a non-k'nonna must succeed at a @Check[perception|dc:20] check.
Half-Speaker.name: Half-Speaker

Gilded Fascination.name: Gilded Fascination
Gilded Fascination.description:
When offered a gift worth at least 50 gp, the k'nonna must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] saving throw; if the gift is worth at least 100 gp, the DC is instead @Check[will|dc:25|name:Gilded Fascination (Higher)].

If they fail the save, the k'nonna accepts the gift, becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} until the end of their next turn, and cannot attack while fascinated. On a critical failure, the fascination lasts for 1 minute.

Offering a gift is an Interact action, and offering multiple gifts in the same round has no additional effect.

Half Steps.name: Half Steps
Half Steps.description: Even though k'nonna are split in half, they still move and Stride as though they have two arms and legs. However, binding just one wrist or ankle leaves them incapable of using that limb, as if it were bound to another.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The k'nonna Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the k'nonna began this action hidden, they remain hidden until after this ability's Strike.

K'nonna.publicNotes:
K'nonna are half human-and only half, in the most literal sense. They most often resemble the right half of a human, and less frequently the left half, split perfectly down the middle starting at the crown of their head. They accordingly have one eye, one ear, one arm, one leg, half of a nose, and half of a mouth full of razor-sharp teeth. A faint shimmer in the air, like the waves over a hot stone, hints at where their other half would be.

Despite the bizarre appearance of the k'nonna, they have no trouble balancing or performing everyday tasks that might be impeded by missing half of their bodies. They are extremely dexterous, able to perform complex tasks with only a single hand. The nature of their missing half has so far defied explanation; it is not invisible, nor does it exist on another plane, yet it seems to exert enough force for a k'nonna to walk like a human being.

No one is certain of the k'nonna's origins, except that they are not of this world and not descended from any known mortal creature. Banishment magic has no effect on them, implying they do not come from another plane. They are intelligent but difficult to communicate with-they speak only in half words and hear only half of what anyone says. K'nonna are also much less interested in talking than eating, and humanoids happen to be their favorite meal. The remains of a k'nonna's victim are unmistakable, as they only consume half the body.

Stories tell of the half-people's love for gifts, especially jewelry. Offerings of rings and necklaces easily distract a k'nonna long enough for prey to escape. Particularly bold victims might try to trick a k'nonna into wearing a bracelet that binds their one visible wrist or ankle to immobilize them, though the tactic is not foolproof, as a k'nonna displeased with their gifts will hunt the person who displeased them for the rest of their days.

Planar Tear.hazarddescription: Ebeshra opens a massive rift in the Material Plane that pulls nearby creatures into another plane entirely. The rift is typically to a random plane in the multiverse, though Ebeshra can have the rift pull creatures into a plane of Ebeshra's choosing. Additionally, Ebeshra can choose any number of creatures to be immune to the effects of the planar rift, usually due to the kaiju recognizing the innocence of the creatures.
Planar Tear.reset: Ebeshra vanishes 1 minute after opening the rift, which closes the rift. Ebeshra must wait 1 week before it can open another planar rift.

Tear Reality.name: Tear Reality
Tear Reality.description:
Trigger Ebeshra recognizes a nearby threat as needing an indisputable resolution, or a deity tasks Ebeshra with creating a planar rift

Effect Ebeshra twists its body, aligning its segmented sections into a fine blade, and cuts the fabric of the Material Plane. It creates an enormous rift in a point in the sky within 1 mile. The rift is 100 feet long and 50 feet wide. The hazard rolls initiative.

Planar Tear.name: Planar Tear
Planar Tear.disable: DC 47 Lore (master) related to the specific plane beyond the rift to disrupt the planar frequency and close the rift, @Check[arcana|dc:52|name:Undo the Rift's Manifestation (Arcana)|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] (legendary) or @Check[occultism|dc:52|name:Undo the Rift's Manifestation (Occultism)|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] (legendary) to undo the magical manifestation of the rift, @Check[performance|dc:55|name:Counteract the Rift's Frequency|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] (legendary) to play a tone that counteracts the rift's harmonic frequency, or @Check[diplomacy|dc:55|name:Plead With Ebeshra (Diplomacy)|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] (legendary) or @Check[religion|dc:55|name:Plead With Ebeshra (Religion)|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] (legendary) to plead with Ebeshra to close the rift
Planar Tear.stealthdetails: (master) to notice Ebeshra twisting its shape in preparation of creating a planar rift
Planar Tear.routine:
The rift pulls creatures within 500 feet toward it. The rift can pull any creature, regardless of its size. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:45|name:Planar Rift|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] or @Check[reflex|dc:45|name:Planar Rift|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] save (the creature's choice) to resist the effects of this pull or attempt to grab something to avoid getting pulled.

Critical Success The creature resists the pull and doesn't move toward the rift.

Success The creature is moved 25 feet toward the rift.

Failure The creature is moved 50 feet toward the rift.

Critical Failure The creature is moved 100 feet toward the rift. The harsh pull causes the creature to take @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

If a creature is directly beneath the rift when the rift pulls it, the creature instead attempts a @Check[fortitude|dc:50|name:Pull Into the Rift|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] or @Check[reflex|dc:50|name:Pull Into the Rift|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] save (the creature's choice) to avoid being pulled into the rift. On a failure, the creature is pulled up into the rift and thrown to a random point on the plane on the other side.

Giant Orchid Mantis.name: 巨兰花螳螂 Giant Orchid Mantis
Giant Orchid Mantis.publicNotes:
很少有生物像兰花螳螂一样美丽。它们优雅的外形和颜色都很像花朵，许多人把这种娇嫩的生物当做短命的宠物。虽然这些普通的昆虫对类人生物而言并不危险，但它们仍能捕食比自己大好几倍的猎物。兰花螳螂在花丛中展开身姿，以令人目眩的速度，甚至能用它们锋利的牙齿和强力的撕咬追赶觅食的蝴蝶。

这些螳螂的体型异常庞大，这使得它们的伪装在大多数环境中都不太有效。因此，它们通常出现在最茂密的热带雨林里，或者在种植稀有药草的地方。被驯服的巨兰花螳螂还能保护那些富有到买得起这种装饰性护卫的人。

Floral Camouflage.name: 花朵迷彩 Floral Camouflage
Floral Camouflage.description: 当躲藏时，巨兰花螳螂可以从任意数量的叶子和花瓣处获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]，即便这些叶子和花瓣的厚度不足以使其他生物隐蔽。

Barbed Limbs.name: 带刺肢体 Barbed Limbs
Barbed Limbs.description: 巨兰花螳螂进行两次腿打击。如果两次攻击均命中相同生物，该生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]状态，直到螳螂下回合结束。

Sudden Strike.name: 突袭 Sudden Strike
Sudden Strike.description: 在战斗第一轮，尚未行动的敌人对兰花螳螂@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。

Vulture Rat.name: Vulture Rat
Vulture Rat.publicNotes:
These scavenger rats live in Geb, where they feast on the remains of the undead. They're adapted to going long periods without sustenance but viciously attack any possible food source.

Giant rats are enormous versions of the common vermin. They are typically found in abundant numbers, but since they cannot fit in the nooks where mundane rats typically hide, they are much easier to locate and exterminate. They mostly live in sewers where they can scavenge from the streets above, but some families of giant rats live in more remote locations, such as dank caves or forests and hills. Rats are incredibly adept survivors and can be found nearly anywhere in the world, though they tend to favor temperate or warm climates as opposed to cold regions.

Although its bite alone is not lethal except to the very young or very old, the giant rat carries the filth fever common to rodents around the world-a pestilence more than capable of ravaging rural communities.

Filth Fever.name: Filth Fever
Filth Fever.description:
The @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions from filth fever don't improve on their own until the disease is cured.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:14]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect ([[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours})

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 Sickened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead

Kallas Devil.name: Kallas Devil

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description: The Kallas Devil adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.RCbLd7dfquHnuvrZ]{False Vision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GP3wewkQXEPrLxYj]{Subconscious Suggestion} to her coven's spells.

Leatherwork.name: Leatherwork
Leatherwork.description: Once a month, the Kallas Devil can spend 1 day stitching the skin of a person into her coat. This gives her skinned cloak a +1 circumstance bonus to her AC for one week.

Skinned Steed.name: Skinned Steed
Skinned Steed.description: The Kallas Devil has a horse minion known as the Skinned Steed. The horse has a swim speed equal to its standard Speed and the minion trait, and it's under the control of the Kallas Devil. The Kallas Devil automatically succeeds at all checks to Command the Skinned Steed. While mounted on the Skinned Steed, the Kallas Devil fuses with the horse, causing the two to become a single being. The Skinned Steed doesn't act on its own while fused with the Kallas Devil, instead acting as the Devil's legs to move around the battlefield. The Kallas Devil doesn't command the Skinned Steed in this state and instead replaces her Speeds with the mount's speeds until she dismounts. While the two are separated, the Kallas Devil needs to Command the Steed, as normal. If the Skinned Steed is killed, the Kallas Devil can replace it by spending 1 day to prepare another horse, converting it into her new Skinned Steed.

Flay Alive.name: Flay Alive
Flay Alive.description:
Requirements The Kallas Devil has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, and it has been grabbed since her last turn.

Effect The Kallas Devil flays her prey, dealing @Damage[(2d12+17)[slashing]] damage, and the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save. On a failure, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). On a critical success, the creature escapes from being grabbed; otherwise, the Kallas Devil extends the grabbed condition until the end of her next turn.

Sewer Haze.name: Sewer Haze
Sewer Haze.description:
Many healers and alchemists suspect that sewer haze has a supernatural origin, given its association with particularly strong otyughs.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:23|name:Sewer Hsaze]

Onset 2 days

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and stupefied 2 (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} (1 day)

Loathsome Stench.description: 20 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). A creature that succeeds at its saves is temporarily immune for 1 minute.
Loathsome Stench.name: Loathsome Stench

Mount Steed.name: Mount Steed
Mount Steed.description:
Trigger The Skinned Steed enters a space adjacent to the Kallas Devil

Effect The Kallas Devil mounts the horse.

Call Steed.name: Call Steed
Call Steed.description:
Requirements The Skinned Steed hasn't been killed and is within 60 feet

Effect The Kallas Devil whistles loudly and calls for her steed, prompting the creature to Stride twice toward the Kallas Devil.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The Kallas Devil can take on the appearance of any Medium or Small female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Devil's Charge.name: Devil's Charge
Devil's Charge.description:
Requirements The Kallas Devil is mounted on the Skinned Steed

Effect The Kallas Devil Strides twice. If she ends her movement within melee reach of at least one creature, she can make a melee Strike against that creature.

Kallas Devil.publicNotes: Bearing a resemblance to the flayed nuckelavee that lurks in stagnant swamps, the Kallas Devil distinguishes herself by being able to separate herself from her mount without issue, as well as with her powers of disguise and subtlety. Though her wicked trident and violent fury are enough to sear her image into the minds of the local people, it's the Kallas Devil's ability to slip unseen among her would-be victims that elevates the creature beyond the ranks of a common horror. No matter how careful the residents of Riverton are with their youth and the vulnerable, the Kallas Devil claims her chosen target more often than not, luring the hapless victim toward doom while wearing a smiling child's face.

Watch over Evil.name: 监视邪恶 Watch over Evil
Watch over Evil.description:
触发 犬熊30尺内的某个生物施法

效果 犬熊对触发生物进行一次幽火打击。如果打击命中具有分体怪特征的生物，或则重击，触发动作被打断。

Phantom Flames.name: 魅影火焰 Phantom Flames
Phantom Flames.description: 犬熊的火焰既是虚体又是实体。每当犬熊造成火焰伤害时，它可以改为造成精魂伤害。犬熊的火焰不会点燃植物或物体，除非犬熊想要这么做。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description: 犬熊变形成任意中型或更小体型类人生物的外貌。在此形态下，犬熊无法使用獠牙打击，其爪打击变为造成钝击伤害的拳头打击，并失去触及特征。

Cleanse the Forest.name: 净化森林 Cleanse the Forest
Cleanse the Forest.description: 犬熊攻击每个附近的敌人，速度快得根本看不出它有移动过，只能看到他们的轮廓在微微闪动。犬熊行走靠近一名敌人，尝试一次近战打击。如果成功命中，犬熊可以行走并尝试打击一名不同敌人。如果第二次攻击成功，它尝试行走并打击第三名敌人。一旦其打击失败（或在第三次打击成功后），犬熊行走回开始所处空间。

Aso Berang.name: 犬熊 Aso Berang
Aso Berang.publicNotes: 森林深处有一些长着獠牙大嘴的巨大生物。它们的面容激发了天夏各地用于盛大节日的各种长牙恶魔面具的灵感。这些野兽在民那塔岛被称为犬熊，或者熊犬。顾名思义，它们就像体型庞大的熊。然而，犬熊并不只是体型庞大，魅力无穷的动物，很多人说它们是森林精魂之王和守护神。生活在它们守护的森林之外的人们常常把它们尊崇为保护神。这些守护者只有在他们居住的森林面临危险或他们需要什么东西时才会出现在普通人面前。当他们出现时，犬熊会以高大威猛的人类形象出现，散发出威严的气势。犬熊有锋利无比的爪子，会定期脱落，而且它们足够强壮，可以爬到树上追捕试图从树上逃跑的女巫。犬熊通常会攻击那些它们认为心灵不洁或对森林构成潜在威胁的访客。不幸的是，要接受这种审判通常只需要忘记履行适当的尊重和敬畏仪式。
Aso Berang.privateNotes:
Enmity of Witches

The first aso berang and ancestor of all aso berangs, Ganas Buti Rajah, faced the witch armies of Rani Randa, the Queen of Witches and Tanggal. Now, Ganas Buti Rajah's descendants uphold the tradition of stewardship: protecting the forests and cleansing the lands of magic they judge evil.

Dual Pounce.name: Dual Pounce
Dual Pounce.description: The grisantian lion Strides and makes two claw Strikes against the same creature at the end of that movement. Each attack counts against the grisantian lion's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the grisantian lion makes both attacks. If both attacks hit, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

Rend.name: Rend
Rend.description:
claw.

If the grisantian lion Rends after a successful Dual Pounce, combine the Rend's damage with that from the Dual Pounce for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Rend]

Vicious Rend.name: Vicious Rend
Vicious Rend.description:
Trigger The grisantian lion uses Rend

Effect The target's armor takes damage equal to the damage from Rend. The target can attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save to reduce this damage.

Kashrishi Evaluator.name: Kashrishi Evaluator
Kashrishi Evaluator.publicNotes:
To some, kashrishi seem to be a quiet, passive people. Those with a deeper understanding know that there's plenty more nuance to interacting with kashrishi, who possess innate psychic abilities that greatly alter the way they communicate with the rest of the world. Unable to turn off their powers, these abilities add a complex dynamic to interpreting their surroundings. Without deeper understanding of a person, kashrishi are only able to get the most vague, general feelings from people around them. This becomes more refined as their relationships evolve; family and friends are often the easiest to engage in psychic communication, while strangers simply add to the amount of mental noise a kashrishi must process.

Kashrishi resemble rhinoceroses, with soft, textured skin that can range from light sandy hues to darker obsidian, or rarer jewel tones of deep sapphire or ruby. The size and number of their horns vary. Kashrishi communities are generally quite welcoming to others, enjoying the conversation and unique auras of every new stranger. However, chaotic environments can overwhelm and overstimulate kashrishi not yet adept at filtering psychic energies, leaving some with limited tolerance for extensive social interaction with strangers and requiring they take periods of time to refocus after socializing. In spite of this possible drawback, kashrishi are typically strong communicators, excelling at roles that require attention to detail.

Empathic Sense.name: Empathic Sense
Empathic Sense.description: Kashrishi evaluators can get a vague sense of the current emotional state of all other creatures within 15 feet of them, as long as the kashrishi evaluator is aware of those creatures. This manifests as a general feeling of happiness, anger, or fear, without any specific details. Additionally, any creature who succeeds at masking or faking their emotions using Deception projects the deceptive emotions instead of their true feelings. For those that kashrishi have an emotional connection with, physical touch can heighten this sense to greater degrees of detail and understanding, increasing with the strength of their bond.

Evaluate Discordance.name: Evaluate Discordance
Evaluate Discordance.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The kashrishi evaluator assesses the disharmony between themself and a creature within 30 feet and then sparks the discordance, sending psychic energy to overwhelm the target's feelings. This deals @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:21|basic]). On a critical failure, the target also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Sié Goluo.name: Sié Goluo
Sié Goluo.publicNotes:
Sié Goluo, sometimes referred to simply as Grandfather, is an ancient spirit that has kept watch over the peoples of the Mwangi Expanse for generations. Most believe he first appeared during the Age of Darkness to protect the Mwangi people from the worst dangers of the everlasting night. Bekyar storytellers claim he is older still, from a time before the first people walked Golarion. This immortal spirit has incarnated into multiple forms over millennia. In the oldest surviving tales, they say Sié Goluo looked like an ordinary-if oversized-ox, save for his nearly human-looking eyes. Most recently, people say he has the appearance of several different animals, but accounts vary on which animals make up his form.

When a traveling farmer is assailed by a deadly beast, or a small village faces the wrath of an advancing army, Sié Goluo manifests in whatever form will allow him to best defend them. There seem to be no geographical limitations on where he can manifest, as there are tales of him saving Mwangi adventurers as far spread as Tian Xia and Arcadia.

Spirit Steps.name: Spirit Steps
Spirit Steps.description: Sié Goluo ignores difficult terrain and doesn't trigger traps with his movement.

Ancestral Response.name: Ancestral Response
Ancestral Response.description:
Trigger A creature on the Material Plane calls out for Sié Goluo

Effect Sié Goluo instantaneously appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the triggering creature and heals @Damage[8d8[healing]] Hit Points on all allies that can see him within 60 feet. Allies healed this way gain a +2 circumstance bonus on saving throws for 1 minute.

Creatures that receive these benefits become temporarily immune to them for 1 year.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.gxBjyPaYDdhjAImf]{Effect: Ancestral Response}

Spirit Charge.name: Spirit Charge
Spirit Charge.description:
Sié Goluo Strides twice, then makes a horn Strike. On a hit, Sié Goluo creates a shock wave that deals @Damage[4d12[force]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect,forced-movement] save).

Creatures that fail their save are pushed away 5 feet (10 feet on a critical failure).

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When Sié Goluo is destroyed, he reforms, fully healed, at a location of his choosing anywhere on the Material Plane after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days}. If every person of Mwangi descent rejects belief in Sié Goluo, the spirit is permanently destroyed.

Charau-ka Warrior.name: 查咯勇士 Charau-ka Warrior
Charau-ka Warrior.publicNotes:
查咯勇士随身携带匕首、短柄斧和类似的武器，并且普通的石块在他们手里也能变成致命的武器。

传说表示查咯猿人与恶魔领主安加赞（Angazhan）有着共同的祖先，安加赞改造了哪些曾经试图反抗其邪教的人类的身体，由此创造了第一只查咯猿人。有传言说，查咯猿人的祭司们为了纪念这个古老的起源，改进了某种可怕的仪式，迫使哪些被其杀死的凡人转化为新的查咯猿人。其他的故事表明，某种用来敬拜安加赞的强大图腾拥有这样的力量，在这些魔法神器前面进行祭祀仪式，就能让死者的灵魂作为野蛮和毁灭之主安加赞的暴力信徒复活。

不久前，大多数查咯猿人还团结在猩猩王鲁萨泽克（Ruthazek the Gorilla King）的旗下。鲁萨泽克是个强大的军阀，是安加赞的忠实信徒，统治着乌萨罗（Usaro）。但当冒险者挑战并打败了鲁萨泽克之后，查咯猿人分裂了，各个氏族分散在丛林各处，各自都由一个强大的军阀领导。

Shrieking Frenzy.name: 暴怒尖啸 Shrieking Frenzy
Shrieking Frenzy.description:
触发 查咯猿人的回合开始。

频率 每小时一次

效果 查咯猿人获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]状态，直到它的下一回合结束，并且他可以用此额外动作打击或行走。

在狂怒生效期间，由于查咯猿人不断大声嚎叫，因此无法说话，隐秘检定也会自动失败。

Thrown Weapon Mastery.name: 精通投掷武器 Thrown Weapon Mastery
Thrown Weapon Mastery.description:
查咯猿人的投掷武器获得“致命D6”特征。

此外，如果查咯猿人投掷一件临时武器，既不会因此受到-2减值，也不会因为投掷一件具有非致命特征的临时武器来造成致命伤害而受到减值。

Walcofinde.name: 墙棺尸 Walcofinde

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 墙棺尸对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}的生物造成额外1d6点精准伤害。

Wall Blend.name: 混入墙壁 Wall Blend
Wall Blend.description:
需求 墙棺尸使用占据建筑显形，且不对任何敌人可见；

效果 直到其下次行动，墙棺尸的显形会改变其视觉外观，使之与周围的墙壁一致。他用于躲藏的隐秘检定结果自动为31。

Wall Glide.name: 墙壁穿行 Wall Glide
Wall Glide.description:
需求 墙棺尸使用占据建筑显形；

效果 墙尸棺的显形行走，潜入墙中，并在移动结束时从墙中浮现。如果墙棺尸使用两个动作进行墙壁穿行，其显形在重新浮出墙壁之前可以行走两次。无论哪种情况，它们都只能在距离其密封房间100尺内的墙壁中移动。

Structural Possession.name: 占据建筑 Structural Possession
Structural Possession.description: 墙棺尸可以将自己与其密封房间中任何可以触碰的墙壁合二为一，并在100尺内通过墙壁两侧的任何部分创造出自己的显形。这种显形表现为从墙壁中伸出的墙棺尸腐烂的上半部，但它们的皮肤上的图案就好像它们是从墙壁中延伸出来的一样。显形时，墙棺尸的爪攻击获得触及10尺，但它们只能通过墙壁穿行来移动。对显形造成的任何伤害都会影响到墙棺尸本身。墙棺尸可以解消其占据建筑，退回到他的密封房间中。

Walcofinde.publicNotes:
永远被埋葬的墙棺尸是一种复仇心切的不死生物，它们栖息在自己被封死并最终死亡的空间中。由于它们最终因饥饿和窒息而缓慢死亡，墙棺尸在饥饿和愤怒方面与丧尸相似。将它们区分开来的是，它们凶猛的爪子有着石头塑造的骨骼，从磨损的没有血肉的手指中伸出来，这是在绝望和徒劳的逃脱中形成的。

墙棺尸被束缚在死亡地点。这些“以墙为棺”的不死生物可以在他们被封印的建筑中显形，占据着墙壁并能沿着墙壁隐秘穿行。墙棺尸的显形拥有建筑材料的图案外观，但不具有其物理特性。它们以饥饿、贪食的人形躯干的形式从墙壁中钻出，就像它们永恒牢狱的痛苦延伸。这些不死生物无法完全离开它们的建筑，注定要永远成为其中的一部分。

尽管已经腐烂，但墙棺尸仍保留着生前的智慧；例如，曾经是士兵的墙棺尸可以了解敌人的战术，评估敌人的外观和装备，从而制定战略，确定目标的优先次序，并与附近的其他墙棺尸组织起来，制定攻击计划。

Failed Prophet.name: Failed Prophet

Wealthsense.name: Wealthsense
Wealthsense.description:
150 gp

The failed prophet can detect concentrations of coinage and other valuables as an imprecise sense with a range of 60 feet. The failed prophet detects any creature carrying coins and treasure totaling at least the average cost of a consumable item of the failed prophet's level.

Broken Mindscape.name: Broken Mindscape
Broken Mindscape.description:
30 feet, @Check[will|dc:27].

A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must attempt a Will save. Use the moderate spell DC for the failed prophet's level.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes immune to broken mindscape for 1 minute.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} as disjointed visions of the failed prophet's mindscape assail its senses.

Failure The creature's mind is pulled into the failed prophet's mindscape. It's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round. While paralyzed, the creature can take any actions with the mental or spirit traits, or that deal mental or spirit damage, as though those actions were purely mental. Such actions only have line of effect to the originating failed prophet and other creatures currently paralyzed by broken mindscape, though they treat all such creatures as though they were adjacent.

Critical Failure As failure, but the duration is 1 minute or until the failed prophet is destroyed, whichever happens first.

Greedy Grab.name: Greedy Grab
Greedy Grab.description:
Requirements The failed prophet's last action was a successful fist Strike that dealt damage

Effect The failed prophet attempts a Thievery check against the target's Reflex DC. On a success, the failed prophet pilfers coins and gems from the target with a total value as indicated in the table, to a maximum of what the target is carrying. Valuables in unlocked containers on the target's person can be taken just as easily as those carried. On a critical success, the failed prophet steals double that amount. The failed prophet gains a number of temporary Hit Points equal to the value stolen that last for 1 minute.

LevelValue Stolen

10–12

[[/r 5d10]] gp

13–15

[[/r 6d10]] gp

16–18

[[/r 7d10]] gp

19–20

[[/r 8d10]] gp

This Is My Reality!.name: This Is My Reality!
This Is My Reality!.description:
@Damage[6d6[spirit]|options:area-damage], @Check[will|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect]

The failed prophet exerts control over their crumbling mindscape to inflict harm upon those trapped within. This can take the form of falling debris, natural disasters, or anything else the failed prophet can imagine. No matter the form, each creature currently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} by the failed prophet's broken mindscape takes spirit damage with a basic Will save. The save DC uses the high spell DC for the failed prophet's level and the unlimited use area damage for the failed prophet's level.

Taboos.name: Taboos
Taboos.description: Despite the failed prophet's transformed body, a lifelong adherence to the strictures of the Prophecies of Kalistrade has ingrained the philosophical prohibitions into their soul. Whenever a failed prophet is critically hit by an unarmed attack, is critically hit by or critically fails a save against a touch spell, or is exposed to a disease or poison effect (even though immune), they take a –2 status penalty to their AC, attack bonuses, DCs, Perception, saving throws, and skill modifiers for 1 minute. Breaking other Kalistocratic taboos can also trigger this penalty at the GM's discretion.

Failed Prophet.publicNotes:
Following the teachings of Kalistrade is a lifelong commitment. It requires studious adherence to the strictures and taboos laid out in the Prophecies. The ultimate reward for the devout is the promise of a personalized afterlife, filled with a lifetime of wealth and free of Pharasma's judgment. Not all who learn of these final revelations are up to the task, however. For the fortunate ones, a simple death is the only consequence for botching the ritual. For the less fortunate, the outcome is an undying half-life of torment. Caught between a twisted mockery of their imagined afterlife and the mortal Universe, a failed prophet will know no peace until their body is destroyed.

A failed prophet resembles the skinless corpse of a humanoid ancestry covered in glowing, golden veinlike cracks. On closer inspection, the organs and musculature are unnaturally smooth and shiny, like cured and buffed leather.

Unseasonable Cold.name: Unseasonable Cold
Unseasonable Cold.description: Wherever the frosthunt goes, winter follows. The temperature within a quarter mile of a frosthunt drops to mild cold, then to severe cold within 500 feet, and extreme cold within 50 feet.

Icy Japes.name: Icy Japes
Icy Japes.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The beirans descend on their prey, biting and clawing at each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[slashing],1[cold]|options:area-damage]{1d6 slashing damage plus 1 cold damage}

2 @Damage[(2d6+2)[slashing],1d4[cold]|options:area-damage]{2d6+2 slashing damage plus 1d4 cold damage}

3 @Damage[(2d6+5)[cold],1d4[cold]|options:area-damage]{2d6+5 cold damage plus 1d4 cold damage}

Beiran.name: Beiran
Beiran.publicNotes:
With pale-blue skin and white hair, the wicked beiran fey are among the most unrepentantly cruel of the First World's spawn. Commonly called ice fey, these wintry tricksters are sadistic and without remorse in their desire to spread the cold wherever they go. Beirans find freezing temperatures to be the most comfortable; the fact that other creatures suffer under such conditions is part of the fun. While a single beiran is unlikely to change the temperature of a given space by more than a few degrees, they're highly social creatures, and it's uncommon to find fewer than a few dozen beirans at any one time.

Though beirans are unapologetic in their rude nature, there's one type of creature they'll bow to and take orders from with no questions asked: winter hags. For reasons unknown, beirans are particularly subservient to these hags and will often flock to one in large numbers. Under a winter hag, the fey will make a bad cold snap worse for a suffering town. Fires will be extinguished, wood ruined, food stolen, all of which suit the mysterious tastes of the winter hag and her preference for joyless landscapes. What the beirans receive from this relationship is uncertain, though some fey academics believe it's possible that the first beirans were created by winter hags, much in the same way that the green men created leshies.

While beirans are most common in northern lands such as Irrisen and the Land of the Linnorm Kings, they also have a surprising presence in the Shining Kingdoms. When Queen Elvanna of Irrisen opened up portals to the Eternal Winter of Irrisen, several of them arrived in the town of Heldren in Taldor, and even today, some still haunt the woods around it. Eighteen years ago in Falcon's Hollow, a particularly nasty batch of beirans were involved in the Carnival of Tears, an icy circus that left many townsfolk dead in its wake before adventurers dismantled it. Winters in Kyonin are often heralded by swarms of fiend-touched beirans flooding in from the Tanglebriar, leaving the Wylderhearts on fey duty for months at a time.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Eye Pluck.name: Eye Pluck
Eye Pluck.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The lamp blighter's last action was a successful claw Strike against a creature with eyes

Effect The lamp blighter attempts to pluck out one of the required creature's eyes. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save. On a failure, the target takes @Damage[4[bleed]]{4 persistent bleed} damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round. On a critical failure, the target's eye is also severely damaged, taking a –4 circumstance penalty on all sight-based Perception checks until the target returns to full Hit Points or the wound is otherwise healed (by magic such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Et8RSCLx8w7uOLvo]{Sound Body} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2Vkd1IxylPceUAAF]{Regenerate}). If all a creature's eyes are severely damaged in this way, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for the same duration.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HVNXglbd6fI36e6u]{Effect: Eye Pluck}

Fear the Darkness.name: Fear the Darkness
Fear the Darkness.description:
Requirements The lamp blighter must be in an area of darkness

Effect The lamp blighter evokes the terror of being unable to see in the dark. Each creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] that doesn't have darkvision must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:23] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Snuff the Light.name: Snuff the Light
Snuff the Light.description: The lamp blighter extinguishes light sources in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10]. They extinguish all non-magical light sources automatically and attempt to extinguish magical light sources with a [[/r 1d20+16 #Counteract]]{+16} counteract modifier and a counteract rank of 3. If the lamp blighter successfully extinguishes any light, their next successful claw or shortbow Strike deals @Damage[1d6[persistent,fire]] damage.

equipment-Shortbow.name: Shortbow
equipment-Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

equipment-Arrows.name: Arrows
equipment-Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

Lamp Blighter.name: Lamp Blighter
Lamp Blighter.allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Crystal Xorn.name: Crystal Xorn
Crystal Xorn.publicNotes:
These squat, rotund elementals have three legs, three arms, three eyes, and one massive maw, which they fill with the gems and metals they find so delicious.

Earth elementals make excellent bodyguards for adventuresome spelunkers and are ideal protectors of important subterranean locations such as vaults and treasuries.

Claw Frenzy.description: The xorn makes three claw Strikes; no more than two can be against the same target. These attacks count toward the xorn's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks have been made.
Claw Frenzy.name: Claw Frenzy

Crystal Corruption.name: Crystal Corruption
Crystal Corruption.description:
This affliction's sickened, slowed, and paralyzed conditions can't be removed until this affliction is removed.

A creature affected by crystal corruption slowly turns into crystal until it is petrified. Creatures with both the earth and elemental traits instead become carriers and suffer no ill effects aside from gaining the vulnerability to sonic.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 hour)

Stage 2 vulnerable 5 sonic and sickened 1 (1 day)

Stage 3 vulnerable 5 sonic and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 day)

Stage 4 vulnerable 10 sonic and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 day)

Stage 5 vulnerable 10 sonic and the creature is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified}.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: The xorn can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the xorn moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Shroudwing.name: Shroudwing

Death Rattle.name: Death Rattle
Death Rattle.description:
The shroudwing emits a guttural, haunting call that instills a sense of fear almost impossible to shake. Each non-shroudwing creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save. Regardless of the result, creatures are then temporarily immune to Death Rattle for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the shroudwing's next turn.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Grave Blight.name: Grave Blight
Grave Blight.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[persistent,poison]] damage every hour, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and can't reduce the value of the sickened condition while taking persistent poison damage (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[persistent,poison]] damage every hour, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}, and can't reduce the value of the sickened condition while taking persistent poison damage (1 day)

Soul Feeding.name: Soul Feeding
Soul Feeding.description:
Requirements The shroudwing is adjacent to a dying creature

Effect The shroudwing attempts to devour the dying creature's soul. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save or their dying condition increases by 1 and the shroudwing regains @Damage[2d8[healing]] Hit Points.

Shroudwing.publicNotes:
These unsettling birds are thick-bodied, long-legged creatures standing 4 to 5 feet tall with an 8-foot wingspan. They possess black feathers, clouded white eyes, and a menacing obsidian bill hooked at the tip like a curled claw. Sometimes called soul-eater crows, shroudwings are carrion feeders known to roam graveyards and sites of collective death, absorbing lingering spirits and consuming the decaying corpses. They can be found digging up grave sites, shoveling the earth and breaking into caskets or tombs with their massive, hooked beaks, as well as lurking at execution sites, burial mounds, or feeding on travelers' corpses left behind on roadsides.

Due to their size, shape, and propensity for burial grounds, it isn't uncommon for a shroudwing to be mistaken for a grieving widow when seen at a distance—only when an unfortunate creature gets close enough does it discover the danger it's in. Though not predatory or outright aggressive, shroudwings are exceptionally territorial; they'll protect and defend both their feeding site as well as their nesting area from anyone who might trespass upon it.

While many might know these unusual birds by name and sight, even more know the shroudwing by sound. When threatened, the shroudwing emits a haunting, fear-inducing death rattle that can be heard for miles. They prefer nesting in covered brush, and their mating season occurs in the winter months. Shroudwings have a particular fondness for the collection of skulls and have been known to decorate nests with them as well as to use them in mating rituals, with the male presenting the female with the freshest and cleanest skull it can find.

Aurosrath.name: Aurosrath

Smeltable.name: Smeltable
Smeltable.description:
If an aurosrath takes 5 or more fire damage from a single attack, the precious metals within their body enter a molten state until the end of their next turn. While in this state, the aurosrath takes a –10-foot status penalty to their Speeds, and their strikes deal an extra @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage. They also lose their weakness to slashing damage and their resistance to electricity damage. Finally, any creature currently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the aurosrath loses 1 round of air if it's holding its breath.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.PeQ2isu6YFcHhQyp]{Effect: Smeltable}

Fetters of Debt.name: Fetters of Debt
Fetters of Debt.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The aurosrath bellows a plea for gold, remarking that their foes are overladen. Creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:19] save or become encumbered for 1 minute. The creature is aware that it can immediately end the condition by giving the aurosrath items or treasure worth at least 20 gp. Handing a held item to the aurosrath is a single Interact action. If the aurosrath's hands are full, the item falls in their space, but the condition still ends.

Suffocating Wealth.name: Suffocating Wealth
Suffocating Wealth.description: As the aurosrath holds their victim, the victim is smothered in a stream of phantom coins. A creature who begins its turn @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by an aurosrath can't speak and must hold its breath or it begins to suffocate. The coins produced are ephemeral and melt away to nothing when removed from the aurosrath's presence for more than 1 round.

Aurosrath.publicNotes:
Greed can be a powerful force; the runelords of old even devised a school of magic based upon it. When an individual dies surrounded by masses of wealth, greed can even reanimate the dead—sufficient avarice can anchor the deceased's soul to their body. The result is an aurosrath, a being so consumed with greed that they're unwilling to donate their corpse to the natural cycle.

Popular lore surrounding the creation of an aurosrath often depicts a miser ironically crushed under the weight of their own gold. While such poetic origins can happen, the truth is often grimmer. Paranoia about potential thieves and freeloaders leads to isolation, both mental and physical. A wealthy merchant succumbs to common illness because they were unwilling to pay the fee for a doctor or priest. Another starves, unable to escape the web of traps and barriers they've set up to defend their treasure from robbers.

Heralded by the clinking of coins, an aurosrath appears as a bloated cadaver who's clad in faded finery, their bulk nearly bursting at the seams with tarnished coins. Their voices are typically a booming bass, their speech peppered with archaic upper-class turns of phrase. They are single-minded in their desire to accumulate wealth but can be reasoned with so long as they believe that goal will ultimately be satiated. An aurosrath can often be found haunting the estates they owned in life. As they brook no competition when it comes to accumulating wealth, they quickly turn to violence when encountering others of their kind. These monstrosities do, however, occasionally command the loyalty of lesser undead and even mercenary mortal servants.

equipment-Gavel.name: 法官槌 Gavel
equipment-Gavel.description: 轻型硬头锤有根短短的木质或金属柄顶端有个厚重的金属头，使用它更像使用棍棒，它能造成沉重的钝击，头上的金属棱或刺还提供额外的力量。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
文书邪魔可以变形成任意小型或中型类人生物。这不会改变其速度或打击的攻击和伤害调整值，但可能会改变其爪打击造成的伤害类型（通常变为钝击）。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Death by 1,000 Papercuts.name: 千纸袭杀 Death by 1,000 Papercuts
Death by 1,000 Papercuts.description: 文书邪魔从袍袖中喷出一股锋利的纸屑。@Template[type:cone|distance:15]范围内的所有生物都会受到@Damage[9d6[slashing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。豁免失败的生物还会受到@Damage[2d4[bleed]]伤害。文书邪魔在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Death by 1,000 Papercuts]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用千纸袭杀。

Inevitable Delays.name: 注定延误 Inevitable Delays
Inevitable Delays.description:
需求 文书邪魔上个动作是一次成功造成伤害的打击

效果 邪魔文书可以凭借直觉知晓到他们刚刚伤害的生物的下个动作，并解释它是如何没有适当的权限来执行这些动作的。该生物必须成功通过一次@Check[will|dc:23]豁免，否则会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。

Red Tape.name: 繁文缛节 Red Tape
Red Tape.description:
30尺。

当非邪魔生物进入灵光范围或在灵感范围内开始回合，它必须尝试一次@Check[will|dc:23]豁免。如果失败，它在对抗语言效果时豁免上承受-2状态减值，持续1轮。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.e1XDZsMrytC0K3k8]

Thoughtsense.name: 思维感知 Thoughtsense
Thoughtsense.description:
文书邪魔能够以模糊感官意识到60尺内的非无心智生物。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Thoughtsense]

Bibliodaemon.name: 文书邪魔 Bibliodaemon
Bibliodaemon.publicNotes:
文书邪魔是一种四臂，像黄鼠狼一样的邪魔，是文书工作和无能官僚的化身。它们经常被官僚滥用权力或以牺牲公民利益为代价偷工减料的地方所吸引。通过伪装成政府官员，文书邪魔会使问题恶化，伪造或遗失重要文件，并使官僚机构的复杂性不断升级。最终，重大违规事件——如监禁或处决无辜者——开始使社区四分五裂。人民陷入偏执和对官员的不信任，最终导致对这些地方政府的反抗，或因缺乏影响变革的力量而完全冷漠。

大多数文书邪魔都是单独行动来制造混乱的，但在某些情况下，这些邪魔也会被战略性地利用。毕竟，一旦一个地区陷入混乱，另一方就很容易介入并接管。在切利亚斯内战期间，文书邪魔有时会被召唤来破坏地区的稳定，以争夺权力。虽然没有人愿意承认，但在整个闪耀诸国的各种政变和政府更迭中，都有文书邪魔的身影。

Replacement Parts.description: A torn quartet can spend 1 minute tearing apart the corpse of a humanoid creature that was killed within the last hour to regain 60 Hit Points and restore one of its nonfunctioning limbs. A torn quartet can't have more than four limbs.
Replacement Parts.name: Replacement Parts

Flurry of Limbs.name: Flurry of Limbs
Flurry of Limbs.description: The torn quartet makes a number of limb Strikes up to its number of functioning limbs, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the torn quartet's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the torn quartet makes all its attacks.

Split Reactions.name: Split Reactions
Split Reactions.description: A torn quartet has a number of reactions per round equal to its number of still-functioning limbs, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the torn quartet must use a different limb for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the torn quartet's limbs is rendered nonfunctional, the torn quartet loses one of its reactions.

Tear Asunder.name: Tear Asunder
Tear Asunder.description:
Requirements The torn quartet has a creature grappled or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by at least two limbs

Effect The creature takes @Damage[5d6[slashing]] damage for each limb currently grabbing or restraining it (maximum 15d6), with a @Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic] save. On a critical failure, the creature also loses a random body part, and one of the torn quartet's limbs is now no longer grabbing or restraining it.

Bound Limbs.name: Bound Limbs
Bound Limbs.description: A torn quartet ordinarily has four severed limbs tethered to a central point by near-incorporeal ropes. A limb is essentially cut away from the central point and rendered nonfunctional each time the torn quartet loses 60 Hit Points (so at 180 Hit Points, the torn quartet has three functional limbs, at 120 Hit Points, it has two functional limbs, and so on). Each functioning limb can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} separate creatures within reach, or multiple functioning limbs can Grapple the same creature; for each additional limb used to Grapple a creature, the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC increases by 2.

Sweeping Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the vorvorak's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The vorvorak attempts a tail Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit, the vorvorak disrupts the action.
Sweeping Tail.name: Sweeping Tail

Canal Walker.name: Canal Walker
Canal Walker.description: A vorvorak ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

Vorvorak Bile.name: Vorvorak Bile
Vorvorak Bile.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:28]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d8[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (2 rounds)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (2 rounds)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d8[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} (2 rounds)

Vorvorak.name: Vorvorak
Vorvorak.publicNotes:
Those trespassing on abandoned canals might come face-to-face with a vorvorak, a large creature that resembles a dragon or crocodile. These territorial beasts keep hoards that they disguise with magical illusions, using their natural talent for spellcasting. Often mistaken for dragons, vorvoraks are commonly referred to as canal dragons or mud dragons. However, they aren't truly related to dragons but rather evolved from local crocodiles and exposure to innate magic in the region of Taldor.

Vorvoraks are solitary creatures, preferring to hunt in the early morning or early evening. In general, vorvoraks make their lairs in areas with some submersion. Such places let them hide their hordes and use their brown, mossy bodies as a natural form of stealth. Due to their evolution and magical contamination, vorvoraks have limited innate magical abilities, allowing them to control the water around them and infuse it with their own poisonous bile.

All vorvoraks share a common trait: hoarding treasure. Many fill their lairs with coins, gems, and anything shiny they take from their victims, with some older hoards containing relics of the surrounding imperial nations. The condition of the items is of no importance to the vorvoraks; a hoard is just as likely to contain junk as items of true value.

A fully grown vorvorak is around 24 feet long and weighs approximately 3,000 pounds, with muddy brown scales, a serpentine neck, and hard fins on their back that resemble wings.

Regeneration 20 (deactivated by cold).name: 再生20（寒冷使其失效） Regeneration 20 (deactivated by cold)

Reactive Strike.name: 反应打击 Reactive Strike
Reactive Strike.description:
触发 你触及范围内的一个生物使用操作或移动动作，进行远程攻击，或者使用移动动作时离开一个方格。

你攻击露出破绽的敌人。对触发此动作的目标进行一次近战打击。如果该攻击为重击，并且触发此动作的是一个操作动作，则打断此动作。这次打击不计入你的多重攻击减值，你的多重攻击减值也不应用于此次打击。

Spine Volley.description: 荆棘蝎进行4次棘刺打击，每次针对不同的目标。这些攻击都会计入荆棘蝎的多重攻击减值，但减值直到荆棘蝎完成攻击后才会增加。
Spine Volley.name: 棘刺齐射 Spine Volley

Corbayrant Venom.name: 荆棘蝎毒 Corbayrant Venom
Corbayrant Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[fortitude|dc:37]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[8d6[poison]]伤害（1轮）

阶段2 @Damage[9d6[poison]]伤害（1轮）

阶段3 @Damage[9d6[poison]]伤害且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1} （1轮）

Vitriolic Miasma.name: 硫酸瘴气 Vitriolic Miasma
Vitriolic Miasma.description:
30尺。

非荆棘蝎生物在灵光范围内，对抗毒素效果时会承受-2环境减值，并获得对毒素的弱点10。

Thorny Hide.name: 荆棘外皮 Thorny Hide
Thorny Hide.description: 荆棘蝎身上长满了锯齿状的刺。用近战打击命中它，以及接触它或用无武装攻击命中它的相邻生物，都会受到@Damage[4d6[piercing]]伤害，并暴露于荆棘麻痹。

Thorn Paralysis.name: 荆棘麻痹 Thorn Paralysis
Thorn Paralysis.description:
荆棘蝎的尾刺上覆盖着一种麻痹毒素，会使受害者身上长出青翠的荆棘。当非荆棘蝎生物暴露在毒素中时，尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:37]豁免。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 该生物会长出像荆棘蝎一样的刺。持续1分钟，该生物会获得荆棘蝎的荆棘外皮能力。试图使用接触射程法术和能力协助受害者的盟友都有可能自身被感染。在持续时间结束时，棘刺会无害地脱落。

失败 同成功，但生物还将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]1分钟。他可以在每回合结束时再尝试一次强韧豁免来结束此麻痹，但不能结束棘刺。

大失败 同失败，但生物不能在回合结束时通过豁免来结束麻痹。

Corbayrant.name: 荆棘蝎 Corbayrant
Corbayrant.publicNotes:
荆棘蝎是名为始祖的精类之一，绿母的造物。在创世之年，她用荆棘和苔藓将它们塑造成致命的掠食者。当侏儒迁徙到凡世物质宇宙时，许多荆棘蝎也跟了过来，但它们发现自己并不适合第一世界以外的生活。

荆棘蝎历来是独居、具有领地意识的生物。它们无法繁衍后代，如果没有第一世界的复苏能力，它们的数量注定要减少。最近，瓦杜兰森林（Verduran Forest）中的一些荆棘蝎克服了天性，联合起来。众所周知，它们会活捉猎物，在卑劣的实验中献祭受害者，试图找到繁衍荆棘蝎数量的方法。

荆棘蝎看起来像巨大的无爪蝎子，浑身长满树皮和荆棘。它们身上飘散着腐烂的雾气。在极少数情况下，它们才会开口说话，而且是用粗哑的低语。

Goldpebble.name: Goldpebble
Goldpebble.publicNotes:
Goldpebbles are large water snakes with bodies that, to the unassuming eye, appear to be nothing more than river rocks, some glinting with traces of gold. These terrifying creatures mimic their natural surroundings to ambush greedy adventurers.

A Taldan alchemist created the goldpebble with the ultimate goal of breeding a creature capable of reproducing at a high rate while possessing a body that would turn to gold upon death, effectively ensuring an endless supply of wealth. Initially, the experiments were successful, with each shed of the snake's skin producing trace amounts of gold. As the snakes grew, however, the amount of gold didn't, and the snakes themselves soon proved unwieldy and difficult to contain. Unhindered, the alchemist redoubled her efforts, adding alchemical reagents to her experiments and leaning more heavily into inhumane tactics to produce her desired results. These tactics failed to lead to an increase in the amount of gold produced but instead mutated the creatures' venom, giving them the ability to slowly turn a victim's blood to frozen water. Empowered with this new ability, the goldpebbles felled their own creator and escaped to spread across the Inner Sea region.

Goldpebbles are generally solitary creatures except for their biannual mating season. During this time, they're even more dangerous than usual, becoming territorial and protective of their young while attacking in groups. Once the eggs hatch, the breeding grounds are filled with hundreds of tiny snakes slithering in all directions in search of new territory. These young goldpebbles are less in control of their alchemical powers than their adult counterparts and have the potential to freeze the water around them at a moment's notice.

Goldpebbles rely heavily on ambush tactics. Often found hiding in shallow pools, rivers, and lakes, goldpebbles will lure unsuspecting adventurers to their lairs using their gold-flecked scales. Once within reach, goldpebbles attack with a gruesome bite that can poison an unlucky victim, slowly turning their prey's blood into freezing water. Goldpebbles can also chill the waters around them, making it incredibly difficult for prey to survive.

Chilling Currents.name: Chilling Currents
Chilling Currents.description: A goldpebble can cause the temperature of all water within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] centered on itself to plummet for 1 minute. Any creature that starts its turn or enters the affected water takes @Damage[2d6[cold]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Pebblefang Poison.name: Pebblefang Poison
Pebblefang Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[cold]] damage (2 rounds)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage (2 rounds)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}

Quantium Golem.name: Quantium Golem

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by sonic (@Damage[9d10[untyped]], @Damage[3d10[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by fire (area @Damage[3d10[healing]] HP); slowed by cold

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

Paired Reconstruction.name: Paired Reconstruction
Paired Reconstruction.description: When reduced to 0 HP, the Quantium golem is destroyed; however, it magically reforms 24 hours later at full HP and free of all conditions and afflictions unless its twin golem is also destroyed.

Vulnerable to Banishment.name: Vulnerable to Banishment
Vulnerable to Banishment.description: Casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.bay4AfSu2iIozNNW]{Banishment} spell on a Quantium golem disrupts its connection to the Crux of Nex. If targeted by such a spell, the golem is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Twin Defenders.name: Twin Defenders
Twin Defenders.description: The Quantium golems were created by Nex as a matched set: one of crimson and one of emerald, each a unique entity. The crimson golem is imbued with blazing fire and crackling lightning; its eye beam and Lambent Beam abilities deal fire and electricity damage. The emerald golem is charged with caustic power and flame; its eye beam and Lambent Beam abilities deal acid and fire damage.

Defender's Link.name: Defender's Link
Defender's Link.description: Each Quantium golem automatically knows the Hit Points, conditions, afflictions, and location of the other.

Lambent Beam.name: Lambent Beam
Lambent Beam.description: The Quantium golem's eyes take on a brilliant glow and it unleashes an arc of destruction dealing @Damage[10d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in a @Template[line|distance:120] (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect]). The Quantium golem can't use Lambent Beam for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Lambent Beam]]{1d4 rounds}.

Quantium Golem.publicNotes:
The long war between Nex and Geb spawned many animate weapons, but while a citizen of Quantium might run screaming from any product of the fleshforges, they barely bat an eyelash at the ground-shaking stomp of the two titanic, deadly constructs that stride outside their city walls. Crafted by the wizard-king Nex ages ago after a devastating attack by Geb's undead forces, including the harrowing benthic reaver, the Quantium golems are meant to protect the capital in case of Nex's absence. These twin golems ceaselessly keep vigil over the city, ready to cut down any invaders that menace Quantium.

Twenty feet tall and crafted from a supernaturally smooth material, the two guardians are a matched set, one of crimson and one of emerald. Wielding swords the size of giants, the guardians relentlessly destroy anything that threatens the city, particularly any undead that might invade the country from Geb. With the mythic Crux of Nex as a power supply, the golems are inexhaustible and nearly indestructible.

Lustrous Lunge.description: The dragon strikes a pose that makes its hide sparkle in the light. Each creature within 20 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:27|inflicts:dazzled] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.
Lustrous Lunge.name: Lustrous Lunge

Ornamental Breath.description: The dragon exhales a torrent of shattered rocks and minerals in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] dealing @Damage[11d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|options:area-effect,inflicts:clumsy] save). A creature who fails the save is weighed down by the stones, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure).
Ornamental Breath.name: Ornamental Breath

+2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal

Cobblegems.name: Cobblegems
Cobblegems.description: 10 feet. The dragon constantly sheds crystalline scales onto the ground around it. The area is uneven ground (DC 27).

Shielding Stone.name: Shielding Stone
Shielding Stone.description:
Trigger A creature at least 10 feet away from the dragon targets them with an attack

Requirements The dragon is on the ground and there is at least one unoccupied square between themself and the attacker

Effect The dragon conjures a thin slab of stone in an unoccupied square between themself and the attacker. The dragon gains standard cover against the triggering attack. The stone falls on the first person other than the dragon who enters that square, dealing @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:27|basic] save. Otherwise, it crumbles harmlessly after 1 round.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Ornamental Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Crystal Dragon (Adult).name: Crystal Dragon (Adult)
Crystal Dragon (Adult).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Time Dragon (Young).name: Time Dragon (Young)

Immortal.description: Time dragons age, but don't die from old age.
Immortal.name: Immortal

Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。
Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy

Timeshift Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a blast of temporal energy, warping time in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save. The dragon can't use Timeshift Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Timeshift Breath]]{1d4 rounds}. Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature shifts briefly forward in time, vanishing and reappearing at the beginning of the time dragon's next turn in the same location (or an adjacent space if their former location is occupied), unaware that any time has passed. While timeshifted, time pauses for that creature, and it cannot take actions or be affected by anything else.
Timeshift Breath.name: Timeshift Breath

Decelerating Dodge.name: Decelerating Dodge
Decelerating Dodge.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with a ranged Strike or spell attack

Effect The dragon slows time to evade, gaining concealment against the triggering attack.

Starflight.name: Starflight
Starflight.description: A time dragon can survive in outer space and fly at incredible speed, taking [[/r 3d20]] hours to reach a destination within the same solar system or [[/r 3d20]] days for destinations beyond. They can carry up to six passengers of at least one size category smaller than themself, protecting them from the void of space.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge their Timeshift Breath.

Time Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
Some time dragons would say time is a deep well, with those who explore it dipping cups into the waters at varying depths. Others might say that time is a shattered mirror, each shard reflecting discrete points that can be viewed simultaneously. None would say time is a firm onward march of linear progress, moving inexorably to a predetermined result. Time is fluid and ever-shifting, and time dragons dedicate themselves to protecting its flow.

Although safeguarding the natural temporal order is a mission all time dragons devote themselves to, they go about it in different ways. Staunch traditionalists oppose any meddling with the timestream whatsoever, even to repair damage caused by prior attempts to influence it, viewing this as doing more harm than good. They believe mortals are too short-sighted to responsibly use time magic and might appear without warning to slay those they believe pose a threat to the timestream. Other time dragons attempt to guide the course of events along the path they believe correct while preventing external tampering, often focusing on particular regions, areas of interest, or even individuals

Countered by Metal.name: 为金所克 Countered by Metal
Countered by Metal.description: 如果森龙受到来自金属物品或具有金特征效果的伤害，他将失去林地通行和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zlnXpME1T2uvn8Lr]直到其下个回合结束。

Fed by Water.name: 由水而生 Fed by Water
Fed by Water.description:
频率 每小时一次

触发 森龙成为一个水法术或效果的目标

效果 森龙获得30点临时生命值，持续1分钟。

Frightful Presence.name: 恐怖威压 Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description:
90尺，@Check[will|dc:27]。具有动物，真菌和植物特征的生物在豁免时承受-2环境减值。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Azure Swarm Breath.name: 蔚蓝虫群吐息 Azure Swarm Breath
Azure Swarm Breath.description: 森龙放出一群昆虫对@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围造成@Damage[10d6[piercing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）随后消散开来。豁免大失败的生物受到@Damage[1d6[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage]伤害。森龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Azure Swarm Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用蔚蓝虫群吐息。

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 森龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，森龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。

Woodland Passage.description: 森龙忽视由非魔法植物和真菌形成的困难地形和高等困难地形，例如灌木，藤蔓和林下植被。
Woodland Passage.name: 林地通行 Woodland Passage

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Forest Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: 青年森龙施法者 Forest Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Forest Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Mist Vision.name: Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: Fog and mist don't impair a cloud dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from fog and mist.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horn Strike in any order.

Dragonmist.name: Dragonmist
Dragonmist.description: The dragon conjures up a sudden mist in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 120 feet. All creatures within the mist become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the mist become concealed to creatures within it. The dragon can use this action again to dismiss the mist—anyone else attempting to remove the dragonmist (via gust of wind or similar) must succeed at a counteract check. A young dragon can have up to three clouds of dragonmist active at a time.

Thundercloud Breath.name: Thundercloud Breath
Thundercloud Breath.description: The dragon breathes a thundercloud that deals @Damage[11d6[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save). They can't use Thundercloud Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Thundercloud Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Thundercloud Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Umbral Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Umbral Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Umbral Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Stories across Golarion warn children about the monsters that dwell in the shadows, but no story captures the reality of the umbral dragon. Natives of the Netherworld, these occult dragons are at home in the darkness, using it to their advantage both in and out of battle. Umbral dragons rarely worry about fighting fairly, emerging from hiding to strike unwary foes and using their magical breath without compunction. Similarly, in social situations, they often remain in the shadows, operating through other creatures. Even in direct conversation, they frequently obscure their true intent, preferring to avoid ever being pinned down with a solid answer.

While umbral dragons are rarely altruistic, their preferred diet creates a strange dichotomy that attracts other creatures to them as a potential source of safety, especially in the Netherworld. While much of the multiverse sees undead as a dire threat, for umbral dragons, undead are a tasty snack. Umbral dragons find the flavor of necrotic flesh irresistible and the void energy of incorporeal undead a potent spice, making them one of the few creatures in existence known to hunt the unliving as a source of food.

Voidsense.name: Voidsense
Voidsense.description: The dragon can taste animating void energy, allowing them to sense creatures with void healing as a precise sense. It can also sense incorporeal creatures with void healing, like shadows, when they are inside solid objects.

Pin Shadow.name: Pin Shadow
Pin Shadow.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's claw uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Requirements The triggering creature is in bright light or dim light and has a shadow

Effect The dragon makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature. On a hit, the trigger creature also has its shadow pinned in place, restricting its movement. The creature treats the area of the dragon's aura as difficult terrain until it uses an Interact action to unpin its shadow. If the area was already difficult terrain, the creature treats it as greater difficult terrain.

Umbral Pall.name: Umbral Pall
Umbral Pall.description: 90 feet. Shadows surround the dragon. The radius of all light from light sources and the areas of light spells in the aura are halved.

Devour Undead.name: Devour Undead
Devour Undead.description: The dragon's jaws Strikes have the benefit of a ghost touch property rune and deal an additional 3d6 force damage to undead.

Tenebrous Breath.name: Tenebrous Breath
Tenebrous Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of darkness that deals @Damage[12d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save). Undead creatures take @Damage[12d6[force]|options:area-damage]{force} damage instead of void damage. The dragon can't use Tenebrous Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Tenebrous Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Despair Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Despair Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Despair Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes: Fear is one of the most powerful emotions, and despair dragons are masters of channeling those feelings of terror and hopelessness for their own benefit. As with other occult dragons, despair dragons are driven by an innate compulsion, in their case, the desire to strike terror in others. Despair dragons tend to settle near settlements, so they have a source of fear to draw from. The most common items in despair dragon hoards are scrolls, tomes, and relics that serve as research material. Through these, despair dragons learn of local folklore, urban legends, and more to better haunt their targets.

Fearsense.name: Fearsense
Fearsense.description: The dragon senses all creatures with the frightened condition at the listed range.

Unbidden Thoughts.name: Unbidden Thoughts
Unbidden Thoughts.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a weapon or unarmed attack

Effect The attacker's mind fills with visions of their worst fears that overwhelm their senses, and they must choose one of the following results: either the triggering attack becomes a normal success, or the critical hit is unaffected but the triggering creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Inspire Dread.description:
The despair dragon telepathically communicates with a creature within 90 feet, listing their deep-seated fears. The creature takes @Damage[16d6[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45] save. Regardless of the result, the creature becomes temporarily immune to Inspire Dread for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.
Inspire Dread.name: Inspire Dread

Look Behind You.name: Look Behind You
Look Behind You.description:
Trigger The dragon successfully Hides from a creature within 90 feet

Effect The dragon teleports to a space directly behind the target creature. The dragon immediately becomes detected unless their chosen position has cover or another means to remain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

Shrieking Breath.name: Shrieking Breath
Shrieking Breath.description: The dragon lets out a cacophonous sound made of every scream the dragon has drawn from a terrified enemy, dealing @Damage[23d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:45|basic] save). Creatures who fail their Will save must spend the first action of their next turn doing nothing but screaming. The dragon can't use Shrieking Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Shrieking Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Tongue Decoy.description:
The despair dragon inflates several bladders at the end of its tongue to create the basic form of a creature. This process takes 1 minute to complete, during which the dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. If the dragon stops or is interrupted in this process, the bladders deflate, and the dragon must start over. Once the process is complete, the dragon can maintain the inflated bladders indefinitely, and can Dismiss to deflate the bladders and retract its tongue instantly.

The inflated tongue takes the basic form of an animal or humanoid and can be inflated to be either Small or Medium. The form resembles the general silhouette of a creature, though closer inspection and success at a @Check[perception|dc:30] check can determine the true nature of the tongue. While inflated, the dragon can send its voice through the decoy, though keeping its tongue inflated makes it difficult to speak, causing the dragon to take a –4 circumstance penalty to any checks related to speaking, such as Deception checks to Lie.

The dragon's tongue can extend up to 90 feet from the dragon's body and it can fully extend its tongue as part of the process to inflate the bladders. The dragon can move the inflated part of its tongue up to 15 feet at a time with an action, which has the concentrate, manipulate, and move traits. While extended, the inflated end of the tongue occupies space as a creature of the appropriate size, but the rest of the tongue doesn't impede or block movement in any way. The dragon's scent functions through cilia at the end of the tongue, but otherwise the dragon has no means of knowing what's near its tongue.

Attacking the tongue is the same as attacking the dragon, except that the tongue is always @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. If the tongue takes any damage, it immediately deflates and remains out. The dragon remains off-guard as long as its tongue is out, but the dragon can retract its tongue with two consecutive Interact actions. If the tongue takes damage, the dragon can't use its tongue decoy again for 1 day.
Tongue Decoy.name: Tongue Decoy

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Consume Fear.name: Consume Fear
Consume Fear.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet loses the frightened condition

Effect The dragon feasts upon the fear that leaves the triggering creature's body, gaining 9d8 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Graceless Domain.name: Graceless Domain
Graceless Domain.description:
90 feet. A creature who enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:42] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the graceless domain aura for 1 minute. The dragon can exclude creatures from this aura.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success For 1 round, the first time the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Failure For 1 minute, the first time each round the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Critical Failure For 1 minute, every time the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Hilarious Exhalation whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.
Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum

Gales of Laughter.name: Gales of Laughter
Gales of Laughter.description:
