Frequency once per round

Effect The dragon surrounds a creature within 90 feet with cacophonous laughter, deafening it for 1 round and causing @Damage[10d4[persistent,mental]] damage unless it succeeds on a @Check[will|dc:42] save.

Humiliating Mark.name: Humiliating Mark
Humiliating Mark.description: On a critical hit, the dragon's claws inflict @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse} on the target as if they had rolled a success.

Insistent Heckling.description:
The dragon can [[/act demoralize]] targets within 90 feet. Targets become immune to the mocking dragon's attempts to Demoralize them for 1 minute after each attempt.

Creatures Demoralized by the ancient mocking dragon are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} while they are frightened.
Insistent Heckling.name: Insistent Heckling

Jeer at Failure.name: Jeer at Failure
Jeer at Failure.description:
Trigger A foe within 90 feet becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} or critically fails on a Strike

Effect The mocking dragon laughs dismissively at the foe, attempting an Intimidation check to [[/act demoralize]] the creature. They do not take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand their language.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of any Tiny, Small, Medium, Large, or Huge animal, beast, or humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Hilarious Exhalation.name: Hilarious Exhalation
Hilarious Exhalation.description:
The dragon unleashes their breath in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Hilarious Exhalation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hilarious Exhalation]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Laughing Gas (emotion, mental) The dragon breaths a cloud of mood-altering gas in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. This has the effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlSE7Ly8vi1Dgddv]{Laughing Fit} (@Check[will|dc:42|traits:emotion,mental]) with a duration of 1 round.

  • Slippery Puddle The dragon expels a glob of viscous goo at a solid surface at a range of 60 feet. This creates a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] with the area effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} (@Check[reflex|dc:42]).

Improved Vex.name: Improved Vex
Improved Vex.description:
Requirements The dragon's last action was a successful tail Strike

Effect The mocking dragon attempts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.5eNKs6738aykAhK2]{Dirty Trick} against the target of their tail Strike. This attempt neither applies nor counts toward the creature's multiple attack penalty.

Ray Displacement.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with a ranged spell attack

Effect The dragon creates a field of distorted space between themself and the caster. The creature targeting the barrage dragon must roll the spell attack twice and take the worse result.
Ray Displacement.name: Ray Displacement

Shrapnel Splash.name: Shrapnel Splash
Shrapnel Splash.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee weapon or unarmed attack

Effect The dragon's blood forms into hard spheres as it erupts from the wound, battering the attacker. The creature who dealt the triggering damage takes @Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Ironsense.name: Ironsense
Ironsense.description: The dragon can detect the presence of iron and other ferrous metals as a precise sense at the listed range.

Arcane Whirlwind.name: Arcane Whirlwind
Arcane Whirlwind.description:
15 feet.

A vortex of fist-sized balls of pure magic swirls around the dragon. Air within the emanation is difficult terrain for Flying creatures other than the dragon. A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn within the aura takes @Damage[8d6[force]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:39|basic] save).

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge Scattershot.

Force Pulse.name: Force Pulse
Force Pulse.description:
1 to 3

The dragon emits pulses of energy that radiates outward in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:25], dealing @Damage[(3d8+3)[force]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save).

For each action spent, a new pulse of energy is created and each subsequent pulse after the first is 5 feet larger than the previous one.

Scattershot.name: Scattershot
Scattershot.description: The dragon exhales a cloud of small balls of pure energy that deal @Damage[(11d4+11)[force]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] with no save. The dragon can't use Scattershot again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Scattershot]]{1d4 rounds}.

Unstoppable Onslaught.name: Unstoppable Onslaught
Unstoppable Onslaught.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The barrage archdragon transforms into pure energy and surges across the battlefield. They Fly up to their Speed, and during this movement they have resistance 30 to all damage (except spirit damage). At any point during this movement, the dragon can make up to two claw Strikes; each of these Strikes deals an additional @Damage[(3d8+3)[force]] damage.

Pushing Pulse.name: Pushing Pulse
Pushing Pulse.description: The barrage dragon performs a 2-action Force Pulse. Each creature who fails its save is pushed 15 feet away from the dragon (30 feet on a critical failure).

Barrage Archdragon.name: Barrage Archdragon
Barrage Archdragon.publicNotes:
To the uninitiated, spellcasting is an art for those with iron wills, people who reach out and grab hold of the fundamental laws of the universe and bend them to their whim. It takes discipline, study, and above all else, it takes control. Fail to control the very building blocks of reality and everything could fall apart.

Those who have even dabbled in the arcane arts know that this is nonsense. Magic is chaos, and channeling arcane forces is less akin to exerting one's will over the world and more like surfing on a bolt of lightning through a world-shaking storm and hoping to steer it without falling off. Spellcasting is barely contained panic, a lance of adrenaline, the constant danger of burning oneself out of existence. And the more powerful someone becomes, the more real this danger is.

Umbral Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Umbral Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)

Hide in Shadows.name: Hide in Shadows
Hide in Shadows.description: The dragon can Hide in dim light even if they don't have cover.

Umbral Pall.name: Umbral Pall
Umbral Pall.description: 120 feet. Shadows surround the dragon. The radius of all light from light sources and the areas of light spells in the aura are halved.

Tenebrous Breath.name: Tenebrous Breath
Tenebrous Breath.description:
The umbral dragon exhales in one of two ways. They can't use Tenebrous Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Tenebrous Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Darkness (occult, void) The dragon breathes a blast of darkness that deals @Damage[16d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic|traits:occult,void] save). Undead creatures take @Damage[16d6[force]|options:area-damage]{force} damage instead of void damage.

  • Shadows (occult, shadow) The dragon breathes a blast of shadows in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40]. Each creature within the cone must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:36|traits:occult,shadow] save.

    Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

    Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round.

    Failure The creature is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute.

Pin Shadow.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's claw uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Requirements The triggering creature is in bright light or dim light and has a shadow

Effect The dragon makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature. On a hit, the trigger creature also has its shadow pinned in place, restricting its movement. The creature treats the area of the dragon's aura as difficult terrain until it uses an Interact action to unpin its shadow. If the area was already difficult terrain, the creature treats it as greater difficult terrain.
Pin Shadow.name: Pin Shadow

Voidsense.name: Voidsense
Voidsense.description: The dragon can taste animating void energy, allowing them to sense creatures with void healing as a precise sense. It can also sense incorporeal creatures with void healing, like shadows, when they are inside solid objects.

Devour Undead.name: Devour Undead
Devour Undead.description: The dragon's jaws Strikes have the benefit of a ghost touch property rune and deal an additional 5d6 force damage to undead.

Umbral Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Stories across Golarion warn children about the monsters that dwell in the shadows, but no story captures the reality of the umbral dragon. Umbral dragons rarely worry about fighting fairly, emerging from hiding to strike unwary foes and using their magical breath without compunction. Similarly, in social situations, they often remain in the shadows, operating through other creatures. Even in direct conversation, they frequently obscure their true intent, preferring to avoid ever being pinned down with a solid answer.

While umbral dragons are rarely altruistic, their preferred diet creates a strange dichotomy that attracts other creatures to them as a potential source of safety, especially in the Netherworld. While much of the multiverse sees undead as a dire threat, for umbral dragons, undead are a tasty snack. Umbral dragons find the flavor of necrotic flesh irresistible and the void energy of incorporeal undead a potent spice, making them one of the few creatures in existence known to hunt the unliving as a source of food.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Word of Caution.name: Word of Caution
Word of Caution.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Wise people listen when a vizier dragon speaks. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains immunity to the vizier dragon's Powerful Utterance and resistance 10 to all other damage for 1 round.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horns Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Powerful Utterance whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Powerful Utterance.name: Powerful Utterance
Powerful Utterance.description:
The dragon expresses their power in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Powerful Utterance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Powerful Utterance]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Ardent Proclamation (occult, fire) The dragon breathes a blast of flame in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] that deals @Damage[12d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|traits:occult,fire] save).

  • Chastising Word (mental, occult) The dragon chides the targets strictly enough to leave the mind reeling. Each creature within a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:30|traits:mental,occult] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure).

Word of Advice.name: Word of Advice
Word of Advice.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The dragon is a skilled mentor, and commands its students like a general. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon can Stride once and Strike once, in any order. If it hits, the Strike deals an additional @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage.

Vizier Dragon (Young).name: Vizier Dragon (Young)
Vizier Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
There's a feeling every teacher knows. It's when one has taken a young mind and educated, trained, and molded them to one's specifications before setting them loose and watching the pupil act on one's teachings. It's a feeling of creation, control, and wonder, the knowledge that one has created this great and glorious thing—and if one has done the job exceptionally well, then the student will outshine the master. This is immortality and power, and this is what vizier dragons chase.

Vizier dragons are primarily concerned with the education and cultivation of people. People fascinate vizier dragons in all their riotous, contradictory complexity. Why do some people excel, and others falter and fail? Why does one person become a saint and the next a tyrant? Why do some become legends in their own time, while others labor in ignominy?

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Emotion.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Emotion

Heartening Aura.name: Heartening Aura
Heartening Aura.description: 40 feet. All allies in the aura gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls. The dragon's bonded companion also gains fast healing 10.

Shielding Wing.name: Shielding Wing
Shielding Wing.description:
Trigger The oath dragon or a bonded companion within 15 feet is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises its wing to protect itself or the bonded companion, providing a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.

Binding Oath.name: Binding Oath
Binding Oath.description: The dragon forges a bond with a willing creature over an hour-long ceremony, making them a bonded companion. The dragon can always sense their distance from the companion and if they're moving closer or farther away. A bonded companion automatically critically succeeds on basic saving throws against the oath dragon's abilities and spells. This link is permanent and neither can form a new link until one member dies. If the dragon or the bonded companion dies, the survivor learns the identity of the killer, but the shock leaves the survivor @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 24 hours and prevents forming a new link for 1 month.

Castigating Breath.name: Castigating Breath
Castigating Breath.description: The dragon unleashes a pronouncement that strikes at the soul of its enemies, dealing @Damage[10d10[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[will|dc:34|basic] save). The dragon can't use Castigating Breath for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Inspiring Word.name: Inspiring Word
Inspiring Word.description: All allies within the dragon's heartening aura become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. Allies can use this extra action to Raise a Shield, Step, Stride, or Strike.

Oathbreaker’s Curse.name: Oathbreaker’s Curse
Oathbreaker’s Curse.description:
If a bonded companion willingly breaks their oath, they retain the benefit of being a bonded companion but are immediately cursed with no initial saving throw. The cursed creature can attempt saving throws as noted to prevent the curse from worsening.

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:38]

Effect The cursed creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't reduce their doomed value below 1 while they're cursed. The first time the cursed creature encounters the oath dragon each day, they must attempt a saving throw. In addition, each time the creature critically fails a Strike or spell attack against the oath dragon, they must attempt a saving throw. On a failure, their doomed value increases by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 3}.

Oath Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Oath Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Oath Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Oath dragons are the embodiment of a cause that they pursue with unerring determination. They draw their power not from mere words, but from the meaning and ideals that those words carry. Their dedication has led to the widespread imagery of oath dragons fighting alongside noble champions trying to bring goodness where only corruption is thought to dwell. Yet, there is nothing more terrifying than the power of an oath dragon who swears to a violent cause or who is dragged into damnation by their loyalty.

While an oath dragon can theoretically be dedicated to multiple ideals, they usually choose a single cause that they pursue with incredible devotion. They provide aid to those who share their dedication and fight fiercely against those who oppose it, all to uphold their ideals. Regardless of the causes they embrace, these dragons do so wholeheartedly. This unwavering determination gives them an intensity that is rarely matched by other creatures, spurring even the most reluctant ally to action.

Cataclysm.name: Cataclysm
Cataclysm.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The magma archdragon releases its primal fury in full. Magma rips from the ground in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] within 240 feet. Each creature in the area takes @Damage[14d6[fire],4d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage, with a @Check[reflex|dc:44|basic|options:area-effect] save.

Pyroclastic Breath.name: Pyroclastic Breath
Pyroclastic Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of magma that deals @Damage[11d6[fire],6d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|basic|dc:44|options:area-effect]). They can't use Pyroclastic Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4#Recharge Pyroclastic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Wing Deflection.name: Wing Deflection
Wing Deflection.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises a wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is Flying, they descend 10 feet after the attack.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of a Medium humanoid. This does not change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horn Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Pyroclastic Blast whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Magma Burrow.name: Magma Burrow
Magma Burrow.description: A magma dragon's burrow Speed functions only when the dragon is Burrowing through magma or molten lava.

Magma Tomb.name: Magma Tomb
Magma Tomb.description: The dragon spits a molten boulder at a target within 120 feet. This deals @Damage[14d6[fire],6d12[bludgeoning]] damage, with a @Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save. If the creature fails its save, it's encased in magma that instantly cools and has Hardness 12, HP 50, and BT 25. The encased creature can't breathe and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} ([[/act escape dc=44]]).

Volcanic Purge.name: Volcanic Purge
Volcanic Purge.description:
If the next action the dragon uses is Pyroclastic Breath, the magma clings to those it damages. Each creature that fails its save against Pyroclastic Breath takes @Damage[6d6[persistent,fire]] damage, and as long as it has this persistent fire damage, it also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7qoZauizAKfPIXeu]{Effect: Volcanic Purge}

Magma Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Magma Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Magma Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Fed by Water.name: 由水而生 Fed by Water
Fed by Water.description:
频率 每小时一次

触发 森龙成为一个水法术或效果的目标

效果 森龙获得40点临时生命值，持续1分钟。

Frightful Presence.name: 恐怖威压 Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description:
90尺，@Check[will|dc:32]。具有动物，真菌和植物特征的生物在豁免时承受-2环境减值。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Metal.name: 为金所克 Countered by Metal
Countered by Metal.description: 如果森龙受到来自金属物品或具有金特征效果的伤害，他将失去林地通行和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zlnXpME1T2uvn8Lr]直到其下个回合结束。

Azure Swarm Breath.name: 蔚蓝虫群吐息 Azure Swarm Breath
Azure Swarm Breath.description: 森龙放出一群昆虫对@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围造成@Damage[14d6[piercing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）随后消散开来。豁免大失败的生物受到@Damage[2d6[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage]伤害。森龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Azure Swarm Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用蔚蓝虫群吐息。

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 森龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，森龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。

Draining Blight.name: 流失枯萎 Draining Blight
Draining Blight.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 森龙从周围的活物身上吸取水分来治愈自己的伤口。@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内的所有活物受到@Damage[7d10[void]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。完全由水和植物构成的生物使用比掷骰结果更差一级的成功度。森龙恢复等同于对该效果本次造成的所有伤害里最高的伤害数值的一半的生命值。区域内所有非生物植物枯萎死亡，清除所有非魔法灌木和所有因此产生的困难地形，掩蔽和隐蔽。

Forest Shape.name: 森林形态 Forest Shape
Forest Shape.description: 当施放@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]时，森龙可以变成体型和年龄与他们自身相同的树木，使用其自己的AC。

Woodland Passage.name: 林地通行 Woodland Passage
Woodland Passage.description: 森龙忽视由非魔法植物和真菌形成的困难地形和高等困难地形，例如灌木，藤蔓和林下植被。

Forest Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: 成年森龙施法者 Forest Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Forest Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Miasma.name: Miasma
Miasma.description:
20 feet.

After the dragon uses their Poison Breath, a cloud of poison gas continues to emanate from their body for 1 round. Any creature that ends its turn in the miasma takes @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:43|basic] save).

Any creature in the miasma is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} and treats other creatures as concealed. The dragon can see through this concealment.

Twisting Tail.name: Twisting Tail
Twisting Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon makes a tail Strike at the creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the dragon disrupts the creature's action.

Forest Passage.name: Forest Passage
Forest Passage.description: The horned dragon ignores any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don't impede their progress.

Trackless Journey.description: The horned dragon always gains the benefits of Cover Tracks in natural surroundings, even while moving at full speed.
Trackless Journey.name: Trackless Journey

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: The dragon can Hide in natural environments even if they don't have cover.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Impaling Charge.name: Impaling Charge
Impaling Charge.description:
Requirements The dragon doesn't have a creature impaled on their horn

Effect The dragon attempts to gore a foe. They Stride, then attempt a horn Strike. On a hit, the target becomes impaled on the dragon's horn. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} while on the horn (and can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} as normal). The dragon doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the impaled creature grabbed. If the dragon moves, they bring the grabbed creature along with them.

Poison Breath.name: Poison Breath
Poison Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a toxic cloud that deals @Damage[22d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:70] (@Check[fortitude|dc:43|basic|options:area-effect] save).

They can't use Poison Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Poison Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Horned Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Horned Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Horned Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
The magic that flows through primal dragons can manifest more animalistic or bestial features in a given type of dragon. Notably among these are the massive paired horns of the horned dragon. While their bulky frames, natural coloration, and prominent ridged scales are all remarkable in their own way, it's the horns that are most obvious and striking at first glance. Horned dragons use their horns to impale their prey in a quick and brutal display of their might. They are generally contemplative and have a fixation on knowledge and self-discipline, traits belied by their bestial appearance. As a result, horned dragons are generally more open to speaking with outsiders.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Horned Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. primal

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of any Tiny, Small, Medium, or Large animal, beast, or humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Vex.description:
Requirements The dragon's last action was a successful tail Strike

Effect The mocking dragon attempts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.5eNKs6738aykAhK2]{Dirty Trick} against the target of their tail Strike. This attempt neither applies nor counts toward the creature's multiple attack penalty.
Vex.name: Vex

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Graceless Domain.name: Graceless Domain
Graceless Domain.description:
90 feet. A creature who enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the graceless domain aura for 1 minute. The dragon can exclude creatures from this aura.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success For 1 round, the first time the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Failure For 1 minute, the first time each round the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Critical Failure For 1 minute, every time the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Hilarious Exhalation whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Hilarious Exhalation.name: Hilarious Exhalation
Hilarious Exhalation.description:
The dragon unleashes their breath in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Hilarious Exhalation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hilarious Exhalation]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Laughing Gas (emotion, mental) The dragon breaths a cloud of mood-altering gas in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. This has the effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlSE7Ly8vi1Dgddv]{Laughing Fit} (@Check[will|dc:32|traits:emotion,mental]) with a duration of 1 round.

  • Slippery Puddle The dragon expels a glob of viscous goo at a solid surface at a range of 60 feet. This creates a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] with the area effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} (@Check[reflex|dc:32]).

Humiliating Mark.name: Humiliating Mark
Humiliating Mark.description: On a critical hit, the dragon's claws inflict @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse} on the target as if they had rolled a success.

Insistent Heckling.name: Insistent Heckling
Insistent Heckling.description: The dragon can [[/act demoralize]] targets within 90 feet. Targets become immune to the mocking dragon's attempts to Demoralize them for 1 minute after each attempt.

Jeer at Failure.name: Jeer at Failure
Jeer at Failure.description:
Trigger A foe within 90 feet becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} or critically fails on a Strike

Effect The mocking dragon laughs dismissively at the foe, attempting an Intimidation check to [[/act demoralize]] the creature. They do not take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand their language.

Vizier Dragon (Adult).name: Vizier Dragon (Adult)

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Dragontongue.name: Dragontongue
Dragontongue.description: When a dragon speaks, the universe listens. The dragon is immune to silence and abilities that would prevent them from speaking if the source's level is lower than the dragon's or its rank is lower than half the dragon's level rounded up.

Word of Wisdom.name: Word of Wisdom
Word of Wisdom.description:
Trigger An ally within 60 feet fails a saving throw

Effect The ally improves its result by one degree of success, turning a failure into a success or a critical failure into a normal failure. The dragon can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge this ability]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horns Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Powerful Utterance whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Powerful Utterance.name: Powerful Utterance
Powerful Utterance.description:
The dragon expresses their power in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Powerful Utterance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Powerful Utterance]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Ardent Proclamation (occult, fire) The dragon breathes a blast of flame in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] that deals @Damage[16d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic|traits:occult,fire] save).

  • Chastising Word (mental, occult) The dragon chides the targets strictly enough to leave the mind reeling. Each creature within a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:36|traits:mental,occult] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure).

Word of Advice.name: Word of Advice
Word of Advice.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The dragon is a skilled mentor, and commands its students like a general. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon can Stride once and Strike once, in any order. If it hits, the Strike deals an additional @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage.

Word of Caution.name: Word of Caution
Word of Caution.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Wise people listen when a vizier dragon speaks. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains immunity to the vizier dragon's Powerful Utterance and resistance 15 to all other damage for 1 round.

Vizier Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
There's a feeling every teacher knows. It's when one has taken a young mind and educated, trained, and molded them to one's specifications before setting them loose and watching the pupil act on one's teachings. It's a feeling of creation, control, and wonder, the knowledge that one has created this great and glorious thing—and if one has done the job exceptionally well, then the student will outshine the master. This is immortality and power, and this is what vizier dragons chase.

Vizier dragons are primarily concerned with the education and cultivation of people. People fascinate vizier dragons in all their riotous, contradictory complexity. Why do some people excel, and others falter and fail? Why does one person become a saint and the next a tyrant? Why do some become legends in their own time, while others labor in ignominy?

Divine Sanctification.name: Divine Sanctification
Divine Sanctification.description: Once an executor dragon reaches adulthood, they are expected to sanctify as either holy or unholy; they gain the corresponding trait and weakness 20 to the opposing sanctification.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Aura of Authority.name: Aura of Authority
Aura of Authority.description:
60 feet. The divine majesty of an adult executor dragon can't be denied. A creature that enters or begins their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:44] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's aura of authority for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} for 10 minutes.

Rage of the Divine.name: Rage of the Divine
Rage of the Divine.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect Raw divine power flashes through the executor dragon harming anyone who dares strike it so brazenly. The creature who dealt the triggering attack takes @Damage[8d8[spirit]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:41|basic] save.

Apocalyptic Roar.name: Apocalyptic Roar
Apocalyptic Roar.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The executor archdragon calls down the full power of the divine. All creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] within 120 feet take @Damage[9d8[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage plus @Damage[6d12[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage, with a @Check[will|dc:44|basic] save.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change its Speed or attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Divine Utterance.name: Divine Utterance
Divine Utterance.description: The dragon screams the truth of the divine, dealing @Damage[17d8[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save). They can't use Divine Utterance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Divine Utterance]]{1d4 rounds}.

Executor Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Executor Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Executor Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Legends state the first executor dragons formed from the rage-filled screams of Sarenrae during her struggle against the Rough Beast. In the face of an enemy even she had no hope of redeeming, the ever-compassionate Dawnflower allowed her divine fury to escape from her lips as she struck down the primordial god, and from this act of anathema, the first executor dragons were given form. Since that moment, executor dragons represent the full wrath of the gods. Divine in nature, executor dragons typically appear to punish those who have strayed so far from the path of their deity's edicts as to begin embracing the anathema. Due to their potent nature as weapons of the divine, executor dragons are generally drawn to target not a single misbehaving follower, but entire villages, cities, or towns that have turned their backs on their gods. Many of the gods prefer not to use executor dragons as part of their punishment of mortal transgressors, and instead keep them reserved for the days of apocalyptic battles.

Though many believe executor dragons are spawned from divine magic, they are fully biological creatures. Compelled by faith and devotion and disgusted by hypocrisy and base cruelty, executor dragons tend to live near human settlements, but rarely within them. They form small familial groups when young, but grow more independent as they age, seeking to claim territory uninhabited by other dragons. Their chosen lairs tend to be locations secreted away, either in the ruins of mountaintop monasteries or in the cavernous depths beneath abandoned places of worship. For the few executor dragons that live actively among non-draconic peoples, even fewer do so in their natural forms. They are sometimes found living disguised as traveling lay priests who bring healing and alms for the needy, choristers singing hymnals, wandering monastic scholars who ask challenging and conflicted questions about faith, or quiet church custodians who protect and beautify their chosen houses of worship. It's said that one or more executor dragons might have even taken up the defense of Kenebres after its near destruction at the hands of the Khorramzadeh, Storm King of the Worldwound.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Radiate Cold.name: Radiate Cold
Radiate Cold.description:
15 feet. The adult rime dragon's presence lowers the temperature around them. A creature who enters or begins their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature begins to shiver as the biting cold affects it. It takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn.

Failure The creature's body temperature begins to drop. It takes a –10-foot status penalty to their Speeds and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure Ice begins to form on the creature. It's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} ([[/act escape dc=33]]) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until the end of their its turn.

Blizzard Breath.name: Blizzard Breath
Blizzard Breath.description: The dragon breathes out a gust of frost and ice that deals @Damage[12d8[cold]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic] save). They can't use Blizzard Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Blizzard Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Arctic Hunter.name: Arctic Hunter
Arctic Hunter.description: A rime dragon's natural camouflage allows them to [[/act hide]] in arctic terrain without cover. A rime dragon also ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from ice and snow and doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.

Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
Snow Vision.description: Snow doesn't impair the rime dragon's vision; they ignore concealment from snowfall.

Piercing Ice.name: Piercing Ice
Piercing Ice.description:
Requirements The dragon has temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield

Effect The dragon launches the collected ice shards from its scales in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], dealing @Damage[6d6[piercing],4d6[cold]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic] save). The dragon then loses the AC bonus and temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield.

Rime Shield.name: Rime Shield
Rime Shield.description:
Requirements The rime dragon's last action was to Fly at least 40 feet

Effect Water vapor collected on the dragon's scales quickly freezes over. The dragon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and 15 temporary Hit Points that last until the end of the dragon's next turn.

Rime Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Rime Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Rime Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Rime dragons are the embodiment of the frigid cold and ice. These hardy creatures have adapted to harsh arctic climates, able to survive indefinitely in sub-zero temperatures. Rime dragons are shades of white and pale blue that perfectly camouflage them in their natural habitat, resembling glaciers or mounds of snow when curled up. They can break through large slabs of ice and dive into frozen waters in search of prey. Due to their natural lower body temperature, they can slow their digestive tract, which allows them to live a long time on little food. Large prey—such as whales, caribou, or moose—offer the best sustenance, but they aren't picky when it's time to eat.

Rime dragons have a deep curiosity for things hidden and lost in the ice. The ocean's currents bring all kinds of artifacts from across the world to their frigid waters. Self-described caretakers and scholars, rime dragons search the arctic regions for ancient antiquities. Rime dragons with an academic interest in archaeology peer into glaciers for pieces of civilizations both recent and ancient, which they preserve in their lairs. Others might search for fossils or preserved corpses. Rime dragons also have an interest in more biological aspects of the world. As preservers of life, some of these dragons collect flora to log and study, and they protect endangered species by using low temperatures to conserve them. They also act as paleopathologists, studying ancient diseases that could cause havoc if they were brought back to a populace unknowingly. These they carefully contain while researching mitigation strategies should the pathogens be reintroduced to the world.

Fed by Water.name: 由水而生 Fed by Water
Fed by Water.description:
频率 每小时一次

触发 森龙成为一个水法术或效果的目标

效果 森龙获得60点临时生命值，持续1分钟。

Frightful Presence.name: 恐怖威压 Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description:
90尺，@Check[will|dc:45]。具有动物，真菌和植物特征的生物在豁免时承受-2环境减值。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Forest Shape.description: 当施放@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]时，森龙可以变成体型和年龄与他们自身相同的树木，使用其自己的AC。
Forest Shape.name: 森林形态 Forest Shape

Lignifying Bite.name: 化木噬咬 Lignifying Bite
Lignifying Bite.description: 当由血肉构成的生物被森龙的颚咬打击削减至0点生命值，该生物必须尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:45]豁免。如果失败，它就会死亡，它的血肉，玄学上视为土属相，将转变为木质。这块木头还是活着的，随着时间推移可能会长成树，但它不能视作尸体或尸体的部分以用作@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG]或其他能使得生物复生的魔法。

Ultimate Remedy.name: 济世良方 Ultimate Remedy
Ultimate Remedy.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 森龙能治愈大部分病痛。森龙尝试一次@Check[nature]检定来反制影响30尺内一个生物的一种疾病或毒素。

Woodland Passage.name: 林地通行 Woodland Passage
Woodland Passage.description: 森龙忽视由非魔法植物和真菌形成的困难地形和高等困难地形，例如灌木，藤蔓和林下植被。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Metal.name: 为金所克 Countered by Metal
Countered by Metal.description: 如果森龙受到来自金属物品或具有金特征效果的伤害，他将失去林地通行和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zlnXpME1T2uvn8Lr]直到其下个回合结束。

Azure Swarm Breath.name: 蔚蓝虫群吐息 Azure Swarm Breath
Azure Swarm Breath.description: 森龙放出一群昆虫对@Template[type:cone|distance:60]范围造成@Damage[20d6[piercing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）随后消散开来。豁免大失败的生物受到@Damage[4d6[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage]伤害。森龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Azure Swarm Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用蔚蓝虫群吐息。

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 森龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，森龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。

Draining Blight.name: 流失枯萎 Draining Blight
Draining Blight.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 森龙从周围的活物身上吸取水分来治愈自己的伤口。@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内的所有活物受到@Damage[12d10[void]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。完全由水和植物构成的生物使用比掷骰结果更差一级的成功度。森龙恢复等同于对该效果本次造成的所有伤害里最高的伤害数值的一半的生命值。区域内所有非生物植物枯萎死亡，清除所有非魔法灌木和所有因此产生的困难地形，掩蔽和隐蔽。

Forest Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: 至古森龙施法者 Forest Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Forest Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+2状态加值

Wished Away.name: Wished Away
Wished Away.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect The dragon wishes not to be hurt by this attack, gaining resistance 20 to all damage against the triggering attack.

Destructive Wish.name: Destructive Wish
Destructive Wish.description:
Requirements An illusion from Wish Come True is currently active

Effect The wish dragon Dismisses the illusion of Wish Come True, which shatters into magical fragments, dealing @Damage[7d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:34|basic] save to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:40] of the illusion.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Breath of Loss whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Best Wishes.name: Best Wishes
Best Wishes.description: 20 feet. Being near a wish dragon gives other creatures a greater sense of what they truly wish for, bolstering their sense of purpose while also distracting them from the task at hand. Creatures in the aura take a –1 status penalty to Perception but gain a +2 status bonus to Will saving throws against mental effects. The wish dragon can't gain the benefit of their own aura or other actions that use the aura, and they can choose to exclude any creatures from any benefit of the aura or action that uses the aura.

Breath of Loss.name: Breath of Loss
Breath of Loss.description: The dragon breathes a warm, gentle breeze of mist that creates the feeling of when deepest desires are achieved. As the breeze dissipates, the feeling of loss overwhelms creatures' senses, dealing @Damage[14d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[will|dc:34] save). A creature that critically fails its save is also consumed with the memory of the moment and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. The wish dragon can't use Breath of Loss again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath of Loss]]{1d4 rounds}.

Wish Come True.name: Wish Come True
Wish Come True.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon creates an illusion in an unoccupied square within 60 feet that appears to all other creatures that can see it to be the manifestation of their deepest material desire. This has the effects of illusory object (though the illusion might appear to be a creature to certain people) that last for 10 minutes. The wish dragon can Dismiss the illusion. Each non-wish dragon creature who begins their turn within 200 feet in line of sight of the illusion must attempt a @Check[will|dc:34] save. If any creature within reach of the illusion Interacts to touch it, the illusion ends and that creature is invigorated, gaining 2d6 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature disbelieves the illusion and becomes temporarily immune to Wish Come True for 1 hour.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Wish Dragon (Adult).name: Wish Dragon (Adult)
Wish Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
What is a wish? A wish dragon would call it the truest expression of self—each individual wish reveals something of deep importance to the wisher, and no two wishes are ever quite the same. Whether the wish is one of creation or destruction, justice or vengeance, love or hate, wish dragons seek to understand what makes it important to the wisher and view their ability to make it a reality as a gift that helps them make sense of the world.

To a wish dragon, learning what someone wishes for is the beginning of a conversation, granting them that wish is a gift, and watching what they do with it is a reward. They take each part of this journey seriously and spend much of their lives moving among other ancestries to better understand what others want and need, especially during their younger years. While they view this mission as a righteous one, it can become all-consuming, and some have been known to lose all sense of themselves in their quest to bring about the dreams and desires of those around them.

Oath Dragon (Young).name: Oath Dragon (Young)
Oath Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
Oath dragons are the embodiment of a cause that they pursue with unerring determination. They draw their power not from mere words, but from the meaning and ideals that those words carry. Their dedication has led to the widespread imagery of oath dragons fighting alongside noble champions trying to bring goodness where only corruption is thought to dwell. Yet, there is nothing more terrifying than the power of an oath dragon who swears to a violent cause or who is dragged into damnation by their loyalty.

While an oath dragon can theoretically be dedicated to multiple ideals, they usually choose a single cause that they pursue with incredible devotion. They provide aid to those who share their dedication and fight fiercely against those who oppose it, all to uphold their ideals. Regardless of the causes they embrace, these dragons do so wholeheartedly. This unwavering determination gives them an intensity that is rarely matched by other creatures, spurring even the most reluctant ally to action.

Binding Oath.description: The dragon forges a bond with a willing creature over an hour-long ceremony, making them a bonded companion. The dragon can always sense their distance from the companion and if they're moving closer or farther away. A bonded companion automatically critically succeeds on basic saving throws against the oath dragon's abilities and spells. This link is permanent and neither can form a new link until one member dies. If the dragon or the bonded companion dies, the survivor learns the identity of the killer, but the shock leaves the survivor @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 24 hours and prevents forming a new link for 1 month.
Binding Oath.name: Binding Oath

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Emotion.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Emotion

Heartening Aura.name: Heartening Aura
Heartening Aura.description: 30 feet. All allies in the aura gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls. The dragon's bonded companion also gains fast healing 5.

Shielding Wing.name: Shielding Wing
Shielding Wing.description:
Trigger The oath dragon or a bonded companion within 15 feet is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises its wing to protect itself or the bonded companion, providing a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.

Castigating Breath.name: Castigating Breath
Castigating Breath.description: The dragon unleashes a pronouncement that strikes at the soul of its enemies, dealing @Damage[7d10[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:29|basic] save). The dragon can't use Castigating Breath for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Oathbreaker’s Curse.name: Oathbreaker’s Curse
Oathbreaker’s Curse.description:
If a bonded companion willingly breaks their oath, they retain the benefit of being a bonded companion but are immediately cursed with no initial saving throw. The cursed creature can attempt saving throws as noted to prevent the curse from worsening.

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:32]

Effect The cursed creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't reduce their doomed value below 1 while they're cursed. The first time the cursed creature encounters the oath dragon each day, they must attempt a saving throw. In addition, each time the creature critically fails a Strike or spell attack against the oath dragon, they must attempt a saving throw. On a failure, their doomed value increases by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: Whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike, the dragon recharges their Castigating Breath.

Inspiring Word.name: Inspiring Word
Inspiring Word.description: All allies within the dragon's heartening aura become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. Allies can use this extra action to Raise a Shield, Step, Stride, or Strike.

Barrage Dragon (Adult).name: Barrage Dragon (Adult)
Barrage Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
To the uninitiated, spellcasting is an art for those with iron wills, people who reach out and grab hold of the fundamental laws of the universe and bend them to their whim. It takes discipline, study, and above all else, it takes control. Fail to control the very building blocks of reality and everything could fall apart.

Those who have even dabbled in the arcane arts know that this is nonsense. Magic is chaos, and channeling arcane forces is less akin to exerting one's will over the world and more like surfing on a bolt of lightning through a world-shaking storm and hoping to steer it without falling off. Spellcasting is barely contained panic, a lance of adrenaline, the constant danger of burning oneself out of existence. And the more powerful someone becomes, the more real this danger is.

Ironsense.name: Ironsense
Ironsense.description: The dragon can detect the presence of iron and other ferrous metals as a precise sense at the listed range.

Arcane Whirlwind.name: Arcane Whirlwind
Arcane Whirlwind.description:
15 feet.

A vortex of fist-sized balls of pure magic swirls around the dragon. Air within the emanation is difficult terrain for Flying creatures other than the dragon. A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn within the aura takes @Damage[6d6[force]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save).

Shrapnel Splash.name: Shrapnel Splash
Shrapnel Splash.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee weapon or unarmed attack

Effect The dragon's blood forms into hard spheres as it erupts from the wound, battering the attacker. The creature who dealt the triggering damage takes @Damage[7d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge Scattershot.

Force Pulse.name: Force Pulse
Force Pulse.description:
1 to 3

The dragon emits pulses of energy that radiates outward in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15], dealing @Damage[(2d6+2)[force]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save).

For each action spent, a new pulse of energy is created and each subsequent pulse after the first is 5 feet larger than the previous one.

Scattershot.name: Scattershot
Scattershot.description: The dragon exhales a cloud of small balls of pure energy that deal @Damage[(7d4+7)[force]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] with no save. The dragon can't use Scattershot again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Scattershot]]{1d4 rounds}.

Pushing Pulse.name: Pushing Pulse
Pushing Pulse.description: The barrage dragon performs a 2-action Force Pulse. Each creature who fails its save is pushed 5 feet away from the dragon (10 feet on a critical failure).

Dragontongue.name: Dragontongue
Dragontongue.description: When a dragon speaks, the universe listens. The dragon is immune to silence and abilities that would prevent them from speaking if the source's level is lower than the dragon's or its rank is lower than half the dragon's level rounded up.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Word of Advice.name: Word of Advice
Word of Advice.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The dragon is a skilled mentor, and commands its students like a general. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon can Stride once and Strike once, in any order. If it hits, the Strike deals an additional @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage.

Word of Caution.name: Word of Caution
Word of Caution.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Wise people listen when a vizier dragon speaks. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains immunity to the vizier dragon's Powerful Utterance and resistance 15 to all other damage for 1 round.

Word of Wisdom.name: Word of Wisdom
Word of Wisdom.description:
Trigger An ally within 60 feet fails a saving throw

Effect The ally improves its result by one degree of success, turning a failure into a success or a critical failure into a normal failure. The dragon can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge this ability]]{1d4 rounds}.

Powerful Utterance.name: Powerful Utterance
Powerful Utterance.description:
The dragon expresses their power in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Powerful Utterance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Powerful Utterance]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Ardent Proclamation (occult, fire) The dragon breathes a blast of flame in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] that deals @Damage[16d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic|traits:occult,fire] save).

  • Chastising Word (mental, occult) The dragon chides the targets strictly enough to leave the mind reeling. Each creature within a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:36|traits:mental,occult] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure).

Vizier Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Vizier Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Vizier Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
There's a feeling every teacher knows. It's when one has taken a young mind and educated, trained, and molded them to one's specifications before setting them loose and watching the pupil act on one's teachings. It's a feeling of creation, control, and wonder, the knowledge that one has created this great and glorious thing—and if one has done the job exceptionally well, then the student will outshine the master. This is immortality and power, and this is what vizier dragons chase.

Vizier dragons are primarily concerned with the education and cultivation of people. People fascinate vizier dragons in all their riotous, contradictory complexity. Why do some people excel, and others falter and fail? Why does one person become a saint and the next a tyrant? Why do some become legends in their own time, while others labor in ignominy?

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal

Aquatic Echolocation.name: Aquatic Echolocation
Aquatic Echolocation.description: A brine dragon can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

Regent's Glower.name: Regent's Glower
Regent's Glower.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon focuses their weighty gaze upon their assailant, filling their foe with dread. The triggering creature takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:29|basic] save. Any creature who fails the save also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

Bathygenic Barrage.name: Bathygenic Barrage
Bathygenic Barrage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon uses Pressurized Pool three times. None of the bursts can overlap.

Benthic Bite.name: Benthic Bite
Benthic Bite.description: A creature who takes damage from a brine dragon's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round.

Crushing Breath.name: Crushing Breath
Crushing Breath.description: The dragon spews a @Template[type:line|distance:80] of pressurized water that deals @Damage[13d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save. A creature that fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. The dragon can't use Crushing Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Crushing Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Pressurized Pool.name: Pressurized Pool
Pressurized Pool.description: The dragon expels a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] of pressurized water within 120 feet that lasts for 1 minute. A creature other than a brine dragon that enters or begins their turn within a burst must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save or become encumbered until the beginning of their next turn.

Tidal Surge.name: Tidal Surge
Tidal Surge.description: The dragon sweeps their wings, creating a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of buffeting water that deals @Damage[8d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic] save. Each unattended object and each creature that fails the save is also pushed away from the dragon 10 feet (20 feet on a critical failure) and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The dragon can't use Tidal Surge again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Tidal Surge]]{1d4 rounds}.

Brine Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Brine Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Brine Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Communal Knowledge.name: Communal Knowledge
Communal Knowledge.description: The dragon mentally communes with all their current active informants simultaneously. They learn the present state of all the informants, as status, and any new information the informants have learned since they were last in communication. Fragments of extraneous information briefly remain after using Communal Knowledge; for the next hour, the dragon can attempt @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} checks for any skill with a modifier of +36.

Distracting Whisper.name: Distracting Whisper
Distracting Whisper.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect A mysterious voice whispers something disconcerting in the triggering creature's ear, inflicting a –2 circumstance penalty to the triggering attack.

Cogitation Breath.name: Cogitation Breath
Cogitation Breath.description: The dragon unleashes a befuddling miasma, dealing @Damage[19d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in an @Template[type:cone|distance:80] (@Check[will|dc:42|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. The dragon can't use Cogitation Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Cogitation Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.name: Spell Effect: Hidden Mind
Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.C2w3YfBKjIRS07DP]{Hidden Mind}

You gain a +4 status bonus to saves against mental effects.

Information Network.name: Information Network
Information Network.description: The dragon can attempt a Society check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} in place of a check to Gather Information, recalling intelligence from prior informants.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Diplomatic Solution.name: Diplomatic Solution
Diplomatic Solution.description:
Trigger The dragon rolls initiative

Effect The dragon affects all enemies it can see within 60 feet with calm heightened to half the dragon's level rounded up (@Check[will|dc:42]). The dragon doesn't need to Sustain this effect, but if the dragon takes any hostile action against those affected, it breaks the effect for all creatures.

Steal Knowledge.name: Steal Knowledge
Steal Knowledge.description:
The dragon plucks a fragment of knowledge from the mind of a creature within 60 feet, choosing a skill to affect. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:42] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For the next minute, the creature takes a –1 status penalty to checks using that skill, and the dragon gets a +1 status bonus to using that skill.

Critical Failure As failure, but the penalty is –2 and the bonus is +2.

Thought Whispers.name: Thought Whispers
Thought Whispers.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The dragon sends their mind out to seek others' thoughts, affecting all creatures within 80 feet with mind reading (@Check[will|dc:42]).

Unveil Secret.name: Unveil Secret
Unveil Secret.description: The dragon delves into the mind of a creature within 60 feet, learning something they'd find embarrassing or shameful unless they succeed at a @Check[will|dc:42] save. The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and cannot reduce their frightened condition for 1 minute or until the dragon reveals the secret. As a reaction when the affected creature attempts a check, the dragon can reveal their secret to discomfit them, requiring them to roll twice and take the lower result; this is a misfortune effect.

Whisper Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Whisper Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Whisper Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes: Whisper dragons are keen collectors of rumors and secrets who spend centuries honing their information networks and relationships. They generally do so not out of an intent to hold the information over others or to use for their own machinations, but simply because the process of learning and gathering information is fulfilling. Their hoards are sparse compared to those of other dragons, as they hold their true treasures—secrets—in their minds.

Magma Tomb.name: Magma Tomb
Magma Tomb.description: The dragon spits a molten boulder at a target within 120 feet. This deals @Damage[12d6[fire],5d12[bludgeoning]] damage, with a @Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save. If the creature fails its save, it's encased in magma that instantly cools and has Hardness 10, HP 40, and BT 20. The encased creature can't breathe and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} ([[/act escape dc=40]]).

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Wing Deflection.name: Wing Deflection
Wing Deflection.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises a wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is Flying, they descend 10 feet after the attack.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of a Medium humanoid. This does not change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horn Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Pyroclastic Blast whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Magma Burrow.name: Magma Burrow
Magma Burrow.description: A magma dragon's burrow Speed functions only when the dragon is Burrowing through magma or molten lava.

Pyroclastic Breath.name: Pyroclastic Breath
Pyroclastic Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of magma that deals @Damage[10d6[fire],5d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|basic|dc:40|options:area-effect]). They can't use Pyroclastic Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4#Recharge Pyroclastic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}

Volcanic Purge.name: Volcanic Purge
Volcanic Purge.description:
If the next action the dragon uses is Pyroclastic Breath, the magma clings to those it damages. Each creature that fails its save against Pyroclastic Breath takes @Damage[5d6[persistent,fire]] damage, and as long as it has this persistent fire damage, it also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7qoZauizAKfPIXeu]{Effect: Volcanic Purge}

Magma Dragon (Ancient).name: Magma Dragon (Ancient)
Magma Dragon (Ancient).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Word of Advice.name: Word of Advice
Word of Advice.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The dragon is a skilled mentor, and commands its students like a general. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon can Stride once and Strike once, in any order. If it hits, the Strike deals an additional @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage.

Word of Caution.name: Word of Caution
Word of Caution.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Wise people listen when a vizier dragon speaks. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains immunity to the vizier dragon's Powerful Utterance and resistance 10 to all other damage for 1 round.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Powerful Utterance.name: Powerful Utterance
Powerful Utterance.description:
The dragon expresses their power in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Powerful Utterance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Powerful Utterance]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Ardent Proclamation (occult, fire) The dragon breathes a blast of flame in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] that deals @Damage[12d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|traits:occult,fire] save).

  • Chastising Word (mental, occult) The dragon chides the targets strictly enough to leave the mind reeling. Each creature within a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:30|traits:mental,occult] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure).

Vizier Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Vizier Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Vizier Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
There's a feeling every teacher knows. It's when one has taken a young mind and educated, trained, and molded them to one's specifications before setting them loose and watching the pupil act on one's teachings. It's a feeling of creation, control, and wonder, the knowledge that one has created this great and glorious thing—and if one has done the job exceptionally well, then the student will outshine the master. This is immortality and power, and this is what vizier dragons chase.

Vizier dragons are primarily concerned with the education and cultivation of people. People fascinate vizier dragons in all their riotous, contradictory complexity. Why do some people excel, and others falter and fail? Why does one person become a saint and the next a tyrant? Why do some become legends in their own time, while others labor in ignominy?

Requiem Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Soul Journey.name: Soul Journey
Soul Journey.description: The dragon spends 1 hour traveling through planar channels to reach the River of Souls, and then reaches any point along the river. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Interplanar Teleport}, except that the dragon can arrive precisely where they like on any major plane.

Status Sight.name: Status Sight
Status Sight.description: The requiem dragon automatically knows the Hit Points of all creatures they can see.

Soul Anchor.name: Soul Anchor
Soul Anchor.description:
A creature within 60 feet would drop to 0 Hit Points

Effect The dragon anchors the triggering creature's soul to its body. The creature remains at 1 Hit Point, becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, and gains fast healing equal to the dragon's level for 1 minute. The creature becomes temporarily immune to further Soul Anchor usages for 24 hours.

Withhold Death.name: Withhold Death
Withhold Death.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect The dragon resists the loosening of its own soul, preventing some of the damage. The dragon gains resistance 25 to all damage against the triggering attack.

Redirect River.name: Redirect River
Redirect River.description: The requiem dragon redirects a small portion of the River of Souls, using their body as a spiritual connection. The river swells around them, filling the area in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] for 1 round, becoming difficult terrain to all other creatures. Additionally, creatures that begin their turn in the emanation or enter it for the first time each round must succeed a @Check[fortitude|dc:48|basic] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. If the target is already drained or doomed, the value increases by 1 (to a maximum of 4). The dragon can Sustain the effect.

Dooming Breath.name: Dooming Breath
Dooming Breath.description: The raw energy of Creation's Forge streams from the dragon's mouth, dealing @Damage[20d8[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:line|distance:150] (@Check[reflex|dc:48|basic] save). Undead creatures who fail the save must also succeed at a @Check[will|dc:48] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. If the target is already doomed, the doomed value increases by 1 (to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 4}). The dragon can't use Dooming Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dooming Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Soul Shield.name: Soul Shield
Soul Shield.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The requiem dragon uses their life essence to create a shield of spiritual energy around a creature within 60 feet. The shield creates a link between the dragon and the creature with the effects of share life except that the effect doesn't end regardless of distance and remains for 1 hour. In addition, the creature gains resistance 15 to physical and spirit damage that applies to the half of damage it receives. The dragon can Dismiss the effect.

Spare the Dying, Free the Tormented.name: Spare the Dying, Free the Tormented
Spare the Dying, Free the Tormented.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The requiem dragon flaps their mighty wings to produce a gust of energy from Creation's Forge. Each dying creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:200] immediately loses the dying condition, though it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} at 0 Hit Points. Each creature with void healing in the same area takes @Damage[16d6[vitality]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:48|basic] save); a creature who is reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage is immediately destroyed and its soul returns to the River of Souls, even if that creature has an ability like rejuvenation. The dragon can choose to exclude as many creatures from this effect as they wish.

Requiem Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Requiem Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Requiem Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes: Requiem dragons are stewards of the River of Souls and the process through which souls reach their final destination in the afterlife. The safe journey of a soul is of utmost importance to a requiem dragon, and some will follow individual souls from their first entry into the river through to their judgment in the Boneyard and eventually to their ultimate resting place. Most requiem dragons tie themselves to specific planes and shepherd any souls bound to that plane, leading to dragons linked to places like Heaven or Hell, though these dragons never swear true allegiance to these planes. Requiem dragons fill their lairs along the River of Souls—patchworks of somber architecture rescued from other planes—with invaluable records and mementos of great accomplishments.

Coral Archdragon.name: Coral Archdragon

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Biomineralize.name: Biomineralize
Biomineralize.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by a melee weapon without reach or an unarmed attack that deals slashing or piercing damage

Effect A gout of blood spurts from the dragon's wound and instantaneously calcifies into a jagged branch of sharpened coral. The coral branch impales the triggering creature, dealing @Damage[10d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save). The triggering creature also takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,bleed]] damage on a critical failure. Regardless of the outcome, the coral then crumbles to dust.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Kaleidoscopic Display.name: Kaleidoscopic Display
Kaleidoscopic Display.description:
90 feet. The coral formations covering the dragon's body shimmer with vivid colors, overwhelming the senses. Any creature entering or beginning its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:42] save. Regardless of outcome, the creature is temporarily immune to the dragon's Kaleidoscopic Display for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is blinded for 1 round and dazzled for 1 minute.

Reef Bond.name: Reef Bond
Reef Bond.description:
Every coral dragon is mystically bound to a single living coral reef. If the dragon moves more than 3 miles from their reef, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and unable to recover, with the sickened value increasing by 1 every 6 hours unless they succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:46] save. After 24 hours, the dragon becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}; their drained value increases by 1 every 24 hours.

If the dragon's reef suffers significant physical damage, they immediately become aware of the location where the reef was harmed, but not the source or nature of the damage. Should the reef ever be completely destroyed, the dragon is immediately slain.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Hydraulic Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Hydraulic Breath.name: Hydraulic Breath
Hydraulic Breath.description: The dragon exhales a pressurized jet of water that deals @Damage[22d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage in an @Template[type:line|distance:140] (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save).
