Creatures that critically fail their Reflex save against the Hydraulic Breath are pushed back 10 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The dragon can't use Hydraulic Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hydraulic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Reef Armor.name: Reef Armor
Reef Armor.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon encases themself in an shell of protective coral, gaining 80 temporary Hit Points and resistance 15 to piercing and slashing damage until the temporary Hit Points are depleted. The effect lasts for 1 minute, until destroyed, or until the dragon Dismisses the effect.

Reef Meld.name: Reef Meld
Reef Meld.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The coral dragon is in physical contact with their bound reef

Effect The dragon physically merges with the reef and vanishes, along with up to 12 willing creatures, into an extradimensional space where it can neither affect nor be affected by the outside world. The effect lasts indefinitely or until the dragon Dismisses it. Once merged, the dragon can spend 1 minute traveling to and emerging from any point on its reef up to 10 mile away.

Coral Archdragon.publicNotes: Coral dragons are the primal guardians of the vast living coral reefs found in oceans across Golarion. Even by draconic standards, coral dragons stand out for their arrogance and vanity, boasting inordinate pride in the vibrant hues of their own coral-encrusted scales and the dazzling splendor of the reefs they protect. Coral dragons like to decorate their reefs, which they view as lairs, with objects of beauty, dotted with the occasional bit of valuables like coins. Those who seek the favor of a coral dragon often find the creature easily swayed by flattery, particularly when paired with shiny or brightly colored gifts that complement the scintillating beauty of the dragon and their underwater domain.

Bog Dragon (Young).name: Bog Dragon (Young)
Bog Dragon (Young).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Bog Rot.name: Bog Rot
Bog Rot.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[acid]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage, clumsy 1, and a –5-foot status penalty to Speed (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[5d6[acid]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and a –10-foot status penalty to Speed (1 day)

Stage 5 death

Swamp Passage.name: Swamp Passage
Swamp Passage.description: The bog dragon ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Tail Lash.name: Tail Lash
Tail Lash.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail makes a Strike or attempts a skill check as part of an attack action

Effect The dragon Strikes with their tail at the triggering creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash}

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Nidorous Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Nidorous Breath.name: Nidorous Breath
Nidorous Breath.description: The dragon belches a boiling spray of fermenting stomach acid that deals @Damage[6d8[acid]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save). They can't use Nidorous Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Nidorous Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Bog Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
The bogs of Golarion are timeless places, unyielding against the encroachment of civilization and greedily hoarding the dead of epochs long past within the murky depths of the morass. Thus, it doesn't take a bard to note that a bog dragon represents the most primal embodiment of their namesake. These dragons are as calm as the brackish waters, as perfectly patient as any crocodile mistaken for debris, and as ancient as any fear held of the realms they dwell within. To the many cultures they've stalked since the first humanoids dared to build their dwellings near brackish fens, a bog dragon is a terror consigned to the nebulous realm of monster and abomination. Though most have been relegated to the stuff of legends and the mythic nightmares of river valley city-states, bog dragons are still out there, lurking beneath the loam.

Bog dragons haunt the parables of old, their primal characteristics a raw expression of a primeval world that rebukes the tyranny of time's progression. Their bodies are those of a belly-dragging thing, corpulent and richly shielded by a scabrous hide of spurs and spines. Their claws, much like their wings, are feeble things, vestiges of a more graceful draconic concept that only the eldest bog archdragon might attain. Their faces are masks of terror; their lips curl back in a snarl to expose brutish grins of dagger-like fangs, pock-marked by vicious stomach acids that give their latent breath the malodorous turpitude that stings the senses almost unto dizziness. They're every inch a night-going monstrosity, a harrowing horror that would drive terror into any who behold them, the pinnacle of marsh-born predators.

Regent's Glower.name: Regent's Glower
Regent's Glower.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon focuses their weighty gaze upon their assailant, filling their foe with dread. The triggering creature takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:26|basic] save. Any creature who fails the save also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

Benthic Bite.name: Benthic Bite
Benthic Bite.description: A creature who takes damage from a brine dragon's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round.

Crushing Breath.name: Crushing Breath
Crushing Breath.description: The dragon spews a @Template[type:line|distance:50] of pressurized water that deals @Damage[8d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save. A creature that fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. The dragon can't use Crushing Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Crushing Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Pressurized Pool.name: Pressurized Pool
Pressurized Pool.description: The dragon expels a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] of pressurized water within 120 feet that lasts for 1 minute. A creature other than a brine dragon that enters or begins their turn within a burst must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or become encumbered until the beginning of their next turn.

Aquatic Echolocation.name: Aquatic Echolocation
Aquatic Echolocation.description: A brine dragon can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal

Brine Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Brine Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Brine Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Sea Dragon (Ancient).name: 古海龙 Sea Dragon (Ancient)

Fed by Metal.name: 由金而生 Fed by Metal
Fed by Metal.description:
当海龙被具有金特征的法术或生物的无武装打击，或金属武器伤害时，其鳞片会发生变化，这会赋予他在AC上+1物品加值直到其下个回合开始。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.OMJnZspk5YHai8yn]

Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 水波感知（模糊）60尺 Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Earth.name: 为土所克 Countered by Earth
Countered by Earth.description: 如果海龙成为具有土特征的法术的目标，液化将会结束，他不能使用之直到其下个回合结束。

Liquefy.name: 液化 Liquefy
Liquefy.description:
触发 龙受到火焰伤害

效果 龙瞬间变成水同时维持其形状。他获得火焰伤害抗力20（包括对抗触发效果时），直到其下个回合结束。

Vortex.name: 涡流 Vortex
Vortex.description: 60尺。灵光范围内，与龙处于同一水体的水对于没有水特征的生物游泳时来说视作困难地形。

Black Water Breath.description: 龙向60尺内射出一个对@Template[burst|distance:30]范围造成@Damage[18d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害的水球（@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。半径内所有非魔法火焰会被熄灭。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4轮}内再次使用黑水吐息。
Black Water Breath.name: 黑水吐息 Black Water Breath

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和尾扫打击，每次对抗相同目标。如果任意一次打击命中，龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]目标。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当龙在一次打击中造成重击时，它充能其黑水吐息。

Hyponatremia.name: 低血钠症 Hyponatremia
Hyponatremia.description: 一个受到来自海龙颚咬打击伤害的活物必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:38]豁免，否则会因为体内激增的水量而陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}。

Tidal Wave.name: 潮涌 Tidal Wave
Tidal Wave.description:
频率 每10分钟一次

效果 龙拍打自己的身体，向外发出一道滔天巨浪。这道波浪对@Template[type:emanation|distance:90]范围造成@Damage[10d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害。区域内每个生物必须尝试一次@Check[reflex|dc:38]豁免。区域内的构造物和无主物体无需豁免承受全额伤害。

大成功 该生物不受伤害但被推离龙30尺。

成功 该生物受到一半伤害并被推离龙60尺。

失败 该生物受到全额伤害并被推离龙120尺，并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

大失败 同失败但受到双倍伤害。

Sea Dragon (Ancient).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值
Sea Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
海帝龙与水元素相连，掌管着雨水、风暴、江河与海洋。他们栖息于天夏文明的附近，随时准备协助凡间事务以证明自身价值。对某些海龙而言，在天气与奥术知识方面提供帮助是职责所在。对另一些则不过是获取珍贵贡品或美味佳肴的动机。前来求见者皆热切献礼，因传说海龙欢愉时，雨水便会柔和丰沛。反之，若他们愤怒时，风暴将肆虐无情。

尽管天夏人普遍如此认为，但文明绝非受制于海龙的摆布，因为大多数海龙都是王国的臣子，宣誓协助凡人。绝大多数海龙都是四海龙王之一的臣子，这些龙王的领地或联合王国分别坐落于因拜罗洋（Embaral Ocean），象牙海（Ivory Sea），御海洋（Okaiyo Ocean），颂寂海（Songil Sea）。鉴于水元素位面本无原生海龙，有理论认为这些王国可能是从无际之海（Boundless Sea）大规模迁徙的残余势力。海龙自身的传说记载，远古之王曾为逃避元素领主凯利赞德里的迫害而立下誓言。尽管尚不确定咸水帝王是否仍在追杀海龙，但多数海龙仍恪守誓约作为其文化传承，或为纪念先祖荣光。

Gales of Laughter.name: Gales of Laughter
Gales of Laughter.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The dragon surrounds a creature within 90 feet with cacophonous laughter, deafening it for 1 round and causing @Damage[10d4[persistent,mental]] damage unless it succeeds on a @Check[will|dc:42] save.

Graceless Domain.name: Graceless Domain
Graceless Domain.description:
90 feet. A creature who enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:42] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the graceless domain aura for 1 minute. The dragon can exclude creatures from this aura.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success For 1 round, the first time the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Failure For 1 minute, the first time each round the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Critical Failure For 1 minute, every time the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of any Tiny, Small, Medium, Large, or Huge animal, beast, or humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Hilarious Exhalation.name: Hilarious Exhalation
Hilarious Exhalation.description:
The dragon unleashes their breath in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Hilarious Exhalation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hilarious Exhalation]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Laughing Gas (emotion, mental) The dragon breaths a cloud of mood-altering gas in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. This has the effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlSE7Ly8vi1Dgddv]{Laughing Fit} (@Check[will|dc:42|traits:emotion,mental]) with a duration of 1 round.

  • Slippery Puddle The dragon expels a glob of viscous goo at a solid surface at a range of 60 feet. This creates a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] with the area effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} (@Check[reflex|dc:42]).

Humiliating Mark.name: Humiliating Mark
Humiliating Mark.description: On a critical hit, the dragon's claws inflict @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse} on the target as if they had rolled a success.

Improved Vex.name: Improved Vex
Improved Vex.description:
Requirements The dragon's last action was a successful tail Strike

Effect The mocking dragon attempts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.5eNKs6738aykAhK2]{Dirty Trick} against the target of their tail Strike. This attempt neither applies nor counts toward the creature's multiple attack penalty.

Insistent Heckling.name: Insistent Heckling
Insistent Heckling.description:
The dragon can [[/act demoralize]] targets within 90 feet. Targets become immune to the mocking dragon's attempts to Demoralize them for 1 minute after each attempt.

Creatures Demoralized by the ancient mocking dragon are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} while they are frightened.

Jeer at Failure.name: Jeer at Failure
Jeer at Failure.description:
Trigger A foe within 90 feet becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} or critically fails on a Strike

Effect The mocking dragon laughs dismissively at the foe, attempting an Intimidation check to [[/act demoralize]] the creature. They do not take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand their language.

Force Pulse.name: Force Pulse
Force Pulse.description:
1 to 3

The dragon emits pulses of energy that radiates outward in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15], dealing @Damage[(2d6+2)[force]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save).

For each action spent, a new pulse of energy is created and each subsequent pulse after the first is 5 feet larger than the previous one.

Ironsense.name: Ironsense
Ironsense.description: The dragon can detect the presence of iron and other ferrous metals as a precise sense at the listed range.

Arcane Whirlwind.name: Arcane Whirlwind
Arcane Whirlwind.description:
15 feet.

A vortex of fist-sized balls of pure magic swirls around the dragon. Air within the emanation is difficult terrain for Flying creatures other than the dragon. A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn within the aura takes @Damage[6d6[force]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save).

Shrapnel Splash.name: Shrapnel Splash
Shrapnel Splash.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee weapon or unarmed attack

Effect The dragon's blood forms into hard spheres as it erupts from the wound, battering the attacker. The creature who dealt the triggering damage takes @Damage[7d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save.

Pushing Pulse.name: Pushing Pulse
Pushing Pulse.description: The barrage dragon performs a 2-action Force Pulse. Each creature who fails its save is pushed 5 feet away from the dragon (10 feet on a critical failure).

Scattershot.name: Scattershot
Scattershot.description: The dragon exhales a cloud of small balls of pure energy that deal @Damage[(7d4+7)[force]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] with no save. The dragon can't use Scattershot again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Scattershot]]{1d4 rounds}.

Barrage Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Barrage Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Barrage Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
To the uninitiated, spellcasting is an art for those with iron wills, people who reach out and grab hold of the fundamental laws of the universe and bend them to their whim. It takes discipline, study, and above all else, it takes control. Fail to control the very building blocks of reality and everything could fall apart.

Those who have even dabbled in the arcane arts know that this is nonsense. Magic is chaos, and channeling arcane forces is less akin to exerting one's will over the world and more like surfing on a bolt of lightning through a world-shaking storm and hoping to steer it without falling off. Spellcasting is barely contained panic, a lance of adrenaline, the constant danger of burning oneself out of existence. And the more powerful someone becomes, the more real this danger is.

Mist Step.name: Mist Step
Mist Step.description:
Requirements The dragon is within a cloud of dragonmist

Effect The dragon dissolves into wisps of cloud, reforming within another cloud of dragonmist within 1 mile.

Shapes in the Fog.name: Shapes in the Fog
Shapes in the Fog.description: With a cloud dragon's mastery of their element, creating shapes and images in a fog is child's play. All creatures within or adjacent to one cloud of dragonmist must attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round (on a critical failure, they are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}).

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Mist Vision.name: Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: Fog and mist don't impair a cloud dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from fog and mist.

Master of Clouds.name: Master of Clouds
Master of Clouds.description:
Trigger The dragon rolls initiative

Effect A cloud dragon controls their element as easily as they breathe. The dragon uses Dragonmist twice.

Dragonmist.name: Dragonmist
Dragonmist.description: The dragon conjures up a sudden mist in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 120 feet. All creatures within the mist become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the mist become concealed to creatures within it. The dragon can use this action again to dismiss the mist—anyone else attempting to remove the dragonmist (via gust of wind or similar) must succeed at a counteract check. An ancient dragon can have up to five clouds of dragonmist active at a time.

Thundercloud Breath.name: Thundercloud Breath
Thundercloud Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a thundercloud that deals @Damage[20d6[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic] save). They can't use Thundercloud Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Thundercloud Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

The cloud remains in the area for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, with the effects of Dragonmist.

Cloud Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Cloud Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Cloud Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Rise Up.name: Rise Up
Rise Up.description:
Trigger A creature walks on top of an ancient bog dragon who is burrowed into the mud or peat below

Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled

Effect The bog dragon automatically notices the creature and Burrows before rolling initiative.

Tail Lash.name: Tail Lash
Tail Lash.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail makes a Strike or attempts a skill check as part of an attack action

Effect The dragon Strikes with their tail at the triggering creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash}

Slain to Serve.name: Slain to Serve
Slain to Serve.description:
A bog dragon can perform a special ritual over the body of a humanoid creature slain by bog rot to raise it as a humanoid intelligent undead.

This functions like a 10th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.c3b6LdLlQDPngNIb]{Create Undead} ritual, except that it takes only 8 hours, the bog dragon doesn't require any secondary casters, and they don't need to pay a cost.

If the bog dragon critically fails the ritual's skill check, they get a failure instead.

Bog Rot.name: Bog Rot
Bog Rot.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[acid]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage, clumsy 1, and a –5-foot status penalty to Speed (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[5d6[acid]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and a –10-foot status penalty to Speed (1 day)

Stage 5 death

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Nidorous Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Drag Beneath the Muck.name: Drag Beneath the Muck
Drag Beneath the Muck.description:
Requirements The bog archdragon is in a swamp and doesn't have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in their jaws

Effect The dragon Burrows, and if they end their movement directly under a creature, they make a jaws Strike against that creature, who is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the attack.

If the Strike is successful, the dragon makes an Athletics check to grapple the target with their jaws; like Grab, this check doesn't use or contribute to the archdragon's multiple attack penalty.

The dragon then Burrows again; any creature they have grabbed or restrained in their jaws moves with them.

Nidorous Breath.name: Nidorous Breath
Nidorous Breath.description: The dragon belches a boiling spray of fermenting stomach acid that deals @Damage[14d8[acid]|options:area-damage] damage and @Damage[2d6[persistent,acid]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic] save). They can't use Nidorous Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Nidorous Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Swamp Passage.name: Swamp Passage
Swamp Passage.description: The bog dragon ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

Bog Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Bog Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Bog Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
The bogs of Golarion are timeless places, unyielding against the encroachment of civilization and greedily hoarding the dead of epochs long past within the murky depths of the morass. Thus, it doesn't take a bard to note that a bog dragon represents the most primal embodiment of their namesake. These dragons are as calm as the brackish waters, as perfectly patient as any crocodile mistaken for debris, and as ancient as any fear held of the realms they dwell within. To the many cultures they've stalked since the first humanoids dared to build their dwellings near brackish fens, a bog dragon is a terror consigned to the nebulous realm of monster and abomination. Though most have been relegated to the stuff of legends and the mythic nightmares of river valley city-states, bog dragons are still out there, lurking beneath the loam.

Bog dragons haunt the parables of old, their primal characteristics a raw expression of a primeval world that rebukes the tyranny of time's progression. Their bodies are those of a belly-dragging thing, corpulent and richly shielded by a scabrous hide of spurs and spines. Their claws, much like their wings, are feeble things, vestiges of a more graceful draconic concept that only the eldest bog archdragon might attain. Their faces are masks of terror; their lips curl back in a snarl to expose brutish grins of dagger-like fangs, pock-marked by vicious stomach acids that give their latent breath the malodorous turpitude that stings the senses almost unto dizziness. They're every inch a night-going monstrosity, a harrowing horror that would drive terror into any who behold them, the pinnacle of marsh-born predators.
Bog Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Immortal.name: Immortal
Immortal.description: Time dragons age, but don't die from old age.

Decelerating Dodge.name: Decelerating Dodge
Decelerating Dodge.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with a ranged Strike or spell attack

Effect The dragon slows time to evade, gaining concealment against the triggering attack.

Starflight.name: Starflight
Starflight.description: A time dragon can survive in outer space and fly at incredible speed, taking [[/r 3d20]] hours to reach a destination within the same solar system or [[/r 3d20]] days for destinations beyond. They can carry up to six passengers of at least one size category smaller than themself, protecting them from the void of space.

Timeshift Breath.name: Timeshift Breath
Timeshift Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a blast of temporal energy, warping time in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save. The dragon can't use Timeshift Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Timeshift Breath]]{1d4 rounds}. Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature shifts briefly forward in time, vanishing and reappearing at the beginning of the time dragon's next turn in the same location (or an adjacent space if their former location is occupied), unaware that any time has passed. While timeshifted, time pauses for that creature, and it cannot take actions or be affected by anything else.

Time Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Time Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Time Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Some time dragons would say time is a deep well, with those who explore it dipping cups into the waters at varying depths. Others might say that time is a shattered mirror, each shard reflecting discrete points that can be viewed simultaneously. None would say time is a firm onward march of linear progress, moving inexorably to a predetermined result. Time is fluid and ever-shifting, and time dragons dedicate themselves to protecting its flow.

Although safeguarding the natural temporal order is a mission all time dragons devote themselves to, they go about it in different ways. Staunch traditionalists oppose any meddling with the timestream whatsoever, even to repair damage caused by prior attempts to influence it, viewing this as doing more harm than good. They believe mortals are too short-sighted to responsibly use time magic and might appear without warning to slay those they believe pose a threat to the timestream. Other time dragons attempt to guide the course of events along the path they believe correct while preventing external tampering, often focusing on particular regions, areas of interest, or even individuals

Delight Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Delight Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)

Reactive Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon attempts an Athletics check to [[/act trip]] the triggering creature. This check doesn't count toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this check.
Reactive Tail.name: Reactive Tail

Breath of Fresh Air.name: Breath of Fresh Air
Breath of Fresh Air.description: The dragon unleashes a stream of magical bubbles in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Each creature within the area takes @Damage[7d8[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:29|basic] save). A creature who fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as they give in to the joyful urge to dance, sing, laugh, or admire the world around them. On a critical failure, the creature is slowed 1 for 1 minute and can't use reactions for as long as they are slowed; they can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turn to end the slowed condition early.

Lover of the Arts.name: Lover of the Arts
Lover of the Arts.description: Checks by or against the dragon to change a creature's attitude using Diplomacy can be attempted with Performance instead.

Whimsysense.name: Whimsysense
Whimsysense.description: Delight dragons can sense the presence of laughter, games, celebrations, and sweets within the listed range.

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine

Play Scape.name: Play Scape
Play Scape.description:
15 feet. Delight dragon magic alters their surroundings, turning weapons into toys and spells into stage effects. All Strikes and other damaging effects used in the aura gain the nonlethal trait and are accompanied by magical sound effects. A creature entering or beginning their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save.

Failure The creature's first damaging effect (such as a Strike) this round does half damage.

Critical Failure All the creature's damaging effects this turn do half damage.

Delight Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine
Delight Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Some would say delight dragons are like children. They would be correct. At least, as correct as if they said a puff of chimney smoke resembled a massive storm cloud or compared a toddler's drawing of a horse to a prized thoroughbred. Which is to say, they are completely and utterly incorrect. Of course, having a smoke cloud or child's drawing running around one's home might be vastly preferable to a delight dragon.

As residents of the Outer Plane Elysium, delight dragons are embodiments of the plane's proclivity toward joy, mischief, passion, and spontaneity. Their massive gossamer wings refract the light of a thousand rainbows between translucent layers. Purple-green scales shimmer in opalescent splendor, while a long, sinuous tail flicks in spiral figures, darting to catch the feet out from under distracted observers. A pair of feathery antennae direct the delight dragon to their next source of amusement—whether play, treat, or general amusement, all surely to become a great time in the dragon's presence, whether a plane's denizens know it or not.

As self-proclaimed defenders of games, whimsy, and the freedom to sow a little chaos, delight dragons are often found on the front line against those that would strip such choice away from others. Demonic forces deployed at the Worldwound whispered of the "lights of doom," massive rainbows that heralded the approach of a delight dragon. The winged crusader would descend upon these fiends with claws and fangs, cackling all the while.

Sweltering Heat.name: Sweltering Heat
Sweltering Heat.description: 10 feet. Each creature that ends its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} while it remains in the aura.

Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair an underworld dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.
Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Water.name: Countered by Water
Countered by Water.description:
If the underworld dragon takes damage from a spell with the cold or water trait, the elemental magic of fire within them is momentarily dampened. Until the end of their next turn, they take a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, and their jaws Strikes don't deal fire damage. This limitation ends if the dragon uses Exploding Red Breath.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.81XYZZ3H0GL8thdQ]{Effect: Countered by Water}

Fed by Wood.name: Fed by Wood
Fed by Wood.description:
When an underworld dragon is struck by a weapon made primarily of wood or affected by a spell with the plant or wood trait, the dragon’s internal fiery essences are stoked with the added fuel. Their Exploding Red Breath recharges, and the fire damage from the dragon’s jaws deals an additional die of damage until the end of the dragon’s next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4FMFRlEC923CnLI7]{Effect: Fed by Wood}

Scorch Earth.name: Scorch Earth
Scorch Earth.description: The dragon plunges their body into the ground, Burrows up to their burrow Speed, and then scorches the land within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]. Creatures underground or on the surface in the area take @Damage[10d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save). A creature that critically fails also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute.

Adamantine Claws.name: Adamantine Claws
Adamantine Claws.description:
Frequency one per hour

Effect The dragon infuses their body with adamantine. For the next minute, their melee Strikes are treated as adamantine and ignore half the Hardness of any object hit.

Exploding Red Breath.name: Exploding Red Breath
Exploding Red Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of fire that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:40] within 75 feet, dealing @Damage[22d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[4d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage] damage. The dragon can't use Exploding Red Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Exploding Red Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Volcanic Fumes.name: Volcanic Fumes
Volcanic Fumes.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Toxic smoke erupts from the dragon in a 30-feet emanation. All creatures within the area take @Damage[6d12[fire]] damage and @Damage[6d12[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save). The dragon can Sustain the emanation, and any creature that ends their turn in the area without holding their breath takes @Damage[6d12[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save); this is an inhaled poison effect.

Underworld Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Underworld Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Underworld Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
If there are any imperial dragons who benefited from moving out of their native elemental plane, it's underworld dragons. Once related solely to the element of fire, early underworld dragons harnessed elemental forces through arcane means for reasons no longer remembered. With each subsequent generation, both their arcane power and mastery over the elements grew. Their efforts were later bolstered by their studies in alchemy, which allowed dragons to cultivate themselves even further with various mutagens and elixirs.

Today, though their nature is primarily still connected with the element of fire, an underworld dragon can consume wood with ease, threaten entire regions with quakes, lay claim to the minerals and gems in the rocks and stone, and die to form volcanoes that create more land masses. Some even flippantly snort at the lapping waves of the sea, not fearing any retaliation from the sea dragon nations nor their kings. Though their powers might be relatively weaker than another imperial dragon of the same age, their mastery of many elements and the arcane arts makes underworld dragons formidable opponents.

Sanctified Sight.name: 祝圣视觉 Sanctified Sight
Sanctified Sight.description: 君龙能够自动侦测出一个生物，效果或物品是否受祝，以及其为圣洁还是邪秽。

Sovereign's Rebuke.name: 君王训诫 Sovereign's Rebuke
Sovereign's Rebuke.description: 君龙释放一道充满精神能量的吼叫，对@Template[type:cone|distance:50]范围造成@Damage[21d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:42|basic]豁免）。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sovereign's Rebuke]]{1d4轮}内再次使用君王训诫。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Mentalist Counterspell.name: 反制心灵法术 Mentalist Counterspell
Mentalist Counterspell.description:
触发 君龙成为他能意识到的心灵法术的目标

效果 君龙立即尝试反制触发效果（反制调整值[[/r 1d20+32 #Counteract]]{+32}，反制环级10环级）。

Violent Retort.name: 以牙还牙 Violent Retort
Violent Retort.description:
触发 一个君龙触及范围内的生物对龙造成了重击

效果 在应用了对龙的所有重击效果之后，君龙对该生物进行一次爪抓或尾扫打击。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
君龙可以变为任意大型或更小体型类人生物的外貌。这不会改变其速度或打击的攻击和伤害加值，但可能会改变其打击造成的伤害类型（通常为钝击）。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Gleaming Armor.name: 耀目宝甲 Gleaming Armor
Gleaming Armor.description:
频率 每小时一次

效果 君龙的护甲散发出金光。君龙在AC上获得+2状态加值，并获得对酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰和音波伤害的20点抗力。@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]范围内每个敌人都必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:42]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]。所有这些效果持续到龙的下个回合结束。

Inspire Envoy.name: 激励特使 Inspire Envoy
Inspire Envoy.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 君龙选择一名凡人并赐予其威严的祝福，以换取该生物去完成一项特殊指令，例如击败暴君或保护圣地。如果该生物同意，直到其下次每日准备，它在由龙选择的以下一项上获得+2状态加值：攻击骰，AC，或以下全部：察觉，意志豁免和基于魅力的技能检定。龙可以解消此增益，如果凡人胆敢违抗龙的指令，他就会迅速这么做。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.YDJnC3Bdc2GI6hX5]

Sovereign Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: 古君龙施法者 Sovereign Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Sovereign Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
据说曾有纯粹的土元素龙类存在。这些帝龙如同其他元素龙一样来到物质宇宙，生老病死，其躯体最终化作大陆的一部分。正如火元素化作熔岩，木元素化作森林，水元素汇成海洋湖泊，金元素化作珍贵矿脉，土元素终成大地、岩石与山岳。依循逻辑推演，若当今世间尚存此类环境与存在，那么土元素龙必然存在。抑或曾在远古时代存在过。

然而如今帝龙之中，唯有君龙在死亡时会留下蛇形骸骨，而非岩石、石块或泥土。龙的内在施法能力，对未加热铁器的弱点等特征，强烈暗示它们与元素之土存在关联。其余能力则几乎与土元素无关，反而聚焦于玄学上的精魂与心灵的奥秘。

关于君龙为何演变至此，尚无明确解释。有人推测这或许是某种为实现个人野心的交易，他们从选拔统治者的角色变为了统治者本身。也有人猜测天夏大地曾在过去遭受腐化，土元素龙为自保而背弃了元素本性。或许它们也曾化作圣天龙，却因凡间未现合格统治者而重返尘世。

Magma Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Magma Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Magma Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Wing Deflection.name: Wing Deflection
Wing Deflection.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises a wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is Flying, they descend 10 feet after the attack.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Magma Burrow.name: Magma Burrow
Magma Burrow.description: A magma dragon's burrow Speed functions only when the dragon is Burrowing through magma or molten lava.

Pyroclastic Breath.name: Pyroclastic Breath
Pyroclastic Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of magma that deals @Damage[5d6[fire],3d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|basic|dc:28|options:area-effect]). They can't use Pyroclastic Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4#Recharge Pyroclastic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}

Echolocation.name: Echolocation
Echolocation.description: A wailing dragon can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Resounding Roar whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and Sonic

Destructive Interference.name: Destructive Interference
Destructive Interference.description:
Trigger A foe within 90 feet uses an auditory or sonic effect

Effect The young wailing dragon releases a burst of noise, attempting to drown out the triggering sound. It makes a counteract check against the effect (counteract rank 5, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+21 #Counteract]]{+21}).

Subsonic Drone.name: Subsonic Drone
Subsonic Drone.description:
90 feet, A creature who enters or begins their turn in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's subsonic drone for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Eerie Call.name: Eerie Call
Eerie Call.description:
Requirements The dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or undetected

Effect The dragon's wail draws in unsuspecting opponents. Anyone that can hear the Eerie Call must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the sound. A fascinated creature must spend at least 1 action Seeking the dragon each turn, and the dragon can Sustain this affect for up to 1 minute

Natural Mimic.name: Natural Mimic
Natural Mimic.description: The dragon can imitate any sound or voice that it has heard. This has the effect of 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.yV7Ouzaoe7DHLESI]{Ventriloquism} (DC 29) but is a nonmagical effect.

Resounding Roar.name: Resounding Roar
Resounding Roar.description:
The dragon unleashes a thunderous call that deals @Damage[11d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic] save). On a critical failure, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute.

In addition, if the area overlaps with an area of magical silence or includes a creature affected by magical silence, the roar attempts to counteract the silence effect (counteract rank 5, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+21 #Counteract]]{+21}).

The dragon can't use Resounding Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Resounding Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

Wailing Dragon (Adult).name: Wailing Dragon (Adult)
Wailing Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
Canny, patient, and creative, wailing dragons are adepts of sound and psychology. With both their physiology and innate connection to arcane magic allowing them to produce and shape sound waves, these reclusive creatures are heard much more often than seen. Named for their tendency to use uncanny keening vocalizations to communicate across long distances and startle prey, wailing dragons haunt locations that create interesting or useful echoes, such as canyons or caverns. Though ruthless predators when needed, most wailing dragons devote their energy toward investigating the effects sound has on the environment and the bodies and minds of creatures.

Minstrels, divas, and tunesmiths seek out these creatures during their mating season, when two dragons sing courtship ballads full of intricate harmonies. While this might be the performance of a lifetime, it's a dangerous concert, as incautious audience members frequently become meals for the nuptial couple. (The famous Chelaxian composer, Gretezi Valtros, disappeared on such an expedition in 4275 ar, after he set out to teach a wailing dragon High Azlanti and "instruct it in the decorous art of opera.") Most creatures also find the close-range subsonic vibrations emitted by wailing dragons extremely uncomfortable, reinforcing the idea that it's best to observe them from a distance.

Diabolic Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair the dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Hell's Sting.name: Hell's Sting
Hell's Sting.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon channels the rancor of Hell back through the body of their foe, overwhelming it with an infernal assault on the mind. The triggering creature takes @Damage[12d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:46|basic] save. Holy creatures use an outcome one degree of success worse than they roll on their saving throw.

Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
Hellfire Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a blast of infernal fire that deals @Damage[24d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:70] (@Check[reflex|dc:48|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The dragon can't use Hellfire Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hellfire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Diabolic Fire.name: Diabolic Fire
Diabolic Fire.description: Any fire damage that a diabolic dragon deals, including fire damage from spells, is imbued with the unholy power of Hell to scorch the spirit as well. A creature takes spirit damage instead of fire damage if that would be more detrimental to the creature (as determined by the GM). A diabolic dragon is immune to the diabolic fire of other diabolic dragons, the fire from divine immolation, and similar effects.

Diabolic Impalement.name: Diabolic Impalement
Diabolic Impalement.description:
Requirements The dragon has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its claw and doesn't already have a creature impaled

Effect The dragon attempts an Athletics check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the dragon drives the creature through the bony protrusion on their chest, dealing @Damage[7d10[piercing]] damage (doubled on a critical success). The creature is grabbed while on the protrusion and can attempt to Escape as normal. The dragon's claws become free to Grab other creatures, and the dragon doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the impaled creature grabbed. If the dragon moves, they bring the grabbed creature along with them.

An impaled creature takes @Damage[2d10[spirit]] damage at the end of each of its turns, as the bone drives itself deeper to pierce the creature's soul. If the creature dies from this spirit damage, its soul becomes condemned to Hell. A creature condemned to Hell in this way can't be resurrected except by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual, divine intervention, or reclaiming the soul from Hell.

Diabolic Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Diabolic Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Diabolic Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Hell, according to some theologians, is a living entity in and of itself. Diabolic dragons, these scholars argue, are just extensions of the plane, living creatures that break off from Hell to enact its will. Whether this is true or whether diabolical dragons are simply the reborn souls of dragons sent to Hell, the fact remains that these dragons are powerful, cunning, and tyrannical. Every diabolic dragon's goal is to further Hell's will, though how this happens can vary. Regardless of their goals, these dragons always approach newcomers with an unsettling calmness.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.

Vorpal Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Vorpal Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)

Vorpal Binding.name: Vorpal Binding
Vorpal Binding.description:
The vorpal dragon beheads its foes—sometimes without killing them. A vorpal dragon's chin blade Strikes count as having the vorpal weapon property rune for the purpose of weaknesses. Whenever the vorpal dragon critically succeeds on a chin blade Strike, it deals an additional @Damage[4d6[persistent,bleed]] damage, which can be ended normally.

When a vorpal dragon rolls a natural 20 on a chin blade Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save; this has the incapacitation trait. On a failure, the creature is beheaded. A creature beheaded this way does not automatically die; instead, their head and body live on, disconnected but mystically linked, with the head controlling the body from afar. A beheaded creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} as they attempt to coordinate movements from an unusual perspective, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 4} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} if their head can't perceive their body from its location. These conditions are suppressed if the body holds its head, and don't apply to actions performed exclusively by the head, mind, or voice. If the body is killed, the head can live on, but destroying the head kills the body as well. This effect can be ended only by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2Vkd1IxylPceUAAF]{Regenerate}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Hnc7eGi7vyZenAIm]{Breath of Life}, or any effect that restores life to the dead; only effects that restore an incomplete corpse will replace an absent or destroyed body, however. The dragon can choose to instantly kill a creature when beheading them, as per the vorpal weapon property rune's activation.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Cutting Rebuke.name: Cutting Rebuke
Cutting Rebuke.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's chin blade that the dragon can see makes a Strike against the dragon

Effect The dragon makes a chin blade Strike against the triggering creature.

Feast of Blood.name: Feast of Blood
Feast of Blood.description: The dragon inhales sharply, pulling blood from wounds and into the dragon's maw. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] takes their current persistent bleed damage plus @Damage[14d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:40|basic] save). The dragon gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the greatest amount of void damage dealt to a single creature this way. The dragon can't use Feast of Blood again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Feast of Blood]]{1d4 rounds}.

Gruesome Cuts.name: Gruesome Cuts
Gruesome Cuts.description: Persistent bleed damage inflicted by the dragon, even magically, carries a poison that inhibits clotting. Healing the creature to full HP doesn't end the bleeding, the DC of any flat check to recover is 2 higher, and the DC to stop the bleeding using Administer First Aid is 40. This poison can be counteracted (DC 40), and successfully doing so ends the bleeding.

Heads Will Roll!.name: Heads Will Roll!
Heads Will Roll!.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The vorpal dragon swoops across the battlefield, sweeping their axe-bladed tail through their foes. The dragon Flies twice; at any point during this movement, the dragon makes up to two chin blade Strikes, each against a different creature within reach. The dragon's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until all Strikes are made.

Vorpal Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Vorpal dragons were not created by some ancient divinity nor born of a specific realm or force. Their birth was an arcane accident, the result of unstoppable magic contacting immovable beast. In unknowable ancient ages, the first jabberwock was wrought by the Eldest and the first vorpal sword was wrought in turn to slay the beast. When that very first blade went snicker-snack for the very first time, tasting the primeval lifeblood of the draconic Tane, the first vorpal dragon was born.

Vorpal dragons are most notorious for their keen vorpal magic. Even the least of these dragons can sever a foe's head in a single lucky stroke. Unusually, however, the subject survives as a bipartite creature: a headless body controlled by a detached head that still thinks and speaks, and which can outlive said body's destruction. It's not uncommon for would-be dragonslayers to be sent home carrying their own heads under one arm as a lesson in humility. The unluckier ones, alas, may be kept as trophies—and, in a very literal sense, conversation pieces—while the dragon devours their greater portion. Some might even wear their favorite severed heads as a macabre necklace.

Wish Archdragon.name: Wish Archdragon

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Best Wishes.name: Best Wishes
Best Wishes.description: 40 feet. Being near a wish dragon gives other creatures a greater sense of what they truly wish for, bolstering their sense of purpose while also distracting them from the task at hand. Creatures in the aura take a –1 status penalty to Perception but gain a +2 status bonus to Will saving throws against mental effects. The wish dragon can't gain the benefit of their own aura or other actions that use the aura, and they can choose to exclude any creatures from any benefit of the aura or action that uses the aura.

Destructive Wish.name: Destructive Wish
Destructive Wish.description:
Requirements An illusion from Wish Come True is currently active

Effect The wish dragon Dismisses the illusion of Wish Come True, which shatters into magical fragments, dealing @Damage[10d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:45|basic] save to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:50] of the illusion.

Dying Wish.name: Dying Wish
Dying Wish.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The dragon is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The dragon wishes to survive by any means necessary. The dragon is instead reduced to 1 Hit Point and teleports up to 10 miles away.

Breath of Loss.description: The dragon breathes a warm, gentle breeze of mist that creates the feeling of when deepest desires are achieved. As the breeze dissipates, the feeling of loss overwhelms creatures' senses, dealing @Damage[22d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[will|dc:45] save). A creature that critically fails its save is also consumed with the memory of the moment and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}. The wish dragon can't use Breath of Loss again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath of Loss]]{1d4 rounds}.
Breath of Loss.name: Breath of Loss

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Breath of Loss whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Wished Away.name: Wished Away
Wished Away.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect The dragon wishes not to be hurt by this attack, gaining resistance 25 to all damage against the triggering attack.

Wish Come True.name: Wish Come True
Wish Come True.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon creates an illusion in an unoccupied square within 60 feet that appears to all other creatures that can see it to be the manifestation of their deepest material desire. This has the effects of illusory object (though the illusion might appear to be a creature to certain people) that last for 10 minutes. The wish dragon can Dismiss the illusion. Each non-wish dragon creature who begins their turn within 200 feet in line of sight of the illusion must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45] save. If any creature within reach of the illusion Interacts to touch it, the illusion ends and that creature is invigorated, gaining 3d6 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature disbelieves the illusion and becomes temporarily immune to Wish Come True for 1 hour.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Wish You Would.name: Wish You Would
Wish You Would.description:
Requirements An illusion from Wish Come True is active

Effect The dragon targets one creature within 200 feet currently stupefied by Wish Come True, making them believe that the object of their desires is under attack from all those around them and the dragon is the only one they can trust. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:44] Save or they become controlled by the dragon for 1 minute. The target may attempt a new save at the end of each of their turns. If the illusion from Wish Come True dissipates, their controlled state immediately ends.

Wish Archdragon.publicNotes:
What is a wish? A wish dragon would call it the truest expression of self—each individual wish reveals something of deep importance to the wisher, and no two wishes are ever quite the same. Whether the wish is one of creation or destruction, justice or vengeance, love or hate, wish dragons seek to understand what makes it important to the wisher and view their ability to make it a reality as a gift that helps them make sense of the world.

To a wish dragon, learning what someone wishes for is the beginning of a conversation, granting them that wish is a gift, and watching what they do with it is a reward. They take each part of this journey seriously and spend much of their lives moving among other ancestries to better understand what others want and need, especially during their younger years. While they view this mission as a righteous one, it can become all-consuming, and some have been known to lose all sense of themselves in their quest to bring about the dreams and desires of those around them.

Requiem Archdragon.name: Requiem Archdragon
Requiem Archdragon.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Dooming Breath.description: The raw energy of Creation's Forge streams from the dragon's mouth, dealing @Damage[20d8[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:line|distance:150] (@Check[reflex|dc:48|basic] save). Undead creatures who fail the save must also succeed at a @Check[will|dc:48] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. If the target is already doomed, the doomed value increases by 1 (to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 4}). The dragon can't use Dooming Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dooming Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
Dooming Breath.name: Dooming Breath

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw strikes and one tail strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Dooming Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Soul Journey.name: Soul Journey
Soul Journey.description: The dragon spends 1 hour traveling through planar channels to reach the River of Souls, and then reaches any point along the river. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Interplanar Teleport}, except that the dragon can arrive precisely where they like on any major plane.

Status Sight.name: Status Sight
Status Sight.description: The requiem dragon automatically knows the Hit Points of all creatures they can see.

Soul Anchor.name: Soul Anchor
Soul Anchor.description:
A creature within 60 feet would drop to 0 Hit Points

Effect The dragon anchors the triggering creature's soul to its body. The creature remains at 1 Hit Point, becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, and gains fast healing equal to the dragon's level for 1 minute. The creature becomes temporarily immune to further Soul Anchor usages for 24 hours.

Withhold Death.name: Withhold Death
Withhold Death.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect The dragon resists the loosening of its own soul, preventing some of the damage. The dragon gains resistance 25 to all damage against the triggering attack.

Redirect River.name: Redirect River
Redirect River.description: The requiem dragon redirects a small portion of the River of Souls, using their body as a spiritual connection. The river swells around them, filling the area in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] for 1 round, becoming difficult terrain to all other creatures. Additionally, creatures that begin their turn in the emanation or enter it for the first time each round must succeed a @Check[fortitude|dc:48|basic] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. If the target is already drained or doomed, the value increases by 1 (to a maximum of 4). The dragon can Sustain the effect.

Soul Shield.name: Soul Shield
Soul Shield.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The requiem dragon uses their life essence to create a shield of spiritual energy around a creature within 60 feet. The shield creates a link between the dragon and the creature with the effects of share life except that the effect doesn't end regardless of distance and remains for 1 hour. In addition, the creature gains resistance 15 to physical and spirit damage that applies to the half of damage it receives. The dragon can Dismiss the effect.

Spare the Dying, Free the Tormented.name: Spare the Dying, Free the Tormented
Spare the Dying, Free the Tormented.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The requiem dragon flaps their mighty wings to produce a gust of energy from Creation's Forge. Each dying creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:200] immediately loses the dying condition, though it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} at 0 Hit Points. Each creature with void healing in the same area takes @Damage[16d6[vitality]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:48|basic] save); a creature who is reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage is immediately destroyed and its soul returns to the River of Souls, even if that creature has an ability like rejuvenation. The dragon can choose to exclude as many creatures from this effect as they wish.

Requiem Archdragon.publicNotes: Requiem dragons are stewards of the River of Souls and the process through which souls reach their final destination in the afterlife. The safe journey of a soul is of utmost importance to a requiem dragon, and some will follow individual souls from their first entry into the river through to their judgment in the Boneyard and eventually to their ultimate resting place. Most requiem dragons tie themselves to specific planes and shepherd any souls bound to that plane, leading to dragons linked to places like Heaven or Hell, though these dragons never swear true allegiance to these planes. Requiem dragons fill their lairs along the River of Souls—patchworks of somber architecture rescued from other planes—with invaluable records and mementos of great accomplishments.

Forest Dragon (Ancient).name: 古森龙 Forest Dragon (Ancient)

Coiling Frenzy.description: 森龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，森龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。
Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当森龙在一次打击中造成重击时，他充能其蔚蓝虫群吐息。

Forest Shape.name: 森林形态 Forest Shape
Forest Shape.description: 当施放@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]时，森龙可以变成体型和年龄与他们自身相同的树木，使用其自己的AC。

Lignifying Bite.name: 化木噬咬 Lignifying Bite
Lignifying Bite.description: 当由血肉构成的生物被森龙的颚咬打击削减至0点生命值，该生物必须尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:41]豁免。如果失败，它就会死亡，它的血肉，玄学上视为土属相，将转变为木质。这块木头还是活着的，随着时间推移可能会长成树，但它不能视作尸体或尸体的部分以用作@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG]或其他能使得生物复生的魔法。

Woodland Passage.name: 林地通行 Woodland Passage
Woodland Passage.description: 森龙忽视由非魔法植物和真菌形成的困难地形和高等困难地形，例如灌木，藤蔓和林下植被。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Metal.name: 为金所克 Countered by Metal
Countered by Metal.description: 如果森龙受到来自金属物品或具有金特征效果的伤害，他将失去林地通行和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zlnXpME1T2uvn8Lr]直到其下个回合结束。

Fed by Water.name: 由水而生 Fed by Water
Fed by Water.description:
频率 每小时一次

触发 森龙成为一个水法术或效果的目标

效果 森龙获得50点临时生命值，持续1分钟。

Frightful Presence.name: 恐怖威压 Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description:
90尺，@Check[will|dc:39]。具有动物，真菌和植物特征的生物在豁免时承受-2环境减值。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Azure Swarm Breath.name: 蔚蓝虫群吐息 Azure Swarm Breath
Azure Swarm Breath.description: 森龙放出一群昆虫对@Template[type:cone|distance:60]范围造成@Damage[18d6[piercing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）随后消散开来。豁免大失败的生物受到@Damage[3d6[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage]伤害。森龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Azure Swarm Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用蔚蓝虫群吐息。

Draining Blight.name: 流失枯萎 Draining Blight
Draining Blight.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 森龙从周围的活物身上吸取水分来治愈自己的伤口。@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内的所有活物受到@Damage[10d10[void]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:41|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。完全由水和植物构成的生物使用比掷骰结果更差一级的成功度。森龙恢复等同于对该效果本次造成的所有伤害里最高的伤害数值的一半的生命值。区域内所有非生物植物枯萎死亡，清除所有非魔法灌木和所有因此产生的困难地形，掩蔽和隐蔽。

Forest Dragon (Ancient).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Impending Fate.name: Impending Fate
Impending Fate.description: The dragon's attacks bring their foes closer to their eventual fates. When the dragon critically hits with a Strike or a creature critically fails against the dragon's Destiny Breath, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}, or increases its doomed value by 1 if it was already doomed.

Prophetic Wings.name: Prophetic Wings
Prophetic Wings.description: The dragon or any ally can glimpse into the future in their wings in a process that requires 10 minutes of concentration. This casts a 10th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury} spell, except that the wings can predict results up to 1 day into the future and the dragon always speaks a few cryptic words related to the result of the prediction. The dragon can use their wings in this way only once per hour and a given creature can seek a future in the wings only once per week. In addition, a creature can choose to predict events up to 1 year into the future—the dragon can view a year ahead in their own wings only once per day.

Walk the Timelines.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The dragon splits themself into two versions with different fates. Each copy Strides or Flies from the dragon's current space, then takes a single action. If the actions are both attacks, they use the same multiple attack penalty and count as one attack toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty.

After both actions, the dragon chooses one of the two locations as their actual destination and the other version of themself disappears.
Walk the Timelines.name: Walk the Timelines

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Challenge Fate.name: Challenge Fate
Challenge Fate.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack;

Effect This fate is not set in stone. The attacker rolls the triggering attack twice and uses the worse result.

Untethered to Fate.name: Untethered to Fate
Untethered to Fate.description: The dragon can choose to negate any fortune or misfortune effects that would affect them; other creatures remain affected normally.

Destiny Breath.name: Destiny Breath
Destiny Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a translucent mist of potentialities that overwhelms creatures with visions of possible features, dealing @Damage[19d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:50] (@Check[will|dc:44|options:area-effect] save). A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) as it struggles with the visions.

The dragon can't use Destiny Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Destiny Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Omen Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Omen Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Omen Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Fate is a fickle matter on Golarion. Even with prophecy broken on the world, there are ways to look to the immediate future or acquire a vague sense of long-term events. Omen dragons are bound to see the future—nebulous though it might be—at all times. Visions of the future hound them like a quiet song that never stops playing in their minds. While an omen dragon can focus on or ignore the music of fate at any time, the song plays all the same. At a glance, omen dragons resemble other occult dragons in appearance, save for the mirror-like interior membrane of their wings. An omen dragon's wings offer glimpses into the future. These glimpses are cloudy and vague, but generally correct, if only technically. Omen dragons have a natural compulsion to share the futures they see. These dragons have no compunctions about what the visions show and share their knowledge equally with innocent villagers as they do with wicked tyrants.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Omen Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

Wailing Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Wailing Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)

Natural Mimic.name: Natural Mimic
Natural Mimic.description: The dragon can imitate any sound or voice that it has heard. This has the effect of 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.yV7Ouzaoe7DHLESI]{Ventriloquism} (DC 24) but is a nonmagical effect.

Resounding Roar.name: Resounding Roar
Resounding Roar.description: The dragon unleashes a thunderous call that deals @Damage[7d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic] save). On a critical failure, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute. The dragon can't use Resounding Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Resounding Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

Echolocation.name: Echolocation
Echolocation.description: A wailing dragon can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and Sonic

Destructive Interference.name: Destructive Interference
Destructive Interference.description:
Trigger A foe within 90 feet uses an auditory or sonic effect

Effect The young wailing dragon releases a burst of noise, attempting to drown out the triggering sound. It makes a counteract check against the effect (counteract rank 3, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+16 #Counteract]]{+16}).

Subsonic Drone.name: Subsonic Drone
Subsonic Drone.description:
90 feet, A creature who enters or begins their turn in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's subsonic drone for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

Eerie Call.name: Eerie Call
Eerie Call.description:
Requirements The dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or undetected

Effect The dragon's wail draws in unsuspecting opponents. Anyone that can hear the Eerie Call must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the sound. A fascinated creature must spend at least 1 action Seeking the dragon each turn, and the dragon can Sustain this affect for up to 1 minute

Wailing Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Canny, patient, and creative, wailing dragons are adepts of sound and psychology. With both their physiology and innate connection to arcane magic allowing them to produce and shape sound waves, these reclusive creatures are heard much more often than seen. Named for their tendency to use uncanny keening vocalizations to communicate across long distances and startle prey, wailing dragons haunt locations that create interesting or useful echoes, such as canyons or caverns. Though ruthless predators when needed, most wailing dragons devote their energy toward investigating the effects sound has on the environment and the bodies and minds of creatures.

Minstrels, divas, and tunesmiths seek out these creatures during their mating season, when two dragons sing courtship ballads full of intricate harmonies. While this might be the performance of a lifetime, it's a dangerous concert, as incautious audience members frequently become meals for the nuptial couple. (The famous Chelaxian composer, Gretezi Valtros, disappeared on such an expedition in 4275 ar, after he set out to teach a wailing dragon High Azlanti and "instruct it in the decorous art of opera.") Most creatures also find the close-range subsonic vibrations emitted by wailing dragons extremely uncomfortable, reinforcing the idea that it's best to observe them from a distance.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair an underworld dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Water.name: Countered by Water
Countered by Water.description:
If the underworld dragon takes damage from a spell with the cold or water trait, the elemental magic of fire within them is momentarily dampened. Until the end of their next turn, they take a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, and their jaws Strikes don't deal fire damage. This limitation ends if the dragon uses Exploding Red Breath.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.81XYZZ3H0GL8thdQ]{Effect: Countered by Water}

Fed by Wood.name: Fed by Wood
Fed by Wood.description:
When an underworld dragon is struck by a weapon made primarily of wood or affected by a spell with the plant or wood trait, the dragon’s internal fiery essences are stoked with the added fuel. Their Exploding Red Breath recharges, and the fire damage from the dragon’s jaws deals an additional die of damage until the end of the dragon’s next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4FMFRlEC923CnLI7]{Effect: Fed by Wood}

Sweltering Heat.name: Sweltering Heat
Sweltering Heat.description: 10 feet. Each creature that ends its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} while it remains in the aura.

Exploding Red Breath.name: Exploding Red Breath
Exploding Red Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of fire that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] within 60 feet, dealing @Damage[14d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:39|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[3d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage] damage. The dragon can't use Exploding Red Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Exploding Red Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Adamantine Claws.name: Adamantine Claws
Adamantine Claws.description:
Frequency one per hour

Effect The dragon infuses their body with adamantine. For the next minute, their melee Strikes are treated as adamantine and ignore half the Hardness of any object hit.

Scorch Earth.name: Scorch Earth
Scorch Earth.description: The dragon plunges their body into the ground, Burrows up to their burrow Speed, and then scorches the land within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]. Creatures underground or on the surface in the area take @Damage[8d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic] save). A creature that critically fails also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute.

Underworld Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Underworld Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Underworld Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
If there are any imperial dragons who benefited from moving out of their native elemental plane, it's underworld dragons. Once related solely to the element of fire, early underworld dragons harnessed elemental forces through arcane means for reasons no longer remembered. With each subsequent generation, both their arcane power and mastery over the elements grew. Their efforts were later bolstered by their studies in alchemy, which allowed dragons to cultivate themselves even further with various mutagens and elixirs.

Today, though their nature is primarily still connected with the element of fire, an underworld dragon can consume wood with ease, threaten entire regions with quakes, lay claim to the minerals and gems in the rocks and stone, and die to form volcanoes that create more land masses. Some even flippantly snort at the lapping waves of the sea, not fearing any retaliation from the sea dragon nations nor their kings. Though their powers might be relatively weaker than another imperial dragon of the same age, their mastery of many elements and the arcane arts makes underworld dragons formidable opponents.

Boiling Blood.name: Boiling Blood
Boiling Blood.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon's superheated blood spills onto the attacker. The target takes @Damage[12d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic] save).

All Becomes Flame.name: All Becomes Flame
All Becomes Flame.description:
The dragon curses a creature within 60 feet to have its magic replaced with primordial flames. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:43] save. Regardless of the result, the target becomes temporarily immune for 1 day.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.
