Success The creature is cursed for 1 round. While cursed, any damage the cursed creature would deal by any means becomes fire damage, regardless of the original damage type. The cursed creature can temporarily suppress the curse for 1 round as an action.

Failure As success, but the curse's duration is 1 hour.

Critical Failure As success, but the curse's duration is 1 day.

Pyre Breath.name: Pyre Breath
Pyre Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of flame that deals @Damage[22d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:70] (@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic] save). Creatures that critically fail their save catch fire, taking @Damage[2d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage] damage. The area then fills with black smoke for 1 minute. This has the effects of mist, except it fills the cone's area. The dragon can't use Pyre Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Pyre Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Stoke the Flames.name: Stoke the Flames
Stoke the Flames.description: The dragon intensifies nearby fires. Every foe within 60 feet that is taking persistent fire damage takes @Damage[5d6[fire]] damage.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a cinder dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Blazing Wind.name: Blazing Wind
Blazing Wind.description:
Requirements The dragon is able to use their Pyre Breath

Effect The dragon Flies up to their Speed in a straight line. At the end of their movement, a superheated gale blows out ahead of them in a @Template[type:line|distance:200] that's 20 feet wide. Structures and vehicles might collapse or catch fire in the whirling inferno, as earthquake. In addition, any creature in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:45] save. This ability counts as a use of the dragon's Pyre Breath.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[8d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[16d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure As failure, plus metal items are superheated and wooden items catch fire. The object takes @Damage[5d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage] damage, as does the creature wearing or holding it, though they can drop or take off the item to avoid taking the damage.

Cinder Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Cinder Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Cinder Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes: Among the largest and fiercest dragons, cinder dragons are typically volatile, demanding respect—even deference—from lesser creatures. Cinder dragons' appearance evokes their flame, often in scales with mixed patterns of red, orange, and yellow. Many cinder dragons dwell in active volcanoes and similarly fiery locales. Cinder dragons prefer treasures that can withstand the heat of their bodies and lairs, with gemstones, gold, and silver common among their hoards.

Cloud Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Cloud Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Cloud Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Mist Vision.name: Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: Fog and mist don't impair a cloud dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from fog and mist.

Master of Clouds.name: Master of Clouds
Master of Clouds.description:
Trigger The dragon rolls initiative

Effect A cloud dragon controls their element as easily as they breathe. The dragon uses Dragonmist four times.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Dragonmist.name: Dragonmist
Dragonmist.description: The dragon conjures up a sudden mist in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 500 feet. All creatures within the mist become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the mist become concealed to creatures within it. The dragon can use this action again to dismiss the mist—anyone else attempting to remove the dragonmist (via gust of wind or similar) must succeed at a counteract check. An archdragon can have up to six clouds of dragonmist active at a time.

Mist Step.description:
Requirements The dragon is within a cloud of dragonmist

Effect The dragon dissolves into wisps of cloud, reforming within another cloud of dragonmist within 1 mile.
Mist Step.name: Mist Step

Shapes in the Fog.name: Shapes in the Fog
Shapes in the Fog.description: With a cloud dragon's mastery of their element, creating shapes and images in a fog is child's play. All creatures within or adjacent to one cloud of dragonmist must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round (on a critical failure, they are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}).

Thundercloud Breath.name: Thundercloud Breath
Thundercloud Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a thundercloud that deals @Damage[23d6[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:70] (@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic] save). They can't use Thundercloud Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Thundercloud Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

The cloud remains in the area for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, with the effects of Dragonmist.

Toothsome Air.name: Toothsome Air
Toothsome Air.description: An archdragon's mist becomes akin to an extension of their body, to be shaped into fangs and claws. Their jaws and claw Strikes can originate from any square of dragonmist that's within 100 feet of the dragon.

Motionsense.description: A stormcrown dragon can detect the movement of nearby creatures through vibration and air movement. This precise sense works only against creatures and objects that moved in the previous round.
Motionsense.name: Motionsense

Coronal Cloak.name: Coronal Cloak
Coronal Cloak.description: When the dragon spends an action to Hover while in stormy weather, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} until they move or until the beginning of their next turn, whichever comes first.

Smooth Flying.description: The stormcrown dragon doesn't fall if they don't Fly during their turn, and they're unaffected by strong winds or similar effects unless they choose to be.
Smooth Flying.name: Smooth Flying

Storm Howl.description: Whenever a creature critically fails a save against one of the stormcrown dragon's abilities that deals electricity damage, that creature is also permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}.
Storm Howl.name: Storm Howl

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Superconductor.name: Superconductor
Superconductor.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack or spell

Effect The dragon uses the displaced air or magical trajectory of the attack as a channel for its electrical energy. The dragon attempts a storm bolt Strike against the attacker, regardless of range.

Command Lightning.name: Command Lightning
Command Lightning.description:
Requirements The dragon's last action was to use Draconic Frenzy or Cast a Spell with the air or electricity trait and they're in an area of stormy weather

Effect The dragon directs a bolt of lightning at a creature within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[4d12[electricity]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save.

Galvanic Barrage.name: Galvanic Barrage
Galvanic Barrage.description: The dragon exhales a massive bolt of lightning at one creature within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[10d12[electricity]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save. The lightning then arcs to a creature of the dragon's choice within 60 feet of the previous target with the same effect. The dragon can't target the same creature more than once, and they must have line of effect to all targets. The bolt can continue to arc this way until the dragon runs out of targets or until a target critically succeeds at their save. The dragon can't use Galvanic Barrage again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Galvanic Barrage]]{1d4 rounds}.

Stormcrown Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Stormcrown Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Stormcrown Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Heralds of—and heralded by—the primal forces of thunder and lightning, stormcrown dragons meld the majesty of fierce storms and mighty dragons. Driven by emotion and curiosity, these mercurial dragons can change from friend to foe or threatening to thoughtful in mere moments.

While no strangers to the personality traits for which dragons are well-known—pride, imperiousness, desire for lovely things, and so on—stormcrown dragons are by nature gregarious, even jovial. Indeed, these dragons often mingle with local communities or extend invitations for everything from raucous feasts to elegant soirees. To offend a stormcrown dragon, however, is most unwise. Insults to the dragon's hospitality or friendship, assertions of authority, and demands on them are all likely to elicit a tempestuous response, in every sense of the word. Cursed metamorphosis is a personal favorite of older stormcrown dragons for the disrespectful and demanding, forcing shapes on them more befitting their insignificance. A stormcrown dragon's fury often passes as suddenly as it arises, however, particularly when dulled by a suitable display of contrition.

Vizier Dragon (Ancient).name: Vizier Dragon (Ancient)
Vizier Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
There's a feeling every teacher knows. It's when one has taken a young mind and educated, trained, and molded them to one's specifications before setting them loose and watching the pupil act on one's teachings. It's a feeling of creation, control, and wonder, the knowledge that one has created this great and glorious thing—and if one has done the job exceptionally well, then the student will outshine the master. This is immortality and power, and this is what vizier dragons chase.

Vizier dragons are primarily concerned with the education and cultivation of people. People fascinate vizier dragons in all their riotous, contradictory complexity. Why do some people excel, and others falter and fail? Why does one person become a saint and the next a tyrant? Why do some become legends in their own time, while others labor in ignominy?

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Dragontongue.name: Dragontongue
Dragontongue.description: When a dragon speaks, the universe listens. The dragon is immune to silence and abilities that would prevent them from speaking if the source's level is lower than the dragon's or its rank is lower than half the dragon's level rounded up.

Word of Advice.name: Word of Advice
Word of Advice.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The dragon is a skilled mentor, and commands its students like a general. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon can Stride once and Strike once, in any order. If it hits, the Strike deals an additional @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage.

Word of Caution.name: Word of Caution
Word of Caution.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Wise people listen when a vizier dragon speaks. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains immunity to the vizier dragon's Powerful Utterance and resistance 20 to all other damage for 1 round.

Word of Wisdom.name: Word of Wisdom
Word of Wisdom.description:
Trigger An ally within 60 feet fails a saving throw

Effect The ally improves its result by one degree of success, turning a failure into a success or a critical failure into a normal failure. The dragon can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge this ability]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horns Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Powerful Utterance whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Dragonspeech.name: Dragonspeech
Dragonspeech.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The ancient dragon uses Word of Advice, Word of Caution, and Word of Heroism, though any given ally can only be the target of a single Word.

Powerful Utterance.name: Powerful Utterance
Powerful Utterance.description:
The dragon expresses their power in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Powerful Utterance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Powerful Utterance]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Ardent Proclamation (occult, fire) The dragon breathes a blast of flame in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] that deals @Damage[21d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|traits:occult,fire] save).

  • Chastising Word (mental, occult) The dragon chides the targets strictly enough to leave the mind reeling. Each creature within a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:42|traits:mental,occult] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} for 1 minute (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} on a critical failure).

Word of Heroism.name: Word of Heroism
Word of Heroism.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Ancient dragons are the teachers of heroes. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains a +2 status bonus to attack rolls, Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks for 1 minute.

Umbral Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Umbral Archdragon (Spellcaster)

Devour Undead.name: Devour Undead
Devour Undead.description: The dragon's jaws Strikes have the benefit of a ghost touch property rune and deal an additional 8d6 force damage to undead.

Tenebrous Breath.name: Tenebrous Breath
Tenebrous Breath.description:
The umbral dragon exhales in one of two ways. They can't use Tenebrous Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Tenebrous Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Darkness (occult, void) The dragon breathes a blast of darkness that deals @Damage[24d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic|traits:occult,void] save). Undead creatures take @Damage[24d6[force]|options:area-damage]{force} damage instead of void damage.

  • Shadows (occult, shadow) The dragon breathes a blast of shadows in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60]. Each creature within the cone must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:46|traits:occult,shadow] save.

    Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

    Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} for 1 round.

    Failure The creature is enfeebled 4 for 1 minute.

Hide in Shadows.name: Hide in Shadows
Hide in Shadows.description: The dragon can Hide in dim light even if they don't have cover.

Voidsense.name: Voidsense
Voidsense.description: The dragon can taste animating void energy, allowing them to sense creatures with void healing as a precise sense. It can also sense incorporeal creatures with void healing, like shadows, when they are inside solid objects.

Pin Shadow.name: Pin Shadow
Pin Shadow.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's claw uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Requirements The triggering creature is in bright light or dim light and has a shadow

Effect The dragon makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature. On a hit, the trigger creature also has its shadow pinned in place, restricting its movement. The creature treats the area of the dragon's aura as difficult terrain until it uses an Interact action to unpin its shadow. If the area was already difficult terrain, the creature treats it as greater difficult terrain.

Tenacious Shadows.name: Tenacious Shadows
Tenacious Shadows.description: Shadows fill attacker's eyes. Any creature that must attempt a flat check to target the dragon because of dim light must roll twice and use the worse result.

Umbral Pall.name: Umbral Pall
Umbral Pall.description: 120 feet. Shadows surround the dragon. The radius of all light from light sources and the areas of light spells in the aura are halved. The shadows also cling to creatures, making areas of dim light difficult terrain.

Drain Vigor.name: Drain Vigor
Drain Vigor.description:
When the dragon deals void damage to a living creature with its jaws Strike, the umbral dragon gains 20 temporary HP that last for 1 minute and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). Further damage dealt by the dragon's jaws Strike increases the drained condition value by 1 on a failed save (2 on a critical failure), to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wBFtXxByOza6N9hs]{Effect: Drain Vigor}

Umbral Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Stories across Golarion warn children about the monsters that dwell in the shadows, but no story captures the reality of the umbral dragon. Natives of the Netherworld, these occult dragons are at home in the darkness, using it to their advantage both in and out of battle. Umbral dragons rarely worry about fighting fairly, emerging from hiding to strike unwary foes and using their magical breath without compunction. Similarly, in social situations, they often remain in the shadows, operating through other creatures. Even in direct conversation, they frequently obscure their true intent, preferring to avoid ever being pinned down with a solid answer.

While umbral dragons are rarely altruistic, their preferred diet creates a strange dichotomy that attracts other creatures to them as a potential source of safety, especially in the Netherworld. While much of the multiverse sees undead as a dire threat, for umbral dragons, undead are a tasty snack. Umbral dragons find the flavor of necrotic flesh irresistible and the void energy of incorporeal undead a potent spice, making them one of the few creatures in existence known to hunt the unliving as a source of food.

Biomineralize.name: Biomineralize
Biomineralize.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by a melee weapon without reach or an unarmed attack that deals slashing or piercing damage

Effect A gout of blood spurts from the dragon's wound and instantaneously calcifies into a jagged branch of sharpened coral. The coral branch impales the triggering creature, dealing @Damage[10d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save). The triggering creature also takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,bleed]] damage on a critical failure. Regardless of the outcome, the coral then crumbles to dust.

Kaleidoscopic Display.name: Kaleidoscopic Display
Kaleidoscopic Display.description:
90 feet. The coral formations covering the dragon's body shimmer with vivid colors, overwhelming the senses. Any creature entering or beginning its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:42] save. Regardless of outcome, the creature is temporarily immune to the dragon's Kaleidoscopic Display for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is blinded for 1 round and dazzled for 1 minute.

Hydraulic Breath.name: Hydraulic Breath
Hydraulic Breath.description: The dragon exhales a pressurized jet of water that deals @Damage[22d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage in an @Template[type:line|distance:140] (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save). Creatures that critically fail their Reflex save against the Hydraulic Breath are pushed back 10 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The dragon can't use Hydraulic Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hydraulic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Reef Bond.name: Reef Bond
Reef Bond.description:
Every coral dragon is mystically bound to a single living coral reef. If the dragon moves more than 3 miles from their reef, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and unable to recover, with the sickened value increasing by 1 every 6 hours unless they succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:46] save. After 24 hours, the dragon becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}; their drained value increases by 1 every 24 hours.

If the dragon's reef suffers significant physical damage, they immediately become aware of the location where the reef was harmed, but not the source or nature of the damage. Should the reef ever be completely destroyed, the dragon is immediately slain.

Reef Armor.name: Reef Armor
Reef Armor.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon encases themself in an shell of protective coral, gaining 80 temporary Hit Points and resistance 15 to piercing and slashing damage until the temporary Hit Points are depleted. The effect lasts for 1 minute, until destroyed, or until the dragon Dismisses the effect.

Reef Meld.name: Reef Meld
Reef Meld.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The coral dragon is in physical contact with their bound reef

Effect The dragon physically merges with the reef and vanishes, along with up to 12 willing creatures, into an extradimensional space where it can neither affect nor be affected by the outside world. The effect lasts indefinitely or until the dragon Dismisses it. Once merged, the dragon can spend 1 minute traveling to and emerging from any point on its reef up to 10 mile away.

Coral Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Coral Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Coral Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes: Coral dragons are the primal guardians of the vast living coral reefs found in oceans across Golarion. Even by draconic standards, coral dragons stand out for their arrogance and vanity, boasting inordinate pride in the vibrant hues of their own coral-encrusted scales and the dazzling splendor of the reefs they protect. Coral dragons like to decorate their reefs, which they view as lairs, with objects of beauty, dotted with the occasional bit of valuables like coins. Those who seek the favor of a coral dragon often find the creature easily swayed by flattery, particularly when paired with shiny or brightly colored gifts that complement the scintillating beauty of the dragon and their underwater domain.

Magma Archdragon.name: Magma Archdragon

Cataclysm.name: Cataclysm
Cataclysm.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The magma archdragon releases its primal fury in full. Magma rips from the ground in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] within 240 feet. Each creature in the area takes @Damage[14d6[fire],4d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage, with a @Check[reflex|dc:44|basic|options:area-effect] save.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Pyroclastic Blast whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Magma Burrow.name: Magma Burrow
Magma Burrow.description: A magma dragon's burrow Speed functions only when the dragon is Burrowing through magma or molten lava.

Pyroclastic Breath.name: Pyroclastic Breath
Pyroclastic Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of magma that deals @Damage[11d6[fire],6d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|basic|dc:44|options:area-effect]). They can't use Pyroclastic Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4#Recharge Pyroclastic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}

Volcanic Purge.name: Volcanic Purge
Volcanic Purge.description:
If the next action the dragon uses is Pyroclastic Breath, the magma clings to those it damages. Each creature that fails its save against Pyroclastic Breath takes @Damage[6d6[persistent,fire]] damage, and as long as it has this persistent fire damage, it also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7qoZauizAKfPIXeu]{Effect: Volcanic Purge}

Wing Deflection.name: Wing Deflection
Wing Deflection.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises a wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is Flying, they descend 10 feet after the attack.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of a Medium humanoid. This does not change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horn Strike in any order.

Magma Tomb.name: Magma Tomb
Magma Tomb.description: The dragon spits a molten boulder at a target within 120 feet. This deals @Damage[14d6[fire],6d12[bludgeoning]] damage, with a @Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save. If the creature fails its save, it's encased in magma that instantly cools and has Hardness 12, HP 50, and BT 25. The encased creature can't breathe and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} ([[/act escape dc=44]]).

Magma Archdragon.allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Cutting Rebuke.name: Cutting Rebuke
Cutting Rebuke.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's chin blade that the dragon can see makes a Strike against the dragon

Effect The dragon makes a chin blade Strike against the triggering creature.

Feast of Blood.name: Feast of Blood
Feast of Blood.description: The dragon inhales sharply, pulling blood from wounds and into the dragon's maw. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] takes their current persistent bleed damage plus @Damage[6d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] save). The dragon gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the greatest amount of void damage dealt to a single creature this way. The dragon can't use Feast of Blood again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Feast of Blood]]{1d4 rounds}.

Vorpal Binding.name: Vorpal Binding
Vorpal Binding.description:
The vorpal dragon beheads its foes—sometimes without killing them. A vorpal dragon's chin blade Strikes count as having the vorpal weapon property rune for the purpose of weaknesses. Whenever the vorpal dragon critically succeeds on a chin blade Strike, it deals an additional @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage, which can be ended normally.

When a vorpal dragon rolls a natural 20 on a chin blade Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save; this has the incapacitation trait. On a failure, the creature is beheaded. A creature beheaded this way does not automatically die; instead, their head and body live on, disconnected but mystically linked, with the head controlling the body from afar. A beheaded creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} as they attempt to coordinate movements from an unusual perspective, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 4} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} if their head can't perceive their body from its location. These conditions are suppressed if the body holds its head, and don't apply to actions performed exclusively by the head, mind, or voice. If the body is killed, the head can live on, but destroying the head kills the body as well. This effect can be reversed by taking a 2-action activity, which has the manipulate trait, to firmly reattach the severed head to the correct body. Whether attaching the severed head to a different headless body is effective is at the GM's discretion.

Vorpal Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Vorpal Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Vorpal Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Vorpal dragons were not created by some ancient divinity nor born of a specific realm or force. Their birth was an arcane accident, the result of unstoppable magic contacting immovable beast. In unknowable ancient ages, the first jabberwock was wrought by the Eldest and the first vorpal sword was wrought in turn to slay the beast. When that very first blade went snicker-snack for the very first time, tasting the primeval lifeblood of the draconic Tane, the first vorpal dragon was born.

Vorpal dragons are most notorious for their keen vorpal magic. Even the least of these dragons can sever a foe's head in a single lucky stroke. Unusually, however, the subject survives as a bipartite creature: a headless body controlled by a detached head that still thinks and speaks, and which can outlive said body's destruction. It's not uncommon for would-be dragonslayers to be sent home carrying their own heads under one arm as a lesson in humility. The unluckier ones, alas, may be kept as trophies—and, in a very literal sense, conversation pieces—while the dragon devours their greater portion. Some might even wear their favorite severed heads as a macabre necklace.

Sanctified Sight.name: 祝圣视觉 Sanctified Sight
Sanctified Sight.description: 君龙能够自动侦测出一个生物，效果或物品是否受祝，以及其为圣洁还是邪秽。

Violent Retort.description:
触发 一个君龙触及范围内的生物对龙造成了重击

效果 在应用了对龙的所有重击效果之后，君龙对该生物进行一次爪抓或尾扫打击。
Violent Retort.name: 以牙还牙 Violent Retort

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
君龙可以变为任意大型或更小体型类人生物的外貌。这不会改变其速度或打击的攻击和伤害加值，但可能会改变其打击造成的伤害类型（通常为钝击）。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Gleaming Armor.name: 耀目宝甲 Gleaming Armor
Gleaming Armor.description:
频率 每小时一次

效果 君龙的护甲散发出金光。君龙在AC上获得+2状态加值，并获得对酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰和音波伤害的10点抗力。@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]范围内每个敌人都必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:30]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]。所有这些效果持续到龙的下个回合结束。

Sovereign's Rebuke.name: 君王训诫 Sovereign's Rebuke
Sovereign's Rebuke.description: 君龙释放一道充满精神能量的吼叫，对@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围造成@Damage[12d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:30|basic]豁免）。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sovereign's Rebuke]]{1d4轮}内再次使用君王训诫。

Sovereign Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: 青年君龙施法者 Sovereign Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Sovereign Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
据说曾有纯粹的土元素龙类存在。这些帝龙如同其他元素龙一样来到物质宇宙，生老病死，其躯体最终化作大陆的一部分。正如火元素化作熔岩，木元素化作森林，水元素汇成海洋湖泊，金元素化作珍贵矿脉，土元素终成大地、岩石与山岳。依循逻辑推演，若当今世间尚存此类环境与存在，那么土元素龙必然存在。抑或曾在远古时代存在过。

然而如今帝龙之中，唯有君龙在死亡时会留下蛇形骸骨，而非岩石、石块或泥土。龙的内在施法能力，对未加热铁器的弱点等特征，强烈暗示它们与元素之土存在关联。其余能力则几乎与土元素无关，反而聚焦于玄学上的精魂与心灵的奥秘。

关于君龙为何演变至此，尚无明确解释。有人推测这或许是某种为实现个人野心的交易，他们从选拔统治者的角色变为了统治者本身。也有人猜测天夏大地曾在过去遭受腐化，土元素龙为自保而背弃了元素本性。或许它们也曾化作圣天龙，却因凡间未现合格统治者而重返尘世。

Sky Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
当帝龙初临物质宇宙时，每条龙都与自身诞生的元素位面紧密相连。随着元素领主之间的战争愈演愈烈，仁慈的领主们接连陨落，金元素位面与木元素位面相继自我封闭。对于源自腐蚀核心（Corroded Core）的龙族而言，它们的生存根基已然岌岌可危。这些龙类在山巅间辗转流亡，逃离妖怪征战的彼时危险的天夏。最终，当它们抵达沉沦山脉（Chenlun）、罗网山脉（Gossamer）、格桑山脉（Kelsang）、金山（Kimu）、库兰山脉（Kullan）、巨人山脉（Kyojin）与天境之墙（Wall of Heaven）时，天界生灵回应了它们的求救。当龙族失去金元素的支撑，天族便以神圣赐福与精粹相补。随着本质蜕变，这些龙从而得以延续。久而久之，它们因贴近苍穹、侍奉神明而得名。昔日的金元素龙的岁月，终成褪色的记忆与创世神话，唯有天龙自身仍铭记于心。

天龙以永恒的侍奉来感恩。部分天龙吸收了所侍奉神祇的位面能量，变得庞大而强大；其中许多成为现代圣天龙的始祖。其余天龙则留在物质宇宙中，终生修习信仰，臻于生命与灵魂的神术技艺。真正能独立行动，运用非神术力量执行无关伟大意志任务的天龙实属罕见。即便如此，这些少数天龙仍保留着隐居沉思的本性，至少在年轻岁月里如此。

随着金元素位面的回归，关于天龙与该位面关联的谨慎探询悄然展开。有人猜测是否能寻得幸存的远亲。这些探询并非出于好奇，而是迫于现实需求。虽然天龙因天界生灵的加持获得了自保之力，却未能解决元素匮乏的问题。更糟的是，即便腐蚀核心已然回归，这种匮乏仍在持续。无论是从蛋里孵化还是自然分娩，天龙雏龙降生时都脆弱不堪，鳞片稀疏甚至全然不长。即便置身于大型矿藏或盐脉（作为金元素能量的磁体与蓄能库）之中，幼龙的鳞片也需历经数十年淬炼，方能坚韧到足以离开巢穴的程度。如果金元素位面存在这些问题的答案——无论是适合作为安全的产崽或育雏的场所，还是恢复龙类吸收环境元素能量的能力——确保所有天龙掌握此法并把握机会，实为当务之急。

Fed by Earth.description: 如果天龙成为土法术或效果的目标，他会将鳞片中的矿物质结晶化，形成折射或散射光线的外层以进行伪装。在1分钟内，天龙在飞行时处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]。
Fed by Earth.name: 由土而生 Fed by Earth

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。

Mist Vision.name: 迷雾视觉 Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: 雾与浓雾不会削弱天龙的视觉；其忽视由雾和迷雾造成的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Fire.name: 为火所克 Countered by Fire
Countered by Fire.description:
如果天龙受到火焰伤害，他们体内的金元素魔法会被回火。直到其下个回合结束，其在攻击骰和AC上承受-1环境减值，且颚咬打击不再造成电击伤害。如果天龙使用了钢电吐息，则限制结束。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.a4bZrBNL17zPjDiH]

Divine Lightning.name: 神圣闪电 Divine Lightning
Divine Lightning.description:
需求 龙信仰祝佑条目列出"圣洁"的神祇

效果 天龙通过攻击引导神力，使得对抗邪秽时更加有效。它在对抗邪秽生物时，造成的任何电击伤害变为精魂伤害。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当天龙在一次打击中造成重击时，他充能其钢电吐息。

Perfected Flight.name: 完美飞行 Perfected Flight
Perfected Flight.description: 天龙不花费动作便可悬停在原地，并且他在用于空中机动的所有特技检定上自动成功。

Steel Lightning Breath.name: 钢电吐息 Steel Lightning Breath
Steel Lightning Breath.description: 天龙向50尺内射出一个电球，对@Template[type:burst|distance:25]范围造成@Damage[8d12[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic]豁免）。其不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Steel Lightning Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用钢电吐息。

Sky Dragon (Adult).name: 成年天龙 Sky Dragon (Adult)

Voidsense.description: The dragon can taste animating void energy, allowing them to sense creatures with void healing as a precise sense. It can also sense incorporeal creatures with void healing, like shadows, when they are inside solid objects.
Voidsense.name: Voidsense

Pin Shadow.name: Pin Shadow
Pin Shadow.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's claw uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Requirements The triggering creature is in bright light or dim light and has a shadow

Effect The dragon makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature. On a hit, the trigger creature also has its shadow pinned in place, restricting its movement. The creature treats the area of the dragon's aura as difficult terrain until it uses an Interact action to unpin its shadow. If the area was already difficult terrain, the creature treats it as greater difficult terrain.

Drain Vigor.name: Drain Vigor
Drain Vigor.description:
When the dragon deals void damage to a living creature with its jaws Strike, the umbral dragon gains 20 temporary HP that last for 1 minute and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). Further damage dealt by the dragon's jaws Strike increases the drained condition value by 1 on a failed save (2 on a critical failure), to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wBFtXxByOza6N9hs]{Effect: Drain Vigor}

Tenebrous Breath.name: Tenebrous Breath
Tenebrous Breath.description:
The umbral dragon exhales in one of two ways. They can't use Tenebrous Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Tenebrous Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Darkness (occult, void) The dragon breathes a blast of darkness that deals @Damage[21d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|traits:occult,void] save). Undead creatures take @Damage[16d6[force]|options:area-damage]{force} damage instead of void damage.

  • Shadows (occult, shadow) The dragon breathes a blast of shadows in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50]. Each creature within the cone must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:42|traits:occult,shadow] save.

    Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

    Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} for 1 round.

    Failure The creature is enfeebled 3 for 1 minute.

Hide in Shadows.name: Hide in Shadows
Hide in Shadows.description: The dragon can Hide in dim light even if they don't have cover.

Umbral Pall.name: Umbral Pall
Umbral Pall.description: 120 feet. Shadows surround the dragon. The radius of all light from light sources and the areas of light spells in the aura are halved. The shadows also cling to creatures, making areas of dim light difficult terrain.

Devour Undead.name: Devour Undead
Devour Undead.description: The dragon's jaws Strikes have the benefit of a ghost touch property rune and deal an additional 7d6 force damage to undead.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges its Tenebrous Breath whenever it scores a critical hit with a Strike.

Umbral Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Umbral Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Umbral Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Stories across Golarion warn children about the monsters that dwell in the shadows, but no story captures the reality of the umbral dragon. Natives of the Netherworld, these occult dragons are at home in the darkness, using it to their advantage both in and out of battle. Umbral dragons rarely worry about fighting fairly, emerging from hiding to strike unwary foes and using their magical breath without compunction. Similarly, in social situations, they often remain in the shadows, operating through other creatures. Even in direct conversation, they frequently obscure their true intent, preferring to avoid ever being pinned down with a solid answer.

While umbral dragons are rarely altruistic, their preferred diet creates a strange dichotomy that attracts other creatures to them as a potential source of safety, especially in the Netherworld. While much of the multiverse sees undead as a dire threat, for umbral dragons, undead are a tasty snack. Umbral dragons find the flavor of necrotic flesh irresistible and the void energy of incorporeal undead a potent spice, making them one of the few creatures in existence known to hunt the unliving as a source of food.

Forest Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: 古森龙施法者 Forest Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Forest Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Fed by Water.name: 由水而生 Fed by Water
Fed by Water.description:
频率 每小时一次

触发 森龙成为一个水法术或效果的目标

效果 森龙获得50点临时生命值，持续1分钟。

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 森龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，森龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。

Draining Blight.name: 流失枯萎 Draining Blight
Draining Blight.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 森龙从周围的活物身上吸取水分来治愈自己的伤口。@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内的所有活物受到@Damage[10d10[void]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:41|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。完全由水和植物构成的生物使用比掷骰结果更差一级的成功度。森龙恢复等同于对该效果本次造成的所有伤害里最高的伤害数值的一半的生命值。区域内所有非生物植物枯萎死亡，清除所有非魔法灌木和所有因此产生的困难地形，掩蔽和隐蔽。

Lignifying Bite.name: 化木噬咬 Lignifying Bite
Lignifying Bite.description: 当由血肉构成的生物被森龙的颚咬打击削减至0点生命值，该生物必须尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:41]豁免。如果失败，它就会死亡，它的血肉，玄学上视为土属相，将转变为木质。这块木头还是活着的，随着时间推移可能会长成树，但它不能视作尸体或尸体的部分以用作@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG]或其他能使得生物复生的魔法。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Frightful Presence.name: 恐怖威压 Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description:
90尺，@Check[will|dc:39]。具有动物，真菌和植物特征的生物在豁免时承受-2环境减值。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Countered by Metal.name: 为金所克 Countered by Metal
Countered by Metal.description: 如果森龙受到来自金属物品或具有金特征效果的伤害，他将失去林地通行和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zlnXpME1T2uvn8Lr]直到其下个回合结束。

Azure Swarm Breath.name: 蔚蓝虫群吐息 Azure Swarm Breath
Azure Swarm Breath.description: 森龙放出一群昆虫对@Template[type:cone|distance:60]范围造成@Damage[18d6[piercing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）随后消散开来。豁免大失败的生物受到@Damage[3d6[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage]伤害。森龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Azure Swarm Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用蔚蓝虫群吐息。

Forest Shape.name: 森林形态 Forest Shape
Forest Shape.description: 当施放@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]时，森龙可以变成体型和年龄与他们自身相同的树木，使用其自己的AC。

Woodland Passage.name: 林地通行 Woodland Passage
Woodland Passage.description: 森龙忽视由非魔法植物和真菌形成的困难地形和高等困难地形，例如灌木，藤蔓和林下植被。

Empyreal Archdragon.name: Empyreal Archdragon

Luminous Form.description: The dragon transforms into a being of pure light for 1 minute, shedding bright light in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. While in their heavenly form, the dragon's melee Strikes deal an additional @Damage[1d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage and @Damage[1d6[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage. Creatures with the unholy trait that can see the light must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:46] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round (blinded for 1 minute on a critical failure); they are then temporarily immune for 1 minute.
Luminous Form.name: Luminous Form

Spirit Breath.name: Spirit Breath
Spirit Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a blast of holy fire that deals @Damage[19d8[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The dragon can't use Spirit Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Divine Deflection.name: Divine Deflection
Divine Deflection.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect Divine power intercedes, preventing some of the damage. The dragon gains resistance 20 to all damage against the triggering attack.

Inspiring Presence.name: Inspiring Presence
Inspiring Presence.description:
60 feet.

The mere sight of an empyreal dragon motivates other creatures. Creatures within the aura gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws and skill checks. The empyreal dragon can't gain the benefit of their own aura or other actions that use the aura, and they can choose to exclude any creatures from any benefit of the aura or action that uses the aura.

Direct Halo.name: Direct Halo
Direct Halo.description: The dragon tosses their halo to a square within 90 feet. While the halo is deployed in this way, the dragon loses their inspiring presence aura, and the aura instead emanates from the halo with the same emanation radius. The dragon can Sustain to recall the halo from any distance. The halo is made of pure light—it doesn't occupy space and can't be targeted or destroyed in any way.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Spirit Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Halo Pulse.name: Halo Pulse
Halo Pulse.description:
The dragon chooses one effect to impose on creatures in their inspiring presence aura.

The dragon can't use Halo Pulse again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Halo Pulse]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Repulsion Each creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:46] save or be pushed until it's no longer in the aura.
  • Restoration (healing, vitality) Each creature recovers @Damage[11d8[healing]]{11d8 Hit Points}.
  • Restriction (incapacitation, mental) Creatures must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:46] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) while they remain within the aura. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to restriction for 1 minute.

Empyreal Archdragon.publicNotes:
The three major celestial planes—Heaven, Nirvana, and Elysium—each have their own respective dragons. Empyreal dragons have a direct connection to Heaven. Using the blessings of Heaven, empyreal dragons protect others and intercede against wickedness. Empyreal dragons are wise, considerate, and compassionate. When speaking with others, empyreal dragons are patient and understanding.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Empyreal Archdragon.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair an underworld dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Countered by Water.name: Countered by Water
Countered by Water.description:
If the underworld dragon takes damage from a spell with the cold or water trait, the elemental magic of fire within them is momentarily dampened. Until the end of their next turn, they take a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, and their jaws Strikes don't deal fire damage. This limitation ends if the dragon uses Exploding Red Breath.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.81XYZZ3H0GL8thdQ]{Effect: Countered by Water}

Fed by Wood.name: Fed by Wood
Fed by Wood.description:
When an underworld dragon is struck by a weapon made primarily of wood or affected by a spell with the plant or wood trait, the dragon’s internal fiery essences are stoked with the added fuel. Their Exploding Red Breath recharges, and the fire damage from the dragon’s jaws deals an additional die of damage until the end of the dragon’s next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4FMFRlEC923CnLI7]{Effect: Fed by Wood}

Adamantine Claws.name: Adamantine Claws
Adamantine Claws.description:
Frequency one per hour

Effect The dragon infuses their body with adamantine. For the next minute, their melee Strikes are treated as adamantine and ignore half the Hardness of any object hit.

Coiling Frenzy.description: The dragon makes one claw Strike and one tail Strike in either order, each against the same target. If either Strike hits, the dragon can attempt to Grab the target with that limb as a free action. The dragon can have up to three creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} at a time; one in each of their front claws, and a last with their tail.
Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Exploding Red Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Exploding Red Breath.name: Exploding Red Breath
Exploding Red Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of fire that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 40 feet, dealing @Damage[7d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[1d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage] damage. The dragon can't use Exploding Red Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Exploding Red Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Underworld Dragon (Young).name: Underworld Dragon (Young)
Underworld Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
If there are any imperial dragons who benefited from moving out of their native elemental plane, it's underworld dragons. Once related solely to the element of fire, early underworld dragons harnessed elemental forces through arcane means for reasons no longer remembered. With each subsequent generation, both their arcane power and mastery over the elements grew. Their efforts were later bolstered by their studies in alchemy, which allowed dragons to cultivate themselves even further with various mutagens and elixirs.

Today, though their nature is primarily still connected with the element of fire, an underworld dragon can consume wood with ease, threaten entire regions with quakes, lay claim to the minerals and gems in the rocks and stone, and die to form volcanoes that create more land masses. Some even flippantly snort at the lapping waves of the sea, not fearing any retaliation from the sea dragon nations nor their kings. Though their powers might be relatively weaker than another imperial dragon of the same age, their mastery of many elements and the arcane arts makes underworld dragons formidable opponents.

Jeer at Failure.name: Jeer at Failure
Jeer at Failure.description:
Trigger A foe within 90 feet becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} or critically fails on a Strike

Effect The mocking dragon laughs dismissively at the foe, attempting an Intimidation check to [[/act demoralize]] the creature. They do not take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand their language.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Graceless Domain.name: Graceless Domain
Graceless Domain.description:
90 feet. A creature who enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:35] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the graceless domain aura for 1 minute. The dragon can exclude creatures from this aura.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success For 1 round, the first time the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Failure For 1 minute, the first time each round the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Critical Failure For 1 minute, every time the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of any Tiny, Small, Medium, Large, or Huge animal, beast, or humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Hilarious Exhalation whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Hilarious Exhalation.name: Hilarious Exhalation
Hilarious Exhalation.description:
The dragon unleashes their breath in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Hilarious Exhalation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hilarious Exhalation]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Laughing Gas (emotion, mental) The dragon breaths a cloud of mood-altering gas in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. This has the effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlSE7Ly8vi1Dgddv]{Laughing Fit} (@Check[will|dc:38|traits:emotion,mental]) with a duration of 1 round.

  • Slippery Puddle The dragon expels a glob of viscous goo at a solid surface at a range of 60 feet. This creates a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] with the area effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} (@Check[reflex|dc:38]).

Humiliating Mark.name: Humiliating Mark
Humiliating Mark.description: On a critical hit, the dragon's claws inflict @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse} on the target as if they had rolled a success.

Improved Vex.name: Improved Vex
Improved Vex.description:
Requirements The dragon's last action was a successful tail Strike

Effect The mocking dragon attempts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.5eNKs6738aykAhK2]{Dirty Trick} against the target of their tail Strike. This attempt neither applies nor counts toward the creature's multiple attack penalty.

Insistent Heckling.name: Insistent Heckling
Insistent Heckling.description:
The dragon can [[/act demoralize]] targets within 90 feet. Targets become immune to the mocking dragon's attempts to Demoralize them for 1 minute after each attempt.

Creatures Demoralized by the ancient mocking dragon are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} while they are frightened.

Reactive Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon attempts an Athletics check to [[/act trip]] the triggering creature. This check doesn't count toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this check.
Reactive Tail.name: Reactive Tail

Breath of Fresh Air.name: Breath of Fresh Air
Breath of Fresh Air.description: The dragon unleashes a stream of magical bubbles in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40]. Each creature within the area takes @Damage[10d8[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:34|basic] save). A creature who fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as they give in to the joyful urge to dance, sing, laugh, or admire the world around them. On a critical failure, the creature is slowed 1 for 1 minute and can't use reactions for as long as they are slowed; they can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turn to end the slowed condition early.

Lover of the Arts.name: Lover of the Arts
Lover of the Arts.description: Checks by or against the dragon to change a creature's attitude using Diplomacy can be attempted with Performance instead.

Whimsysense.name: Whimsysense
Whimsysense.description: Delight dragons can sense the presence of laughter, games, celebrations, and sweets within the listed range.

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine

Play Scape.name: Play Scape
Play Scape.description:
15 feet. Delight dragon magic alters their surroundings, turning weapons into toys and spells into stage effects. All Strikes and other damaging effects used in the aura gain the nonlethal trait and are accompanied by magical sound effects. A creature entering or beginning their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:34] save.

Failure The creature's first damaging effect (such as a Strike) this round does half damage.

Critical Failure All the creature's damaging effects this turn do half damage.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge their Breath of Fresh Air.

Let's Play!.name: Let's Play!
Let's Play!.description: The dragon conjures up a magical arena to play a game, making up rules on the spot. Up to four target creatures inside the dragon's aura take @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage from the dragon's baffling explanation (@Check[will|dc:34|basic] save). Creatures who fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure). Regardless of result, all targets are immune for 24 hours.

Delight Dragon (Adult).name: Delight Dragon (Adult)
Delight Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
Some would say delight dragons are like children. They would be correct. At least, as correct as if they said a puff of chimney smoke resembled a massive storm cloud or compared a toddler's drawing of a horse to a prized thoroughbred. Which is to say, they are completely and utterly incorrect. Of course, having a smoke cloud or child's drawing running around one's home might be vastly preferable to a delight dragon.

As residents of the Outer Plane Elysium, delight dragons are embodiments of the plane's proclivity toward joy, mischief, passion, and spontaneity. Their massive gossamer wings refract the light of a thousand rainbows between translucent layers. Purple-green scales shimmer in opalescent splendor, while a long, sinuous tail flicks in spiral figures, darting to catch the feet out from under distracted observers. A pair of feathery antennae direct the delight dragon to their next source of amusement—whether play, treat, or general amusement, all surely to become a great time in the dragon's presence, whether a plane's denizens know it or not.

As self-proclaimed defenders of games, whimsy, and the freedom to sow a little chaos, delight dragons are often found on the front line against those that would strip such choice away from others. Demonic forces deployed at the Worldwound whispered of the "lights of doom," massive rainbows that heralded the approach of a delight dragon. The winged crusader would descend upon these fiends with claws and fangs, cackling all the while.
Delight Dragon (Adult).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Fed by Earth.description: 如果天龙成为土法术或效果的目标，他会将鳞片中的矿物质结晶化，形成折射或散射光线的外层以进行伪装。在1分钟内，天龙在飞行时处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]。
Fed by Earth.name: 由土而生 Fed by Earth

Divine Lightning.name: 神圣闪电 Divine Lightning
Divine Lightning.description:
需求 龙信仰祝佑条目列出"圣洁"的神祇

效果 天龙通过攻击引导神力，使得对抗邪秽时更加有效。它在对抗邪秽生物时，造成的任何电击伤害变为精魂伤害。

Perfected Flight.name: 完美飞行 Perfected Flight
Perfected Flight.description: 天龙不花费动作便可悬停在原地，并且他在用于空中机动的所有特技检定上自动成功。

Mist Vision.name: 迷雾视觉 Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: 雾与浓雾不会削弱天龙的视觉；其忽视由雾和迷雾造成的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Fire.name: 为火所克 Countered by Fire
Countered by Fire.description:
如果天龙受到火焰伤害，他们体内的金元素魔法会被回火。直到其下个回合结束，其在攻击骰和AC上承受-1环境减值，且颚咬打击不再造成电击伤害。如果天龙使用了钢电吐息，则限制结束。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.a4bZrBNL17zPjDiH]

Steel Lightning Breath.description: 天龙向60尺内射出一个电球，对@Template[type:burst|distance:30]范围造成@Damage[10d12[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic]豁免）。其不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Steel Lightning Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用钢电吐息。
Steel Lightning Breath.name: 钢电吐息 Steel Lightning Breath

Stunning Electricity.name: 震慑电击 Stunning Electricity
Stunning Electricity.description:
天龙快速盘旋，然后释放噼啪作响的闪电，对@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]范围造成@Damage[5d12[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害。区域内每个生物都必须尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:40]豁免；无论结果如何，这些生物都会临时免疫10分钟。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物受到一半伤害，并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。

失败 该生物受到全额伤害，并陷入震慑1轮且4轮内不能飞行。

大失败 该生物受到双倍伤害，并陷入震慑2轮且1分钟内不能飞行。

Sky Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: 古天龙施法者 Sky Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Sky Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
当帝龙初临物质宇宙时，每条龙都与自身诞生的元素位面紧密相连。随着元素领主之间的战争愈演愈烈，仁慈的领主们接连陨落，金元素位面与木元素位面相继自我封闭。对于源自腐蚀核心（Corroded Core）的龙族而言，它们的生存根基已然岌岌可危。这些龙类在山巅间辗转流亡，逃离妖怪征战的彼时危险的天夏。最终，当它们抵达沉沦山脉（Chenlun）、罗网山脉（Gossamer）、格桑山脉（Kelsang）、金山（Kimu）、库兰山脉（Kullan）、巨人山脉（Kyojin）与天境之墙（Wall of Heaven）时，天界生灵回应了它们的求救。当龙族失去金元素的支撑，天族便以神圣赐福与精粹相补。随着本质蜕变，这些龙从而得以延续。久而久之，它们因贴近苍穹、侍奉神明而得名。昔日的金元素龙的岁月，终成褪色的记忆与创世神话，唯有天龙自身仍铭记于心。

天龙以永恒的侍奉来感恩。部分天龙吸收了所侍奉神祇的位面能量，变得庞大而强大；其中许多成为现代圣天龙的始祖。其余天龙则留在物质宇宙中，终生修习信仰，臻于生命与灵魂的神术技艺。真正能独立行动，运用非神术力量执行无关伟大意志任务的天龙实属罕见。即便如此，这些少数天龙仍保留着隐居沉思的本性，至少在年轻岁月里如此。

随着金元素位面的回归，关于天龙与该位面关联的谨慎探询悄然展开。有人猜测是否能寻得幸存的远亲。这些探询并非出于好奇，而是迫于现实需求。虽然天龙因天界生灵的加持获得了自保之力，却未能解决元素匮乏的问题。更糟的是，即便腐蚀核心已然回归，这种匮乏仍在持续。无论是从蛋里孵化还是自然分娩，天龙雏龙降生时都脆弱不堪，鳞片稀疏甚至全然不长。即便置身于大型矿藏或盐脉（作为金元素能量的磁体与蓄能库）之中，幼龙的鳞片也需历经数十年淬炼，方能坚韧到足以离开巢穴的程度。如果金元素位面存在这些问题的答案——无论是适合作为安全的产崽或育雏的场所，还是恢复龙类吸收环境元素能量的能力——确保所有天龙掌握此法并把握机会，实为当务之急。

Wailing Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Wailing Archdragon (Spellcaster)

Echolocation.name: Echolocation
Echolocation.description: A wailing dragon can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

Eerie Call.name: Eerie Call
Eerie Call.description:
Requirements The dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or undetected

Effect The dragon's wail draws in unsuspecting opponents. Anyone that can hear the Eerie Call must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the sound. A fascinated creature must spend at least 1 action Seeking the dragon each turn, and the dragon can Sustain this affect for up to 1 minute

Natural Mimic.name: Natural Mimic
Natural Mimic.description: The dragon can imitate any sound or voice that it has heard. This has the effect of 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.yV7Ouzaoe7DHLESI]{Ventriloquism} (DC 40) but is a nonmagical effect.

Steal Sound.name: Steal Sound
Steal Sound.description: A creature struck by the wailing archdragon's melee Strikes must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:40] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} and silenced for 1 round. A silenced creature can't use sonic attacks, auditory actions, or Cast Spells (with the exception of subtle spells).

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and Sonic

Destructive Interference.name: Destructive Interference
Destructive Interference.description:
Trigger A foe within 90 feet uses an auditory or sonic effect

Effect The young wailing dragon releases a burst of noise, attempting to drown out the triggering sound. It makes a counteract check against the effect (counteract rank 9, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+32 #Counteract]]{+32}).

Subsonic Drone.name: Subsonic Drone
Subsonic Drone.description:
120 feet, A creature who enters or begins their turn in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's subsonic drone for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

Resounding Roar.name: Resounding Roar
Resounding Roar.description:
The dragon unleashes a thunderous call that deals @Damage[19d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic] save). On a critical failure, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute.

In addition, if the area overlaps with an area of magical silence or includes a creature affected by magical silence, the roar attempts to counteract the silence effect (counteract rank 9, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+32 #Counteract]]{+32}).

The dragon can't use Resounding Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Resounding Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

Reverberating Rush.name: Reverberating Rush
Reverberating Rush.description: The dragon Flies three times. The dragon gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. Any creature that is adjacent to the dragon at any point during its movement takes @Damage[9d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 hour. A creature can be affected only once per Reverberating Rush.

Wailing Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Canny, patient, and creative, wailing dragons are adepts of sound and psychology. With both their physiology and innate connection to arcane magic allowing them to produce and shape sound waves, these reclusive creatures are heard much more often than seen. Named for their tendency to use uncanny keening vocalizations to communicate across long distances and startle prey, wailing dragons haunt locations that create interesting or useful echoes, such as canyons or caverns. Though ruthless predators when needed, most wailing dragons devote their energy toward investigating the effects sound has on the environment and the bodies and minds of creatures.

Minstrels, divas, and tunesmiths seek out these creatures during their mating season, when two dragons sing courtship ballads full of intricate harmonies. While this might be the performance of a lifetime, it's a dangerous concert, as incautious audience members frequently become meals for the nuptial couple. (The famous Chelaxian composer, Gretezi Valtros, disappeared on such an expedition in 4275 ar, after he set out to teach a wailing dragon High Azlanti and "instruct it in the decorous art of opera.") Most creatures also find the close-range subsonic vibrations emitted by wailing dragons extremely uncomfortable, reinforcing the idea that it's best to observe them from a distance.

Conspirator Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Conspirator Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Conspirator Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

Retract Body.name: Retract Body
Retract Body.description:
Trigger The dragon is hit or critically hit by an attack made by a creature the dragon can see

Effect The dragon retracts the targeted body part or twists away to avoid the attack, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Conjure Disguise.name: Conjure Disguise
Conjure Disguise.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon conjures a perfect flesh-suit replica of a humanoid they've seen of their size or smaller and compresses themself into it, along with generating appropriate clothing for the humanoid. This process takes 1 minute to complete, during which the dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. If the dragon stops or is interrupted in this process, the suit is destroyed. Once the process is complete, the dragon can remain in this disguise indefinitely.

The transformation has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]{Change Shape}, except that the disguise is not actively magical in nature and doesn't register as magical to detect magic and similar effects. The dragon loses Retract Body while transformed.

If the dragon is critically hit while wearing the disguise, the suit is destroyed and immediately explodes. This has the effects of Detonate Disguise, except that creatures use the outcome one degree of success better than they rolled on their save.

Rushed Transformation.name: Rushed Transformation
Rushed Transformation.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect Using the aid of magic and an exhausting amount of effort, the dragon quickly reshapes their body into the form of a generic humanoid figure. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2qGqa33E4GPUCbMV]{Humanoid Form} except that it lasts only 1 minute, and the dragon doesn't gain the +4 status bonus to Deception as the transformation makes use of the dragon's body to crudely mimic a humanoid form. The dragon can Dismiss the effect.

Whenever the effect ends, the dragon leaves behind scraps of magically conjured flesh, which could give away the dragon's presence.

Smoke Breath.name: Smoke Breath
Smoke Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a noxious cloud of smoke that deals @Damage[18d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:70] (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect] save). The smoke remains for 1 minute. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Mist}, except it fills the cone's area.

The dragon can't use Smoke Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Smoke Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The dragon's Strikes deal an additional 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Detonate Disguise.name: Detonate Disguise
Detonate Disguise.description:
Requirements The dragon is wearing their conjured disguise

Effect The dragon erupts from the disguise, destroying it. The explosive revelation deals @Damage[21d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:5] with a @Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect] save. A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round as it becomes covered in scraps from the disguise.

Any creature sharing a space with the dragon after they erupt is pushed into the nearest empty space.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge Smoke Breath.

Conspirator Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Hidden among the shadows and upper echelons of society are the conspirator dragons. These dragons are schemers, always looking to manipulate and control others, either for personal gain or simply for the thrill of watching their machinations play out. Conspirator dragons see themselves above others and typically speak with infantilizing tones and words. However, as most conspirator dragons meet others while in disguise, they do their best to maintain their disguise.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.

Delight Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Whimsysense.name: Whimsysense
Whimsysense.description: Delight dragons can sense the presence of laughter, games, celebrations, and sweets within the listed range.

Cloud of Giggles.name: Cloud of Giggles
Cloud of Giggles.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The delight dragon transforms into a Huge sparkling cloud of gas for 10 minutes. During this time, the dragon gains resistance 20 to physical damage and is immune to precision damage, but they can't cast spells, activate items, or use Strikes or actions that have the attack or manipulate trait. They can only use their fly Speed, can slip through tiny cracks, and occupy the same space as other creatures. If the dragon ends their turn sharing the same space as other creatures, each of those creatures must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} from a fit of giggles until the end of the dragon's next turn. The dragon can Dismiss this action as long as it has space to take its original size.

Let's Play!.name: Let's Play!
Let's Play!.description: The dragon conjures up a magical arena to play a game, making up rules on the spot. Any number of target creatures inside the dragon's aura take @Damage[14d6[mental]] damage from the dragon's baffling explanation (@Check[will|dc:45|basic] save). Creatures who fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure). Regardless of result, all targets are immune for 24 hours.

Breath of Fresh Air.name: Breath of Fresh Air
Breath of Fresh Air.description: The dragon unleashes a stream of magical bubbles in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60]. Each creature within the area takes @Damage[16d8[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:45|basic] save). A creature who fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as they give in to the joyful urge to dance, sing, laugh, or admire the world around them. On a critical failure, the creature is slowed 1 for 1 minute and can't use reactions for as long as they are slowed; they can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turn to end the slowed condition early.

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine

Lover of the Arts.name: Lover of the Arts
Lover of the Arts.description: Checks by or against the dragon to change a creature's attitude using Diplomacy can be attempted with Performance instead.

Can't Kill Fun.name: Can't Kill Fun
Can't Kill Fun.description: Once per day, if the delight archdragon would die, it instead automatically resurrects in its most recently visited lair with half its maximum Hit Points.

Play Scape.name: Play Scape
Play Scape.description:
15 feet. Delight dragon magic alters their surroundings, turning weapons into toys and spells into stage effects. All Strikes and other damaging effects used in the aura gain the nonlethal trait and are accompanied by magical sound effects. A creature entering or beginning their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45] save.

Failure The creature's first damaging effect (such as a Strike) this round does half damage.

Critical Failure All the creature's damaging effects this turn do half damage.

Reactive Tail.name: Reactive Tail
Reactive Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon attempts an Athletics check to [[/act trip]] the triggering creature. This check doesn't count toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this check.

Delight Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Delight Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Delight Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Some would say delight dragons are like children. They would be correct. At least, as correct as if they said a puff of chimney smoke resembled a massive storm cloud or compared a toddler's drawing of a horse to a prized thoroughbred. Which is to say, they are completely and utterly incorrect. Of course, having a smoke cloud or child's drawing running around one's home might be vastly preferable to a delight dragon.

As residents of the Outer Plane Elysium, delight dragons are embodiments of the plane's proclivity toward joy, mischief, passion, and spontaneity. Their massive gossamer wings refract the light of a thousand rainbows between translucent layers. Purple-green scales shimmer in opalescent splendor, while a long, sinuous tail flicks in spiral figures, darting to catch the feet out from under distracted observers. A pair of feathery antennae direct the delight dragon to their next source of amusement—whether play, treat, or general amusement, all surely to become a great time in the dragon's presence, whether a plane's denizens know it or not.

As self-proclaimed defenders of games, whimsy, and the freedom to sow a little chaos, delight dragons are often found on the front line against those that would strip such choice away from others. Demonic forces deployed at the Worldwound whispered of the "lights of doom," massive rainbows that heralded the approach of a delight dragon. The winged crusader would descend upon these fiends with claws and fangs, cackling all the while.

Sage Dragon (Ancient).name: Sage Dragon (Ancient)

Mystic Facility.name: Mystic Facility
Mystic Facility.description: The dragon can activate scrolls and wands of any tradition as if the spells they contain were occult spells.

Overwhelming Proclamation.name: Overwhelming Proclamation
Overwhelming Proclamation.description: The dragon exclaims hidden truths that only they have been able to understand, dealing @Damage[19d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:40|basic] save). On a critical failure, creatures are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. The dragon can't use Overwhelming Proclamation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Overwhelming Proclamation]]{1d4 rounds}.

Reflexive Understanding.name: Reflexive Understanding
Reflexive Understanding.description:
Frequency once per hour

Requirements The dragon was targeted by a spell of 8th rank or lower in the last round

Effect The dragon analyzes the spell's inner workings. For the next 10 minutes, the dragon can cast the spell at the same rank as if it were one of their innate occult spells.

Reveal Shame.name: Reveal Shame
Reveal Shame.description:
Requirements The dragon has successfully Recalled Knowledge about an enemy within 90 feet

Effect The dragon utters an embarrassing secret about the creature, unnerving them and their allies. Every enemy within 90 feet that can hear the secret must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}. Sanguine Knowledge As young sage dragon.

Sanguine Knowledge.name: Sanguine Knowledge
Sanguine Knowledge.description: The first time each encounter a dragon hits and deals damage to a creature with their jaws Strike, they receive information about the creature as if the dragon had succeeded at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about that creature.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells

Divert Essence.name: Divert Essence
Divert Essence.description:
Trigger A creature within 90 feet Casts a Spell that targets the dragon

Effect The sage dragon steals energy from the spell to protect itself, gaining resistance to damage from spells equal to the triggering spell's rank until the beginning of their next turn.

Eldritch Interference.name: Eldritch Interference
Eldritch Interference.description:
90 feet, @Check[will|dc:40].

Overlapping fields near the dragon make spellcasting unpredictable. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's eldritch interference for 1 minute.
