Critical Success For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they gain a status bonus to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they take a status penalty to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Overwhelming Proclamation whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Sage Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
A shining, rune-inscribed scale is all that most people, even adventurers, see of a sage dragon during their lifetimes. Even then, only those familiar with dragon lore will likely recognize the scale as anything other than an elaborate spell scroll. Collectors and scholars of esoteric lore, sage dragons become increasingly reclusive as they age, and, even in their youths, they're prone to work through trusted intermediaries. For those able to locate and gain the trust of such a creature, even the youngest sage dragons are fonts of difficult-to-find knowledge and rare magical techniques. The oldest sage dragons are living combinations of gargantuan libraries and endless grimoires, accumulating the secrets of the Universe, and beyond, in their isolated lairs.

Organized and methodical, with an insatiable curiosity and eidetic memory, sage dragons are the devout researchers of the dragon world. The intellectual pursuits of sage dragons demand extended periods of quiet study, one of the reasons that such dragons live in isolated, hidden locations. Young dragons tend to specialize in a particular area of research. As they age, these research interests also broaden, with an expert in a particular river expanding into topics such as the water cycle, ecology, or the Plane of Water. Sage dragons interested in religious topics often worship Nethys or a god dedicated to knowledge, such as Gruhastha, Qi Zhong, or Ydajisk. Dragons who seek grim rituals or cryptic knowledge might join the church of Abraxas or worship Norgorber in his aspect of the Reaper of Reputation.

Gleaming Armor.description:
频率 每小时一次

效果 君龙的护甲散发出金光。君龙在AC上获得+2状态加值，并获得对酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰和音波伤害的15点抗力。@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]范围内每个敌人都必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:36]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]。所有这些效果持续到龙的下个回合结束。
Gleaming Armor.name: 耀目宝甲 Gleaming Armor

Inspire Envoy.name: 激励特使 Inspire Envoy
Inspire Envoy.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 君龙选择一名凡人并赐予其威严的祝福，以换取该生物去完成一项特殊指令，例如击败暴君或保护圣地。如果该生物同意，直到其下次每日准备，它在由龙选择的以下一项上获得+1状态加值：攻击骰，AC，或以下全部：察觉，意志豁免和基于魅力的技能检定。龙可以解消此增益，如果凡人胆敢违抗龙的指令，他就会迅速这么做。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.YDJnC3Bdc2GI6hX5]

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Sanctified Sight.name: 祝圣视觉 Sanctified Sight
Sanctified Sight.description: 君龙能够自动侦测出一个生物，效果或物品是否受祝，以及其为圣洁还是邪秽。

Violent Retort.name: 以牙还牙 Violent Retort
Violent Retort.description:
触发 一个君龙触及范围内的生物对龙造成了重击

效果 在应用了对龙的所有重击效果之后，君龙对该生物进行一次爪抓或尾扫打击。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
君龙可以变为任意大型或更小体型类人生物的外貌。这不会改变其速度或打击的攻击和伤害加值，但可能会改变其打击造成的伤害类型（通常为钝击）。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Sovereign's Rebuke.name: 君王训诫 Sovereign's Rebuke
Sovereign's Rebuke.description: 君龙释放一道充满精神能量的吼叫，对@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围造成@Damage[16d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:36|basic]豁免）。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sovereign's Rebuke]]{1d4轮}内再次使用君王训诫。

Sovereign Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: 成年君龙施法者 Sovereign Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Sovereign Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
据说曾有纯粹的土元素龙类存在。这些帝龙如同其他元素龙一样来到物质宇宙，生老病死，其躯体最终化作大陆的一部分。正如火元素化作熔岩，木元素化作森林，水元素汇成海洋湖泊，金元素化作珍贵矿脉，土元素终成大地、岩石与山岳。依循逻辑推演，若当今世间尚存此类环境与存在，那么土元素龙必然存在。抑或曾在远古时代存在过。

然而如今帝龙之中，唯有君龙在死亡时会留下蛇形骸骨，而非岩石、石块或泥土。龙的内在施法能力，对未加热铁器的弱点等特征，强烈暗示它们与元素之土存在关联。其余能力则几乎与土元素无关，反而聚焦于玄学上的精魂与心灵的奥秘。

关于君龙为何演变至此，尚无明确解释。有人推测这或许是某种为实现个人野心的交易，他们从选拔统治者的角色变为了统治者本身。也有人猜测天夏大地曾在过去遭受腐化，土元素龙为自保而背弃了元素本性。或许它们也曾化作圣天龙，却因凡间未现合格统治者而重返尘世。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Mist Vision.name: 迷雾视觉 Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: 雾与浓雾不会削弱天龙的视觉；其忽视由雾和迷雾造成的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态。

Countered by Fire.name: 为火所克 Countered by Fire
Countered by Fire.description:
如果天龙受到火焰伤害，他们体内的金元素魔法会被回火。直到其下个回合结束，其在攻击骰和AC上承受-1环境减值，且颚咬打击不再造成电击伤害。如果天龙使用了钢电吐息，则限制结束。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.a4bZrBNL17zPjDiH]

Fed by Earth.name: 由土而生 Fed by Earth
Fed by Earth.description: 如果天龙成为土法术或效果的目标，他会将鳞片中的矿物质结晶化，形成折射或散射光线的外层以进行伪装。在1分钟内，天龙在飞行时处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]。

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。

Divine Lightning.description:
需求 龙信仰祝佑条目列出"圣洁"的神祇

效果 天龙通过攻击引导神力，使得对抗邪秽时更加有效。它在对抗邪秽生物时，造成的任何电击伤害变为精魂伤害。
Divine Lightning.name: 神圣闪电 Divine Lightning

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当天龙在一次打击中造成重击时，他充能其钢电吐息。

Metallic Strikes.name: 金属打击 Metallic Strikes
Metallic Strikes.description: 至古天龙的颚咬和爪抓打击在计算免疫，抗力和弱点时视作任何金属。

Perfected Flight.name: 完美飞行 Perfected Flight
Perfected Flight.description: 天龙不花费动作便可悬停在原地，并且他在用于空中机动的所有特技检定上自动成功。

Steel Lightning Breath.name: 钢电吐息 Steel Lightning Breath
Steel Lightning Breath.description: 天龙向75尺内射出一个电球，对@Template[type:burst|distance:40]范围造成@Damage[12d12[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic]豁免）。其不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Steel Lightning Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用钢电吐息。

Stunning Electricity.name: 震慑电击 Stunning Electricity
Stunning Electricity.description:
天龙快速盘旋，然后释放噼啪作响的闪电，对@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]范围造成@Damage[5d12[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害。区域内每个生物都必须尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:44]豁免；无论结果如何，这些生物都会临时免疫10分钟。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物受到一半伤害，并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。

失败 该生物受到全额伤害，并陷入震慑1轮且4轮内不能飞行。

大失败 该生物受到双倍伤害，并陷入震慑2轮且1分钟内不能飞行。

Sky Archdragon.name: 至古天龙 Sky Archdragon
Sky Archdragon.publicNotes:
当帝龙初临物质宇宙时，每条龙都与自身诞生的元素位面紧密相连。随着元素领主之间的战争愈演愈烈，仁慈的领主们接连陨落，金元素位面与木元素位面相继自我封闭。对于源自腐蚀核心（Corroded Core）的龙族而言，它们的生存根基已然岌岌可危。这些龙类在山巅间辗转流亡，逃离妖怪征战的彼时危险的天夏。最终，当它们抵达沉沦山脉（Chenlun）、罗网山脉（Gossamer）、格桑山脉（Kelsang）、金山（Kimu）、库兰山脉（Kullan）、巨人山脉（Kyojin）与天境之墙（Wall of Heaven）时，天界生灵回应了它们的求救。当龙族失去金元素的支撑，天族便以神圣赐福与精粹相补。随着本质蜕变，这些龙从而得以延续。久而久之，它们因贴近苍穹、侍奉神明而得名。昔日的金元素龙的岁月，终成褪色的记忆与创世神话，唯有天龙自身仍铭记于心。

天龙以永恒的侍奉来感恩。部分天龙吸收了所侍奉神祇的位面能量，变得庞大而强大；其中许多成为现代圣天龙的始祖。其余天龙则留在物质宇宙中，终生修习信仰，臻于生命与灵魂的神术技艺。真正能独立行动，运用非神术力量执行无关伟大意志任务的天龙实属罕见。即便如此，这些少数天龙仍保留着隐居沉思的本性，至少在年轻岁月里如此。

随着金元素位面的回归，关于天龙与该位面关联的谨慎探询悄然展开。有人猜测是否能寻得幸存的远亲。这些探询并非出于好奇，而是迫于现实需求。虽然天龙因天界生灵的加持获得了自保之力，却未能解决元素匮乏的问题。更糟的是，即便腐蚀核心已然回归，这种匮乏仍在持续。无论是从蛋里孵化还是自然分娩，天龙雏龙降生时都脆弱不堪，鳞片稀疏甚至全然不长。即便置身于大型矿藏或盐脉（作为金元素能量的磁体与蓄能库）之中，幼龙的鳞片也需历经数十年淬炼，方能坚韧到足以离开巢穴的程度。如果金元素位面存在这些问题的答案——无论是适合作为安全的产崽或育雏的场所，还是恢复龙类吸收环境元素能量的能力——确保所有天龙掌握此法并把握机会，实为当务之急。

Wished Away.name: Wished Away
Wished Away.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect The dragon wishes not to be hurt by this attack, gaining resistance 25 to all damage against the triggering attack.

Breath of Loss.name: Breath of Loss
Breath of Loss.description: The dragon breathes a warm, gentle breeze of mist that creates the feeling of when deepest desires are achieved. As the breeze dissipates, the feeling of loss overwhelms creatures' senses, dealing @Damage[19d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[will|dc:41] save). A creature that critically fails its save is also consumed with the memory of the moment and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}. The wish dragon can't use Breath of Loss again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath of Loss]]{1d4 rounds}.

Destructive Wish.name: Destructive Wish
Destructive Wish.description:
Requirements An illusion from Wish Come True is currently active

Effect The wish dragon Dismisses the illusion of Wish Come True, which shatters into magical fragments, dealing @Damage[9d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:41|basic] save to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:50] of the illusion.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Best Wishes.name: Best Wishes
Best Wishes.description: 30 feet. Being near a wish dragon gives other creatures a greater sense of what they truly wish for, bolstering their sense of purpose while also distracting them from the task at hand. Creatures in the aura take a –1 status penalty to Perception but gain a +2 status bonus to Will saving throws against mental effects. The wish dragon can't gain the benefit of their own aura or other actions that use the aura, and they can choose to exclude any creatures from any benefit of the aura or action that uses the aura.

Wish Come True.name: Wish Come True
Wish Come True.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon creates an illusion in an unoccupied square within 60 feet that appears to all other creatures that can see it to be the manifestation of their deepest material desire. This has the effects of illusory object (though the illusion might appear to be a creature to certain people) that last for 10 minutes. The wish dragon can Dismiss the illusion. Each non-wish dragon creature who begins their turn within 200 feet in line of sight of the illusion must attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save. If any creature within reach of the illusion Interacts to touch it, the illusion ends and that creature is invigorated, gaining 2d8 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature disbelieves the illusion and becomes temporarily immune to Wish Come True for 1 hour.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Wish You Would.name: Wish You Would
Wish You Would.description:
Requirements An illusion from Wish Come True is active

Effect The dragon targets one creature within 200 feet currently stupefied by Wish Come True, making them believe that the object of their desires is under attack from all those around them and the dragon is the only one they can trust. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:40] Save or they become controlled by the dragon for 1 minute. The target may attempt a new save at the end of each of their turns. If the illusion from Wish Come True dissipates, their controlled state immediately ends.

Wish Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Wish Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Wish Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
What is a wish? A wish dragon would call it the truest expression of self—each individual wish reveals something of deep importance to the wisher, and no two wishes are ever quite the same. Whether the wish is one of creation or destruction, justice or vengeance, love or hate, wish dragons seek to understand what makes it important to the wisher and view their ability to make it a reality as a gift that helps them make sense of the world.

To a wish dragon, learning what someone wishes for is the beginning of a conversation, granting them that wish is a gift, and watching what they do with it is a reward. They take each part of this journey seriously and spend much of their lives moving among other ancestries to better understand what others want and need, especially during their younger years. While they view this mission as a righteous one, it can become all-consuming, and some have been known to lose all sense of themselves in their quest to bring about the dreams and desires of those around them.

Fortune Archdragon.name: Fortune Archdragon

Capture Spell.name: Capture Spell
Capture Spell.description:
Trigger The dragon succeeds or critically succeeds on a saving throw against a spell

Effect The dragon attempts to capture a portion of the spell's magic to feed themself. They attempt to counteract the spell (counteract rank 10, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+42 #Counteract]]{+42}). If successful, the dragon is unaffected by the spell and regains one expended spontaneous spell slot; other subjects are affected by the spell normally.

Disruptive Breath.name: Disruptive Breath
Disruptive Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a spray of magic-disrupting energies that deals @Damage[22d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:80] (@Check[reflex|dc:50|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute.

The dragon can't use Disruptive Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Disruptive Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Treasure Dive.name: Treasure Dive
Treasure Dive.description:
Requirements The dragon's body isn't covered in riches and the dragon is adjacent to their hoard

Effect The dragon Strides or Burrows through their hoard using their land Speed. They coat themself in coins, magic items, and other treasures. This contact with magical items revitalizes the dragon, causing them to regain one expended spontaneous spell slot.

The dragon can move through other creatures while moving in this way. Creatures in the dragon's path, or above it if the dragon Burrows, must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:43] save or be pushed 10 feet (or pushed 20 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a critical failure).

Treasure Tsunami.name: Treasure Tsunami
Treasure Tsunami.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Requirements The dragon is within 120 feet of their hoard

Effect The dragon exerts their pull on their hoard, creating a wave of treasures 60 feet wide and 60 feet tall that emanates at a place of their choosing within their hoard and within 120 feet. The wave moves in a straight line toward them, ending where they stand and crashing over them, covering the dragon in riches. Creatures struck by the wave must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:43] save or take @Damage[15d10[bludgeoning]] damage and are pulled 20 feet toward the dragon (on a success they take half the bludgeoning damage and are knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} instead of pulled).

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Aura of Disruption.description:
120 feet.

The dragon radiates disruptive energies that allow them to feed on magic. When a spell is counteracted or disrupted within the aura, the dragon regains one expended spontaneous spell slot and gains 45 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.
Aura of Disruption.name: Aura of Disruption

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: Whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike, the dragon chooses to either recharge Disruptive Breath or regain one expended spontaneous spell slot.

Drain Hoard.name: Drain Hoard
Drain Hoard.description:
Requirements The dragon is within 60 feet of their hoard

Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon draws power out of the magic items in their hoard, regaining all their expended spontaneous spell slots.

Share the Wealth.name: Share the Wealth
Share the Wealth.description:
Requirements The dragon's body is covered in riches (this is typically the case when the dragon is first encountered)

Effect The dragon shakes their body aggressively, sending coins and other riches flying in every direction, dealing @Damage[22d10[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:45|basic|options:area-effect] save to all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:60]. The dragon's body is then no longer covered in riches.

Fortune Archdragon.publicNotes:
Fortune dragons have the innate ability to draw upon the raw magical energies that surround them. They constantly use these magical energies to empower their magical abilities and even their bodies, as the energy can heal wounds. A fortune dragon has a typical build for an arcane dragon, but their bodies sport a striking feature: their treasure. The dragon's nature of drawing upon magic causes coins, gems, and, most notably, magical items to cling to their body like iron drawn to magnets. A dragon constantly pulls magical energies from the items attached to their body and makes use of these energies to cast spells. The magical energies that flow through a fortune dragon constantly flow through the dragon's items as well, and in many cases, the items melt from the heat produced in this process. Fortune dragons are seekers of novel experiences. This desire for originality leads fortune dragons to approach visitors of other ancestries with curiosity, though this initial interest quickly wanes if a visitor lacks exciting qualities.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Fortune Archdragon.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Crystal Dragon (Young).name: Crystal Dragon (Young)
Crystal Dragon (Young).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Ornamental Breath.description: The dragon exhales a torrent of shattered rocks and minerals in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] dealing @Damage[7d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|options:area-effect,inflicts:clumsy] save). A creature who fails the save is weighed down by the stones, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure).
Ornamental Breath.name: Ornamental Breath

+2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal

Shielding Stone.name: Shielding Stone
Shielding Stone.description:
Trigger A creature at least 10 feet away from the dragon targets them with an attack

Requirements The dragon is on the ground and there is at least one unoccupied square between themself and the attacker

Effect The dragon conjures a thin slab of stone in an unoccupied square between themself and the attacker. The dragon gains standard cover against the triggering attack. The stone falls on the first person other than the dragon who enters that square, dealing @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save. Otherwise, it crumbles harmlessly after 1 round.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Ornamental Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Wish Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Wish Archdragon (Spellcaster)

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Destructive Wish.name: Destructive Wish
Destructive Wish.description:
Requirements An illusion from Wish Come True is currently active

Effect The wish dragon Dismisses the illusion of Wish Come True, which shatters into magical fragments, dealing @Damage[10d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:45|basic] save to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:50] of the illusion.

Wish Come True.name: Wish Come True
Wish Come True.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon creates an illusion in an unoccupied square within 60 feet that appears to all other creatures that can see it to be the manifestation of their deepest material desire. This has the effects of illusory object (though the illusion might appear to be a creature to certain people) that last for 10 minutes. The wish dragon can Dismiss the illusion. Each non-wish dragon creature who begins their turn within 200 feet in line of sight of the illusion must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45] save. If any creature within reach of the illusion Interacts to touch it, the illusion ends and that creature is invigorated, gaining 3d6 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature disbelieves the illusion and becomes temporarily immune to Wish Come True for 1 hour.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Wish You Would.name: Wish You Would
Wish You Would.description:
Requirements An illusion from Wish Come True is active

Effect The dragon targets one creature within 200 feet currently stupefied by Wish Come True, making them believe that the object of their desires is under attack from all those around them and the dragon is the only one they can trust. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:44] Save or they become controlled by the dragon for 1 minute. The target may attempt a new save at the end of each of their turns. If the illusion from Wish Come True dissipates, their controlled state immediately ends.

Best Wishes.name: Best Wishes
Best Wishes.description: 40 feet. Being near a wish dragon gives other creatures a greater sense of what they truly wish for, bolstering their sense of purpose while also distracting them from the task at hand. Creatures in the aura take a –1 status penalty to Perception but gain a +2 status bonus to Will saving throws against mental effects. The wish dragon can't gain the benefit of their own aura or other actions that use the aura, and they can choose to exclude any creatures from any benefit of the aura or action that uses the aura.

Dying Wish.name: Dying Wish
Dying Wish.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The dragon is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The dragon wishes to survive by any means necessary. The dragon is instead reduced to 1 Hit Point and teleports up to 10 miles away.

Wished Away.name: Wished Away
Wished Away.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect The dragon wishes not to be hurt by this attack, gaining resistance 25 to all damage against the triggering attack.

Breath of Loss.name: Breath of Loss
Breath of Loss.description: The dragon breathes a warm, gentle breeze of mist that creates the feeling of when deepest desires are achieved. As the breeze dissipates, the feeling of loss overwhelms creatures' senses, dealing @Damage[22d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[will|dc:45] save). A creature that critically fails its save is also consumed with the memory of the moment and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}. The wish dragon can't use Breath of Loss again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath of Loss]]{1d4 rounds}.

Wish Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
What is a wish? A wish dragon would call it the truest expression of self—each individual wish reveals something of deep importance to the wisher, and no two wishes are ever quite the same. Whether the wish is one of creation or destruction, justice or vengeance, love or hate, wish dragons seek to understand what makes it important to the wisher and view their ability to make it a reality as a gift that helps them make sense of the world.

To a wish dragon, learning what someone wishes for is the beginning of a conversation, granting them that wish is a gift, and watching what they do with it is a reward. They take each part of this journey seriously and spend much of their lives moving among other ancestries to better understand what others want and need, especially during their younger years. While they view this mission as a righteous one, it can become all-consuming, and some have been known to lose all sense of themselves in their quest to bring about the dreams and desires of those around them.

Sage Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Sage Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells

Divert Essence.name: Divert Essence
Divert Essence.description:
Trigger A creature within 90 feet Casts a Spell that targets the dragon

Effect The sage dragon steals energy from the spell to protect itself, gaining resistance to damage from spells equal to the triggering spell's rank until the beginning of their next turn.

Eldritch Interference.name: Eldritch Interference
Eldritch Interference.description:
90 feet, @Check[will|dc:30].

Overlapping fields near the dragon make spellcasting unpredictable. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's eldritch interference for 1 minute.

Critical Success For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they gain a status bonus to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they take a status penalty to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Mystic Facility.name: Mystic Facility
Mystic Facility.description: The dragon can activate scrolls and wands of any tradition as if the spells they contain were occult spells.

Overwhelming Proclamation.name: Overwhelming Proclamation
Overwhelming Proclamation.description: The dragon exclaims hidden truths that only they have been able to understand, dealing @Damage[14d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:33|basic] save). On a critical failure, creatures are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. The dragon can't use Overwhelming Proclamation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Overwhelming Proclamation]]{1d4 rounds}.

Reveal Shame.name: Reveal Shame
Reveal Shame.description:
Requirements The dragon has successfully Recalled Knowledge about an enemy within 90 feet

Effect The dragon utters an embarrassing secret about the creature, unnerving them and their allies. Every enemy within 90 feet that can hear the secret must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}. Sanguine Knowledge As young sage dragon.

Sanguine Knowledge.name: Sanguine Knowledge
Sanguine Knowledge.description: The first time each encounter a dragon hits and deals damage to a creature with their jaws Strike, they receive information about the creature as if the dragon had succeeded at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about that creature.

Sage Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
A shining, rune-inscribed scale is all that most people, even adventurers, see of a sage dragon during their lifetimes. Even then, only those familiar with dragon lore will likely recognize the scale as anything other than an elaborate spell scroll. Collectors and scholars of esoteric lore, sage dragons become increasingly reclusive as they age, and, even in their youths, they're prone to work through trusted intermediaries. For those able to locate and gain the trust of such a creature, even the youngest sage dragons are fonts of difficult-to-find knowledge and rare magical techniques. The oldest sage dragons are living combinations of gargantuan libraries and endless grimoires, accumulating the secrets of the Universe, and beyond, in their isolated lairs.

Organized and methodical, with an insatiable curiosity and eidetic memory, sage dragons are the devout researchers of the dragon world. The intellectual pursuits of sage dragons demand extended periods of quiet study, one of the reasons that such dragons live in isolated, hidden locations. Young dragons tend to specialize in a particular area of research. As they age, these research interests also broaden, with an expert in a particular river expanding into topics such as the water cycle, ecology, or the Plane of Water. Sage dragons interested in religious topics often worship Nethys or a god dedicated to knowledge, such as Gruhastha, Qi Zhong, or Ydajisk. Dragons who seek grim rituals or cryptic knowledge might join the church of Abraxas or worship Norgorber in his aspect of the Reaper of Reputation.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Dragontongue.name: Dragontongue
Dragontongue.description: When a dragon speaks, the universe listens. The dragon is immune to silence and abilities that would prevent them from speaking if the source's level is lower than the dragon's or its rank is lower than half the dragon's level rounded up.

Word of Advice.name: Word of Advice
Word of Advice.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The dragon is a skilled mentor, and commands its students like a general. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon can Stride once and Strike once, in any order. If it hits, the Strike deals an additional @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage.

Word of Heroism.name: Word of Heroism
Word of Heroism.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Ancient dragons are the teachers of heroes. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains a +3 status bonus to attack rolls, Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks for 1 minute.

Word of Vigor.name: Word of Vigor
Word of Vigor.description: An archdragon is a wellspring of power, a well from which one might drink deep. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains regeneration 25 for 1 round, and the dragon can Sustain this effect once per round as a free action.

Word of Wisdom.name: Word of Wisdom
Word of Wisdom.description:
Trigger An ally within 60 feet fails a saving throw

Effect The ally improves its result by one degree of success, turning a failure into a success or a critical failure into a normal failure. The dragon can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge this ability]]{1d4 rounds}.

Dragonspeech.name: Dragonspeech
Dragonspeech.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The ancient dragon uses Word of Advice, Word of Caution, and Word of Heroism, though any given ally can only be the target of a single Word.

Powerful Utterance.name: Powerful Utterance
Powerful Utterance.description:
The dragon expresses their power in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Powerful Utterance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Powerful Utterance]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Ardent Proclamation (occult, fire) The dragon breathes a blast of flame in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] that deals @Damage[24d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic|traits:occult,fire] save).

  • Chastising Word (mental, occult) The dragon chides the targets strictly enough to leave the mind reeling. Each creature within a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:46|traits:mental,occult] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} for 1 minute (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 6} on a critical failure).

Word of Caution.name: Word of Caution
Word of Caution.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Wise people listen when a vizier dragon speaks. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains immunity to the vizier dragon's Powerful Utterance and resistance 30 to all other damage for 1 round.

Vizier Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Vizier Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Vizier Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
There's a feeling every teacher knows. It's when one has taken a young mind and educated, trained, and molded them to one's specifications before setting them loose and watching the pupil act on one's teachings. It's a feeling of creation, control, and wonder, the knowledge that one has created this great and glorious thing—and if one has done the job exceptionally well, then the student will outshine the master. This is immortality and power, and this is what vizier dragons chase.

Vizier dragons are primarily concerned with the education and cultivation of people. People fascinate vizier dragons in all their riotous, contradictory complexity. Why do some people excel, and others falter and fail? Why does one person become a saint and the next a tyrant? Why do some become legends in their own time, while others labor in ignominy?

Sovereign Archdragon.name: 至古君龙 Sovereign Archdragon

Sanctified Sight.name: 祝圣视觉 Sanctified Sight
Sanctified Sight.description: 君龙能够自动侦测出一个生物，效果或物品是否受祝，以及其为圣洁还是邪秽。

Gleaming Armor.name: 耀目宝甲 Gleaming Armor
Gleaming Armor.description:
频率 每小时一次

效果 君龙的护甲散发出金光。君龙在AC上获得+2状态加值，并获得对酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰和音波伤害的25点抗力。@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]范围内每个敌人都必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:46]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]。所有这些效果持续到龙的下个回合结束。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Mentalist Counterspell.name: 反制心灵法术 Mentalist Counterspell
Mentalist Counterspell.description:
触发 君龙成为他能意识到的心灵法术的目标

效果 君龙立即尝试反制触发效果（反制调整值[[/r 1d20+32 #Counteract]]{+32}，反制环级10环级）。

Violent Retort.name: 以牙还牙 Violent Retort
Violent Retort.description:
触发 一个君龙触及范围内的生物对龙造成了重击

效果 在应用了对龙的所有重击效果之后，君龙对该生物进行一次爪抓或尾扫打击。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
君龙可以变为任意大型或更小体型类人生物的外貌。这不会改变其速度或打击的攻击和伤害加值，但可能会改变其打击造成的伤害类型（通常为钝击）。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 君龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，君龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当君龙在一次打击中造成重击时，他充能其君王训诫。

Inspire Envoy.name: 激励特使 Inspire Envoy
Inspire Envoy.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 君龙选择一名凡人并赐予其威严的祝福，以换取该生物去完成一项特殊指令，例如击败暴君或保护圣地。如果该生物同意，直到其下次每日准备，它在由龙选择的以下一项上获得+3状态加值：攻击骰，AC，或以下全部：察觉，意志豁免和基于魅力的技能检定。龙可以解消此增益，如果凡人胆敢违抗龙的指令，他就会迅速这么做。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.YDJnC3Bdc2GI6hX5]

Sovereign's Rebuke.name: 君王训诫 Sovereign's Rebuke
Sovereign's Rebuke.description: 君龙释放一道充满精神能量的吼叫，对@Template[type:cone|distance:60]范围造成@Damage[24d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:46|basic]豁免）。豁免失败的生物还将陷入1轮@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]（或大失败时被龙@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]1轮）。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sovereign's Rebuke]]{1d4轮}内再次使用君王训诫。

Sovereign Archdragon.publicNotes:
据说曾有纯粹的土元素龙类存在。这些帝龙如同其他元素龙一样来到物质宇宙，生老病死，其躯体最终化作大陆的一部分。正如火元素化作熔岩，木元素化作森林，水元素汇成海洋湖泊，金元素化作珍贵矿脉，土元素终成大地、岩石与山岳。依循逻辑推演，若当今世间尚存此类环境与存在，那么土元素龙必然存在。抑或曾在远古时代存在过。

然而如今帝龙之中，唯有君龙在死亡时会留下蛇形骸骨，而非岩石、石块或泥土。龙的内在施法能力，对未加热铁器的弱点等特征，强烈暗示它们与元素之土存在关联。其余能力则几乎与土元素无关，反而聚焦于玄学上的精魂与心灵的奥秘。

关于君龙为何演变至此，尚无明确解释。有人推测这或许是某种为实现个人野心的交易，他们从选拔统治者的角色变为了统治者本身。也有人猜测天夏大地曾在过去遭受腐化，土元素龙为自保而背弃了元素本性。或许它们也曾化作圣天龙，却因凡间未现合格统治者而重返尘世。

Sky Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: 青年天龙施法者 Sky Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Sky Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
当帝龙初临物质宇宙时，每条龙都与自身诞生的元素位面紧密相连。随着元素领主之间的战争愈演愈烈，仁慈的领主们接连陨落，金元素位面与木元素位面相继自我封闭。对于源自腐蚀核心（Corroded Core）的龙族而言，它们的生存根基已然岌岌可危。这些龙类在山巅间辗转流亡，逃离妖怪征战的彼时危险的天夏。最终，当它们抵达沉沦山脉（Chenlun）、罗网山脉（Gossamer）、格桑山脉（Kelsang）、金山（Kimu）、库兰山脉（Kullan）、巨人山脉（Kyojin）与天境之墙（Wall of Heaven）时，天界生灵回应了它们的求救。当龙族失去金元素的支撑，天族便以神圣赐福与精粹相补。随着本质蜕变，这些龙从而得以延续。久而久之，它们因贴近苍穹、侍奉神明而得名。昔日的金元素龙的岁月，终成褪色的记忆与创世神话，唯有天龙自身仍铭记于心。

天龙以永恒的侍奉来感恩。部分天龙吸收了所侍奉神祇的位面能量，变得庞大而强大；其中许多成为现代圣天龙的始祖。其余天龙则留在物质宇宙中，终生修习信仰，臻于生命与灵魂的神术技艺。真正能独立行动，运用非神术力量执行无关伟大意志任务的天龙实属罕见。即便如此，这些少数天龙仍保留着隐居沉思的本性，至少在年轻岁月里如此。

随着金元素位面的回归，关于天龙与该位面关联的谨慎探询悄然展开。有人猜测是否能寻得幸存的远亲。这些探询并非出于好奇，而是迫于现实需求。虽然天龙因天界生灵的加持获得了自保之力，却未能解决元素匮乏的问题。更糟的是，即便腐蚀核心已然回归，这种匮乏仍在持续。无论是从蛋里孵化还是自然分娩，天龙雏龙降生时都脆弱不堪，鳞片稀疏甚至全然不长。即便置身于大型矿藏或盐脉（作为金元素能量的磁体与蓄能库）之中，幼龙的鳞片也需历经数十年淬炼，方能坚韧到足以离开巢穴的程度。如果金元素位面存在这些问题的答案——无论是适合作为安全的产崽或育雏的场所，还是恢复龙类吸收环境元素能量的能力——确保所有天龙掌握此法并把握机会，实为当务之急。

Mist Vision.name: 迷雾视觉 Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: 雾与浓雾不会削弱天龙的视觉；其忽视由雾和迷雾造成的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态。

Fed by Earth.name: 由土而生 Fed by Earth
Fed by Earth.description: 如果天龙成为土法术或效果的目标，他会将鳞片中的矿物质结晶化，形成折射或散射光线的外层以进行伪装。在1分钟内，天龙在飞行时处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]。

Perfected Flight.description: 天龙不花费动作便可悬停在原地，并且他在用于空中机动的所有特技检定上自动成功。
Perfected Flight.name: 完美飞行 Perfected Flight

Steel Lightning Breath.name: 钢电吐息 Steel Lightning Breath
Steel Lightning Breath.description: 天龙向40尺内射出一个电球，对@Template[type:burst|distance:20]范围造成@Damage[5d12[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic]豁免）。其不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Steel Lightning Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用钢电吐息。

Countered by Fire.name: 为火所克 Countered by Fire
Countered by Fire.description:
如果天龙受到火焰伤害，他们体内的金元素魔法会被回火。直到其下个回合结束，其在攻击骰和AC上承受-1环境减值，且颚咬打击不再造成电击伤害。如果天龙使用了钢电吐息，则限制结束。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.a4bZrBNL17zPjDiH]

Decelerating Dodge.name: Decelerating Dodge
Decelerating Dodge.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with a ranged Strike or spell attack

Effect The dragon slows time to evade, gaining concealment against the triggering attack.

Immortal.name: Immortal
Immortal.description: Time dragons age, but don't die from old age.

Temporal Eddies.name: Temporal Eddies
Temporal Eddies.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon Strides or Flies up to their Speed, leaving behind afterimages of their past and future selves in each space they move through. Until the end of the dragon's next turn, they can use any of these spaces as the origin of their Strikes, spells, and other abilities. Observers also perceive the dragon in all these spaces simultaneously and must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:15] to target the dragon or fail to affect it. A creature can take a concentrate action to attempt to identify the dragon's true location with a successful @Check[will|dc:34] save.

Starflight.name: Starflight
Starflight.description: A time dragon can survive in outer space and fly at incredible speed, taking [[/r 3d20]] hours to reach a destination within the same solar system or [[/r 3d20]] days for destinations beyond. They can carry up to six passengers of at least one size category smaller than themself, protecting them from the void of space.

Timeshift Breath.name: Timeshift Breath
Timeshift Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a blast of temporal energy, warping time in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60]. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save. The dragon can't use Timeshift Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Timeshift Breath]]{1d4 rounds}. Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature shifts briefly forward in time, vanishing and reappearing at the beginning of the time dragon's next turn in the same location (or an adjacent space if their former location is occupied), unaware that any time has passed. While timeshifted, time pauses for that creature, and it cannot take actions or be affected by anything else.

Time Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Time Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Time Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Some time dragons would say time is a deep well, with those who explore it dipping cups into the waters at varying depths. Others might say that time is a shattered mirror, each shard reflecting discrete points that can be viewed simultaneously. None would say time is a firm onward march of linear progress, moving inexorably to a predetermined result. Time is fluid and ever-shifting, and time dragons dedicate themselves to protecting its flow.

Although safeguarding the natural temporal order is a mission all time dragons devote themselves to, they go about it in different ways. Staunch traditionalists oppose any meddling with the timestream whatsoever, even to repair damage caused by prior attempts to influence it, viewing this as doing more harm than good. They believe mortals are too short-sighted to responsibly use time magic and might appear without warning to slay those they believe pose a threat to the timestream. Other time dragons attempt to guide the course of events along the path they believe correct while preventing external tampering, often focusing on particular regions, areas of interest, or even individuals

Rime Archdragon.name: Rime Archdragon

Radiate Cold.name: Radiate Cold
Radiate Cold.description:
20 feet. The adult rime dragon's presence lowers the temperature around them. A creature who enters or begins their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature begins to shiver as the biting cold affects it. It takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn.

Failure The creature's body temperature begins to drop. It takes a –10-foot status penalty to their Speeds and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure Ice begins to form on the creature. It's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} ([[/act escape dc=37]]) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until the end of their its turn.

Blizzard Breath.name: Blizzard Breath
Blizzard Breath.description: The dragon breathes out a gust of frost and ice that deals @Damage[15d8[cold]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). They can't use Blizzard Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Blizzard Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Arctic Hunter.name: Arctic Hunter
Arctic Hunter.description: A rime dragon's natural camouflage allows them to [[/act hide]] in arctic terrain without cover. A rime dragon also ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from ice and snow and doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.

Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
Snow Vision.description: Snow doesn't impair the rime dragon's vision; they ignore concealment from snowfall.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Piercing Ice.name: Piercing Ice
Piercing Ice.description:
Requirements The dragon has temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield

Effect The dragon launches the collected ice shards from its scales in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], dealing @Damage[8d6[piercing],4d6[cold]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). The dragon then loses the AC bonus and temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Blizzard Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Rime Shield.description:
Requirements The rime dragon's last action was to Fly at least 40 feet

Effect Water vapor collected on the dragon's scales quickly freezes over. The dragon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and 20 temporary Hit Points that last until the end of the dragon's next turn.
Rime Shield.name: Rime Shield

Rime Archdragon.publicNotes:
Rime dragons are the embodiment of the frigid cold and ice. These hardy creatures have adapted to harsh arctic climates, able to survive indefinitely in sub-zero temperatures. Rime dragons are shades of white and pale blue that perfectly camouflage them in their natural habitat, resembling glaciers or mounds of snow when curled up. They can break through large slabs of ice and dive into frozen waters in search of prey. Due to their natural lower body temperature, they can slow their digestive tract, which allows them to live a long time on little food. Large prey—such as whales, caribou, or moose—offer the best sustenance, but they aren't picky when it's time to eat.

Rime dragons have a deep curiosity for things hidden and lost in the ice. The ocean's currents bring all kinds of artifacts from across the world to their frigid waters. Self-described caretakers and scholars, rime dragons search the arctic regions for ancient antiquities. Rime dragons with an academic interest in archaeology peer into glaciers for pieces of civilizations both recent and ancient, which they preserve in their lairs. Others might search for fossils or preserved corpses. Rime dragons also have an interest in more biological aspects of the world. As preservers of life, some of these dragons collect flora to log and study, and they protect endangered species by using low temperatures to conserve them. They also act as paleopathologists, studying ancient diseases that could cause havoc if they were brought back to a populace unknowingly. These they carefully contain while researching mitigation strategies should the pathogens be reintroduced to the world.

Regent's Glower.name: Regent's Glower
Regent's Glower.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon focuses their weighty gaze upon their assailant, filling their foe with dread. The triggering creature takes @Damage[6d8[mental]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:35|basic] save. Any creature who fails the save also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

Bathygenic Barrage.name: Bathygenic Barrage
Bathygenic Barrage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon uses Pressurized Pool three times. None of the bursts can overlap.

Benthic Bite.name: Benthic Bite
Benthic Bite.description: A creature who takes damage from a brine dragon's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round.

Crushing Breath.name: Crushing Breath
Crushing Breath.description: The dragon spews a @Template[type:line|distance:100] of pressurized water that deals @Damage[18d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save. A creature that fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. The dragon can't use Crushing Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Crushing Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Tidal Surge.name: Tidal Surge
Tidal Surge.description: The dragon sweeps their wings, creating a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of buffeting water that deals @Damage[12d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:38|basic] save. Each unattended object and each creature that fails the save is also pushed away from the dragon 20 feet (30 feet on a critical failure) and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The dragon can't use Tidal Surge again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Tidal Surge]]{1d4 rounds}.

Aquatic Echolocation.name: Aquatic Echolocation
Aquatic Echolocation.description: A brine dragon can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge Crushing Breath.

Pressurized Pool.name: Pressurized Pool
Pressurized Pool.description: The dragon expels a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] of pressurized water within 120 feet that lasts for 1 minute. A creature other than a brine dragon that enters or begins their turn within a burst must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] save or become encumbered until the beginning of their next turn.

Brine Dragon (Ancient).name: Brine Dragon (Ancient)
Brine Dragon (Ancient).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Gruesome Cuts.name: Gruesome Cuts
Gruesome Cuts.description: Persistent bleed damage inflicted by the dragon, even magically, carries a poison that inhibits clotting. Healing the creature to full HP doesn't end the bleeding, the DC of any flat check to recover is 2 higher, and the DC to stop the bleeding using Administer First Aid is 40. This poison can be counteracted (DC 41), and successfully doing so ends the bleeding.

Dragon’s Teeth.name: Dragon’s Teeth
Dragon’s Teeth.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect A vorpal archdragon never fights alone save by choice, for within their pinioned wings an army of armaments stands ever ready. With a snap of their wings, the archdragon rains blades across the battlefield in a @Template[type:line|distance:100], dealing @Damage[22d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save. These blades are partially animated and remain in the area for 10 minutes, during which time the area is considered greater difficult terrain for every creature except for the archdragon. Any creature that enters the area or begins their turn within or adjacent to this area takes @Damage[(4d8+16)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save).

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Cutting Rebuke.name: Cutting Rebuke
Cutting Rebuke.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's chin blade that the dragon can see makes a Strike against the dragon

Effect The dragon makes a chin blade Strike against the triggering creature.

Feast of Blood.name: Feast of Blood
Feast of Blood.description: The dragon inhales sharply, pulling blood from wounds and into the dragon's maw. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] takes their current persistent bleed damage plus @Damage[14d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:45|basic] save). The dragon gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the greatest amount of void damage dealt to a single creature this way. The dragon can't use Feast of Blood again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Feast of Blood]]{1d4 rounds}.

Heads Will Roll!.name: Heads Will Roll!
Heads Will Roll!.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The vorpal dragon swoops across the battlefield, sweeping their axe-bladed tail through their foes. The dragon Flies twice; at any point during this movement, the dragon makes up to two chin blade Strikes, each against a different creature within reach. The dragon's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until all Strikes are made.

Vorpal Binding.name: Vorpal Binding
Vorpal Binding.description:
The vorpal dragon beheads its foes—sometimes without killing them. A vorpal dragon's chin blade Strikes count as having the vorpal weapon property rune for the purpose of weaknesses. Whenever the vorpal dragon critically succeeds on a chin blade Strike, it deals an additional @Damage[6d6[persistent,bleed]] damage, which can be ended normally.

When a vorpal dragon rolls a natural 20 on a chin blade Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save; this has the incapacitation trait. On a failure, the creature is beheaded. A creature beheaded this way does not automatically die; instead, their head and body live on, disconnected but mystically linked, with the head controlling the body from afar. A beheaded creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} as they attempt to coordinate movements from an unusual perspective, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 4} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} if their head can't perceive their body from its location. These conditions are suppressed if the body holds its head, and don't apply to actions performed exclusively by the head, mind, or voice. If the body is killed, the head can live on, but destroying the head kills the body as well. This effect can be ended only by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2Vkd1IxylPceUAAF]{Regenerate}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Hnc7eGi7vyZenAIm]{Breath of Life}, or any effect that restores life to the dead; only effects that restore an incomplete corpse will replace an absent or destroyed body, however. The dragon can choose to instantly kill a creature when beheading them, as per the vorpal weapon property rune's activation.

Vorpal Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Vorpal Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Vorpal Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Vorpal dragons were not created by some ancient divinity nor born of a specific realm or force. Their birth was an arcane accident, the result of unstoppable magic contacting immovable beast. In unknowable ancient ages, the first jabberwock was wrought by the Eldest and the first vorpal sword was wrought in turn to slay the beast. When that very first blade went snicker-snack for the very first time, tasting the primeval lifeblood of the draconic Tane, the first vorpal dragon was born.

Vorpal dragons are most notorious for their keen vorpal magic. Even the least of these dragons can sever a foe's head in a single lucky stroke. Unusually, however, the subject survives as a bipartite creature: a headless body controlled by a detached head that still thinks and speaks, and which can outlive said body's destruction. It's not uncommon for would-be dragonslayers to be sent home carrying their own heads under one arm as a lesson in humility. The unluckier ones, alas, may be kept as trophies—and, in a very literal sense, conversation pieces—while the dragon devours their greater portion. Some might even wear their favorite severed heads as a macabre necklace.

Stormcrown Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Stormcrown Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)

Smooth Flying.name: Smooth Flying
Smooth Flying.description: The stormcrown dragon doesn't fall if they don't Fly during their turn, and they're unaffected by strong winds or similar effects unless they choose to be.

Motionsense.name: Motionsense
Motionsense.description: A stormcrown dragon can detect the movement of nearby creatures through vibration and air movement. This precise sense works only against creatures and objects that moved in the previous round.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Superconductor.name: Superconductor
Superconductor.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack or spell

Effect The dragon uses the displaced air or magical trajectory of the attack as a channel for its electrical energy. The dragon attempts a storm bolt Strike against the attacker, regardless of range.

Coronal Cloak.name: Coronal Cloak
Coronal Cloak.description: When the dragon spends an action to Hover while in stormy weather, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} until they move or until the beginning of their next turn, whichever comes first.

Galvanic Barrage.name: Galvanic Barrage
Galvanic Barrage.description: The dragon exhales a massive bolt of lightning at one creature within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[5d12[electricity]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save. The lightning then arcs to a creature of the dragon's choice within 30 feet of the previous target with the same effect. The dragon can't target the same creature more than once, and they must have line of effect to all targets. The bolt can continue to arc this way until the dragon runs out of targets or until a target critically succeeds at their save. The dragon can't use Galvanic Barrage again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Galvanic Barrage]]{1d4 rounds}.

Stormcrown Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Heralds of—and heralded by—the primal forces of thunder and lightning, stormcrown dragons meld the majesty of fierce storms and mighty dragons. Driven by emotion and curiosity, these mercurial dragons can change from friend to foe or threatening to thoughtful in mere moments.

While no strangers to the personality traits for which dragons are well-known—pride, imperiousness, desire for lovely things, and so on—stormcrown dragons are by nature gregarious, even jovial. Indeed, these dragons often mingle with local communities or extend invitations for everything from raucous feasts to elegant soirees. To offend a stormcrown dragon, however, is most unwise. Insults to the dragon's hospitality or friendship, assertions of authority, and demands on them are all likely to elicit a tempestuous response, in every sense of the word. Cursed metamorphosis is a personal favorite of older stormcrown dragons for the disrespectful and demanding, forcing shapes on them more befitting their insignificance. A stormcrown dragon's fury often passes as suddenly as it arises, however, particularly when dulled by a suitable display of contrition.

Woodland Passage.description: 森龙忽视由非魔法植物和真菌形成的困难地形和高等困难地形，例如灌木，藤蔓和林下植被。
Woodland Passage.name: 林地通行 Woodland Passage

Fed by Water.name: 由水而生 Fed by Water
Fed by Water.description:
频率 每小时一次

触发 森龙成为一个水法术或效果的目标

效果 森龙获得30点临时生命值，持续1分钟。

Frightful Presence.name: 恐怖威压 Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description:
90尺，@Check[will|dc:27]。具有动物，真菌和植物特征的生物在豁免时承受-2环境减值。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Azure Swarm Breath.name: 蔚蓝虫群吐息 Azure Swarm Breath
Azure Swarm Breath.description: 森龙放出一群昆虫对@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围造成@Damage[10d6[piercing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）随后消散开来。豁免大失败的生物受到@Damage[1d6[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage]伤害。森龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Azure Swarm Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用蔚蓝虫群吐息。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Metal.name: 为金所克 Countered by Metal
Countered by Metal.description: 如果森龙受到来自金属物品或具有金特征效果的伤害，他将失去林地通行和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zlnXpME1T2uvn8Lr]直到其下个回合结束。

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 森龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，森龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当森龙在一次打击中造成重击时，他充能其蔚蓝虫群吐息。

Forest Dragon (Young).name: 青年森龙 Forest Dragon (Young)
Forest Dragon (Young).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Pin Shadow.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's claw uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Requirements The triggering creature is in bright light or dim light and has a shadow

Effect The dragon makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature. On a hit, the trigger creature also has its shadow pinned in place, restricting its movement. The creature treats the area of the dragon's aura as difficult terrain until it uses an Interact action to unpin its shadow. If the area was already difficult terrain, the creature treats it as greater difficult terrain.
Pin Shadow.name: Pin Shadow

Tenacious Shadows.name: Tenacious Shadows
Tenacious Shadows.description: Shadows fill attacker's eyes. Any creature that must attempt a flat check to target the dragon because of dim light must roll twice and use the worse result.

Umbral Pall.name: Umbral Pall
Umbral Pall.description: 120 feet. Shadows surround the dragon. The radius of all light from light sources and the areas of light spells in the aura are halved. The shadows also cling to creatures, making areas of dim light difficult terrain.

Devour Undead.name: Devour Undead
Devour Undead.description: The dragon's jaws Strikes have the benefit of a ghost touch property rune and deal an additional 8d6 force damage to undead.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges its Tenebrous Breath whenever it scores a critical hit with a Strike.

Drain Vigor.name: Drain Vigor
Drain Vigor.description:
When the dragon deals void damage to a living creature with its jaws Strike, the umbral dragon gains 20 temporary HP that last for 1 minute and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). Further damage dealt by the dragon's jaws Strike increases the drained condition value by 1 on a failed save (2 on a critical failure), to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wBFtXxByOza6N9hs]{Effect: Drain Vigor}

Hide in Shadows.name: Hide in Shadows
Hide in Shadows.description: The dragon can Hide in dim light even if they don't have cover.

Voidsense.name: Voidsense
Voidsense.description: The dragon can taste animating void energy, allowing them to sense creatures with void healing as a precise sense. It can also sense incorporeal creatures with void healing, like shadows, when they are inside solid objects.

Tenebrous Breath.name: Tenebrous Breath
Tenebrous Breath.description:
The umbral dragon exhales in one of two ways. They can't use Tenebrous Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Tenebrous Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Darkness (occult, void) The dragon breathes a blast of darkness that deals @Damage[24d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic|traits:occult,void] save). Undead creatures take @Damage[24d6[force]|options:area-damage]{force} damage instead of void damage.

  • Shadows (occult, shadow) The dragon breathes a blast of shadows in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60]. Each creature within the cone must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:46|traits:occult,shadow] save.

    Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

    Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} for 1 round.

    Failure The creature is enfeebled 4 for 1 minute.

Umbral Archdragon.name: Umbral Archdragon
Umbral Archdragon.publicNotes:
Stories across Golarion warn children about the monsters that dwell in the shadows, but no story captures the reality of the umbral dragon. Natives of the Netherworld, these occult dragons are at home in the darkness, using it to their advantage both in and out of battle. Umbral dragons rarely worry about fighting fairly, emerging from hiding to strike unwary foes and using their magical breath without compunction. Similarly, in social situations, they often remain in the shadows, operating through other creatures. Even in direct conversation, they frequently obscure their true intent, preferring to avoid ever being pinned down with a solid answer.

While umbral dragons are rarely altruistic, their preferred diet creates a strange dichotomy that attracts other creatures to them as a potential source of safety, especially in the Netherworld. While much of the multiverse sees undead as a dire threat, for umbral dragons, undead are a tasty snack. Umbral dragons find the flavor of necrotic flesh irresistible and the void energy of incorporeal undead a potent spice, making them one of the few creatures in existence known to hunt the unliving as a source of food.

Brine Archdragon.name: Brine Archdragon
Brine Archdragon.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Aquatic Echolocation.name: Aquatic Echolocation
Aquatic Echolocation.description: A brine dragon can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal

Decompression Sickness.name: Decompression Sickness
Decompression Sickness.description: 20 feet. After the dragon uses their Crushing Breath, the pressure of the depths surrounds them for 1 round. Any creature that leaves the aura during this time must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save or become dizzy and unbalanced from the sudden change in pressure, treating all squares as difficult terrain until the end of their next turn. Incorporeal creatures are immune to this aura.

Regent's Glower.name: Regent's Glower
Regent's Glower.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon focuses their weighty gaze upon their assailant, filling their foe with dread. The triggering creature takes @Damage[9d8[mental]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:42|basic] save. Any creature who fails the save also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

Crushing Breath.description: The dragon spews a @Template[type:line|distance:120] of pressurized water that deals @Damage[21d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save. A creature that fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. The dragon can't use Crushing Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Crushing Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
Crushing Breath.name: Crushing Breath

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Bathygenic Barrage.name: Bathygenic Barrage
Bathygenic Barrage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon uses Pressurized Pool three times. None of the bursts can overlap.

Benthic Bite.name: Benthic Bite
Benthic Bite.description: A creature who takes damage from a brine dragon's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} for 1 round.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge Crushing Breath.

Pressurized Pool.name: Pressurized Pool
Pressurized Pool.description: The dragon expels a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] of pressurized water within 120 feet that lasts for 1 minute. A creature other than a brine dragon that enters or begins their turn within a burst must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:42] save or become encumbered until the beginning of their next turn.

Tidal Surge.name: Tidal Surge
Tidal Surge.description: The dragon sweeps their wings, creating a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of buffeting water that deals @Damage[14d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save. Each unattended object and each creature that fails the save is also pushed away from the dragon 20 feet (30 feet on a critical failure) and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The dragon can't use Tidal Surge again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Tidal Surge]]{1d4 rounds}.

Umbral Pall.description: 90 feet. Shadows surround the dragon. The radius of all light from light sources and the areas of light spells in the aura are halved.
Umbral Pall.name: Umbral Pall

Devour Undead.name: Devour Undead
Devour Undead.description: The dragon's jaws Strikes have the benefit of a ghost touch property rune and deal an additional 3d6 force damage to undead.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges its Tenebrous Breath whenever it scores a critical hit with a Strike.

Tenebrous Breath.name: Tenebrous Breath
Tenebrous Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of darkness that deals @Damage[12d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save). Undead creatures take @Damage[12d6[force]|options:area-damage]{force} damage instead of void damage. The dragon can't use Tenebrous Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Tenebrous Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Voidsense.name: Voidsense
Voidsense.description: The dragon can taste animating void energy, allowing them to sense creatures with void healing as a precise sense. It can also sense incorporeal creatures with void healing, like shadows, when they are inside solid objects.

Pin Shadow.name: Pin Shadow
Pin Shadow.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's claw uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Requirements The triggering creature is in bright light or dim light and has a shadow

Effect The dragon makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature. On a hit, the trigger creature also has its shadow pinned in place, restricting its movement. The creature treats the area of the dragon's aura as difficult terrain until it uses an Interact action to unpin its shadow. If the area was already difficult terrain, the creature treats it as greater difficult terrain.

Umbral Dragon (Young).name: Umbral Dragon (Young)
Umbral Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
Stories across Golarion warn children about the monsters that dwell in the shadows, but no story captures the reality of the umbral dragon. Natives of the Netherworld, these occult dragons are at home in the darkness, using it to their advantage both in and out of battle. Umbral dragons rarely worry about fighting fairly, emerging from hiding to strike unwary foes and using their magical breath without compunction. Similarly, in social situations, they often remain in the shadows, operating through other creatures. Even in direct conversation, they frequently obscure their true intent, preferring to avoid ever being pinned down with a solid answer.

While umbral dragons are rarely altruistic, their preferred diet creates a strange dichotomy that attracts other creatures to them as a potential source of safety, especially in the Netherworld. While much of the multiverse sees undead as a dire threat, for umbral dragons, undead are a tasty snack. Umbral dragons find the flavor of necrotic flesh irresistible and the void energy of incorporeal undead a potent spice, making them one of the few creatures in existence known to hunt the unliving as a source of food.

Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of a Medium humanoid. This does not change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape

Magma Burrow.name: Magma Burrow
Magma Burrow.description: A magma dragon's burrow Speed functions only when the dragon is Burrowing through magma or molten lava.

Magma Tomb.name: Magma Tomb
Magma Tomb.description: The dragon spits a molten boulder at a target within 120 feet. This deals @Damage[12d6[fire],5d12[bludgeoning]] damage, with a @Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save. If the creature fails its save, it's encased in magma that instantly cools and has Hardness 10, HP 40, and BT 20. The encased creature can't breathe and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} ([[/act escape dc=40]]).

Pyroclastic Breath.name: Pyroclastic Breath
Pyroclastic Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of magma that deals @Damage[10d6[fire],5d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|basic|dc:40|options:area-effect]). They can't use Pyroclastic Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4#Recharge Pyroclastic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}

Volcanic Purge.name: Volcanic Purge
Volcanic Purge.description:
If the next action the dragon uses is Pyroclastic Breath, the magma clings to those it damages. Each creature that fails its save against Pyroclastic Breath takes @Damage[5d6[persistent,fire]] damage, and as long as it has this persistent fire damage, it also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7qoZauizAKfPIXeu]{Effect: Volcanic Purge}

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic
