A rune dragon can have any number of runes etched on its scales, though they typically have only a handful of runes etched on their scales at a time.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Retributive Rune.name: Retributive Rune
Retributive Rune.description:
Trigger A creature within 15 feet damages the rune dragon

Effect With a burst of runic magic, the rune dragon creates a detonating rune on the triggering creature and immediately causes it to detonate if it didn't automatically do so.

The rune dragon gains an additional reaction at the beginning of each of their turns that they can use only for a Retributive Rune.

Detonating Rune.name: Detonating Rune
Detonating Rune.description: The rune dragon's Strikes and abilities can leave a detonating rune on their targets. If a creature would receive a detonating rune while they already have one, instead of adding another rune, their current detonating rune activates, dealing @Damage[8d6[untyped]] damage to the target and expending the rune. The detonating rune's damage type matches the dragon's current Shifting Rune. A creature can use an Interact action to remove the rune. Detonating runes fade after 1 minute if not detonated.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Runic Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Entangling Rune.name: Entangling Rune
Entangling Rune.description: The rune dragon creates large trapping runes in 3 non-overlapping @Template[type:burst|distance:15]s within 60 feet. Creatures other than the dragon that enter a trapped space or end their turn in the trapped space activate the rune, causing it to entangle the creature. The creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:46] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 minute or until it Escapes. The rune can only trap a single creature at a time. The rune vanishes either when a creature succeeds against the rune, when a creature successfully Escapes the rune, or after 1 minute. A creature adjacent to the rune can use an Interact action to remove the rune.

Trail of Runes.name: Trail of Runes
Trail of Runes.description: The rune dragon Strides, leaving behind a collection of runes wherever it steps. The dragon chooses to leave behind either detonating runes or entangling runes. Every space that the dragon moves through, including spaces occupied by creatures, gains a rune. These runes automatically activate when a creature other than the rune dragon enters the space or ends its turn in the space. The runes can otherwise be removed or vanish like normal.

Runic Breath.name: Runic Breath
Runic Breath.description: The dragon launches hundreds of exploding runes that detonate upon impact, dealing @Damage[20d6[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic] save). The damage type of this ability is determined by Shifting Rune. Creatures that take damage from the breath also gain a detonating rune. The dragon can't use Runic Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Runic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Rune Archdragon.publicNotes: Rune dragons have an innate insight on the power of runes. Most rune dragons keep a variety of runes etched on their scales, which their bodies can magically empower. They typically don't cast spells themselves, instead relying on their ability to create runes on the fly to produce desired effects. A rune dragon often refers to their hoard as their library, as it's full of important historical texts, plays, speeches, textbooks, and spellbooks written by people of different cultures in a variety of languages. While they can often speak a language with the aid of magic, they much prefer to learn languages in the context of their speakers so they can grasp the nuances hidden within the syntax and the magic within their symbols.
Rune Archdragon.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Underworld Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Underworld Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)

Fed by Wood.name: Fed by Wood
Fed by Wood.description:
When an underworld dragon is struck by a weapon made primarily of wood or affected by a spell with the plant or wood trait, the dragon’s internal fiery essences are stoked with the added fuel. Their Exploding Red Breath recharges, and the fire damage from the dragon’s jaws deals an additional die of damage until the end of the dragon’s next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4FMFRlEC923CnLI7]{Effect: Fed by Wood}

Exploding Red Breath.name: Exploding Red Breath
Exploding Red Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of fire that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 40 feet, dealing @Damage[7d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[1d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage] damage. The dragon can't use Exploding Red Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Exploding Red Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair an underworld dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Countered by Water.name: Countered by Water
Countered by Water.description:
If the underworld dragon takes damage from a spell with the cold or water trait, the elemental magic of fire within them is momentarily dampened. Until the end of their next turn, they take a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, and their jaws Strikes don't deal fire damage. This limitation ends if the dragon uses Exploding Red Breath.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.81XYZZ3H0GL8thdQ]{Effect: Countered by Water}

Adamantine Claws.name: Adamantine Claws
Adamantine Claws.description:
Frequency one per hour

Effect The dragon infuses their body with adamantine. For the next minute, their melee Strikes are treated as adamantine and ignore half the Hardness of any object hit.

Underworld Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
If there are any imperial dragons who benefited from moving out of their native elemental plane, it's underworld dragons. Once related solely to the element of fire, early underworld dragons harnessed elemental forces through arcane means for reasons no longer remembered. With each subsequent generation, both their arcane power and mastery over the elements grew. Their efforts were later bolstered by their studies in alchemy, which allowed dragons to cultivate themselves even further with various mutagens and elixirs.

Today, though their nature is primarily still connected with the element of fire, an underworld dragon can consume wood with ease, threaten entire regions with quakes, lay claim to the minerals and gems in the rocks and stone, and die to form volcanoes that create more land masses. Some even flippantly snort at the lapping waves of the sea, not fearing any retaliation from the sea dragon nations nor their kings. Though their powers might be relatively weaker than another imperial dragon of the same age, their mastery of many elements and the arcane arts makes underworld dragons formidable opponents.

Shrapnel Splash.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee weapon or unarmed attack

Effect The dragon's blood forms into hard spheres as it erupts from the wound, battering the attacker. The creature who dealt the triggering damage takes @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save.
Shrapnel Splash.name: Shrapnel Splash

Force Pulse.name: Force Pulse
Force Pulse.description:
1 to 3

The dragon emits pulses of energy that radiates outward in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10], dealing @Damage[(1d6+1)[force]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save).

For each action spent, a new pulse of energy is created and each subsequent pulse after the first is 5 feet larger than the previous one.

Scattershot.description: The dragon exhales a cloud of small balls of pure energy that deal @Damage[(5d4+5)[force]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] with no save. The dragon can't use Scattershot again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Scattershot]]{1d4 rounds}.
Scattershot.name: Scattershot

Ironsense.name: Ironsense
Ironsense.description: The dragon can detect the presence of iron and other ferrous metals as a precise sense at the listed range.

Arcane Whirlwind.name: Arcane Whirlwind
Arcane Whirlwind.description:
15 feet.

A vortex of fist-sized balls of pure magic swirls around the dragon. Air within the emanation is difficult terrain for Flying creatures other than the dragon. A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn within the aura takes @Damage[4d6[force]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save).

Barrage Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Barrage Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Barrage Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
To the uninitiated, spellcasting is an art for those with iron wills, people who reach out and grab hold of the fundamental laws of the universe and bend them to their whim. It takes discipline, study, and above all else, it takes control. Fail to control the very building blocks of reality and everything could fall apart.

Those who have even dabbled in the arcane arts know that this is nonsense. Magic is chaos, and channeling arcane forces is less akin to exerting one's will over the world and more like surfing on a bolt of lightning through a world-shaking storm and hoping to steer it without falling off. Spellcasting is barely contained panic, a lance of adrenaline, the constant danger of burning oneself out of existence. And the more powerful someone becomes, the more real this danger is.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Sweltering Heat.name: Sweltering Heat
Sweltering Heat.description: 10 feet. Each creature that ends its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} while it remains in the aura.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Exploding Red Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Exploding Red Breath.name: Exploding Red Breath
Exploding Red Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of fire that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:40] within 75 feet, dealing @Damage[22d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[4d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage] damage. The dragon can't use Exploding Red Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Exploding Red Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Scorch Earth.name: Scorch Earth
Scorch Earth.description: The dragon plunges their body into the ground, Burrows up to their burrow Speed, and then scorches the land within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]. Creatures underground or on the surface in the area take @Damage[10d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save). A creature that critically fails also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute.

Volcanic Fumes.name: Volcanic Fumes
Volcanic Fumes.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Toxic smoke erupts from the dragon in a 30-feet emanation. All creatures within the area take @Damage[6d12[fire]] damage and @Damage[6d12[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save). The dragon can Sustain the emanation, and any creature that ends their turn in the area without holding their breath takes @Damage[6d12[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save); this is an inhaled poison effect.

Fed by Wood.name: Fed by Wood
Fed by Wood.description:
When an underworld dragon is struck by a weapon made primarily of wood or affected by a spell with the plant or wood trait, the dragon’s internal fiery essences are stoked with the added fuel. Their Exploding Red Breath recharges, and the fire damage from the dragon’s jaws deals an additional die of damage until the end of the dragon’s next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4FMFRlEC923CnLI7]{Effect: Fed by Wood}

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair an underworld dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Countered by Water.name: Countered by Water
Countered by Water.description:
If the underworld dragon takes damage from a spell with the cold or water trait, the elemental magic of fire within them is momentarily dampened. Until the end of their next turn, they take a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, and their jaws Strikes don't deal fire damage. This limitation ends if the dragon uses Exploding Red Breath.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.81XYZZ3H0GL8thdQ]{Effect: Countered by Water}

Adamantine Claws.name: Adamantine Claws
Adamantine Claws.description:
Frequency one per hour

Effect The dragon infuses their body with adamantine. For the next minute, their melee Strikes are treated as adamantine and ignore half the Hardness of any object hit.

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: The dragon makes one claw Strike and one tail Strike in either order, each against the same target. If either Strike hits, the dragon can attempt to Grab the target with that limb as a free action. The dragon can have up to three creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} at a time; one in each of their front claws, and a last with their tail.

Underworld Archdragon.name: Underworld Archdragon
Underworld Archdragon.publicNotes:
If there are any imperial dragons who benefited from moving out of their native elemental plane, it's underworld dragons. Once related solely to the element of fire, early underworld dragons harnessed elemental forces through arcane means for reasons no longer remembered. With each subsequent generation, both their arcane power and mastery over the elements grew. Their efforts were later bolstered by their studies in alchemy, which allowed dragons to cultivate themselves even further with various mutagens and elixirs.

Today, though their nature is primarily still connected with the element of fire, an underworld dragon can consume wood with ease, threaten entire regions with quakes, lay claim to the minerals and gems in the rocks and stone, and die to form volcanoes that create more land masses. Some even flippantly snort at the lapping waves of the sea, not fearing any retaliation from the sea dragon nations nor their kings. Though their powers might be relatively weaker than another imperial dragon of the same age, their mastery of many elements and the arcane arts makes underworld dragons formidable opponents.

Best Wishes.name: Best Wishes
Best Wishes.description: 30 feet. Being near a wish dragon gives other creatures a greater sense of what they truly wish for, bolstering their sense of purpose while also distracting them from the task at hand. Creatures in the aura take a –1 status penalty to Perception but gain a +2 status bonus to Will saving throws against mental effects. The wish dragon can't gain the benefit of their own aura or other actions that use the aura, and they can choose to exclude any creatures from any benefit of the aura or action that uses the aura.

Wished Away.name: Wished Away
Wished Away.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect The dragon wishes not to be hurt by this attack, gaining resistance 25 to all damage against the triggering attack.

Breath of Loss.name: Breath of Loss
Breath of Loss.description: The dragon breathes a warm, gentle breeze of mist that creates the feeling of when deepest desires are achieved. As the breeze dissipates, the feeling of loss overwhelms creatures' senses, dealing @Damage[19d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[will|dc:41] save). A creature that critically fails its save is also consumed with the memory of the moment and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}. The wish dragon can't use Breath of Loss again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath of Loss]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Wish You Would.name: Wish You Would
Wish You Would.description:
Requirements An illusion from Wish Come True is active

Effect The dragon targets one creature within 200 feet currently stupefied by Wish Come True, making them believe that the object of their desires is under attack from all those around them and the dragon is the only one they can trust. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:40] Save or they become controlled by the dragon for 1 minute. The target may attempt a new save at the end of each of their turns. If the illusion from Wish Come True dissipates, their controlled state immediately ends.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Destructive Wish.name: Destructive Wish
Destructive Wish.description:
Requirements An illusion from Wish Come True is currently active

Effect The wish dragon Dismisses the illusion of Wish Come True, which shatters into magical fragments, dealing @Damage[9d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:41|basic] save to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:50] of the illusion.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Breath of Loss whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Wish Come True.name: Wish Come True
Wish Come True.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon creates an illusion in an unoccupied square within 60 feet that appears to all other creatures that can see it to be the manifestation of their deepest material desire. This has the effects of illusory object (though the illusion might appear to be a creature to certain people) that last for 10 minutes. The wish dragon can Dismiss the illusion. Each non-wish dragon creature who begins their turn within 200 feet in line of sight of the illusion must attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save. If any creature within reach of the illusion Interacts to touch it, the illusion ends and that creature is invigorated, gaining 2d8 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature disbelieves the illusion and becomes temporarily immune to Wish Come True for 1 hour.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Wish Dragon (Ancient).name: Wish Dragon (Ancient)
Wish Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
What is a wish? A wish dragon would call it the truest expression of self—each individual wish reveals something of deep importance to the wisher, and no two wishes are ever quite the same. Whether the wish is one of creation or destruction, justice or vengeance, love or hate, wish dragons seek to understand what makes it important to the wisher and view their ability to make it a reality as a gift that helps them make sense of the world.

To a wish dragon, learning what someone wishes for is the beginning of a conversation, granting them that wish is a gift, and watching what they do with it is a reward. They take each part of this journey seriously and spend much of their lives moving among other ancestries to better understand what others want and need, especially during their younger years. While they view this mission as a righteous one, it can become all-consuming, and some have been known to lose all sense of themselves in their quest to bring about the dreams and desires of those around them.

Sea Archragon.name: 至古海龙 Sea Archragon

Draconic Momentum.description: 当龙在一次打击中造成重击时，它充能其黑水吐息。
Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum

Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 水波感知（模糊）60尺 Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Earth.name: 为土所克 Countered by Earth
Countered by Earth.description: 如果海龙成为具有土特征的法术的目标，液化将会结束，他不能使用之直到其下个回合结束。

Fed by Metal.name: 由金而生 Fed by Metal
Fed by Metal.description:
当海龙被具有金特征的法术或生物的无武装打击，或金属武器伤害时，其鳞片会发生变化，这会赋予他在AC上+2物品加值直到其下个回合开始。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.OMJnZspk5YHai8yn]

Liquefy.name: 液化 Liquefy
Liquefy.description:
触发 龙受到火焰伤害

效果 龙瞬间变成水同时维持其形状。他获得火焰伤害抗力25（包括对抗触发效果时），直到其下个回合结束。

Vortex.name: 涡流 Vortex
Vortex.description: 60尺。灵光范围内，与龙处于同一水体的水对于没有水特征的生物游泳时来说视作困难地形。

Black Water Breath.name: 黑水吐息 Black Water Breath
Black Water Breath.description: 龙向80尺内射出一个对@Template[burst|distance:40]范围造成@Damage[21d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害的水球（@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。半径内所有非魔法火焰会被熄灭。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4轮}内再次使用黑水吐息。

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和尾扫打击，每次对抗相同目标。如果任意一次打击命中，龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]目标。

Hyponatremia.name: 低血钠症 Hyponatremia
Hyponatremia.description: 一个受到来自海龙颚咬打击伤害的活物必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:38]豁免，否则会因为体内激增的水量而陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}。

Tidal Wave.name: 潮涌 Tidal Wave
Tidal Wave.description:
频率 每10分钟一次

效果 龙拍打自己的身体，向外发出一道滔天巨浪。这道波浪对@Template[type:emanation|distance:90]范围造成@Damage[11d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害。区域内每个生物必须尝试一次@Check[reflex|dc:42]豁免。区域内的构造物和无主物体无需豁免承受全额伤害。

大成功 该生物不受伤害但被推离龙30尺。

成功 该生物受到一半伤害并被推离龙60尺。

失败 该生物受到全额伤害并被推离龙120尺，并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

大失败 同失败但受到双倍伤害。

Typhoon Fling.name: 台风翱翔 Typhoon Fling
Typhoon Fling.description:
频率 每小时一次

效果 龙飞行至多其飞行速度一半的距离。龙路径上10尺内所有生物必须尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:42]豁免，否则被向上吹飞到空中120尺，然后坠落，并受到相应的坠落伤害。已经处于空中的生物，其坠落距离需要加上当前高度。

Sea Archragon.publicNotes:
海帝龙与水元素相连，掌管着雨水、风暴、江河与海洋。他们栖息于天夏文明的附近，随时准备协助凡间事务以证明自身价值。对某些海龙而言，在天气与奥术知识方面提供帮助是职责所在。对另一些则不过是获取珍贵贡品或美味佳肴的动机。前来求见者皆热切献礼，因传说海龙欢愉时，雨水便会柔和丰沛。反之，若他们愤怒时，风暴将肆虐无情。

尽管天夏人普遍如此认为，但文明绝非受制于海龙的摆布，因为大多数海龙都是王国的臣子，宣誓协助凡人。绝大多数海龙都是四海龙王之一的臣子，这些龙王的领地或联合王国分别坐落于因拜罗洋（Embaral Ocean），象牙海（Ivory Sea），御海洋（Okaiyo Ocean），颂寂海（Songil Sea）。鉴于水元素位面本无原生海龙，有理论认为这些王国可能是从无际之海（Boundless Sea）大规模迁徙的残余势力。海龙自身的传说记载，远古之王曾为逃避元素领主凯利赞德里的迫害而立下誓言。尽管尚不确定咸水帝王是否仍在追杀海龙，但多数海龙仍恪守誓约作为其文化传承，或为纪念先祖荣光。
Sea Archragon.allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Executor Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
Legends state the first executor dragons formed from the rage-filled screams of Sarenrae during her struggle against the Rough Beast. In the face of an enemy even she had no hope of redeeming, the ever-compassionate Dawnflower allowed her divine fury to escape from her lips as she struck down the primordial god, and from this act of anathema, the first executor dragons were given form. Since that moment, executor dragons represent the full wrath of the gods. Divine in nature, executor dragons typically appear to punish those who have strayed so far from the path of their deity's edicts as to begin embracing the anathema. Due to their potent nature as weapons of the divine, executor dragons are generally drawn to target not a single misbehaving follower, but entire villages, cities, or towns that have turned their backs on their gods. Many of the gods prefer not to use executor dragons as part of their punishment of mortal transgressors, and instead keep them reserved for the days of apocalyptic battles.

Though many believe executor dragons are spawned from divine magic, they are fully biological creatures. Compelled by faith and devotion and disgusted by hypocrisy and base cruelty, executor dragons tend to live near human settlements, but rarely within them. They form small familial groups when young, but grow more independent as they age, seeking to claim territory uninhabited by other dragons. Their chosen lairs tend to be locations secreted away, either in the ruins of mountaintop monasteries or in the cavernous depths beneath abandoned places of worship. For the few executor dragons that live actively among non-draconic peoples, even fewer do so in their natural forms. They are sometimes found living disguised as traveling lay priests who bring healing and alms for the needy, choristers singing hymnals, wandering monastic scholars who ask challenging and conflicted questions about faith, or quiet church custodians who protect and beautify their chosen houses of worship. It's said that one or more executor dragons might have even taken up the defense of Kenebres after its near destruction at the hands of the Khorramzadeh, Storm King of the Worldwound.
Executor Dragon (Adult).name: Executor Dragon (Adult)

Divine Sanctification.name: Divine Sanctification
Divine Sanctification.description: Once an executor dragon reaches adulthood, they are expected to sanctify as either holy or unholy; they gain the corresponding trait and weakness 10 to the opposing sanctification.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Aura of Authority.name: Aura of Authority
Aura of Authority.description:
60 feet. The divine majesty of an adult executor dragon can't be denied. A creature that enters or begins their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's aura of authority for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} for 10 minutes.

Rage of the Divine.name: Rage of the Divine
Rage of the Divine.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect Raw divine power flashes through the executor dragon harming anyone who dares strike it so brazenly. The creature who dealt the triggering attack takes @Damage[6d8[spirit]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:30|basic] save.

Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change its Speed or attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape

Divine Utterance.name: Divine Utterance
Divine Utterance.description: The dragon screams the truth of the divine, dealing @Damage[11d8[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save). They can't use Divine Utterance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Divine Utterance]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Divine Utterance whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Phase Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Portal Strike.name: Portal Strike
Portal Strike.description: The dragon momentarily opens a small portal, and makes a claw Strike against a creature within 120 feet. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the Strike.

Redirect.description:
Trigger A creature within 100 feet casts a teleportation spell or uses a teleportation effect to appear within 100 feet

Effect The dragon determines the destination of the spell or effect. It must be within 100 feet of the dragon and in the spell's range, on the ground, and in a space with no hazards.
Redirect.name: Redirect

Shoo!.name: Shoo!
Shoo!.description:
Trigger An enemy within 15 feet damages the dragon

Effect The dragon teleports the creature up to 45 feet away. The destination must be on the ground and in a space with no hazards.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Unerring Location.name: Unerring Location
Unerring Location.description: The dragon automatically attempts to counteract any teleportation effect that targets them (counteract rank 10th, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+37 #Counteract]]{+37}). The dragon can choose to be affected normally instead. Other creatures targeted by the same effect remain affected normally.

Blinking Barrage.name: Blinking Barrage
Blinking Barrage.description: The dragon channels all their teleportation prowess into a remarkable series of blows. The dragon teleports up to 70 feet to a space adjacent to a creature and makes a claw Strike against that creature. The dragon can do this any number of times, teleporting to a different creature each time. Each attack counts toward their multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until all attacks have been made. The dragon cannot take actions with the teleportation trait again until the end of their next turn.

Dislocating Breath.name: Dislocating Breath
Dislocating Breath.description: The dragon exhales a swirl of energy that pulls creatures apart, dealing @Damage[21d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic] save). The dragon can teleport any creature that fails its save, teleporting that creature up to 60 feet (or twice as far on a critical failure) in any direction. The destination must be on the ground and in a space with no hazards. The dragon can't use Dislocating Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dislocating Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Phase Jump.name: Phase Jump
Phase Jump.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The dragon teleports up to 120 feet. If they are airborne, they maintain their momentum, and do not fall at the end of their turn, even if they didn't use an action to Fly.

Phase Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Phase Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Phase Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes: No place can contain a phase dragon or even hold their interest for long; their innate arcane connection ties them to teleportation and repositioning magic. Explorers and scholars, phase dragons move about at will, discovering new locales and the arcane secrets of teleportation. They frequently establish multiple lairs in far-flung places they repeatedly visit. Beyond the typical wealth found in lairs, phase dragons tend to keep items of sentimental value from their travels, such as a particularly rare flower from the region or a piece by a local artist.

Fed by Wood.name: Fed by Wood
Fed by Wood.description:
When an underworld dragon is struck by a weapon made primarily of wood or affected by a spell with the plant or wood trait, the dragon’s internal fiery essences are stoked with the added fuel. Their Exploding Red Breath recharges, and the fire damage from the dragon’s jaws deals an additional die of damage until the end of the dragon’s next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4FMFRlEC923CnLI7]{Effect: Fed by Wood}

Sweltering Heat.description: 10 feet. Each creature that ends its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} while it remains in the aura.
Sweltering Heat.name: Sweltering Heat

Exploding Red Breath.name: Exploding Red Breath
Exploding Red Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of fire that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:25] within 50 feet, dealing @Damage[10d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[2d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage] damage. The dragon can't use Exploding Red Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Exploding Red Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair an underworld dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Water.name: Countered by Water
Countered by Water.description:
If the underworld dragon takes damage from a spell with the cold or water trait, the elemental magic of fire within them is momentarily dampened. Until the end of their next turn, they take a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, and their jaws Strikes don't deal fire damage. This limitation ends if the dragon uses Exploding Red Breath.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.81XYZZ3H0GL8thdQ]{Effect: Countered by Water}

Adamantine Claws.name: Adamantine Claws
Adamantine Claws.description:
Frequency one per hour

Effect The dragon infuses their body with adamantine. For the next minute, their melee Strikes are treated as adamantine and ignore half the Hardness of any object hit.

Underworld Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Underworld Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Underworld Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
If there are any imperial dragons who benefited from moving out of their native elemental plane, it's underworld dragons. Once related solely to the element of fire, early underworld dragons harnessed elemental forces through arcane means for reasons no longer remembered. With each subsequent generation, both their arcane power and mastery over the elements grew. Their efforts were later bolstered by their studies in alchemy, which allowed dragons to cultivate themselves even further with various mutagens and elixirs.

Today, though their nature is primarily still connected with the element of fire, an underworld dragon can consume wood with ease, threaten entire regions with quakes, lay claim to the minerals and gems in the rocks and stone, and die to form volcanoes that create more land masses. Some even flippantly snort at the lapping waves of the sea, not fearing any retaliation from the sea dragon nations nor their kings. Though their powers might be relatively weaker than another imperial dragon of the same age, their mastery of many elements and the arcane arts makes underworld dragons formidable opponents.

Delight Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Play Scape.name: Play Scape
Play Scape.description:
15 feet. Delight dragon magic alters their surroundings, turning weapons into toys and spells into stage effects. All Strikes and other damaging effects used in the aura gain the nonlethal trait and are accompanied by magical sound effects. A creature entering or beginning their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save.

Failure The creature's first damaging effect (such as a Strike) this round does half damage.

Critical Failure All the creature's damaging effects this turn do half damage.

Breath of Fresh Air.name: Breath of Fresh Air
Breath of Fresh Air.description: The dragon unleashes a stream of magical bubbles in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50]. Each creature within the area takes @Damage[14d8[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:41|basic] save). A creature who fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as they give in to the joyful urge to dance, sing, laugh, or admire the world around them. On a critical failure, the creature is slowed 1 for 1 minute and can't use reactions for as long as they are slowed; they can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turn to end the slowed condition early.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge their Breath of Fresh Air.

Lover of the Arts.name: Lover of the Arts
Lover of the Arts.description: Checks by or against the dragon to change a creature's attitude using Diplomacy can be attempted with Performance instead.

Whimsysense.name: Whimsysense
Whimsysense.description: Delight dragons can sense the presence of laughter, games, celebrations, and sweets within the listed range.

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine

Reactive Tail.name: Reactive Tail
Reactive Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon attempts an Athletics check to [[/act trip]] the triggering creature. This check doesn't count toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this check.

Cloud of Giggles.name: Cloud of Giggles
Cloud of Giggles.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The delight dragon transforms into a Huge sparkling cloud of gas for 10 minutes. During this time, the dragon gains resistance 20 to physical damage and is immune to precision damage, but they can't cast spells, activate items, or use Strikes or actions that have the attack or manipulate trait. They can only use their fly Speed, can slip through tiny cracks, and occupy the same space as other creatures. If the dragon ends their turn sharing the same space as other creatures, each of those creatures must attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} from a fit of giggles until the end of the dragon's next turn. The dragon can Dismiss this action as long as it has space to take its original size.

Let's Play!.name: Let's Play!
Let's Play!.description: The dragon conjures up a magical arena to play a game, making up rules on the spot. Up to six target creatures inside the dragon's aura take @Damage[12d6[mental]] damage from the dragon's baffling explanation (@Check[will|dc:41|basic] save). Creatures who fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure). Regardless of result, all targets are immune for 24 hours.

Delight Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Delight Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Delight Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Some would say delight dragons are like children. They would be correct. At least, as correct as if they said a puff of chimney smoke resembled a massive storm cloud or compared a toddler's drawing of a horse to a prized thoroughbred. Which is to say, they are completely and utterly incorrect. Of course, having a smoke cloud or child's drawing running around one's home might be vastly preferable to a delight dragon.

As residents of the Outer Plane Elysium, delight dragons are embodiments of the plane's proclivity toward joy, mischief, passion, and spontaneity. Their massive gossamer wings refract the light of a thousand rainbows between translucent layers. Purple-green scales shimmer in opalescent splendor, while a long, sinuous tail flicks in spiral figures, darting to catch the feet out from under distracted observers. A pair of feathery antennae direct the delight dragon to their next source of amusement—whether play, treat, or general amusement, all surely to become a great time in the dragon's presence, whether a plane's denizens know it or not.

As self-proclaimed defenders of games, whimsy, and the freedom to sow a little chaos, delight dragons are often found on the front line against those that would strip such choice away from others. Demonic forces deployed at the Worldwound whispered of the "lights of doom," massive rainbows that heralded the approach of a delight dragon. The winged crusader would descend upon these fiends with claws and fangs, cackling all the while.

Bathygenic Barrage.name: Bathygenic Barrage
Bathygenic Barrage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon uses Pressurized Pool three times. None of the bursts can overlap.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge Crushing Breath.

Tidal Surge.description: The dragon sweeps their wings, creating a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of buffeting water that deals @Damage[8d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic] save. Each unattended object and each creature that fails the save is also pushed away from the dragon 10 feet (20 feet on a critical failure) and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The dragon can't use Tidal Surge again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Tidal Surge]]{1d4 rounds}.
Tidal Surge.name: Tidal Surge

Aquatic Echolocation.name: Aquatic Echolocation
Aquatic Echolocation.description: A brine dragon can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal

Regent's Glower.name: Regent's Glower
Regent's Glower.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon focuses their weighty gaze upon their assailant, filling their foe with dread. The triggering creature takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:29|basic] save. Any creature who fails the save also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

Benthic Bite.name: Benthic Bite
Benthic Bite.description: A creature who takes damage from a brine dragon's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round.

Crushing Breath.name: Crushing Breath
Crushing Breath.description: The dragon spews a @Template[type:line|distance:80] of pressurized water that deals @Damage[13d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save. A creature that fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. The dragon can't use Crushing Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Crushing Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Pressurized Pool.name: Pressurized Pool
Pressurized Pool.description: The dragon expels a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] of pressurized water within 120 feet that lasts for 1 minute. A creature other than a brine dragon that enters or begins their turn within a burst must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save or become encumbered until the beginning of their next turn.

Brine Dragon (Adult).name: Brine Dragon (Adult)
Brine Dragon (Adult).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Fire.name: 为火所克 Countered by Fire
Countered by Fire.description:
如果天龙受到火焰伤害，他们体内的金元素魔法会被回火。直到其下个回合结束，其在攻击骰和AC上承受-1环境减值，且颚咬打击不再造成电击伤害。如果天龙使用了钢电吐息，则限制结束。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.a4bZrBNL17zPjDiH]

Fed by Earth.name: 由土而生 Fed by Earth
Fed by Earth.description: 如果天龙成为土法术或效果的目标，他会将鳞片中的矿物质结晶化，形成折射或散射光线的外层以进行伪装。在1分钟内，天龙在飞行时处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]。

Mist Vision.name: 迷雾视觉 Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: 雾与浓雾不会削弱天龙的视觉；其忽视由雾和迷雾造成的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态。

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。

Divine Lightning.name: 神圣闪电 Divine Lightning
Divine Lightning.description:
需求 龙信仰祝佑条目列出"圣洁"的神祇

效果 天龙通过攻击引导神力，使得对抗邪秽时更加有效。它在对抗邪秽生物时，造成的任何电击伤害变为精魂伤害。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当天龙在一次打击中造成重击时，他充能其钢电吐息。

Perfected Flight.name: 完美飞行 Perfected Flight
Perfected Flight.description: 天龙不花费动作便可悬停在原地，并且他在用于空中机动的所有特技检定上自动成功。

Steel Lightning Breath.name: 钢电吐息 Steel Lightning Breath
Steel Lightning Breath.description: 天龙向60尺内射出一个电球，对@Template[type:burst|distance:30]范围造成@Damage[10d12[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic]豁免）。其不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Steel Lightning Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用钢电吐息。

Stunning Electricity.name: 震慑电击 Stunning Electricity
Stunning Electricity.description:
天龙快速盘旋，然后释放噼啪作响的闪电，对@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]范围造成@Damage[5d12[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害。区域内每个生物都必须尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:40]豁免；无论结果如何，这些生物都会临时免疫10分钟。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物受到一半伤害，并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。

失败 该生物受到全额伤害，并陷入震慑1轮且4轮内不能飞行。

大失败 该生物受到双倍伤害，并陷入震慑2轮且1分钟内不能飞行。

Sky Dragon (Ancient).name: 古天龙 Sky Dragon (Ancient)
Sky Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
当帝龙初临物质宇宙时，每条龙都与自身诞生的元素位面紧密相连。随着元素领主之间的战争愈演愈烈，仁慈的领主们接连陨落，金元素位面与木元素位面相继自我封闭。对于源自腐蚀核心（Corroded Core）的龙族而言，它们的生存根基已然岌岌可危。这些龙类在山巅间辗转流亡，逃离妖怪征战的彼时危险的天夏。最终，当它们抵达沉沦山脉（Chenlun）、罗网山脉（Gossamer）、格桑山脉（Kelsang）、金山（Kimu）、库兰山脉（Kullan）、巨人山脉（Kyojin）与天境之墙（Wall of Heaven）时，天界生灵回应了它们的求救。当龙族失去金元素的支撑，天族便以神圣赐福与精粹相补。随着本质蜕变，这些龙从而得以延续。久而久之，它们因贴近苍穹、侍奉神明而得名。昔日的金元素龙的岁月，终成褪色的记忆与创世神话，唯有天龙自身仍铭记于心。

天龙以永恒的侍奉来感恩。部分天龙吸收了所侍奉神祇的位面能量，变得庞大而强大；其中许多成为现代圣天龙的始祖。其余天龙则留在物质宇宙中，终生修习信仰，臻于生命与灵魂的神术技艺。真正能独立行动，运用非神术力量执行无关伟大意志任务的天龙实属罕见。即便如此，这些少数天龙仍保留着隐居沉思的本性，至少在年轻岁月里如此。

随着金元素位面的回归，关于天龙与该位面关联的谨慎探询悄然展开。有人猜测是否能寻得幸存的远亲。这些探询并非出于好奇，而是迫于现实需求。虽然天龙因天界生灵的加持获得了自保之力，却未能解决元素匮乏的问题。更糟的是，即便腐蚀核心已然回归，这种匮乏仍在持续。无论是从蛋里孵化还是自然分娩，天龙雏龙降生时都脆弱不堪，鳞片稀疏甚至全然不长。即便置身于大型矿藏或盐脉（作为金元素能量的磁体与蓄能库）之中，幼龙的鳞片也需历经数十年淬炼，方能坚韧到足以离开巢穴的程度。如果金元素位面存在这些问题的答案——无论是适合作为安全的产崽或育雏的场所，还是恢复龙类吸收环境元素能量的能力——确保所有天龙掌握此法并把握机会，实为当务之急。

Rune Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Rune Archdragon (Spellcaster)

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Detonating Rune.name: Detonating Rune
Detonating Rune.description: The rune dragon's Strikes and abilities can leave a detonating rune on their targets. If a creature would receive a detonating rune while they already have one, instead of adding another rune, their current detonating rune activates, dealing @Damage[8d6[untyped]] damage to the target and expending the rune. The detonating rune's damage type matches the dragon's current Shifting Rune. A creature can use an Interact action to remove the rune. Detonating runes fade after 1 minute if not detonated.

Shifting Runes.description: The rune dragon chooses between acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage. The runes etched upon the dragon shift, forming runes of that energy on their scales. The dragon gains immunity to that damage type, and their detonating runes and Runic Breath deal that damage type. Anyone trained in Arcana can immediately recognize the energy type of the etched rune without a check.
Shifting Runes.name: Shifting Runes

equipment-Common runes of 18th level or.name: Common runes of 18th level or lower etched upon their scales

Magic Sense.name: Magic Sense
Magic Sense.description: The rune dragon is aware of any active magical abilities and effects within the listed range. When the dragon Seeks, it gains the benefits of a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} spell on the things it sees within the listed range (in addition to the normal benefits of Seeking).

Runic Scales.name: Runic Scales
Runic Scales.description: The rune dragon's scales function as runestones. The rune dragon can't use the effects or abilities of the runes etched on its scales, but can transfer these runes to appropriate objects. Transferring a rune to or from an item in this way requires 1 minute to complete, during which the dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. The process is automatic and doesn't require a check, but if the dragon stops or is interrupted in this process, the rune is destroyed. A rune dragon can have any number of runes etched on its scales, though they typically have only a handful of runes etched on their scales at a time.

Canceling Rune.name: Canceling Rune
Canceling Rune.description:
Trigger The dragon is the target of a spell that requires a saving throw

Effect The dragon attempts to unmake the spell's foundational runes. They attempt to counteract the spell (counteract rank 10, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+42 #Counteract]]{+42}). If successful, the dragon is unaffected by the spell; other subjects are affected by the spell normally. The dragon can't use canceling rune again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge canceling rune]]{1d4 rounds}.

Retributive Rune.name: Retributive Rune
Retributive Rune.description:
Trigger A creature within 15 feet damages the rune dragon

Effect With a burst of runic magic, the rune dragon creates a detonating rune on the triggering creature and immediately causes it to detonate if it didn't automatically do so.

The rune dragon gains an additional reaction at the beginning of each of their turns that they can use only for a Retributive Rune.

Entangling Rune.name: Entangling Rune
Entangling Rune.description: The rune dragon creates large trapping runes in 3 non-overlapping @Template[type:burst|distance:15]s within 60 feet. Creatures other than the dragon that enter a trapped space or end their turn in the trapped space activate the rune, causing it to entangle the creature. The creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:46] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 minute or until it Escapes. The rune can only trap a single creature at a time. The rune vanishes either when a creature succeeds against the rune, when a creature successfully Escapes the rune, or after 1 minute. A creature adjacent to the rune can use an Interact action to remove the rune.

Runic Breath.name: Runic Breath
Runic Breath.description: The dragon launches hundreds of exploding runes that detonate upon impact, dealing @Damage[20d6[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic] save). The damage type of this ability is determined by Shifting Rune. Creatures that take damage from the breath also gain a detonating rune. The dragon can't use Runic Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Runic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Trail of Runes.name: Trail of Runes
Trail of Runes.description: The rune dragon Strides, leaving behind a collection of runes wherever it steps. The dragon chooses to leave behind either detonating runes or entangling runes. Every space that the dragon moves through, including spaces occupied by creatures, gains a rune. These runes automatically activate when a creature other than the rune dragon enters the space or ends its turn in the space. The runes can otherwise be removed or vanish like normal.

Rune Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes: Rune dragons have an innate insight on the power of runes. Most rune dragons keep a variety of runes etched on their scales, which their bodies can magically empower. They typically don't cast spells themselves, instead relying on their ability to create runes on the fly to produce desired effects. A rune dragon often refers to their hoard as their library, as it's full of important historical texts, plays, speeches, textbooks, and spellbooks written by people of different cultures in a variety of languages. While they can often speak a language with the aid of magic, they much prefer to learn languages in the context of their speakers so they can grasp the nuances hidden within the syntax and the magic within their symbols.
Rune Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Executor Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
Legends state the first executor dragons formed from the rage-filled screams of Sarenrae during her struggle against the Rough Beast. In the face of an enemy even she had no hope of redeeming, the ever-compassionate Dawnflower allowed her divine fury to escape from her lips as she struck down the primordial god, and from this act of anathema, the first executor dragons were given form. Since that moment, executor dragons represent the full wrath of the gods. Divine in nature, executor dragons typically appear to punish those who have strayed so far from the path of their deity's edicts as to begin embracing the anathema. Due to their potent nature as weapons of the divine, executor dragons are generally drawn to target not a single misbehaving follower, but entire villages, cities, or towns that have turned their backs on their gods. Many of the gods prefer not to use executor dragons as part of their punishment of mortal transgressors, and instead keep them reserved for the days of apocalyptic battles.

Though many believe executor dragons are spawned from divine magic, they are fully biological creatures. Compelled by faith and devotion and disgusted by hypocrisy and base cruelty, executor dragons tend to live near human settlements, but rarely within them. They form small familial groups when young, but grow more independent as they age, seeking to claim territory uninhabited by other dragons. Their chosen lairs tend to be locations secreted away, either in the ruins of mountaintop monasteries or in the cavernous depths beneath abandoned places of worship. For the few executor dragons that live actively among non-draconic peoples, even fewer do so in their natural forms. They are sometimes found living disguised as traveling lay priests who bring healing and alms for the needy, choristers singing hymnals, wandering monastic scholars who ask challenging and conflicted questions about faith, or quiet church custodians who protect and beautify their chosen houses of worship. It's said that one or more executor dragons might have even taken up the defense of Kenebres after its near destruction at the hands of the Khorramzadeh, Storm King of the Worldwound.
Executor Dragon (Ancient).name: Executor Dragon (Ancient)

Divine Sanctification.name: Divine Sanctification
Divine Sanctification.description: Once an executor dragon reaches adulthood, they are expected to sanctify as either holy or unholy; they gain the corresponding trait and weakness 15 to the opposing sanctification.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Aura of Authority.name: Aura of Authority
Aura of Authority.description:
60 feet. The divine majesty of an adult executor dragon can't be denied. A creature that enters or begins their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:37] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's aura of authority for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} for 10 minutes.

Rage of the Divine.name: Rage of the Divine
Rage of the Divine.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect Raw divine power flashes through the executor dragon harming anyone who dares strike it so brazenly. The creature who dealt the triggering attack takes @Damage[7d8[spirit]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:37|basic] save.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change its Speed or attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Divine Utterance.name: Divine Utterance
Divine Utterance.description: The dragon screams the truth of the divine, dealing @Damage[15d8[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). They can't use Divine Utterance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Divine Utterance]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Divine Utterance whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Arise!.name: Arise!
Arise!.description:
The resurrection dragon uses their mastery over life energy to cast their own soul into the Boneyard and pull a willing creature's soul back to their body in a process that takes 1 hour. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG]{Raise Dead} except the maximum level of the target is 18 and the soul is tethered to the dragon's. Only one creature can be tethered to the dragon's soul at a time. If the creature and the dragon are no longer on the same plane or the dragon dies, the raised creature dies and can't be raised with Arise! again.

The dragon can Dismiss the connection at any time. Doing so doesn't prevent the dragon from raising the creature with Arise! again. While raised in this way, the creature is still a valid target for raise dead, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect}, and similar effects. Returning the creature to life in this way fully restores the creature, severing the connection to the dragon and allowing the dragon to establish a connection with a different creature.

Reawaken!.name: Reawaken!
Reawaken!.description:
Trigger A living creature the resurrection dragon can see dies

Effect The resurrection dragon uses divine and vital energy to retether the soul to its dead body. The willing creature is returned to life with half of their total Hit Points. A creature can be resurrected by this ability only once.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw strikes and one tail strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Soul Siphoning Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Mortal Fears.name: Mortal Fears
Mortal Fears.description:
The archdragon imposes the fear of death onto the living and fear of the living onto the undead. Each creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:120] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:46] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}. A living creature can't reduce its frightened condition below 1 if it ends its turn within 15 feet of the archdragon or an undead creature. An undead creature can't reduce its frightened condition below 1 if it ends its turn within 15 feet of the archdragon or a living creature.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}.

Risen Commander.name: Risen Commander
Risen Commander.description: A resurrection dragon has a strong connection with its minions and can Sustain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9WGeBwIIbbUuWKq0]{Summon Undead} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hghGRzOSzEl4UXdS]{Invoke Spirits} as a free action once per turn.

Siphon Life.name: Siphon Life
Siphon Life.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet uses a healing effect that restores Hit Points

Effect The resurrection dragon redirects vital energies away from the effect, minimizing its impact. The triggering effect rolls the minimum amount on any dice rolls to restore Hit Points, and any flat values for restoring Hit Points (such as the additional Hit Points for a two-action heal spell), are cut in half. The dragon then gains 4d8 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 round.

Necro Puppeteer.name: Necro Puppeteer
Necro Puppeteer.description: The dragon siphons energy into an undead creature, a dying creature, or a corpse they can see within 60 feet. The dragon moves the target creature 30 feet and causes it to unleash a wave of void energy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10], dealing @Damage[8d8[void]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:43|basic] save).

Soul Siphoning Breath.name: Soul Siphoning Breath
Soul Siphoning Breath.description: The archdragon unleashes a torrent of divine energy dealing @Damage[22d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[fortitude|dc:46|basic] save) that draws the life force from the creatures within. The dragon gains fast healing 20 until their Soul Siphoning Breath recharges. The resurrection dragon can't use Soul Siphoning Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Soul Siphoning Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Resurrection Archdragon.name: Resurrection Archdragon
Resurrection Archdragon.publicNotes: Resurrection dragons teeter between life and death. They have a mastery of vital energies, allowing them to restore life to the dead, and a mastery of void energies, to bestow death on others. They make use of their abilities to play with the lives of mortals, calling on spirits to aid them or reviving creatures they find important or interesting. The lair of a resurrection dragon is generally a barren place. While they still hoard wealth like other dragons, they do little to decorate their lairs and treasures are generally kept in dark niches, as if the dragon has little care for their possessions. Resurrection dragons tend to take tokens from those they resurrect or plan to resurrect, however, and these are kept particularly safe.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The wyrmwraith makes two claw Strikes and one jaws Strike in any order.

Ectoplasmic Form.name: Ectoplasmic Form
Ectoplasmic Form.description: A wyrmwraith can push through the ectoplasmic veil to temporarily assume a physical form made of ectoplasm. The wyrmwraith loses the incorporeal trait for [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Physical Form]]{1d4 rounds}, though they can return to their incorporeal form as a free action before then. Once this ability ends, the wyrmwraith can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Ectoplasmatic Form]]{1d4 rounds}. While in their ectoplasmic form, the wyrmwraith's AC increases to 43 and they gain 100 temporary Hit Points. They lose their immunity to precision damage and all of their resistances. Their melee Strikes deal slashing and piercing damage, respectively, instead of void damage.

Void's Embrace.name: Void's Embrace
Void's Embrace.description:
If a victim succeeds at a saving throw against this curse while in sunlight, the curse ends. While a creature has this curse, they bypass the resistances of the wyrmwraith that cursed them

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:38]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} in any light (1 hour)

Stage 2 gains lifesense 30 feet but is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} in any light (1 hour)

Stage 3 as stage 2, but also has void healing (1 hour)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and can't awaken (1 day)

Stage 5 dead and becomes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.Gu0cJHGwPd547OtC]{Wraith}, its body crumbling to ash.

Frightful Presence.name: 恐怖威压 Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description:
90 feet. @Check[will|dc:36]

On a critical failure, a creature is also paralyzed until the start of their next turn.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Vitality Transfer.name: Vitality Transfer
Vitality Transfer.description:
Trigger The wyrmwraith succeeds at a saving throw to resist vitality damage but still takes damage

Effect The wyrmwraith transfers all vitality damage from the effect to a single undead creature of their choice within 120 feet that they control or that's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.v66R7FdOf11l94im]{Friendly} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.v44P3WUcU1j0115l]{Helpful} to them.

Decaying Breath.name: Decaying Breath
Decaying Breath.description: The wyrmwraith unleashes a torrent of void energy that deals @Damage[18d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save). They can't use Decaying Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Decaying Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Divine Dispelling.name: Divine Dispelling
Divine Dispelling.description: A wyrmwraith's claws rend divine magic. Whenever a wyrmwraith hits a creature with a spectral claws Strike, the wyrmwraith can attempt a @Check[religion] check to counteract an ongoing divine spell effect on the creature.

Phase Lurch.name: Phase Lurch
Phase Lurch.description:
Requirements The wyrmwraith is in their ectoplasmic form

Effect As the Stride action, but the wyrmwraith can pass through walls or material obstacles as though they were incorporeal. They must begin and end their movement outside of any physical obstacles, and passing through solid material is difficult terrain.

Wings of Shadow.name: Wings of Shadow
Wings of Shadow.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The wyrmwraith spreads its spectral wings wide covering all near it in shadow. Each living creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] is exposed to void's embrace.

Wyrmwraith.name: Wyrmwraith
Wyrmwraith.publicNotes:
Dahak's defiance and his hatred for all of creation brought loss to dragonkind. It is said that the first wyrmwraiths rose from the souls of dragons hurled into the Void by Dahak, but whether this is true or not is still a matter of debate. What is undeniable is that the wyrmwraiths are unliving conduits of the Void, shaped but unshackled by the plane's hunger for indiscriminate destruction.

Wyrmwraiths dwell in remote areas marred by catastrophes and death, where they can better hide their undead nature or indulge in their grim research. Their lairs often have a single, hidden and highly defensible antechamber where the wyrmwraith confers with its agents as it engages in a war with distant rivals through expendable proxies. This dimly lit antechamber is usually filled with death and many undead servants, some raised from the bodies of those whose usefulness has come to an end.

Wyrmwraiths might enter temporary alliances with other undead, cults, or necromancers, especially when it comes to unearthing powerful secrets or striking a blow against a common powerful threat. While wyrmwraiths take great pleasure in acting against those who wield the power of the gods, often targeting them first in battle to rend their flesh and protective spells with their claws, they are often very cautious, striking only after stacking the odds in their favor.

Cutting Rebuke.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's chin blade that the dragon can see makes a Strike against the dragon

Effect The dragon makes a chin blade Strike against the triggering creature.
Cutting Rebuke.name: Cutting Rebuke

Feast of Blood.name: Feast of Blood
Feast of Blood.description: The dragon inhales sharply, pulling blood from wounds and into the dragon's maw. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] takes their current persistent bleed damage plus @Damage[10d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:33|basic] save). The dragon gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the greatest amount of void damage dealt to a single creature this way. The dragon can't use Feast of Blood again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Feast of Blood]]{1d4 rounds}.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Heads Will Roll!.name: Heads Will Roll!
Heads Will Roll!.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The vorpal dragon swoops across the battlefield, sweeping their axe-bladed tail through their foes. The dragon Flies twice; at any point during this movement, the dragon makes up to two chin blade Strikes, each against a different creature within reach. The dragon's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until all Strikes are made.

Vorpal Binding.name: Vorpal Binding
Vorpal Binding.description:
The vorpal dragon beheads its foes—sometimes without killing them. A vorpal dragon's chin blade Strikes count as having the vorpal weapon property rune for the purpose of weaknesses. Whenever the vorpal dragon critically succeeds on a chin blade Strike, it deals an additional @Damage[3d6[persistent,bleed]] damage, which can be ended normally.

When a vorpal dragon rolls a natural 20 on a chin blade Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save; this has the incapacitation trait. On a failure, the creature is beheaded. A creature beheaded this way does not automatically die; instead, their head and body live on, disconnected but mystically linked, with the head controlling the body from afar. A beheaded creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} as they attempt to coordinate movements from an unusual perspective, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 4} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} if their head can't perceive their body from its location. These conditions are suppressed if the body holds its head, and don't apply to actions performed exclusively by the head, mind, or voice. If the body is killed, the head can live on, but destroying the head kills the body as well. This effect can be reversed by taking a 2-action activity, which has the manipulate trait, to firmly reattach the severed head to the correct body. Whether attaching the severed head to a different headless body is effective is at the GM's discretion.

Vorpal Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Vorpal Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Vorpal Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Vorpal dragons were not created by some ancient divinity nor born of a specific realm or force. Their birth was an arcane accident, the result of unstoppable magic contacting immovable beast. In unknowable ancient ages, the first jabberwock was wrought by the Eldest and the first vorpal sword was wrought in turn to slay the beast. When that very first blade went snicker-snack for the very first time, tasting the primeval lifeblood of the draconic Tane, the first vorpal dragon was born.

Vorpal dragons are most notorious for their keen vorpal magic. Even the least of these dragons can sever a foe's head in a single lucky stroke. Unusually, however, the subject survives as a bipartite creature: a headless body controlled by a detached head that still thinks and speaks, and which can outlive said body's destruction. It's not uncommon for would-be dragonslayers to be sent home carrying their own heads under one arm as a lesson in humility. The unluckier ones, alas, may be kept as trophies—and, in a very literal sense, conversation pieces—while the dragon devours their greater portion. Some might even wear their favorite severed heads as a macabre necklace.

Divert Essence.description:
Trigger A creature within 90 feet Casts a Spell that targets the dragon

Effect The sage dragon steals energy from the spell to protect itself, gaining resistance to damage from spells equal to the triggering spell's rank until the beginning of their next turn.
Divert Essence.name: Divert Essence

Eldritch Interference.name: Eldritch Interference
Eldritch Interference.description:
90 feet, @Check[will|dc:30].

Overlapping fields near the dragon make spellcasting unpredictable. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's eldritch interference for 1 minute.

Critical Success For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they gain a status bonus to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they take a status penalty to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Reveal Shame.name: Reveal Shame
Reveal Shame.description:
Requirements The dragon has successfully Recalled Knowledge about an enemy within 90 feet

Effect The dragon utters an embarrassing secret about the creature, unnerving them and their allies. Every enemy within 90 feet that can hear the secret must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}. Sanguine Knowledge As young sage dragon.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Overwhelming Proclamation whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Mystic Facility.name: Mystic Facility
Mystic Facility.description: The dragon can activate scrolls and wands of any tradition as if the spells they contain were occult spells.

Overwhelming Proclamation.name: Overwhelming Proclamation
Overwhelming Proclamation.description: The dragon exclaims hidden truths that only they have been able to understand, dealing @Damage[14d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:33|basic] save). On a critical failure, creatures are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. The dragon can't use Overwhelming Proclamation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Overwhelming Proclamation]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sanguine Knowledge.name: Sanguine Knowledge
Sanguine Knowledge.description: The first time each encounter a dragon hits and deals damage to a creature with their jaws Strike, they receive information about the creature as if the dragon had succeeded at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about that creature.

Sage Dragon (Adult).name: Sage Dragon (Adult)
Sage Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
A shining, rune-inscribed scale is all that most people, even adventurers, see of a sage dragon during their lifetimes. Even then, only those familiar with dragon lore will likely recognize the scale as anything other than an elaborate spell scroll. Collectors and scholars of esoteric lore, sage dragons become increasingly reclusive as they age, and, even in their youths, they're prone to work through trusted intermediaries. For those able to locate and gain the trust of such a creature, even the youngest sage dragons are fonts of difficult-to-find knowledge and rare magical techniques. The oldest sage dragons are living combinations of gargantuan libraries and endless grimoires, accumulating the secrets of the Universe, and beyond, in their isolated lairs.

Organized and methodical, with an insatiable curiosity and eidetic memory, sage dragons are the devout researchers of the dragon world. The intellectual pursuits of sage dragons demand extended periods of quiet study, one of the reasons that such dragons live in isolated, hidden locations. Young dragons tend to specialize in a particular area of research. As they age, these research interests also broaden, with an expert in a particular river expanding into topics such as the water cycle, ecology, or the Plane of Water. Sage dragons interested in religious topics often worship Nethys or a god dedicated to knowledge, such as Gruhastha, Qi Zhong, or Ydajisk. Dragons who seek grim rituals or cryptic knowledge might join the church of Abraxas or worship Norgorber in his aspect of the Reaper of Reputation.

Fog of Chance.name: Fog of Chance
Fog of Chance.description:
The pearl dragonet breathes a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] of golden, fortune-altering mist. The dragonet chooses fortune or misfortune when using this ability, which gains the corresponding trait.

If the dragonet chooses fortune, all creatures in the mist gain a bit of luck; the first time in the next round each affected creature attempts an attack roll or skill check, they roll twice and use the better result.

If the dragonet chooses misfortune, each creature in the mist must attempt a @Check[will|dc:17] save.

On a failure, the first time in the next round that creature attempts an attack roll or skill check, it must roll twice and use the worse result. The dragonet can't use Fortune Fog again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Fortune Fog]]{1d4 rounds}.

Bounce Away.name: Bounce Away
Bounce Away.description:
Trigger The dragonet is hit by a melee Strike that deals bludgeoning damage

Effect The dragonet absorbs the blow by rolling into a ball and bouncing away. It gains resistance 3 to bludgeoning damage against the triggering attack and Flies away from the attacker. This movement does not trigger reactions.

Pearl Dragonet.name: Pearl Dragonet
Pearl Dragonet.publicNotes:
Pearl dragonets are fortune magic incarnate.

Nobody takes small, round dragonets seriously, but they're lucky to have around. Social and relatively defenseless, pearl dragonets have thrived by providing good luck in exchange for food and protection. This reputation for bringing fortune—which the dragonets encourage—has led to the popularity of good-luck charms featuring this plump dragonet species and the belief that harming a pearl dragonet can incur a lifetime of ill luck.

Pearl dragonets have pearlescent scales and a round body with stumpy legs. Their minute wings cannot support flight, so they rely on magic to fly. They have long tails that can be up to five times the length of their bodies. This odd build exacerbates their ungainly, waddling gait, which is punctuated by head-over-heel rolls and erratic flight paths.

Pearl dragonets are attentive, with an acute ability to understand the world around them. They are commonly found in the mountains of Tian Xia, living close to remote or insular highland communities that show due respect for their insight. Communities seeking to attract pearl dragonets often hang up round, red paper lanterns, though both the dragonets and the villagers take minor offense toward anyone who compares the relative shape of the dragonets and the lanterns.

Though dragonets are smaller and lacking the raw power of great dragons, they are every bit as varied and fascinating as their larger relatives. Like dragons, dragonets have strong ties to magic. These ties influence the contrasting natures exhibited by different dragonet types. For example, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.QIXc18xHrEWDmtKW]{Fey Dragonets} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core-2.Actor.Zh8awPHA7DZxTboc]{House Drakes} make fascinating pets and companions, and thus are a popular familiar for spellcasters. Tidepool dragonets, on the other hand, are arrogant and untamable.
