Assuming dragonets are harmless due to their size, or the fact that they often live near people, is dangerous. Pest drakes, for instance, are weak and shy individually but are inclined to form dangerous swarms when unsettled. By contrast, pearl dragonets are gentle oddities that seem naturally friendly.

Dragonets range in size from little bigger than songbirds to no larger than house cats. Unlike most great dragons, they stop growing after reaching maturity. They vary greatly in intelligence; fey dragonets are known for their tricks and wit, while feral racing drakes have the average problem solving capacity of a pigeon. Each type of dragonet has its own lairing and hoarding habits, and they have unique abilities that reveal their magical nature.

Destructive Interference.name: Destructive Interference
Destructive Interference.description:
Trigger A foe within 90 feet uses an auditory or sonic effect

Effect The young wailing dragon releases a burst of noise, attempting to drown out the triggering sound. It makes a counteract check against the effect (counteract rank 5, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+21 #Counteract]]{+21}).

Echolocation.name: Echolocation
Echolocation.description: A wailing dragon can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and Sonic

Subsonic Drone.name: Subsonic Drone
Subsonic Drone.description:
90 feet, A creature who enters or begins their turn in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's subsonic drone for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

Eerie Call.name: Eerie Call
Eerie Call.description:
Requirements The dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or undetected

Effect The dragon's wail draws in unsuspecting opponents. Anyone that can hear the Eerie Call must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the sound. A fascinated creature must spend at least 1 action Seeking the dragon each turn, and the dragon can Sustain this affect for up to 1 minute

Natural Mimic.name: Natural Mimic
Natural Mimic.description: The dragon can imitate any sound or voice that it has heard. This has the effect of 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.yV7Ouzaoe7DHLESI]{Ventriloquism} (DC 29) but is a nonmagical effect.

Resounding Roar.name: Resounding Roar
Resounding Roar.description:
The dragon unleashes a thunderous call that deals @Damage[11d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic] save). On a critical failure, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute.

In addition, if the area overlaps with an area of magical silence or includes a creature affected by magical silence, the roar attempts to counteract the silence effect (counteract rank 5, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+21 #Counteract]]{+21}).

The dragon can't use Resounding Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Resounding Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

Wailing Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Wailing Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Wailing Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Canny, patient, and creative, wailing dragons are adepts of sound and psychology. With both their physiology and innate connection to arcane magic allowing them to produce and shape sound waves, these reclusive creatures are heard much more often than seen. Named for their tendency to use uncanny keening vocalizations to communicate across long distances and startle prey, wailing dragons haunt locations that create interesting or useful echoes, such as canyons or caverns. Though ruthless predators when needed, most wailing dragons devote their energy toward investigating the effects sound has on the environment and the bodies and minds of creatures.

Minstrels, divas, and tunesmiths seek out these creatures during their mating season, when two dragons sing courtship ballads full of intricate harmonies. While this might be the performance of a lifetime, it's a dangerous concert, as incautious audience members frequently become meals for the nuptial couple. (The famous Chelaxian composer, Gretezi Valtros, disappeared on such an expedition in 4275 ar, after he set out to teach a wailing dragon High Azlanti and "instruct it in the decorous art of opera.") Most creatures also find the close-range subsonic vibrations emitted by wailing dragons extremely uncomfortable, reinforcing the idea that it's best to observe them from a distance.

Shrieking Breath.name: Shrieking Breath
Shrieking Breath.description: The dragon lets out a cacophonous sound made of every scream the dragon has drawn from a terrified enemy, dealing @Damage[23d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:45|basic] save). Creatures who fail their Will save must spend the first action of their next turn doing nothing but screaming. The dragon can't use Shrieking Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Shrieking Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Tongue Decoy.name: Tongue Decoy
Tongue Decoy.description:
The despair dragon inflates several bladders at the end of its tongue to create the basic form of a creature. This process takes 1 minute to complete, during which the dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. If the dragon stops or is interrupted in this process, the bladders deflate, and the dragon must start over. Once the process is complete, the dragon can maintain the inflated bladders indefinitely, and can Dismiss to deflate the bladders and retract its tongue instantly.

The inflated tongue takes the basic form of an animal or humanoid and can be inflated to be either Small or Medium. The form resembles the general silhouette of a creature, though closer inspection and success at a @Check[perception|dc:30] check can determine the true nature of the tongue. While inflated, the dragon can send its voice through the decoy, though keeping its tongue inflated makes it difficult to speak, causing the dragon to take a –4 circumstance penalty to any checks related to speaking, such as Deception checks to Lie.

The dragon's tongue can extend up to 90 feet from the dragon's body and it can fully extend its tongue as part of the process to inflate the bladders. The dragon can move the inflated part of its tongue up to 15 feet at a time with an action, which has the concentrate, manipulate, and move traits. While extended, the inflated end of the tongue occupies space as a creature of the appropriate size, but the rest of the tongue doesn't impede or block movement in any way. The dragon's scent functions through cilia at the end of the tongue, but otherwise the dragon has no means of knowing what's near its tongue.

Attacking the tongue is the same as attacking the dragon, except that the tongue is always @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. If the tongue takes any damage, it immediately deflates and remains out. The dragon remains off-guard as long as its tongue is out, but the dragon can retract its tongue with two consecutive Interact actions. If the tongue takes damage, the dragon can't use its tongue decoy again for 1 day.

Fearsense.name: Fearsense
Fearsense.description: The dragon senses all creatures with the frightened condition at the listed range.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Consume Fear.name: Consume Fear
Consume Fear.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet loses the frightened condition

Effect The dragon feasts upon the fear that leaves the triggering creature's body, gaining 9d8 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Unbidden Thoughts.name: Unbidden Thoughts
Unbidden Thoughts.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a weapon or unarmed attack

Effect The attacker's mind fills with visions of their worst fears that overwhelm their senses, and they must choose one of the following results: either the triggering attack becomes a normal success, or the critical hit is unaffected but the triggering creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Shrieking Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Inspire Dread.name: Inspire Dread
Inspire Dread.description:
The despair dragon telepathically communicates with a creature within 90 feet, listing their deep-seated fears. The creature takes @Damage[16d6[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45] save. Regardless of the result, the creature becomes temporarily immune to Inspire Dread for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Look Behind You.name: Look Behind You
Look Behind You.description:
Trigger The dragon successfully Hides from a creature within 90 feet

Effect The dragon teleports to a space directly behind the target creature. The dragon immediately becomes detected unless their chosen position has cover or another means to remain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

Despair Dragon (Ancient).name: Despair Dragon (Ancient)
Despair Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes: Fear is one of the most powerful emotions, and despair dragons are masters of channeling those feelings of terror and hopelessness for their own benefit. As with other occult dragons, despair dragons are driven by an innate compulsion, in their case, the desire to strike terror in others. Despair dragons tend to settle near settlements, so they have a source of fear to draw from. The most common items in despair dragon hoards are scrolls, tomes, and relics that serve as research material. Through these, despair dragons learn of local folklore, urban legends, and more to better haunt their targets.

Sovereign Dragon (Adult).name: 成年君龙 Sovereign Dragon (Adult)

Sanctified Sight.name: 祝圣视觉 Sanctified Sight
Sanctified Sight.description: 君龙能够自动侦测出一个生物，效果或物品是否受祝，以及其为圣洁还是邪秽。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
君龙可以变为任意大型或更小体型类人生物的外貌。这不会改变其速度或打击的攻击和伤害加值，但可能会改变其打击造成的伤害类型（通常为钝击）。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 君龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，君龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当君龙在一次打击中造成重击时，他充能其君王训诫。

Violent Retort.name: 以牙还牙 Violent Retort
Violent Retort.description:
触发 一个君龙触及范围内的生物对龙造成了重击

效果 在应用了对龙的所有重击效果之后，君龙对该生物进行一次爪抓或尾扫打击。

Gleaming Armor.name: 耀目宝甲 Gleaming Armor
Gleaming Armor.description:
频率 每小时一次

效果 君龙的护甲散发出金光。君龙在AC上获得+2状态加值，并获得对酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰和音波伤害的15点抗力。@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]范围内每个敌人都必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:36]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]。所有这些效果持续到龙的下个回合结束。

Inspire Envoy.name: 激励特使 Inspire Envoy
Inspire Envoy.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 君龙选择一名凡人并赐予其威严的祝福，以换取该生物去完成一项特殊指令，例如击败暴君或保护圣地。如果该生物同意，直到其下次每日准备，它在由龙选择的以下一项上获得+1状态加值：攻击骰，AC，或以下全部：察觉，意志豁免和基于魅力的技能检定。龙可以解消此增益，如果凡人胆敢违抗龙的指令，他就会迅速这么做。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.YDJnC3Bdc2GI6hX5]

Sovereign's Rebuke.name: 君王训诫 Sovereign's Rebuke
Sovereign's Rebuke.description: 君龙释放一道充满精神能量的吼叫，对@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围造成@Damage[16d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:36|basic]豁免）。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sovereign's Rebuke]]{1d4轮}内再次使用君王训诫。

Sovereign Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
据说曾有纯粹的土元素龙类存在。这些帝龙如同其他元素龙一样来到物质宇宙，生老病死，其躯体最终化作大陆的一部分。正如火元素化作熔岩，木元素化作森林，水元素汇成海洋湖泊，金元素化作珍贵矿脉，土元素终成大地、岩石与山岳。依循逻辑推演，若当今世间尚存此类环境与存在，那么土元素龙必然存在。抑或曾在远古时代存在过。

然而如今帝龙之中，唯有君龙在死亡时会留下蛇形骸骨，而非岩石、石块或泥土。龙的内在施法能力，对未加热铁器的弱点等特征，强烈暗示它们与元素之土存在关联。其余能力则几乎与土元素无关，反而聚焦于玄学上的精魂与心灵的奥秘。

关于君龙为何演变至此，尚无明确解释。有人推测这或许是某种为实现个人野心的交易，他们从选拔统治者的角色变为了统治者本身。也有人猜测天夏大地曾在过去遭受腐化，土元素龙为自保而背弃了元素本性。或许它们也曾化作圣天龙，却因凡间未现合格统治者而重返尘世。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Feast of Blood.name: Feast of Blood
Feast of Blood.description: The dragon inhales sharply, pulling blood from wounds and into the dragon's maw. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] takes their current persistent bleed damage plus @Damage[14d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:45|basic] save). The dragon gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the greatest amount of void damage dealt to a single creature this way. The dragon can't use Feast of Blood again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Feast of Blood]]{1d4 rounds}.

Gruesome Cuts.name: Gruesome Cuts
Gruesome Cuts.description: Persistent bleed damage inflicted by the dragon, even magically, carries a poison that inhibits clotting. Healing the creature to full HP doesn't end the bleeding, the DC of any flat check to recover is 2 higher, and the DC to stop the bleeding using Administer First Aid is 40. This poison can be counteracted (DC 41), and successfully doing so ends the bleeding.

Heads Will Roll!.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The vorpal dragon swoops across the battlefield, sweeping their axe-bladed tail through their foes. The dragon Flies twice; at any point during this movement, the dragon makes up to two chin blade Strikes, each against a different creature within reach. The dragon's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until all Strikes are made.
Heads Will Roll!.name: Heads Will Roll!

Vorpal Binding.name: Vorpal Binding
Vorpal Binding.description:
The vorpal dragon beheads its foes—sometimes without killing them. A vorpal dragon's chin blade Strikes count as having the vorpal weapon property rune for the purpose of weaknesses. Whenever the vorpal dragon critically succeeds on a chin blade Strike, it deals an additional @Damage[6d6[persistent,bleed]] damage, which can be ended normally.

When a vorpal dragon rolls a natural 20 on a chin blade Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save; this has the incapacitation trait. On a failure, the creature is beheaded. A creature beheaded this way does not automatically die; instead, their head and body live on, disconnected but mystically linked, with the head controlling the body from afar. A beheaded creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} as they attempt to coordinate movements from an unusual perspective, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 4} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} if their head can't perceive their body from its location. These conditions are suppressed if the body holds its head, and don't apply to actions performed exclusively by the head, mind, or voice. If the body is killed, the head can live on, but destroying the head kills the body as well. This effect can be ended only by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2Vkd1IxylPceUAAF]{Regenerate}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Hnc7eGi7vyZenAIm]{Breath of Life}, or any effect that restores life to the dead; only effects that restore an incomplete corpse will replace an absent or destroyed body, however. The dragon can choose to instantly kill a creature when beheading them, as per the vorpal weapon property rune's activation.

Cutting Rebuke.name: Cutting Rebuke
Cutting Rebuke.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's chin blade that the dragon can see makes a Strike against the dragon

Effect The dragon makes a chin blade Strike against the triggering creature.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Feast of Blood whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Dragon’s Teeth.name: Dragon’s Teeth
Dragon’s Teeth.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect A vorpal archdragon never fights alone save by choice, for within their pinioned wings an army of armaments stands ever ready. With a snap of their wings, the archdragon rains blades across the battlefield in a @Template[type:line|distance:100], dealing @Damage[22d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save. These blades are partially animated and remain in the area for 10 minutes, during which time the area is considered greater difficult terrain for every creature except for the archdragon. Any creature that enters the area or begins their turn within or adjacent to this area takes @Damage[(4d8+16)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save).

Vorpal Archdragon.name: Vorpal Archdragon
Vorpal Archdragon.publicNotes:
Vorpal dragons were not created by some ancient divinity nor born of a specific realm or force. Their birth was an arcane accident, the result of unstoppable magic contacting immovable beast. In unknowable ancient ages, the first jabberwock was wrought by the Eldest and the first vorpal sword was wrought in turn to slay the beast. When that very first blade went snicker-snack for the very first time, tasting the primeval lifeblood of the draconic Tane, the first vorpal dragon was born.

Vorpal dragons are most notorious for their keen vorpal magic. Even the least of these dragons can sever a foe's head in a single lucky stroke. Unusually, however, the subject survives as a bipartite creature: a headless body controlled by a detached head that still thinks and speaks, and which can outlive said body's destruction. It's not uncommon for would-be dragonslayers to be sent home carrying their own heads under one arm as a lesson in humility. The unluckier ones, alas, may be kept as trophies—and, in a very literal sense, conversation pieces—while the dragon devours their greater portion. Some might even wear their favorite severed heads as a macabre necklace.

Sea Archragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Countered by Earth.description: 如果海龙成为具有土特征的法术的目标，液化将会结束，他不能使用之直到其下个回合结束。
Countered by Earth.name: 为土所克 Countered by Earth

Fed by Metal.name: 由金而生 Fed by Metal
Fed by Metal.description:
当海龙被具有金特征的法术或生物的无武装打击，或金属武器伤害时，其鳞片会发生变化，这会赋予他在AC上+2物品加值直到其下个回合开始。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.OMJnZspk5YHai8yn]

Typhoon Fling.name: 台风翱翔 Typhoon Fling
Typhoon Fling.description:
频率 每小时一次

效果 龙飞行至多其飞行速度一半的距离。龙路径上10尺内所有生物必须尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:42]豁免，否则被向上吹飞到空中120尺，然后坠落，并受到相应的坠落伤害。已经处于空中的生物，其坠落距离需要加上当前高度。

Tidal Wave.name: 潮涌 Tidal Wave
Tidal Wave.description:
频率 每10分钟一次

效果 龙拍打自己的身体，向外发出一道滔天巨浪。这道波浪对@Template[type:emanation|distance:90]范围造成@Damage[11d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害。区域内每个生物必须尝试一次@Check[reflex|dc:42]豁免。区域内的构造物和无主物体无需豁免承受全额伤害。

大成功 该生物不受伤害但被推离龙30尺。

成功 该生物受到一半伤害并被推离龙60尺。

失败 该生物受到全额伤害并被推离龙120尺，并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

大失败 同失败但受到双倍伤害。

Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 水波感知（模糊）60尺 Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Liquefy.name: 液化 Liquefy
Liquefy.description:
触发 龙受到火焰伤害

效果 龙瞬间变成水同时维持其形状。他获得火焰伤害抗力25（包括对抗触发效果时），直到其下个回合结束。

Vortex.name: 涡流 Vortex
Vortex.description: 60尺。灵光范围内，与龙处于同一水体的水对于没有水特征的生物游泳时来说视作困难地形。

Black Water Breath.name: 黑水吐息 Black Water Breath
Black Water Breath.description: 龙向80尺内射出一个对@Template[burst|distance:40]范围造成@Damage[21d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害的水球（@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。半径内所有非魔法火焰会被熄灭。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4轮}内再次使用黑水吐息。

Hyponatremia.name: 低血钠症 Hyponatremia
Hyponatremia.description: 一个受到来自海龙颚咬打击伤害的活物必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:38]豁免，否则会因为体内激增的水量而陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}。

Sea Archragon (Spellcaster).name: 至古海龙施法者 Sea Archragon (Spellcaster)
Sea Archragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
海帝龙与水元素相连，掌管着雨水、风暴、江河与海洋。他们栖息于天夏文明的附近，随时准备协助凡间事务以证明自身价值。对某些海龙而言，在天气与奥术知识方面提供帮助是职责所在。对另一些则不过是获取珍贵贡品或美味佳肴的动机。前来求见者皆热切献礼，因传说海龙欢愉时，雨水便会柔和丰沛。反之，若他们愤怒时，风暴将肆虐无情。

尽管天夏人普遍如此认为，但文明绝非受制于海龙的摆布，因为大多数海龙都是王国的臣子，宣誓协助凡人。绝大多数海龙都是四海龙王之一的臣子，这些龙王的领地或联合王国分别坐落于因拜罗洋（Embaral Ocean），象牙海（Ivory Sea），御海洋（Okaiyo Ocean），颂寂海（Songil Sea）。鉴于水元素位面本无原生海龙，有理论认为这些王国可能是从无际之海（Boundless Sea）大规模迁徙的残余势力。海龙自身的传说记载，远古之王曾为逃避元素领主凯利赞德里的迫害而立下誓言。尽管尚不确定咸水帝王是否仍在追杀海龙，但多数海龙仍恪守誓约作为其文化传承，或为纪念先祖荣光。

Rime Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Rime Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)

Arctic Hunter.name: Arctic Hunter
Arctic Hunter.description: A rime dragon's natural camouflage allows them to [[/act hide]] in arctic terrain without cover. A rime dragon also ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from ice and snow and doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.

Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
Snow Vision.description: Snow doesn't impair the rime dragon's vision; they ignore concealment from snowfall.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Blizzard Breath.name: Blizzard Breath
Blizzard Breath.description: The dragon breathes out a gust of frost and ice that deals @Damage[6d8[cold]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save). They can't use Blizzard Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Blizzard Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Piercing Ice.name: Piercing Ice
Piercing Ice.description:
Requirements The dragon has temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield

Effect The dragon launches the collected ice shards from its scales in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], dealing @Damage[3d6[piercing],2d6[cold]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save). The dragon then loses the AC bonus and temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield.

Rime Shield.name: Rime Shield
Rime Shield.description:
Requirements The rime dragon's last action was to Fly at least 40 feet

Effect Water vapor collected on the dragon's scales quickly freezes over. The dragon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and 5 temporary Hit Points that last until the end of the dragon's next turn.

Rime Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Rime dragons are the embodiment of the frigid cold and ice. These hardy creatures have adapted to harsh arctic climates, able to survive indefinitely in sub-zero temperatures. Rime dragons are shades of white and pale blue that perfectly camouflage them in their natural habitat, resembling glaciers or mounds of snow when curled up. They can break through large slabs of ice and dive into frozen waters in search of prey. Due to their natural lower body temperature, they can slow their digestive tract, which allows them to live a long time on little food. Large prey—such as whales, caribou, or moose—offer the best sustenance, but they aren't picky when it's time to eat.

Rime dragons have a deep curiosity for things hidden and lost in the ice. The ocean's currents bring all kinds of artifacts from across the world to their frigid waters. Self-described caretakers and scholars, rime dragons search the arctic regions for ancient antiquities. Rime dragons with an academic interest in archaeology peer into glaciers for pieces of civilizations both recent and ancient, which they preserve in their lairs. Others might search for fossils or preserved corpses. Rime dragons also have an interest in more biological aspects of the world. As preservers of life, some of these dragons collect flora to log and study, and they protect endangered species by using low temperatures to conserve them. They also act as paleopathologists, studying ancient diseases that could cause havoc if they were brought back to a populace unknowingly. These they carefully contain while researching mitigation strategies should the pathogens be reintroduced to the world.

Rise Up.name: Rise Up
Rise Up.description:
Trigger A creature walks on top of an ancient bog dragon who is burrowed into the mud or peat below

Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled

Effect The bog dragon automatically notices the creature and Burrows before rolling initiative.

Drag Beneath the Muck.description:
Requirements The bog archdragon is in a swamp and doesn't have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in their jaws

Effect The dragon Burrows, and if they end their movement directly under a creature, they make a jaws Strike against that creature, who is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the attack.

If the Strike is successful, the dragon makes an Athletics check to grapple the target with their jaws; like Grab, this check doesn't use or contribute to the archdragon's multiple attack penalty.

The dragon then Burrows again; any creature they have grabbed or restrained in their jaws moves with them.
Drag Beneath the Muck.name: Drag Beneath the Muck

Nidorous Breath.description: The dragon belches a boiling spray of fermenting stomach acid that deals @Damage[14d8[acid]|options:area-damage] damage and @Damage[2d6[persistent,acid]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic] save). They can't use Nidorous Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Nidorous Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
Nidorous Breath.name: Nidorous Breath

Slain to Serve.name: Slain to Serve
Slain to Serve.description:
A bog dragon can perform a special ritual over the body of a humanoid creature slain by bog rot to raise it as a humanoid intelligent undead.

This functions like a 10th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.c3b6LdLlQDPngNIb]{Create Undead} ritual, except that it takes only 8 hours, the bog dragon doesn't require any secondary casters, and they don't need to pay a cost.

If the bog dragon critically fails the ritual's skill check, they get a failure instead.

Swamp Passage.description: The bog dragon ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.
Swamp Passage.name: Swamp Passage

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Tail Lash.name: Tail Lash
Tail Lash.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail makes a Strike or attempts a skill check as part of an attack action

Effect The dragon Strikes with their tail at the triggering creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash}

Bog Rot.name: Bog Rot
Bog Rot.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[acid]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage, clumsy 1, and a –5-foot status penalty to Speed (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[5d6[acid]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and a –10-foot status penalty to Speed (1 day)

Stage 5 death

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Nidorous Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Bog Archdragon.name: Bog Archdragon
Bog Archdragon.publicNotes:
The bogs of Golarion are timeless places, unyielding against the encroachment of civilization and greedily hoarding the dead of epochs long past within the murky depths of the morass. Thus, it doesn't take a bard to note that a bog dragon represents the most primal embodiment of their namesake. These dragons are as calm as the brackish waters, as perfectly patient as any crocodile mistaken for debris, and as ancient as any fear held of the realms they dwell within. To the many cultures they've stalked since the first humanoids dared to build their dwellings near brackish fens, a bog dragon is a terror consigned to the nebulous realm of monster and abomination. Though most have been relegated to the stuff of legends and the mythic nightmares of river valley city-states, bog dragons are still out there, lurking beneath the loam.

Bog dragons haunt the parables of old, their primal characteristics a raw expression of a primeval world that rebukes the tyranny of time's progression. Their bodies are those of a belly-dragging thing, corpulent and richly shielded by a scabrous hide of spurs and spines. Their claws, much like their wings, are feeble things, vestiges of a more graceful draconic concept that only the eldest bog archdragon might attain. Their faces are masks of terror; their lips curl back in a snarl to expose brutish grins of dagger-like fangs, pock-marked by vicious stomach acids that give their latent breath the malodorous turpitude that stings the senses almost unto dizziness. They're every inch a night-going monstrosity, a harrowing horror that would drive terror into any who behold them, the pinnacle of marsh-born predators.
Bog Archdragon.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a cinder dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

All Becomes Flame.description:
The dragon curses a creature within 60 feet to have its magic replaced with primordial flames. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:43] save. Regardless of the result, the target becomes temporarily immune for 1 day.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is cursed for 1 round. While cursed, any damage the cursed creature would deal by any means becomes fire damage, regardless of the original damage type. The cursed creature can temporarily suppress the curse for 1 round as an action.

Failure As success, but the curse's duration is 1 hour.

Critical Failure As success, but the curse's duration is 1 day.
All Becomes Flame.name: All Becomes Flame

Blazing Wind.name: Blazing Wind
Blazing Wind.description:
Requirements The dragon is able to use their Pyre Breath

Effect The dragon Flies up to their Speed in a straight line. At the end of their movement, a superheated gale blows out ahead of them in a @Template[type:line|distance:200] that's 20 feet wide. Structures and vehicles might collapse or catch fire in the whirling inferno, as earthquake. In addition, any creature in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:45] save. This ability counts as a use of the dragon's Pyre Breath.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[8d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[16d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure As failure, plus metal items are superheated and wooden items catch fire. The object takes @Damage[5d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage] damage, as does the creature wearing or holding it, though they can drop or take off the item to avoid taking the damage.

Pyre Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of flame that deals @Damage[22d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:70] (@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic] save). Creatures that critically fail their save catch fire, taking @Damage[2d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage] damage. The area then fills with black smoke for 1 minute. This has the effects of mist, except it fills the cone's area. The dragon can't use Pyre Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Pyre Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
Pyre Breath.name: Pyre Breath

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Boiling Blood.name: Boiling Blood
Boiling Blood.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon's superheated blood spills onto the attacker. The target takes @Damage[12d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic] save).

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Pyre Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Stoke the Flames.name: Stoke the Flames
Stoke the Flames.description: The dragon intensifies nearby fires. Every foe within 60 feet that is taking persistent fire damage takes @Damage[5d6[fire]] damage.

Cinder Archdragon.name: Cinder Archdragon
Cinder Archdragon.publicNotes: Among the largest and fiercest dragons, cinder dragons are typically volatile, demanding respect—even deference—from lesser creatures. Cinder dragons' appearance evokes their flame, often in scales with mixed patterns of red, orange, and yellow. Many cinder dragons dwell in active volcanoes and similarly fiery locales. Cinder dragons prefer treasures that can withstand the heat of their bodies and lairs, with gemstones, gold, and silver common among their hoards.

Stormcrown Dragon (Young).name: Stormcrown Dragon (Young)
Stormcrown Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
Heralds of—and heralded by—the primal forces of thunder and lightning, stormcrown dragons meld the majesty of fierce storms and mighty dragons. Driven by emotion and curiosity, these mercurial dragons can change from friend to foe or threatening to thoughtful in mere moments.

While no strangers to the personality traits for which dragons are well-known—pride, imperiousness, desire for lovely things, and so on—stormcrown dragons are by nature gregarious, even jovial. Indeed, these dragons often mingle with local communities or extend invitations for everything from raucous feasts to elegant soirees. To offend a stormcrown dragon, however, is most unwise. Insults to the dragon's hospitality or friendship, assertions of authority, and demands on them are all likely to elicit a tempestuous response, in every sense of the word. Cursed metamorphosis is a personal favorite of older stormcrown dragons for the disrespectful and demanding, forcing shapes on them more befitting their insignificance. A stormcrown dragon's fury often passes as suddenly as it arises, however, particularly when dulled by a suitable display of contrition.

Motionsense.name: Motionsense
Motionsense.description: A stormcrown dragon can detect the movement of nearby creatures through vibration and air movement. This precise sense works only against creatures and objects that moved in the previous round.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Superconductor.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack or spell

Effect The dragon uses the displaced air or magical trajectory of the attack as a channel for its electrical energy. The dragon attempts a storm bolt Strike against the attacker, regardless of range.
Superconductor.name: Superconductor

Coronal Cloak.name: Coronal Cloak
Coronal Cloak.description: When the dragon spends an action to Hover while in stormy weather, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} until they move or until the beginning of their next turn, whichever comes first.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Galvanic Barrage whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Galvanic Barrage.name: Galvanic Barrage
Galvanic Barrage.description: The dragon exhales a massive bolt of lightning at one creature within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[5d12[electricity]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save. The lightning then arcs to a creature of the dragon's choice within 30 feet of the previous target with the same effect. The dragon can't target the same creature more than once, and they must have line of effect to all targets. The bolt can continue to arc this way until the dragon runs out of targets or until a target critically succeeds at their save. The dragon can't use Galvanic Barrage again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Galvanic Barrage]]{1d4 rounds}.

Smooth Flying.name: Smooth Flying
Smooth Flying.description: The stormcrown dragon doesn't fall if they don't Fly during their turn, and they're unaffected by strong winds or similar effects unless they choose to be.

Coronal Cloak.name: Coronal Cloak
Coronal Cloak.description: When the dragon spends an action to Hover while in stormy weather, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} until they move or until the beginning of their next turn, whichever comes first.

Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。
Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Galvanic Barrage whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Galvanic Barrage.name: Galvanic Barrage
Galvanic Barrage.description: The dragon exhales a massive bolt of lightning at one creature within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[8d12[electricity]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save. The lightning then arcs to a creature of the dragon's choice within 30 feet of the previous target with the same effect. The dragon can't target the same creature more than once, and they must have line of effect to all targets. The bolt can continue to arc this way until the dragon runs out of targets or until a target critically succeeds at their save. The dragon can't use Galvanic Barrage again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Galvanic Barrage]]{1d4 rounds}.

Smooth Flying.name: Smooth Flying
Smooth Flying.description: The stormcrown dragon doesn't fall if they don't Fly during their turn, and they're unaffected by strong winds or similar effects unless they choose to be.

Motionsense.name: Motionsense
Motionsense.description: A stormcrown dragon can detect the movement of nearby creatures through vibration and air movement. This precise sense works only against creatures and objects that moved in the previous round.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Superconductor.name: Superconductor
Superconductor.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack or spell

Effect The dragon uses the displaced air or magical trajectory of the attack as a channel for its electrical energy. The dragon attempts a storm bolt Strike against the attacker, regardless of range.

Command Lightning.name: Command Lightning
Command Lightning.description:
Requirements The dragon's last action was to use Draconic Frenzy or Cast a Spell with the air or electricity trait and they're in an area of stormy weather

Effect The dragon directs a bolt of lightning at a creature within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[3d12[electricity]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save.

Stormcrown Dragon (Adult).name: Stormcrown Dragon (Adult)
Stormcrown Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
Heralds of—and heralded by—the primal forces of thunder and lightning, stormcrown dragons meld the majesty of fierce storms and mighty dragons. Driven by emotion and curiosity, these mercurial dragons can change from friend to foe or threatening to thoughtful in mere moments.

While no strangers to the personality traits for which dragons are well-known—pride, imperiousness, desire for lovely things, and so on—stormcrown dragons are by nature gregarious, even jovial. Indeed, these dragons often mingle with local communities or extend invitations for everything from raucous feasts to elegant soirees. To offend a stormcrown dragon, however, is most unwise. Insults to the dragon's hospitality or friendship, assertions of authority, and demands on them are all likely to elicit a tempestuous response, in every sense of the word. Cursed metamorphosis is a personal favorite of older stormcrown dragons for the disrespectful and demanding, forcing shapes on them more befitting their insignificance. A stormcrown dragon's fury often passes as suddenly as it arises, however, particularly when dulled by a suitable display of contrition.

Decelerating Dodge.name: Decelerating Dodge
Decelerating Dodge.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with a ranged Strike or spell attack

Effect The dragon slows time to evade, gaining concealment against the triggering attack.

Immortal.name: Immortal
Immortal.description: Time dragons age, but don't die from old age.

Second Chance.name: Second Chance
Second Chance.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger A creature within 60 feet (including the time dragon) fails a saving throw or skill check

Effect The target rerolls the check, but must use the second result. The target is then temporarily immune to Second Chance for 24 hours.

Time Portal.name: Time Portal
Time Portal.description:
Frequency once per century

Effect Over the course of 10 minutes, the time archdragon opens a portal to any point in time and travels through, taking up to 10 creatures along. The portal remains active for 1 week, connecting the two time periods, though only the time archdragon and creatures traveling with them can see or pass through it.

Chronowarp Aura.name: Chronowarp Aura
Chronowarp Aura.description:
30 feet. Time shifts strangely in the presence of a time archdragon. Each creature starting their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:43] save.

Success The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Failure The creature's age advances to elderly or regresses to youth (determined randomly) for 1 round. If elderly, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}; if a youth, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3}.

Starflight.name: Starflight
Starflight.description: A time dragon can survive in outer space and fly at incredible speed, taking [[/r 3d20]] hours to reach a destination within the same solar system or [[/r 3d20]] days for destinations beyond. They can carry up to six passengers of at least one size category smaller than themself, protecting them from the void of space.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge their Timeshift Breath.

Temporal Eddies.name: Temporal Eddies
Temporal Eddies.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon Strides or Flies up to their Speed, leaving behind afterimages of their past and future selves in each space they move through. Until the end of the dragon's next turn, they can use any of these spaces as the origin of their Strikes, spells, and other abilities. Observers also perceive the dragon in all these spaces simultaneously and must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:15] to target the dragon or fail to affect it. A creature can take a concentrate action to attempt to identify the dragon's true location with a successful @Check[will|dc:46] save.

Timeshift Breath.name: Timeshift Breath
Timeshift Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a blast of temporal energy, warping time in a @Template[type:cone|distance:80]. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:46] save. The dragon can't use Timeshift Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Timeshift Breath]]{1d4 rounds}. Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature shifts briefly forward in time, vanishing and reappearing at the beginning of the time dragon's next turn in the same location (or an adjacent space if their former location is occupied), unaware that any time has passed. While timeshifted, time pauses for that creature, and it cannot take actions or be affected by anything else.

Time Archdragon.name: Time Archdragon
Time Archdragon.publicNotes:
Some time dragons would say time is a deep well, with those who explore it dipping cups into the waters at varying depths. Others might say that time is a shattered mirror, each shard reflecting discrete points that can be viewed simultaneously. None would say time is a firm onward march of linear progress, moving inexorably to a predetermined result. Time is fluid and ever-shifting, and time dragons dedicate themselves to protecting its flow.

Although safeguarding the natural temporal order is a mission all time dragons devote themselves to, they go about it in different ways. Staunch traditionalists oppose any meddling with the timestream whatsoever, even to repair damage caused by prior attempts to influence it, viewing this as doing more harm than good. They believe mortals are too short-sighted to responsibly use time magic and might appear without warning to slay those they believe pose a threat to the timestream. Other time dragons attempt to guide the course of events along the path they believe correct while preventing external tampering, often focusing on particular regions, areas of interest, or even individuals

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Fire.name: 为火所克 Countered by Fire
Countered by Fire.description:
如果天龙受到火焰伤害，他们体内的金元素魔法会被回火。直到其下个回合结束，其在攻击骰和AC上承受-1环境减值，且颚咬打击不再造成电击伤害。如果天龙使用了钢电吐息，则限制结束。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.a4bZrBNL17zPjDiH]

Fed by Earth.name: 由土而生 Fed by Earth
Fed by Earth.description: 如果天龙成为土法术或效果的目标，他会将鳞片中的矿物质结晶化，形成折射或散射光线的外层以进行伪装。在1分钟内，天龙在飞行时处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]。

Steel Lightning Breath.name: 钢电吐息 Steel Lightning Breath
Steel Lightning Breath.description: 天龙向75尺内射出一个电球，对@Template[type:burst|distance:40]范围造成@Damage[12d12[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic]豁免）。其不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Steel Lightning Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用钢电吐息。

Stunning Electricity.name: 震慑电击 Stunning Electricity
Stunning Electricity.description:
天龙快速盘旋，然后释放噼啪作响的闪电，对@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]范围造成@Damage[5d12[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害。区域内每个生物都必须尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:44]豁免；无论结果如何，这些生物都会临时免疫10分钟。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物受到一半伤害，并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。

失败 该生物受到全额伤害，并陷入震慑1轮且4轮内不能飞行。

大失败 该生物受到双倍伤害，并陷入震慑2轮且1分钟内不能飞行。

Mist Vision.name: 迷雾视觉 Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: 雾与浓雾不会削弱天龙的视觉；其忽视由雾和迷雾造成的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态。

Divine Lightning.name: 神圣闪电 Divine Lightning
Divine Lightning.description:
需求 龙信仰祝佑条目列出"圣洁"的神祇

效果 天龙通过攻击引导神力，使得对抗邪秽时更加有效。它在对抗邪秽生物时，造成的任何电击伤害变为精魂伤害。

Metallic Strikes.name: 金属打击 Metallic Strikes
Metallic Strikes.description: 至古天龙的颚咬和爪抓打击在计算免疫，抗力和弱点时视作任何金属。

Perfected Flight.name: 完美飞行 Perfected Flight
Perfected Flight.description: 天龙不花费动作便可悬停在原地，并且他在用于空中机动的所有特技检定上自动成功。

Sky Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: 至古天龙施法者 Sky Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Sky Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
当帝龙初临物质宇宙时，每条龙都与自身诞生的元素位面紧密相连。随着元素领主之间的战争愈演愈烈，仁慈的领主们接连陨落，金元素位面与木元素位面相继自我封闭。对于源自腐蚀核心（Corroded Core）的龙族而言，它们的生存根基已然岌岌可危。这些龙类在山巅间辗转流亡，逃离妖怪征战的彼时危险的天夏。最终，当它们抵达沉沦山脉（Chenlun）、罗网山脉（Gossamer）、格桑山脉（Kelsang）、金山（Kimu）、库兰山脉（Kullan）、巨人山脉（Kyojin）与天境之墙（Wall of Heaven）时，天界生灵回应了它们的求救。当龙族失去金元素的支撑，天族便以神圣赐福与精粹相补。随着本质蜕变，这些龙从而得以延续。久而久之，它们因贴近苍穹、侍奉神明而得名。昔日的金元素龙的岁月，终成褪色的记忆与创世神话，唯有天龙自身仍铭记于心。

天龙以永恒的侍奉来感恩。部分天龙吸收了所侍奉神祇的位面能量，变得庞大而强大；其中许多成为现代圣天龙的始祖。其余天龙则留在物质宇宙中，终生修习信仰，臻于生命与灵魂的神术技艺。真正能独立行动，运用非神术力量执行无关伟大意志任务的天龙实属罕见。即便如此，这些少数天龙仍保留着隐居沉思的本性，至少在年轻岁月里如此。

随着金元素位面的回归，关于天龙与该位面关联的谨慎探询悄然展开。有人猜测是否能寻得幸存的远亲。这些探询并非出于好奇，而是迫于现实需求。虽然天龙因天界生灵的加持获得了自保之力，却未能解决元素匮乏的问题。更糟的是，即便腐蚀核心已然回归，这种匮乏仍在持续。无论是从蛋里孵化还是自然分娩，天龙雏龙降生时都脆弱不堪，鳞片稀疏甚至全然不长。即便置身于大型矿藏或盐脉（作为金元素能量的磁体与蓄能库）之中，幼龙的鳞片也需历经数十年淬炼，方能坚韧到足以离开巢穴的程度。如果金元素位面存在这些问题的答案——无论是适合作为安全的产崽或育雏的场所，还是恢复龙类吸收环境元素能量的能力——确保所有天龙掌握此法并把握机会，实为当务之急。

Sea Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: 青年海龙施法者 Sea Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Sea Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
海帝龙与水元素相连，掌管着雨水、风暴、江河与海洋。他们栖息于天夏文明的附近，随时准备协助凡间事务以证明自身价值。对某些海龙而言，在天气与奥术知识方面提供帮助是职责所在。对另一些则不过是获取珍贵贡品或美味佳肴的动机。前来求见者皆热切献礼，因传说海龙欢愉时，雨水便会柔和丰沛。反之，若他们愤怒时，风暴将肆虐无情。

尽管天夏人普遍如此认为，但文明绝非受制于海龙的摆布，因为大多数海龙都是王国的臣子，宣誓协助凡人。绝大多数海龙都是四海龙王之一的臣子，这些龙王的领地或联合王国分别坐落于因拜罗洋（Embaral Ocean），象牙海（Ivory Sea），御海洋（Okaiyo Ocean），颂寂海（Songil Sea）。鉴于水元素位面本无原生海龙，有理论认为这些王国可能是从无际之海（Boundless Sea）大规模迁徙的残余势力。海龙自身的传说记载，远古之王曾为逃避元素领主凯利赞德里的迫害而立下誓言。尽管尚不确定咸水帝王是否仍在追杀海龙，但多数海龙仍恪守誓约作为其文化传承，或为纪念先祖荣光。

Countered by Earth.name: 为土所克 Countered by Earth
Countered by Earth.description: 如果海龙成为具有土特征的法术的目标，液化将会结束，他不能使用之直到其下个回合结束。

Fed by Metal.name: 由金而生 Fed by Metal
Fed by Metal.description:
当海龙被具有金特征的法术或生物的无武装打击，或金属武器伤害时，其鳞片会发生变化，这会赋予他在AC上+1物品加值直到其下个回合开始。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.OMJnZspk5YHai8yn]

Black Water Breath.description: 龙向40尺内射出一个对@Template[burst|distance:20]范围造成@Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害的水球（@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。半径内所有非魔法火焰会被熄灭。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4轮}内再次使用黑水吐息。
Black Water Breath.name: 黑水吐息 Black Water Breath

Hyponatremia.name: 低血钠症 Hyponatremia
Hyponatremia.description: 一个受到来自海龙颚咬打击伤害的活物必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:26]豁免，否则会因为体内激增的水量而陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

Liquefy.name: 液化 Liquefy
Liquefy.description:
触发 龙受到火焰伤害

效果 龙瞬间变成水同时维持其形状。他获得火焰伤害抗力10（包括对抗触发效果时），直到其下个回合结束。

Crystal Dragon (Ancient).name: Crystal Dragon (Ancient)
Crystal Dragon (Ancient).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

+2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal

Shimmering Armor.name: Shimmering Armor
Shimmering Armor.description: When the dragon takes a critical hit from any attack that deals physical damage, its hide chips, releasing sharp slivers. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] take @Damage[13d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect] save.

Cobblegems.name: Cobblegems
Cobblegems.description: 10 feet. The dragon constantly sheds crystalline scales onto the ground around it. The area is uneven ground (DC 34).

Shielding Stone.name: Shielding Stone
Shielding Stone.description:
Trigger A creature at least 10 feet away from the dragon targets them with an attack

Requirements The dragon is on the ground and there is at least one unoccupied square between themself and the attacker

Effect The dragon conjures a thin slab of stone in an unoccupied square between themself and the attacker. The dragon gains standard cover against the triggering attack. The stone falls on the first person other than the dragon who enters that square, dealing @Damage[8d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:34|basic] save. Otherwise, it crumbles harmlessly after 1 round.

Crystallize.name: Crystallize
Crystallize.description: The claws of an ancient crystal dragon embed shards that slowly turns the flesh of those they Strike to crystal. The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:34|options:inflicts:petrified,inflicts:slowed] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. Further failed saves against crystallize increase the slowed condition. Once a creature's actions are reduced to 0 by crystallize, that creature becomes petrified, turned into crystal instead of stone.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Ornamental Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Lustrous Lunge.name: Lustrous Lunge
Lustrous Lunge.description: The dragon strikes a pose that makes its hide sparkle in the light. Each creature within 20 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:34|inflicts:dazzled] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Ornamental Breath.name: Ornamental Breath
Ornamental Breath.description: The dragon exhales a torrent of shattered rocks and minerals in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] dealing @Damage[16d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:37|options:area-effect,inflicts:clumsy] save). A creature who fails the save is weighed down by the stones, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure).

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal

Pressurized Pool.name: Pressurized Pool
Pressurized Pool.description: The dragon expels a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] of pressurized water within 120 feet that lasts for 1 minute. A creature other than a brine dragon that enters or begins their turn within a burst must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] save or become encumbered until the beginning of their next turn.

Aquatic Echolocation.name: Aquatic Echolocation
Aquatic Echolocation.description: A brine dragon can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

Regent's Glower.name: Regent's Glower
Regent's Glower.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon focuses their weighty gaze upon their assailant, filling their foe with dread. The triggering creature takes @Damage[6d8[mental]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:35|basic] save. Any creature who fails the save also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

Bathygenic Barrage.name: Bathygenic Barrage
Bathygenic Barrage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon uses Pressurized Pool three times. None of the bursts can overlap.

Benthic Bite.name: Benthic Bite
Benthic Bite.description: A creature who takes damage from a brine dragon's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round.

Crushing Breath.name: Crushing Breath
Crushing Breath.description: The dragon spews a @Template[type:line|distance:100] of pressurized water that deals @Damage[18d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save. A creature that fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. The dragon can't use Crushing Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Crushing Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Tidal Surge.name: Tidal Surge
Tidal Surge.description: The dragon sweeps their wings, creating a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of buffeting water that deals @Damage[12d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:38|basic] save. Each unattended object and each creature that fails the save is also pushed away from the dragon 20 feet (30 feet on a critical failure) and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The dragon can't use Tidal Surge again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Tidal Surge]]{1d4 rounds}.

Brine Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Brine Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Brine Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Flummoxing Flurry.name: Flummoxing Flurry
Flummoxing Flurry.description:
Trigger The swarm takes damage

Effect The swarm's frenzied flapping intensifies as the dragonets attempt to confuse their foes. Each creature in the swarm's space must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until they are outside of the swarm's space.

Acrid Bites.name: Acrid Bites
Acrid Bites.description: Each enemy in the pest drake swarm's space takes @Damage[3d6[piercing]] damage and @Damage[2d6[persistent,acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save).

Pest Drake Swarm.name: Pest Drake Swarm
Pest Drake Swarm.publicNotes:
Pest drakes are the feral descendants of valuable racing "pace drakes." Prized for their colors, speed, and homing ability, pace drakes have been bred, traded, and raced throughout Golarion. Their popularity invariably led to the establishment of feral populations, as these naturally nervous creatures used their homing ability to establish protective flocks. Readily agitated, these rat-sized dragonets are dangerous in large numbers. They are easily overlooked in urban areas, however, as familiarity breeds complacency from those who see these dragonets every day with little incident.

Many pest drakes are a dun or dusty brown in color, though some flocks retain the brilliant blues, reds, and greens of their captive relatives. Both varieties have many tiny spines that resemble hairs and short, stubby noses that earned them the derogatory nickname of "dragon-winged rats." Much like other urban animals, pest drakes are highly adaptable, adept at scavenging food from trash piles or discarded foodstuffs. People likewise find the tiny dragons cute and will feed them, despite laws or warnings.

Pest drakes live in cities and ruins. They build their lairs atop hidden stone ledges and within inaccessible monument alcoves. There, their acidic mess often does irreparable damage before it is discovered and removed. Such lairs are usually full of tiny trinkets swiped off the street, such as earrings, coins, and nails they pull from cart wheels.

Though dragonets are smaller and lacking the raw power of great dragons, they are every bit as varied and fascinating as their larger relatives. Like dragons, dragonets have strong ties to magic. These ties influence the contrasting natures exhibited by different dragonet types. For example, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.QIXc18xHrEWDmtKW]{Fey Dragonets} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core-2.Actor.Zh8awPHA7DZxTboc]{House Drakes} make fascinating pets and companions, and thus are a popular familiar for spellcasters. Tidepool dragonets, on the other hand, are arrogant and untamable.

Assuming dragonets are harmless due to their size, or the fact that they often live near people, is dangerous. Pest drakes, for instance, are weak and shy individually but are inclined to form dangerous swarms when unsettled. By contrast, pearl dragonets are gentle oddities that seem naturally friendly.

Dragonets range in size from little bigger than songbirds to no larger than house cats. Unlike most great dragons, they stop growing after reaching maturity. They vary greatly in intelligence; fey dragonets are known for their tricks and wit, while feral racing drakes have the average problem solving capacity of a pigeon. Each type of dragonet has its own lairing and hoarding habits, and they have unique abilities that reveal their magical nature.

Sea Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: 成年海龙施法者 Sea Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)

Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 水波感知（模糊）60尺 Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Earth.name: 为土所克 Countered by Earth
Countered by Earth.description: 如果海龙成为具有土特征的法术的目标，液化将会结束，他不能使用之直到其下个回合结束。

Fed by Metal.name: 由金而生 Fed by Metal
Fed by Metal.description:
当海龙被具有金特征的法术或生物的无武装打击，或金属武器伤害时，其鳞片会发生变化，这会赋予他在AC上+1物品加值直到其下个回合开始。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.OMJnZspk5YHai8yn]

Black Water Breath.name: 黑水吐息 Black Water Breath
Black Water Breath.description: 龙向50尺内射出一个对@Template[burst|distance:25]范围造成@Damage[13d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害的水球（@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。半径内所有非魔法火焰会被熄灭。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4轮}内再次使用黑水吐息。

Hyponatremia.name: 低血钠症 Hyponatremia
Hyponatremia.description: 一个受到来自海龙颚咬打击伤害的活物必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:32]豁免，否则会因为体内激增的水量而陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

Liquefy.name: 液化 Liquefy
Liquefy.description:
触发 龙受到火焰伤害

效果 龙瞬间变成水同时维持其形状。他获得火焰伤害抗力15（包括对抗触发效果时），直到其下个回合结束。

Vortex.name: 涡流 Vortex
Vortex.description: 40尺。灵光范围内，与龙处于同一水体的水对于没有水特征的生物游泳时来说视作困难地形。

Sea Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
海帝龙与水元素相连，掌管着雨水、风暴、江河与海洋。他们栖息于天夏文明的附近，随时准备协助凡间事务以证明自身价值。对某些海龙而言，在天气与奥术知识方面提供帮助是职责所在。对另一些则不过是获取珍贵贡品或美味佳肴的动机。前来求见者皆热切献礼，因传说海龙欢愉时，雨水便会柔和丰沛。反之，若他们愤怒时，风暴将肆虐无情。

尽管天夏人普遍如此认为，但文明绝非受制于海龙的摆布，因为大多数海龙都是王国的臣子，宣誓协助凡人。绝大多数海龙都是四海龙王之一的臣子，这些龙王的领地或联合王国分别坐落于因拜罗洋（Embaral Ocean），象牙海（Ivory Sea），御海洋（Okaiyo Ocean），颂寂海（Songil Sea）。鉴于水元素位面本无原生海龙，有理论认为这些王国可能是从无际之海（Boundless Sea）大规模迁徙的残余势力。海龙自身的传说记载，远古之王曾为逃避元素领主凯利赞德里的迫害而立下誓言。尽管尚不确定咸水帝王是否仍在追杀海龙，但多数海龙仍恪守誓约作为其文化传承，或为纪念先祖荣光。
Sea Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Fed by Wood.name: Fed by Wood
Fed by Wood.description:
When an underworld dragon is struck by a weapon made primarily of wood or affected by a spell with the plant or wood trait, the dragon’s internal fiery essences are stoked with the added fuel. Their Exploding Red Breath recharges, and the fire damage from the dragon’s jaws deals an additional die of damage until the end of the dragon’s next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4FMFRlEC923CnLI7]{Effect: Fed by Wood}

Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Exploding Red Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.
Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair an underworld dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Countered by Water.name: Countered by Water
Countered by Water.description:
If the underworld dragon takes damage from a spell with the cold or water trait, the elemental magic of fire within them is momentarily dampened. Until the end of their next turn, they take a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, and their jaws Strikes don't deal fire damage. This limitation ends if the dragon uses Exploding Red Breath.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.81XYZZ3H0GL8thdQ]{Effect: Countered by Water}

Sweltering Heat.name: Sweltering Heat
Sweltering Heat.description: 10 feet. Each creature that ends its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} while it remains in the aura.

Adamantine Claws.name: Adamantine Claws
Adamantine Claws.description:
Frequency one per hour

Effect The dragon infuses their body with adamantine. For the next minute, their melee Strikes are treated as adamantine and ignore half the Hardness of any object hit.

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: The dragon makes one claw Strike and one tail Strike in either order, each against the same target. If either Strike hits, the dragon can attempt to Grab the target with that limb as a free action. The dragon can have up to three creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} at a time; one in each of their front claws, and a last with their tail.

Exploding Red Breath.name: Exploding Red Breath
Exploding Red Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of fire that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:25] within 50 feet, dealing @Damage[10d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[2d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage] damage. The dragon can't use Exploding Red Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Exploding Red Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Underworld Dragon (Adult).name: Underworld Dragon (Adult)
Underworld Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
If there are any imperial dragons who benefited from moving out of their native elemental plane, it's underworld dragons. Once related solely to the element of fire, early underworld dragons harnessed elemental forces through arcane means for reasons no longer remembered. With each subsequent generation, both their arcane power and mastery over the elements grew. Their efforts were later bolstered by their studies in alchemy, which allowed dragons to cultivate themselves even further with various mutagens and elixirs.

Today, though their nature is primarily still connected with the element of fire, an underworld dragon can consume wood with ease, threaten entire regions with quakes, lay claim to the minerals and gems in the rocks and stone, and die to form volcanoes that create more land masses. Some even flippantly snort at the lapping waves of the sea, not fearing any retaliation from the sea dragon nations nor their kings. Though their powers might be relatively weaker than another imperial dragon of the same age, their mastery of many elements and the arcane arts makes underworld dragons formidable opponents.

Ironsense.name: Ironsense
Ironsense.description: The dragon can detect the presence of iron and other ferrous metals as a precise sense at the listed range.

Arcane Whirlwind.name: Arcane Whirlwind
Arcane Whirlwind.description:
15 feet.

A vortex of fist-sized balls of pure magic swirls around the dragon. Air within the emanation is difficult terrain for Flying creatures other than the dragon. A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn within the aura takes @Damage[8d6[force]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:39|basic] save).

Shrapnel Splash.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee weapon or unarmed attack

Effect The dragon's blood forms into hard spheres as it erupts from the wound, battering the attacker. The creature who dealt the triggering damage takes @Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save.
Shrapnel Splash.name: Shrapnel Splash

Pushing Pulse.name: Pushing Pulse
Pushing Pulse.description: The barrage dragon performs a 2-action Force Pulse. Each creature who fails its save is pushed 15 feet away from the dragon (30 feet on a critical failure).

Ray Displacement.name: Ray Displacement
Ray Displacement.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with a ranged spell attack

Effect The dragon creates a field of distorted space between themself and the caster. The creature targeting the barrage dragon must roll the spell attack twice and take the worse result.

Force Pulse.name: Force Pulse
Force Pulse.description:
1 to 3

The dragon emits pulses of energy that radiates outward in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:25], dealing @Damage[(3d8+3)[force]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save).

For each action spent, a new pulse of energy is created and each subsequent pulse after the first is 5 feet larger than the previous one.

Scattershot.name: Scattershot
Scattershot.description: The dragon exhales a cloud of small balls of pure energy that deal @Damage[(11d4+11)[force]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] with no save. The dragon can't use Scattershot again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Scattershot]]{1d4 rounds}.

Unstoppable Onslaught.name: Unstoppable Onslaught
Unstoppable Onslaught.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The barrage archdragon transforms into pure energy and surges across the battlefield. They Fly up to their Speed, and during this movement they have resistance 30 to all damage (except spirit damage). At any point during this movement, the dragon can make up to two claw Strikes; each of these Strikes deals an additional @Damage[(3d8+3)[force]] damage.

Barrage Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Barrage Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Barrage Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
To the uninitiated, spellcasting is an art for those with iron wills, people who reach out and grab hold of the fundamental laws of the universe and bend them to their whim. It takes discipline, study, and above all else, it takes control. Fail to control the very building blocks of reality and everything could fall apart.

Those who have even dabbled in the arcane arts know that this is nonsense. Magic is chaos, and channeling arcane forces is less akin to exerting one's will over the world and more like surfing on a bolt of lightning through a world-shaking storm and hoping to steer it without falling off. Spellcasting is barely contained panic, a lance of adrenaline, the constant danger of burning oneself out of existence. And the more powerful someone becomes, the more real this danger is.

Wish Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Wish Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)

Destructive Wish.name: Destructive Wish
Destructive Wish.description:
Requirements An illusion from Wish Come True is currently active

Effect The wish dragon Dismisses the illusion of Wish Come True, which shatters into magical fragments, dealing @Damage[6d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] of the illusion.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Best Wishes.name: Best Wishes
Best Wishes.description: 20 feet. Being near a wish dragon gives other creatures a greater sense of what they truly wish for, bolstering their sense of purpose while also distracting them from the task at hand. Creatures in the aura take a –1 status penalty to Perception but gain a +2 status bonus to Will saving throws against mental effects. The wish dragon can't gain the benefit of their own aura or other actions that use the aura, and they can choose to exclude any creatures from any benefit of the aura or action that uses the aura.

Wished Away.name: Wished Away
Wished Away.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect The dragon wishes not to be hurt by this attack, gaining resistance 15 to all damage against the triggering attack.

Breath of Loss.name: Breath of Loss
Breath of Loss.description: The dragon breathes a warm, gentle breeze of mist that creates the feeling of when deepest desires are achieved. As the breeze dissipates, the feeling of loss overwhelms creatures' senses, dealing @Damage[11d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:29] save). A creature that critically fails its save is also consumed with the memory of the moment and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. The wish dragon can't use Breath of Loss again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath of Loss]]{1d4 rounds}.

Wish Come True.name: Wish Come True
Wish Come True.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon creates an illusion in an unoccupied square within 60 feet that appears to all other creatures that can see it to be the manifestation of their deepest material desire. This has the effects of illusory object (though the illusion might appear to be a creature to certain people) that last for 10 minutes. The wish dragon can Dismiss the illusion. Each non-wish dragon creature who begins their turn within 200 feet in line of sight of the illusion must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save. If any creature within reach of the illusion Interacts to touch it, the illusion ends and that creature is invigorated, gaining 2d4 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature disbelieves the illusion and becomes temporarily immune to Wish Come True for 1 hour.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Wish Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
What is a wish? A wish dragon would call it the truest expression of self—each individual wish reveals something of deep importance to the wisher, and no two wishes are ever quite the same. Whether the wish is one of creation or destruction, justice or vengeance, love or hate, wish dragons seek to understand what makes it important to the wisher and view their ability to make it a reality as a gift that helps them make sense of the world.

To a wish dragon, learning what someone wishes for is the beginning of a conversation, granting them that wish is a gift, and watching what they do with it is a reward. They take each part of this journey seriously and spend much of their lives moving among other ancestries to better understand what others want and need, especially during their younger years. While they view this mission as a righteous one, it can become all-consuming, and some have been known to lose all sense of themselves in their quest to bring about the dreams and desires of those around them.

Phase Archdragon.name: Phase Archdragon
Phase Archdragon.publicNotes: No place can contain a phase dragon or even hold their interest for long; their innate arcane connection ties them to teleportation and repositioning magic. Explorers and scholars, phase dragons move about at will, discovering new locales and the arcane secrets of teleportation. They frequently establish multiple lairs in far-flung places they repeatedly visit. Beyond the typical wealth found in lairs, phase dragons tend to keep items of sentimental value from their travels, such as a particularly rare flower from the region or a piece by a local artist.
Phase Archdragon.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Redirect.name: Redirect
Redirect.description:
Trigger A creature within 100 feet casts a teleportation spell or uses a teleportation effect to appear within 100 feet

Effect The dragon determines the destination of the spell or effect. It must be within 100 feet of the dragon and in the spell's range, on the ground, and in a space with no hazards.

Shoo!.name: Shoo!
Shoo!.description:
Trigger An enemy within 15 feet damages the dragon

Effect The dragon teleports the creature up to 45 feet away. The destination must be on the ground and in a space with no hazards.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Unerring Location.name: Unerring Location
Unerring Location.description: The dragon automatically attempts to counteract any teleportation effect that targets them (counteract rank 10th, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+37 #Counteract]]{+37}). The dragon can choose to be affected normally instead. Other creatures targeted by the same effect remain affected normally.

Blinking Barrage.name: Blinking Barrage
Blinking Barrage.description: The dragon channels all their teleportation prowess into a remarkable series of blows. The dragon teleports up to 70 feet to a space adjacent to a creature and makes a claw Strike against that creature. The dragon can do this any number of times, teleporting to a different creature each time. Each attack counts toward their multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until all attacks have been made. The dragon cannot take actions with the teleportation trait again until the end of their next turn.

Dislocating Breath.name: Dislocating Breath
Dislocating Breath.description: The dragon exhales a swirl of energy that pulls creatures apart, dealing @Damage[21d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic] save). The dragon can teleport any creature that fails its save, teleporting that creature up to 60 feet (or twice as far on a critical failure) in any direction. The destination must be on the ground and in a space with no hazards. The dragon can't use Dislocating Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dislocating Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: Whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike, the dragon chooses to either recharge Dislocating Breath or regain an expended teleportation spell.

Phase Jump.name: Phase Jump
Phase Jump.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The dragon teleports up to 120 feet. If they are airborne, they maintain their momentum, and do not fall at the end of their turn, even if they didn't use an action to Fly.

Portal Strike.name: Portal Strike
Portal Strike.description: The dragon momentarily opens a small portal and makes a claw Strike against a creature within 120 feet. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the Strike.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Emotion.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Emotion

Binding Oath.name: Binding Oath
Binding Oath.description: The dragon forges a bond with a willing creature over an hour-long ceremony, making them a bonded companion. The dragon can always sense their distance from the companion and if they're moving closer or farther away. A bonded companion automatically critically succeeds on basic saving throws against the oath dragon's abilities and spells. This link is permanent and neither can form a new link until one member dies. If the dragon or the bonded companion dies, the survivor learns the identity of the killer, but the shock leaves the survivor @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 24 hours and prevents forming a new link for 1 month.

Heartening Aura.name: Heartening Aura
Heartening Aura.description: 50 feet. All allies in the aura gain a +2 status bonus to attack and damage rolls. The dragon's bonded companion also gains fast healing 20.

Shielding Wing.name: Shielding Wing
Shielding Wing.description:
Trigger The oath dragon or a bonded companion within 15 feet is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises its wing to protect itself or the bonded companion, providing a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.

Castigating Breath.name: Castigating Breath
Castigating Breath.description: The dragon unleashes a pronouncement that strikes at the soul of its enemies, dealing @Damage[15d10[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[will|dc:45|basic] save). The dragon can't use Castigating Breath for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
