Draconic Momentum.description: Whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike, the dragon recharges their Castigating Breath.

Dread Promise.name: Dread Promise
Dread Promise.description:
The dragon's roar shakes the resolve of all those who oppose them. The roar can be heard up to 1 mile away under the open sky. Any enemy who hears it is cowed by the dragon's resolve and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for as long as it's frightened.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for as long as it's frightened.

Inspiring Word.name: Inspiring Word
Inspiring Word.description: All allies within the dragon's heartening aura become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. Allies can use this extra action to Raise a Shield, Step, Stride, or Strike.

Oathbreaker’s Curse.name: Oathbreaker’s Curse
Oathbreaker’s Curse.description:
If a bonded companion willingly breaks their oath, they retain the benefit of being a bonded companion but are immediately cursed with no initial saving throw. The cursed creature can attempt saving throws as noted to prevent the curse from worsening.

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:50]

Effect The cursed creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't reduce their doomed value below 1 while they're cursed. The first time the cursed creature encounters the oath dragon each day, they must attempt a saving throw. In addition, each time the creature critically fails a Strike or spell attack against the oath dragon, they must attempt a saving throw. On a failure, their doomed value increases by 1, 2 on a critical failure, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 3}.

Oath Archdragon.name: Oath Archdragon
Oath Archdragon.publicNotes:
Oath dragons are the embodiment of a cause that they pursue with unerring determination. They draw their power not from mere words, but from the meaning and ideals that those words carry. Their dedication has led to the widespread imagery of oath dragons fighting alongside noble champions trying to bring goodness where only corruption is thought to dwell. Yet, there is nothing more terrifying than the power of an oath dragon who swears to a violent cause or who is dragged into damnation by their loyalty.

While an oath dragon can theoretically be dedicated to multiple ideals, they usually choose a single cause that they pursue with incredible devotion. They provide aid to those who share their dedication and fight fiercely against those who oppose it, all to uphold their ideals. Regardless of the causes they embrace, these dragons do so wholeheartedly. This unwavering determination gives them an intensity that is rarely matched by other creatures, spurring even the most reluctant ally to action.

Diabolic Archdragon.name: Diabolic Archdragon

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Hellfire Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
Hellfire Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a blast of infernal fire that deals @Damage[24d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:70] (@Check[reflex|dc:48|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The dragon can't use Hellfire Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hellfire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair the dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Hell's Sting.name: Hell's Sting
Hell's Sting.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon channels the rancor of Hell back through the body of their foe, overwhelming it with an infernal assault on the mind. The triggering creature takes @Damage[12d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:46|basic] save. Holy creatures use an outcome one degree of success worse than they roll on their saving throw.

Diabolic Fire.name: Diabolic Fire
Diabolic Fire.description: Any fire damage that a diabolic dragon deals, including fire damage from spells, is imbued with the unholy power of Hell to scorch the spirit as well. A creature takes spirit damage instead of fire damage if that would be more detrimental to the creature (as determined by the GM). A diabolic dragon is immune to the diabolic fire of other diabolic dragons, the fire from divine immolation, and similar effects.

Diabolic Impalement.name: Diabolic Impalement
Diabolic Impalement.description:
Requirements The dragon has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its claw and doesn't already have a creature impaled

Effect The dragon attempts an Athletics check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the dragon drives the creature through the bony protrusion on their chest, dealing @Damage[7d10[piercing]] damage (doubled on a critical success). The creature is grabbed while on the protrusion and can attempt to Escape as normal. The dragon's claws become free to Grab other creatures, and the dragon doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the impaled creature grabbed. If the dragon moves, they bring the grabbed creature along with them.

An impaled creature takes @Damage[2d10[spirit]] damage at the end of each of its turns, as the bone drives itself deeper to pierce the creature's soul. If the creature dies from this spirit damage, its soul becomes condemned to Hell. A creature condemned to Hell in this way can't be resurrected except by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual, divine intervention, or reclaiming the soul from Hell.

Diabolic Archdragon.publicNotes:
Hell, according to some theologians, is a living entity in and of itself. Diabolic dragons, these scholars argue, are just extensions of the plane, living creatures that break off from Hell to enact its will. Whether this is true or whether diabolical dragons are simply the reborn souls of dragons sent to Hell, the fact remains that these dragons are powerful, cunning, and tyrannical. Every diabolic dragon's goal is to further Hell's will, though how this happens can vary. Regardless of their goals, these dragons always approach newcomers with an unsettling calmness.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Diabolic Archdragon.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Eldritch Interference.name: Eldritch Interference
Eldritch Interference.description:
90 feet, @Check[will|dc:40].

Overlapping fields near the dragon make spellcasting unpredictable. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's eldritch interference for 1 minute.

Critical Success For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they gain a status bonus to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they take a status penalty to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Mystic Facility.name: Mystic Facility
Mystic Facility.description: The dragon can activate scrolls and wands of any tradition as if the spells they contain were occult spells.

Overwhelming Proclamation.description: The dragon exclaims hidden truths that only they have been able to understand, dealing @Damage[19d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:40|basic] save). On a critical failure, creatures are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. The dragon can't use Overwhelming Proclamation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Overwhelming Proclamation]]{1d4 rounds}.
Overwhelming Proclamation.name: Overwhelming Proclamation

Reveal Shame.name: Reveal Shame
Reveal Shame.description:
Requirements The dragon has successfully Recalled Knowledge about an enemy within 90 feet

Effect The dragon utters an embarrassing secret about the creature, unnerving them and their allies. Every enemy within 90 feet that can hear the secret must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}. Sanguine Knowledge As young sage dragon.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells

Divert Essence.name: Divert Essence
Divert Essence.description:
Trigger A creature within 90 feet Casts a Spell that targets the dragon

Effect The sage dragon steals energy from the spell to protect itself, gaining resistance to damage from spells equal to the triggering spell's rank until the beginning of their next turn.

Reflexive Understanding.name: Reflexive Understanding
Reflexive Understanding.description:
Frequency once per hour

Requirements The dragon was targeted by a spell of 8th rank or lower in the last round

Effect The dragon analyzes the spell's inner workings. For the next 10 minutes, the dragon can cast the spell at the same rank as if it were one of their innate occult spells.

Sanguine Knowledge.name: Sanguine Knowledge
Sanguine Knowledge.description: The first time each encounter a dragon hits and deals damage to a creature with their jaws Strike, they receive information about the creature as if the dragon had succeeded at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about that creature.

Sage Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Sage Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Sage Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
A shining, rune-inscribed scale is all that most people, even adventurers, see of a sage dragon during their lifetimes. Even then, only those familiar with dragon lore will likely recognize the scale as anything other than an elaborate spell scroll. Collectors and scholars of esoteric lore, sage dragons become increasingly reclusive as they age, and, even in their youths, they're prone to work through trusted intermediaries. For those able to locate and gain the trust of such a creature, even the youngest sage dragons are fonts of difficult-to-find knowledge and rare magical techniques. The oldest sage dragons are living combinations of gargantuan libraries and endless grimoires, accumulating the secrets of the Universe, and beyond, in their isolated lairs.

Organized and methodical, with an insatiable curiosity and eidetic memory, sage dragons are the devout researchers of the dragon world. The intellectual pursuits of sage dragons demand extended periods of quiet study, one of the reasons that such dragons live in isolated, hidden locations. Young dragons tend to specialize in a particular area of research. As they age, these research interests also broaden, with an expert in a particular river expanding into topics such as the water cycle, ecology, or the Plane of Water. Sage dragons interested in religious topics often worship Nethys or a god dedicated to knowledge, such as Gruhastha, Qi Zhong, or Ydajisk. Dragons who seek grim rituals or cryptic knowledge might join the church of Abraxas or worship Norgorber in his aspect of the Reaper of Reputation.

Magma Dragon (Young).name: Magma Dragon (Young)
Magma Dragon (Young).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Wing Deflection.name: Wing Deflection
Wing Deflection.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises a wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is Flying, they descend 10 feet after the attack.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horn Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Pyroclastic Blast whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Magma Burrow.name: Magma Burrow
Magma Burrow.description: A magma dragon's burrow Speed functions only when the dragon is Burrowing through magma or molten lava.

Pyroclastic Breath.name: Pyroclastic Breath
Pyroclastic Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of magma that deals @Damage[5d6[fire],3d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|basic|dc:28|options:area-effect]). They can't use Pyroclastic Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4#Recharge Pyroclastic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Aura of Authority.name: Aura of Authority
Aura of Authority.description:
60 feet. The divine majesty of an adult executor dragon can't be denied. A creature that enters or begins their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's aura of authority for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} for 10 minutes.

Rage of the Divine.name: Rage of the Divine
Rage of the Divine.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect Raw divine power flashes through the executor dragon harming anyone who dares strike it so brazenly. The creature who dealt the triggering attack takes @Damage[6d8[spirit]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:30|basic] save.

Divine Utterance.name: Divine Utterance
Divine Utterance.description: The dragon screams the truth of the divine, dealing @Damage[11d8[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save). They can't use Divine Utterance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Divine Utterance]]{1d4 rounds}.

Divine Sanctification.name: Divine Sanctification
Divine Sanctification.description: Once an executor dragon reaches adulthood, they are expected to sanctify as either holy or unholy; they gain the corresponding trait and weakness 10 to the opposing sanctification.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change its Speed or attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Executor Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Executor Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Executor Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Legends state the first executor dragons formed from the rage-filled screams of Sarenrae during her struggle against the Rough Beast. In the face of an enemy even she had no hope of redeeming, the ever-compassionate Dawnflower allowed her divine fury to escape from her lips as she struck down the primordial god, and from this act of anathema, the first executor dragons were given form. Since that moment, executor dragons represent the full wrath of the gods. Divine in nature, executor dragons typically appear to punish those who have strayed so far from the path of their deity's edicts as to begin embracing the anathema. Due to their potent nature as weapons of the divine, executor dragons are generally drawn to target not a single misbehaving follower, but entire villages, cities, or towns that have turned their backs on their gods. Many of the gods prefer not to use executor dragons as part of their punishment of mortal transgressors, and instead keep them reserved for the days of apocalyptic battles.

Though many believe executor dragons are spawned from divine magic, they are fully biological creatures. Compelled by faith and devotion and disgusted by hypocrisy and base cruelty, executor dragons tend to live near human settlements, but rarely within them. They form small familial groups when young, but grow more independent as they age, seeking to claim territory uninhabited by other dragons. Their chosen lairs tend to be locations secreted away, either in the ruins of mountaintop monasteries or in the cavernous depths beneath abandoned places of worship. For the few executor dragons that live actively among non-draconic peoples, even fewer do so in their natural forms. They are sometimes found living disguised as traveling lay priests who bring healing and alms for the needy, choristers singing hymnals, wandering monastic scholars who ask challenging and conflicted questions about faith, or quiet church custodians who protect and beautify their chosen houses of worship. It's said that one or more executor dragons might have even taken up the defense of Kenebres after its near destruction at the hands of the Khorramzadeh, Storm King of the Worldwound.

Dragontongue.description: When a dragon speaks, the universe listens. The dragon is immune to silence and abilities that would prevent them from speaking if the source's level is lower than the dragon's or its rank is lower than half the dragon's level rounded up.
Dragontongue.name: Dragontongue

Word of Wisdom.name: Word of Wisdom
Word of Wisdom.description:
Trigger An ally within 60 feet fails a saving throw

Effect The ally improves its result by one degree of success, turning a failure into a success or a critical failure into a normal failure. The dragon can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge this ability]]{1d4 rounds}.

Word of Caution.name: Word of Caution
Word of Caution.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Wise people listen when a vizier dragon speaks. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains immunity to the vizier dragon's Powerful Utterance and resistance 30 to all other damage for 1 round.

Word of Heroism.name: Word of Heroism
Word of Heroism.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Ancient dragons are the teachers of heroes. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains a +3 status bonus to attack rolls, Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks for 1 minute.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horns Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Powerful Utterance whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Dragonspeech.name: Dragonspeech
Dragonspeech.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The ancient dragon uses Word of Advice, Word of Caution, and Word of Heroism, though any given ally can only be the target of a single Word.

Powerful Utterance.name: Powerful Utterance
Powerful Utterance.description:
The dragon expresses their power in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Powerful Utterance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Powerful Utterance]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Ardent Proclamation (occult, fire) The dragon breathes a blast of flame in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] that deals @Damage[24d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic|traits:occult,fire] save).

  • Chastising Word (mental, occult) The dragon chides the targets strictly enough to leave the mind reeling. Each creature within a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:46|traits:mental,occult] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} for 1 minute (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 6} on a critical failure).

Word of Advice.name: Word of Advice
Word of Advice.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The dragon is a skilled mentor, and commands its students like a general. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon can Stride once and Strike once, in any order. If it hits, the Strike deals an additional @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage.

Word of Vigor.name: Word of Vigor
Word of Vigor.description: An archdragon is a wellspring of power, a well from which one might drink deep. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains regeneration 25 for 1 round, and the dragon can Sustain this effect once per round as a free action.

Vizier Archdragon.name: Vizier Archdragon
Vizier Archdragon.publicNotes:
There's a feeling every teacher knows. It's when one has taken a young mind and educated, trained, and molded them to one's specifications before setting them loose and watching the pupil act on one's teachings. It's a feeling of creation, control, and wonder, the knowledge that one has created this great and glorious thing—and if one has done the job exceptionally well, then the student will outshine the master. This is immortality and power, and this is what vizier dragons chase.

Vizier dragons are primarily concerned with the education and cultivation of people. People fascinate vizier dragons in all their riotous, contradictory complexity. Why do some people excel, and others falter and fail? Why does one person become a saint and the next a tyrant? Why do some become legends in their own time, while others labor in ignominy?

Aquatic Echolocation.name: Aquatic Echolocation
Aquatic Echolocation.description: A brine dragon can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

Benthic Bite.name: Benthic Bite
Benthic Bite.description: A creature who takes damage from a brine dragon's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} for 1 round.

Crushing Breath.name: Crushing Breath
Crushing Breath.description: The dragon spews a @Template[type:line|distance:120] of pressurized water that deals @Damage[21d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save. A creature that fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. The dragon can't use Crushing Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Crushing Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Pressurized Pool.description: The dragon expels a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] of pressurized water within 120 feet that lasts for 1 minute. A creature other than a brine dragon that enters or begins their turn within a burst must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:42] save or become encumbered until the beginning of their next turn.
Pressurized Pool.name: Pressurized Pool

Tidal Surge.name: Tidal Surge
Tidal Surge.description: The dragon sweeps their wings, creating a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of buffeting water that deals @Damage[14d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save. Each unattended object and each creature that fails the save is also pushed away from the dragon 20 feet (30 feet on a critical failure) and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The dragon can't use Tidal Surge again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Tidal Surge]]{1d4 rounds}.

Regent's Glower.name: Regent's Glower
Regent's Glower.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon focuses their weighty gaze upon their assailant, filling their foe with dread. The triggering creature takes @Damage[9d8[mental]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:42|basic] save. Any creature who fails the save also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal

Decompression Sickness.name: Decompression Sickness
Decompression Sickness.description: 20 feet. After the dragon uses their Crushing Breath, the pressure of the depths surrounds them for 1 round. Any creature that leaves the aura during this time must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save or become dizzy and unbalanced from the sudden change in pressure, treating all squares as difficult terrain until the end of their next turn. Incorporeal creatures are immune to this aura.

Bathygenic Barrage.name: Bathygenic Barrage
Bathygenic Barrage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon uses Pressurized Pool three times. None of the bursts can overlap.

Brine Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Brine Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Brine Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Superconductor.name: Superconductor
Superconductor.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack or spell

Effect The dragon uses the displaced air or magical trajectory of the attack as a channel for its electrical energy. The dragon attempts a storm bolt Strike against the attacker, regardless of range.

Command Lightning.name: Command Lightning
Command Lightning.description:
Requirements The dragon's last action was to use Draconic Frenzy or Cast a Spell with the air or electricity trait and they're in an area of stormy weather

Effect The dragon directs a bolt of lightning at a creature within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[5d12[electricity]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save.

Furious Cloudburst.name: Furious Cloudburst
Furious Cloudburst.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The dragon must be outdoors and aboveground

Effect The dragon exhales a massive bolt of lightning directly upward to create a terrible storm centered on the dragon. Strong winds blow in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:120] that lasts for 10 minutes; this creates greater difficult terrain for both flying creatures and creatures on the ground. Creatures in the area except for the dragon take a –2 circumstance penalty to Acrobatics and Perception checks and a –4 circumstance penalty to ranged attacks due to the wind and rain. This counts as stormy weather for the dragon's Command Lightning and Coronal Cloak, and the dragon can Command Lightning once per turn as a single action (instead of a free action that requires using Draconic Frenzy or Casting a Spell).

Galvanic Barrage.name: Galvanic Barrage
Galvanic Barrage.description: The dragon exhales a massive bolt of lightning at one creature within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[12d12[electricity]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save. The lightning then arcs to a creature of the dragon's choice within 60 feet of the previous target with the same effect. The dragon can't target the same creature more than once, and they must have line of effect to all targets. The bolt can continue to arc this way until the dragon runs out of targets or until a target critically succeeds at their save. The dragon can't use Galvanic Barrage again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Galvanic Barrage]]{1d4 rounds}.

Storm Howl.description: Whenever a creature critically fails a save against one of the stormcrown dragon's abilities that deals electricity damage, that creature is also permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}.
Storm Howl.name: Storm Howl

Smooth Flying.description: The stormcrown dragon doesn't fall if they don't Fly during their turn, and they're unaffected by strong winds or similar effects unless they choose to be.
Smooth Flying.name: Smooth Flying

Motionsense.name: Motionsense
Motionsense.description: A stormcrown dragon can detect the movement of nearby creatures through vibration and air movement. This precise sense works only against creatures and objects that moved in the previous round.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Coronal Cloak.name: Coronal Cloak
Coronal Cloak.description: When the dragon spends an action to Hover while in stormy weather, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} until they move or until the beginning of their next turn, whichever comes first.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Galvanic Barrage whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Stormcrown Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Stormcrown Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Stormcrown Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Heralds of—and heralded by—the primal forces of thunder and lightning, stormcrown dragons meld the majesty of fierce storms and mighty dragons. Driven by emotion and curiosity, these mercurial dragons can change from friend to foe or threatening to thoughtful in mere moments.

While no strangers to the personality traits for which dragons are well-known—pride, imperiousness, desire for lovely things, and so on—stormcrown dragons are by nature gregarious, even jovial. Indeed, these dragons often mingle with local communities or extend invitations for everything from raucous feasts to elegant soirees. To offend a stormcrown dragon, however, is most unwise. Insults to the dragon's hospitality or friendship, assertions of authority, and demands on them are all likely to elicit a tempestuous response, in every sense of the word. Cursed metamorphosis is a personal favorite of older stormcrown dragons for the disrespectful and demanding, forcing shapes on them more befitting their insignificance. A stormcrown dragon's fury often passes as suddenly as it arises, however, particularly when dulled by a suitable display of contrition.

Vorpal Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
Vorpal dragons were not created by some ancient divinity nor born of a specific realm or force. Their birth was an arcane accident, the result of unstoppable magic contacting immovable beast. In unknowable ancient ages, the first jabberwock was wrought by the Eldest and the first vorpal sword was wrought in turn to slay the beast. When that very first blade went snicker-snack for the very first time, tasting the primeval lifeblood of the draconic Tane, the first vorpal dragon was born.

Vorpal dragons are most notorious for their keen vorpal magic. Even the least of these dragons can sever a foe's head in a single lucky stroke. Unusually, however, the subject survives as a bipartite creature: a headless body controlled by a detached head that still thinks and speaks, and which can outlive said body's destruction. It's not uncommon for would-be dragonslayers to be sent home carrying their own heads under one arm as a lesson in humility. The unluckier ones, alas, may be kept as trophies—and, in a very literal sense, conversation pieces—while the dragon devours their greater portion. Some might even wear their favorite severed heads as a macabre necklace.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Cutting Rebuke.name: Cutting Rebuke
Cutting Rebuke.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's chin blade that the dragon can see makes a Strike against the dragon

Effect The dragon makes a chin blade Strike against the triggering creature.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Feast of Blood whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Feast of Blood.name: Feast of Blood
Feast of Blood.description: The dragon inhales sharply, pulling blood from wounds and into the dragon's maw. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] takes their current persistent bleed damage plus @Damage[6d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] save). The dragon gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the greatest amount of void damage dealt to a single creature this way. The dragon can't use Feast of Blood again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Feast of Blood]]{1d4 rounds}.

Vorpal Binding.name: Vorpal Binding
Vorpal Binding.description:
The vorpal dragon beheads its foes—sometimes without killing them. A vorpal dragon's chin blade Strikes count as having the vorpal weapon property rune for the purpose of weaknesses. Whenever the vorpal dragon critically succeeds on a chin blade Strike, it deals an additional @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage, which can be ended normally.

When a vorpal dragon rolls a natural 20 on a chin blade Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save; this has the incapacitation trait. On a failure, the creature is beheaded. A creature beheaded this way does not automatically die; instead, their head and body live on, disconnected but mystically linked, with the head controlling the body from afar. A beheaded creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} as they attempt to coordinate movements from an unusual perspective, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 4} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} if their head can't perceive their body from its location. These conditions are suppressed if the body holds its head, and don't apply to actions performed exclusively by the head, mind, or voice. If the body is killed, the head can live on, but destroying the head kills the body as well. This effect can be reversed by taking a 2-action activity, which has the manipulate trait, to firmly reattach the severed head to the correct body. Whether attaching the severed head to a different headless body is effective is at the GM's discretion.

Vorpal Dragon (Young).name: Vorpal Dragon (Young)

Benthic Bite.name: Benthic Bite
Benthic Bite.description: A creature who takes damage from a brine dragon's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round.

Aquatic Echolocation.name: Aquatic Echolocation
Aquatic Echolocation.description: A brine dragon can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Primal

Regent's Glower.name: Regent's Glower
Regent's Glower.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee attack

Effect The dragon focuses their weighty gaze upon their assailant, filling their foe with dread. The triggering creature takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:26|basic] save. Any creature who fails the save also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

Crushing Breath.name: Crushing Breath
Crushing Breath.description: The dragon spews a @Template[type:line|distance:50] of pressurized water that deals @Damage[8d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save. A creature that fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. The dragon can't use Crushing Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Crushing Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge Crushing Breath.

Pressurized Pool.name: Pressurized Pool
Pressurized Pool.description: The dragon expels a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] of pressurized water within 120 feet that lasts for 1 minute. A creature other than a brine dragon that enters or begins their turn within a burst must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or become encumbered until the beginning of their next turn.

Brine Dragon (Young).name: Brine Dragon (Young)
Brine Dragon (Young).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Forest Dragon (Adult).name: 成年森龙 Forest Dragon (Adult)
Forest Dragon (Adult).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Frightful Presence.description:
90尺，@Check[will|dc:32]。具有动物，真菌和植物特征的生物在豁免时承受-2环境减值。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]
Frightful Presence.name: 恐怖威压 Frightful Presence

Countered by Metal.name: 为金所克 Countered by Metal
Countered by Metal.description: 如果森龙受到来自金属物品或具有金特征效果的伤害，他将失去林地通行和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zlnXpME1T2uvn8Lr]直到其下个回合结束。

Fed by Water.name: 由水而生 Fed by Water
Fed by Water.description:
频率 每小时一次

触发 森龙成为一个水法术或效果的目标

效果 森龙获得40点临时生命值，持续1分钟。

Azure Swarm Breath.name: 蔚蓝虫群吐息 Azure Swarm Breath
Azure Swarm Breath.description: 森龙放出一群昆虫对@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围造成@Damage[14d6[piercing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）随后消散开来。豁免大失败的生物受到@Damage[2d6[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage]伤害。森龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Azure Swarm Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用蔚蓝虫群吐息。

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 森龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，森龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。

Draining Blight.name: 流失枯萎 Draining Blight
Draining Blight.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 森龙从周围的活物身上吸取水分来治愈自己的伤口。@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内的所有活物受到@Damage[7d10[void]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。完全由水和植物构成的生物使用比掷骰结果更差一级的成功度。森龙恢复等同于对该效果本次造成的所有伤害里最高的伤害数值的一半的生命值。区域内所有非生物植物枯萎死亡，清除所有非魔法灌木和所有因此产生的困难地形，掩蔽和隐蔽。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当森龙在一次打击中造成重击时，他充能其蔚蓝虫群吐息。

Forest Shape.name: 森林形态 Forest Shape
Forest Shape.description: 当施放@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]时，森龙可以变成体型和年龄与他们自身相同的树木，使用其自己的AC。

Woodland Passage.name: 林地通行 Woodland Passage
Woodland Passage.description: 森龙忽视由非魔法植物和真菌形成的困难地形和高等困难地形，例如灌木，藤蔓和林下植被。

Arctic Hunter.name: Arctic Hunter
Arctic Hunter.description: A rime dragon's natural camouflage allows them to [[/act hide]] in arctic terrain without cover. A rime dragon also ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from ice and snow and doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.

Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
Snow Vision.description: Snow doesn't impair the rime dragon's vision; they ignore concealment from snowfall.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Radiate Cold.name: Radiate Cold
Radiate Cold.description:
20 feet. The adult rime dragon's presence lowers the temperature around them. A creature who enters or begins their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature begins to shiver as the biting cold affects it. It takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn.

Failure The creature's body temperature begins to drop. It takes a –10-foot status penalty to their Speeds and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure Ice begins to form on the creature. It's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} ([[/act escape dc=37]]) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until the end of their its turn.

Blizzard Breath.name: Blizzard Breath
Blizzard Breath.description: The dragon breathes out a gust of frost and ice that deals @Damage[15d8[cold]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). They can't use Blizzard Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Blizzard Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Piercing Ice.name: Piercing Ice
Piercing Ice.description:
Requirements The dragon has temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield

Effect The dragon launches the collected ice shards from its scales in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], dealing @Damage[8d6[piercing],4d6[cold]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). The dragon then loses the AC bonus and temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield.

Rime Shield.name: Rime Shield
Rime Shield.description:
Requirements The rime dragon's last action was to Fly at least 40 feet

Effect Water vapor collected on the dragon's scales quickly freezes over. The dragon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and 20 temporary Hit Points that last until the end of the dragon's next turn.

Rime Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Rime Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Rime Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Rime dragons are the embodiment of the frigid cold and ice. These hardy creatures have adapted to harsh arctic climates, able to survive indefinitely in sub-zero temperatures. Rime dragons are shades of white and pale blue that perfectly camouflage them in their natural habitat, resembling glaciers or mounds of snow when curled up. They can break through large slabs of ice and dive into frozen waters in search of prey. Due to their natural lower body temperature, they can slow their digestive tract, which allows them to live a long time on little food. Large prey—such as whales, caribou, or moose—offer the best sustenance, but they aren't picky when it's time to eat.

Rime dragons have a deep curiosity for things hidden and lost in the ice. The ocean's currents bring all kinds of artifacts from across the world to their frigid waters. Self-described caretakers and scholars, rime dragons search the arctic regions for ancient antiquities. Rime dragons with an academic interest in archaeology peer into glaciers for pieces of civilizations both recent and ancient, which they preserve in their lairs. Others might search for fossils or preserved corpses. Rime dragons also have an interest in more biological aspects of the world. As preservers of life, some of these dragons collect flora to log and study, and they protect endangered species by using low temperatures to conserve them. They also act as paleopathologists, studying ancient diseases that could cause havoc if they were brought back to a populace unknowingly. These they carefully contain while researching mitigation strategies should the pathogens be reintroduced to the world.

Blizzard Breath.description: The dragon breathes out a gust of frost and ice that deals @Damage[12d8[cold]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic] save). They can't use Blizzard Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Blizzard Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Blizzard Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Piercing Ice.name: Piercing Ice
Piercing Ice.description:
Requirements The dragon has temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield

Effect The dragon launches the collected ice shards from its scales in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], dealing @Damage[6d6[piercing],4d6[cold]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic] save). The dragon then loses the AC bonus and temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield.

Rime Shield.name: Rime Shield
Rime Shield.description:
Requirements The rime dragon's last action was to Fly at least 40 feet

Effect Water vapor collected on the dragon's scales quickly freezes over. The dragon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and 15 temporary Hit Points that last until the end of the dragon's next turn.

Rime Dragon (Ancient).name: Rime Dragon (Ancient)

Let's Play!.name: Let's Play!
Let's Play!.description: The dragon conjures up a magical arena to play a game, making up rules on the spot. Up to four target creatures inside the dragon's aura take @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage from the dragon's baffling explanation (@Check[will|dc:34|basic] save). Creatures who fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure). Regardless of result, all targets are immune for 24 hours.

Lover of the Arts.name: Lover of the Arts
Lover of the Arts.description: Checks by or against the dragon to change a creature's attitude using Diplomacy can be attempted with Performance instead.

Whimsysense.name: Whimsysense
Whimsysense.description: Delight dragons can sense the presence of laughter, games, celebrations, and sweets within the listed range.

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine

Play Scape.name: Play Scape
Play Scape.description:
15 feet. Delight dragon magic alters their surroundings, turning weapons into toys and spells into stage effects. All Strikes and other damaging effects used in the aura gain the nonlethal trait and are accompanied by magical sound effects. A creature entering or beginning their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:34] save.

Failure The creature's first damaging effect (such as a Strike) this round does half damage.

Critical Failure All the creature's damaging effects this turn do half damage.

Reactive Tail.name: Reactive Tail
Reactive Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon attempts an Athletics check to [[/act trip]] the triggering creature. This check doesn't count toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this check.

Breath of Fresh Air.name: Breath of Fresh Air
Breath of Fresh Air.description: The dragon unleashes a stream of magical bubbles in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40]. Each creature within the area takes @Damage[10d8[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:34|basic] save). A creature who fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as they give in to the joyful urge to dance, sing, laugh, or admire the world around them. On a critical failure, the creature is slowed 1 for 1 minute and can't use reactions for as long as they are slowed; they can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turn to end the slowed condition early.

Delight Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Delight Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Delight Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine
Delight Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Some would say delight dragons are like children. They would be correct. At least, as correct as if they said a puff of chimney smoke resembled a massive storm cloud or compared a toddler's drawing of a horse to a prized thoroughbred. Which is to say, they are completely and utterly incorrect. Of course, having a smoke cloud or child's drawing running around one's home might be vastly preferable to a delight dragon.

As residents of the Outer Plane Elysium, delight dragons are embodiments of the plane's proclivity toward joy, mischief, passion, and spontaneity. Their massive gossamer wings refract the light of a thousand rainbows between translucent layers. Purple-green scales shimmer in opalescent splendor, while a long, sinuous tail flicks in spiral figures, darting to catch the feet out from under distracted observers. A pair of feathery antennae direct the delight dragon to their next source of amusement—whether play, treat, or general amusement, all surely to become a great time in the dragon's presence, whether a plane's denizens know it or not.

As self-proclaimed defenders of games, whimsy, and the freedom to sow a little chaos, delight dragons are often found on the front line against those that would strip such choice away from others. Demonic forces deployed at the Worldwound whispered of the "lights of doom," massive rainbows that heralded the approach of a delight dragon. The winged crusader would descend upon these fiends with claws and fangs, cackling all the while.

Tail Lash.name: Tail Lash
Tail Lash.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail makes a Strike or attempts a skill check as part of an attack action

Effect The dragon Strikes with their tail at the triggering creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash}

Nidorous Breath.name: Nidorous Breath
Nidorous Breath.description: The dragon belches a boiling spray of fermenting stomach acid that deals @Damage[9d8[acid]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save). They can't use Nidorous Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Nidorous Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Slain to Serve.name: Slain to Serve
Slain to Serve.description:
A bog dragon can perform a special ritual over the body of a humanoid creature slain by bog rot to raise it as a humanoid intelligent undead.

This functions like a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.c3b6LdLlQDPngNIb]{Create Undead} ritual, except that it takes only 8 hours, the bog dragon doesn't require any secondary casters, and they don't need to pay a cost.

If the bog dragon critically fails the ritual's skill check, they get a failure instead.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Bog Rot.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:27]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[acid]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage, clumsy 1, and a –5-foot status penalty to Speed (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[5d6[acid]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and a –10-foot status penalty to Speed (1 day)

Stage 5 death
Bog Rot.name: Bog Rot

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Nidorous Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Swamp Passage.name: Swamp Passage
Swamp Passage.description: The bog dragon ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

Bog Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Bog Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Bog Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
The bogs of Golarion are timeless places, unyielding against the encroachment of civilization and greedily hoarding the dead of epochs long past within the murky depths of the morass. Thus, it doesn't take a bard to note that a bog dragon represents the most primal embodiment of their namesake. These dragons are as calm as the brackish waters, as perfectly patient as any crocodile mistaken for debris, and as ancient as any fear held of the realms they dwell within. To the many cultures they've stalked since the first humanoids dared to build their dwellings near brackish fens, a bog dragon is a terror consigned to the nebulous realm of monster and abomination. Though most have been relegated to the stuff of legends and the mythic nightmares of river valley city-states, bog dragons are still out there, lurking beneath the loam.

Bog dragons haunt the parables of old, their primal characteristics a raw expression of a primeval world that rebukes the tyranny of time's progression. Their bodies are those of a belly-dragging thing, corpulent and richly shielded by a scabrous hide of spurs and spines. Their claws, much like their wings, are feeble things, vestiges of a more graceful draconic concept that only the eldest bog archdragon might attain. Their faces are masks of terror; their lips curl back in a snarl to expose brutish grins of dagger-like fangs, pock-marked by vicious stomach acids that give their latent breath the malodorous turpitude that stings the senses almost unto dizziness. They're every inch a night-going monstrosity, a harrowing horror that would drive terror into any who behold them, the pinnacle of marsh-born predators.
Bog Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。
Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy

Divine Sanctification.name: Divine Sanctification
Divine Sanctification.description: Once an executor dragon reaches adulthood, they are expected to sanctify as either holy or unholy; they gain the corresponding trait and weakness 20 to the opposing sanctification.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Aura of Authority.name: Aura of Authority
Aura of Authority.description:
60 feet. The divine majesty of an adult executor dragon can't be denied. A creature that enters or begins their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:44] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's aura of authority for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} for 10 minutes.

Rage of the Divine.name: Rage of the Divine
Rage of the Divine.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect Raw divine power flashes through the executor dragon harming anyone who dares strike it so brazenly. The creature who dealt the triggering attack takes @Damage[8d8[spirit]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:41|basic] save.

Apocalyptic Roar.name: Apocalyptic Roar
Apocalyptic Roar.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The executor archdragon calls down the full power of the divine. All creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] within 120 feet take @Damage[9d8[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage plus @Damage[6d12[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage, with a @Check[will|dc:44|basic] save.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change its Speed or attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Divine Utterance.name: Divine Utterance
Divine Utterance.description: The dragon screams the truth of the divine, dealing @Damage[17d8[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save). They can't use Divine Utterance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Divine Utterance]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Divine Utterance whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Executor Archdragon.name: Executor Archdragon
Executor Archdragon.publicNotes:
Legends state the first executor dragons formed from the rage-filled screams of Sarenrae during her struggle against the Rough Beast. In the face of an enemy even she had no hope of redeeming, the ever-compassionate Dawnflower allowed her divine fury to escape from her lips as she struck down the primordial god, and from this act of anathema, the first executor dragons were given form. Since that moment, executor dragons represent the full wrath of the gods. Divine in nature, executor dragons typically appear to punish those who have strayed so far from the path of their deity's edicts as to begin embracing the anathema. Due to their potent nature as weapons of the divine, executor dragons are generally drawn to target not a single misbehaving follower, but entire villages, cities, or towns that have turned their backs on their gods. Many of the gods prefer not to use executor dragons as part of their punishment of mortal transgressors, and instead keep them reserved for the days of apocalyptic battles.

Though many believe executor dragons are spawned from divine magic, they are fully biological creatures. Compelled by faith and devotion and disgusted by hypocrisy and base cruelty, executor dragons tend to live near human settlements, but rarely within them. They form small familial groups when young, but grow more independent as they age, seeking to claim territory uninhabited by other dragons. Their chosen lairs tend to be locations secreted away, either in the ruins of mountaintop monasteries or in the cavernous depths beneath abandoned places of worship. For the few executor dragons that live actively among non-draconic peoples, even fewer do so in their natural forms. They are sometimes found living disguised as traveling lay priests who bring healing and alms for the needy, choristers singing hymnals, wandering monastic scholars who ask challenging and conflicted questions about faith, or quiet church custodians who protect and beautify their chosen houses of worship. It's said that one or more executor dragons might have even taken up the defense of Kenebres after its near destruction at the hands of the Khorramzadeh, Storm King of the Worldwound.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Vortex.name: 涡流 Vortex
Vortex.description: 40尺。灵光范围内，与龙处于同一水体的水对于没有水特征的生物游泳时来说视作困难地形。

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和尾扫打击，每次对抗相同目标。如果任意一次打击命中，龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]目标。

Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 水波感知（模糊）60尺 Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet

Countered by Earth.name: 为土所克 Countered by Earth
Countered by Earth.description: 如果海龙成为具有土特征的法术的目标，液化将会结束，他不能使用之直到其下个回合结束。

Fed by Metal.name: 由金而生 Fed by Metal
Fed by Metal.description:
当海龙被具有金特征的法术或生物的无武装打击，或金属武器伤害时，其鳞片会发生变化，这会赋予他在AC上+1物品加值直到其下个回合开始。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.OMJnZspk5YHai8yn]

Liquefy.name: 液化 Liquefy
Liquefy.description:
触发 龙受到火焰伤害

效果 龙瞬间变成水同时维持其形状。他获得火焰伤害抗力15（包括对抗触发效果时），直到其下个回合结束。

Black Water Breath.name: 黑水吐息 Black Water Breath
Black Water Breath.description: 龙向50尺内射出一个对@Template[burst|distance:25]范围造成@Damage[13d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害的水球（@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。半径内所有非魔法火焰会被熄灭。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4轮}内再次使用黑水吐息。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当龙在一次打击中造成重击时，它充能其黑水吐息。

Hyponatremia.name: 低血钠症 Hyponatremia
Hyponatremia.description: 一个受到来自海龙颚咬打击伤害的活物必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:32]豁免，否则会因为体内激增的水量而陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

Sea Dragon (Adult).name: 成年海龙 Sea Dragon (Adult)
Sea Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
海帝龙与水元素相连，掌管着雨水、风暴、江河与海洋。他们栖息于天夏文明的附近，随时准备协助凡间事务以证明自身价值。对某些海龙而言，在天气与奥术知识方面提供帮助是职责所在。对另一些则不过是获取珍贵贡品或美味佳肴的动机。前来求见者皆热切献礼，因传说海龙欢愉时，雨水便会柔和丰沛。反之，若他们愤怒时，风暴将肆虐无情。

尽管天夏人普遍如此认为，但文明绝非受制于海龙的摆布，因为大多数海龙都是王国的臣子，宣誓协助凡人。绝大多数海龙都是四海龙王之一的臣子，这些龙王的领地或联合王国分别坐落于因拜罗洋（Embaral Ocean），象牙海（Ivory Sea），御海洋（Okaiyo Ocean），颂寂海（Songil Sea）。鉴于水元素位面本无原生海龙，有理论认为这些王国可能是从无际之海（Boundless Sea）大规模迁徙的残余势力。海龙自身的传说记载，远古之王曾为逃避元素领主凯利赞德里的迫害而立下誓言。尽管尚不确定咸水帝王是否仍在追杀海龙，但多数海龙仍恪守誓约作为其文化传承，或为纪念先祖荣光。
Sea Dragon (Adult).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Unveil Secret.name: Unveil Secret
Unveil Secret.description: The dragon delves into the mind of a creature within 60 feet, learning something they'd find embarrassing or shameful unless they succeed at a @Check[will|dc:42] save. The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and cannot reduce their frightened condition for 1 minute or until the dragon reveals the secret. As a reaction when the affected creature attempts a check, the dragon can reveal their secret to discomfit them, requiring them to roll twice and take the lower result; this is a misfortune effect.

Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.name: Spell Effect: Hidden Mind
Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.C2w3YfBKjIRS07DP]{Hidden Mind}

You gain a +4 status bonus to saves against mental effects.

Communal Knowledge.name: Communal Knowledge
Communal Knowledge.description: The dragon mentally communes with all their current active informants simultaneously. They learn the present state of all the informants, as status, and any new information the informants have learned since they were last in communication. Fragments of extraneous information briefly remain after using Communal Knowledge; for the next hour, the dragon can attempt @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} checks for any skill with a modifier of +36.

Information Network.name: Information Network
Information Network.description: The dragon can attempt a Society check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} in place of a check to Gather Information, recalling intelligence from prior informants.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Diplomatic Solution.name: Diplomatic Solution
Diplomatic Solution.description:
Trigger The dragon rolls initiative

Effect The dragon affects all enemies it can see within 60 feet with calm heightened to half the dragon's level rounded up (@Check[will|dc:42]). The dragon doesn't need to Sustain this effect, but if the dragon takes any hostile action against those affected, it breaks the effect for all creatures.

Distracting Whisper.name: Distracting Whisper
Distracting Whisper.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect A mysterious voice whispers something disconcerting in the triggering creature's ear, inflicting a –2 circumstance penalty to the triggering attack.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.qsvSWxRqVQofjDdH]{Effect: Distracting Whisper}

Cogitation Breath.name: Cogitation Breath
Cogitation Breath.description: The dragon unleashes a befuddling miasma, dealing @Damage[19d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in an @Template[type:cone|distance:80] (@Check[will|dc:42|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. The dragon can't use Cogitation Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Cogitation Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。
Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Cogitation Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Steal Knowledge.name: Steal Knowledge
Steal Knowledge.description:
The dragon plucks a fragment of knowledge from the mind of a creature within 60 feet, choosing a skill to affect. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:42] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For the next minute, the creature takes a –1 status penalty to checks using that skill, and the dragon gets a +1 status bonus to using that skill.

Critical Failure As failure, but the penalty is –2 and the bonus is +2.

Thought Whispers.name: Thought Whispers
Thought Whispers.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The dragon sends their mind out to seek others' thoughts, affecting all creatures within 80 feet with mind reading (@Check[will|dc:42]).

Whisper Archdragon.name: Whisper Archdragon
Whisper Archdragon.publicNotes: Whisper dragons are keen collectors of rumors and secrets who spend centuries honing their information networks and relationships. They generally do so not out of an intent to hold the information over others or to use for their own machinations, but simply because the process of learning and gathering information is fulfilling. Their hoards are sparse compared to those of other dragons, as they hold their true treasures—secrets—in their minds.

Adamantine Weight.name: Adamantine Weight
Adamantine Weight.description: The dragon shapes rocks even after it throws them, capturing its prey. The creature struck must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:44|options:inflicts:immobilized] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. Creatures remain immobilized until they Escape and immediately fall if they're flying. The weight can be destroyed as an object with 40 Hit Points and 20 Hardness.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Abandon Armor.name: Abandon Armor
Abandon Armor.description: Once the adamantine dragon is reduced to fewer than half their Hit Points, their resistance is reduced by 10 and they gain a +10 circumstance bonus to their Speeds.

Resilient Form.name: Resilient Form
Resilient Form.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a weapon or unarmed attack;

Effect The dragon's tough scales ward off deadly attacks. The dragon attempts a @Check[flat|dc:14]. On a success, the triggering attack becomes a normal hit.

Adamantine Body.name: Adamantine Body
Adamantine Body.description: The dragon's unarmed melee Strikes are adamantine.

Avalanche Breath.name: Avalanche Breath
Avalanche Breath.description:
The dragon belches a mass of boulders that deals @Damage[17d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:44] (@Check[reflex|dc:50|basic|options:area-effect] save).

They can't use Avalanche Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge use Avalanche Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Burrowing Pounce.name: Burrowing Pounce
Burrowing Pounce.description:
Requirements The dragon is burrowed

Effect The dragon Burrows, then Leaps out of the ground, landing at a point within 40 feet. The dragon makes a melee Strike against a creature within reach when they land. If the Strike is a critical hit, the target is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Avalanche Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
Fast Swallow.description:
Trigger The dragon Grabs a creature

Effect The dragon uses Swallow Whole.

Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
Rock Tunneler.description: The dragon can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 40 feet. They can leave a tunnel if they desire, and they usually don't.

Sky Below Stone.name: Sky Below Stone
Sky Below Stone.description: An eruption of skymetal blades churns the earth in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:40]. The area becomes difficult terrain and creatures touching the ground take @Damage[8d8[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (basic @Check[reflex|dc:45|options:area-effect,inflicts:prone] save). Creatures that fail the save are knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and moved 20 feet in a direction of the dragon's choice.

Adamantine Archdragon.name: Adamantine Archdragon
Adamantine Archdragon.publicNotes:
The powerful adamantine dragons are one of several dragons known as skymetal dragons. The innate magic that flows through these dragons causes them to draw particular metals to their bodies like magnets or, in some cases, naturally grow these skymetals on their bodies. Adamantine dragons begin their lives with tough scales that are naturally replaced with thicker and even tougher adamantine plating as they grow older. Adamantine dragons are typically steadfast and loyal. Once they commit to a certain purpose, changing their minds is nigh impossible.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Adamantine Archdragon.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs primal

Barrage Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Barrage Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Barrage Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
To the uninitiated, spellcasting is an art for those with iron wills, people who reach out and grab hold of the fundamental laws of the universe and bend them to their whim. It takes discipline, study, and above all else, it takes control. Fail to control the very building blocks of reality and everything could fall apart.

Those who have even dabbled in the arcane arts know that this is nonsense. Magic is chaos, and channeling arcane forces is less akin to exerting one's will over the world and more like surfing on a bolt of lightning through a world-shaking storm and hoping to steer it without falling off. Spellcasting is barely contained panic, a lance of adrenaline, the constant danger of burning oneself out of existence. And the more powerful someone becomes, the more real this danger is.

Ironsense.name: Ironsense
Ironsense.description: The dragon can detect the presence of iron and other ferrous metals as a precise sense at the listed range.

Arcane Whirlwind.name: Arcane Whirlwind
Arcane Whirlwind.description:
15 feet.

A vortex of fist-sized balls of pure magic swirls around the dragon. Air within the emanation is difficult terrain for Flying creatures other than the dragon. A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn within the aura takes @Damage[7d6[force]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic] save).

Ray Displacement.name: Ray Displacement
Ray Displacement.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with a ranged spell attack

Effect The dragon creates a field of distorted space between themself and the caster. The creature targeting the barrage dragon must roll the spell attack twice and take the worse result.

Shrapnel Splash.name: Shrapnel Splash
Shrapnel Splash.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee weapon or unarmed attack

Effect The dragon's blood forms into hard spheres as it erupts from the wound, battering the attacker. The creature who dealt the triggering damage takes @Damage[8d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save.

Force Pulse.name: Force Pulse
Force Pulse.description:
1 to 3

The dragon emits pulses of energy that radiates outward in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20], dealing @Damage[(2d8+2)[force]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save).

For each action spent, a new pulse of energy is created and each subsequent pulse after the first is 5 feet larger than the previous one.

Scattershot.name: Scattershot
Scattershot.description: The dragon exhales a cloud of small balls of pure energy that deal @Damage[(9d4+9)[force]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] with no save. The dragon can't use Scattershot again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Scattershot]]{1d4 rounds}.

Pushing Pulse.name: Pushing Pulse
Pushing Pulse.description: The barrage dragon performs a 2-action Force Pulse. Each creature who fails its save is pushed 10 feet away from the dragon (20 feet on a critical failure).

Sage Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Sage Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Sage Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
A shining, rune-inscribed scale is all that most people, even adventurers, see of a sage dragon during their lifetimes. Even then, only those familiar with dragon lore will likely recognize the scale as anything other than an elaborate spell scroll. Collectors and scholars of esoteric lore, sage dragons become increasingly reclusive as they age, and, even in their youths, they're prone to work through trusted intermediaries. For those able to locate and gain the trust of such a creature, even the youngest sage dragons are fonts of difficult-to-find knowledge and rare magical techniques. The oldest sage dragons are living combinations of gargantuan libraries and endless grimoires, accumulating the secrets of the Universe, and beyond, in their isolated lairs.

Organized and methodical, with an insatiable curiosity and eidetic memory, sage dragons are the devout researchers of the dragon world. The intellectual pursuits of sage dragons demand extended periods of quiet study, one of the reasons that such dragons live in isolated, hidden locations. Young dragons tend to specialize in a particular area of research. As they age, these research interests also broaden, with an expert in a particular river expanding into topics such as the water cycle, ecology, or the Plane of Water. Sage dragons interested in religious topics often worship Nethys or a god dedicated to knowledge, such as Gruhastha, Qi Zhong, or Ydajisk. Dragons who seek grim rituals or cryptic knowledge might join the church of Abraxas or worship Norgorber in his aspect of the Reaper of Reputation.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells

Divert Essence.name: Divert Essence
Divert Essence.description:
Trigger A creature within 90 feet Casts a Spell that targets the dragon

Effect The sage dragon steals energy from the spell to protect itself, gaining resistance to damage from spells equal to the triggering spell's rank until the beginning of their next turn.

Eldritch Interference.name: Eldritch Interference
Eldritch Interference.description:
90 feet, @Check[will|dc:25].

Overlapping fields near the dragon make spellcasting unpredictable. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's eldritch interference for 1 minute.

Critical Success For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they gain a status bonus to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they take a status penalty to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Overwhelming Proclamation whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Mystic Facility.name: Mystic Facility
Mystic Facility.description: The dragon can activate scrolls and wands of any tradition as if the spells they contain were occult spells.

Overwhelming Proclamation.name: Overwhelming Proclamation
Overwhelming Proclamation.description: The dragon exclaims hidden truths that only they have been able to understand, dealing @Damage[10d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] save). On a critical failure, creatures are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. The dragon can't use Overwhelming Proclamation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Overwhelming Proclamation]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sanguine Knowledge.name: Sanguine Knowledge
Sanguine Knowledge.description: The first time each encounter a dragon hits and deals damage to a creature with their jaws Strike, they receive information about the creature as if the dragon had succeeded at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about that creature.

Vizier Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Vizier Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)

Word of Advice.name: Word of Advice
Word of Advice.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The dragon is a skilled mentor, and commands its students like a general. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon can Stride once and Strike once, in any order. If it hits, the Strike deals an additional @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage.

Word of Caution.name: Word of Caution
Word of Caution.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Wise people listen when a vizier dragon speaks. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains immunity to the vizier dragon's Powerful Utterance and resistance 20 to all other damage for 1 round.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Dragontongue.name: Dragontongue
Dragontongue.description: When a dragon speaks, the universe listens. The dragon is immune to silence and abilities that would prevent them from speaking if the source's level is lower than the dragon's or its rank is lower than half the dragon's level rounded up.

Word of Wisdom.name: Word of Wisdom
Word of Wisdom.description:
Trigger An ally within 60 feet fails a saving throw

Effect The ally improves its result by one degree of success, turning a failure into a success or a critical failure into a normal failure. The dragon can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge this ability]]{1d4 rounds}.

Dragonspeech.name: Dragonspeech
Dragonspeech.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The ancient dragon uses Word of Advice, Word of Caution, and Word of Heroism, though any given ally can only be the target of a single Word.

Powerful Utterance.name: Powerful Utterance
Powerful Utterance.description:
The dragon expresses their power in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Powerful Utterance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Powerful Utterance]]{1d4 rounds}.
