  • Ardent Proclamation (occult, fire) The dragon breathes a blast of flame in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] that deals @Damage[21d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|traits:occult,fire] save).

  • Chastising Word (mental, occult) The dragon chides the targets strictly enough to leave the mind reeling. Each creature within a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:42|traits:mental,occult] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} for 1 minute (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} on a critical failure).

Word of Heroism.name: Word of Heroism
Word of Heroism.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Ancient dragons are the teachers of heroes. An ally within 60 feet of the dragon gains a +2 status bonus to attack rolls, Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks for 1 minute.

Vizier Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
There's a feeling every teacher knows. It's when one has taken a young mind and educated, trained, and molded them to one's specifications before setting them loose and watching the pupil act on one's teachings. It's a feeling of creation, control, and wonder, the knowledge that one has created this great and glorious thing—and if one has done the job exceptionally well, then the student will outshine the master. This is immortality and power, and this is what vizier dragons chase.

Vizier dragons are primarily concerned with the education and cultivation of people. People fascinate vizier dragons in all their riotous, contradictory complexity. Why do some people excel, and others falter and fail? Why does one person become a saint and the next a tyrant? Why do some become legends in their own time, while others labor in ignominy?

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Blizzard Breath.name: Blizzard Breath
Blizzard Breath.description: The dragon breathes out a gust of frost and ice that deals @Damage[6d8[cold]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save). They can't use Blizzard Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Blizzard Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Rime Shield.name: Rime Shield
Rime Shield.description:
Requirements The rime dragon's last action was to Fly at least 40 feet

Effect Water vapor collected on the dragon's scales quickly freezes over. The dragon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and 5 temporary Hit Points that last until the end of the dragon's next turn.

Arctic Hunter.name: Arctic Hunter
Arctic Hunter.description: A rime dragon's natural camouflage allows them to [[/act hide]] in arctic terrain without cover. A rime dragon also ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from ice and snow and doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.

Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
Snow Vision.description: Snow doesn't impair the rime dragon's vision; they ignore concealment from snowfall.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Blizzard Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Piercing Ice.name: Piercing Ice
Piercing Ice.description:
Requirements The dragon has temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield

Effect The dragon launches the collected ice shards from its scales in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], dealing @Damage[3d6[piercing],2d6[cold]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save). The dragon then loses the AC bonus and temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield.

Rime Dragon (Young).name: Rime Dragon (Young)
Rime Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
Rime dragons are the embodiment of the frigid cold and ice. These hardy creatures have adapted to harsh arctic climates, able to survive indefinitely in sub-zero temperatures. Rime dragons are shades of white and pale blue that perfectly camouflage them in their natural habitat, resembling glaciers or mounds of snow when curled up. They can break through large slabs of ice and dive into frozen waters in search of prey. Due to their natural lower body temperature, they can slow their digestive tract, which allows them to live a long time on little food. Large prey—such as whales, caribou, or moose—offer the best sustenance, but they aren't picky when it's time to eat.

Rime dragons have a deep curiosity for things hidden and lost in the ice. The ocean's currents bring all kinds of artifacts from across the world to their frigid waters. Self-described caretakers and scholars, rime dragons search the arctic regions for ancient antiquities. Rime dragons with an academic interest in archaeology peer into glaciers for pieces of civilizations both recent and ancient, which they preserve in their lairs. Others might search for fossils or preserved corpses. Rime dragons also have an interest in more biological aspects of the world. As preservers of life, some of these dragons collect flora to log and study, and they protect endangered species by using low temperatures to conserve them. They also act as paleopathologists, studying ancient diseases that could cause havoc if they were brought back to a populace unknowingly. These they carefully contain while researching mitigation strategies should the pathogens be reintroduced to the world.

Thundercloud Breath.description: The dragon breathes a thundercloud that deals @Damage[11d6[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save). They can't use Thundercloud Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Thundercloud Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
Thundercloud Breath.name: Thundercloud Breath

Mist Vision.name: Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: Fog and mist don't impair a cloud dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from fog and mist.

Dragonmist.name: Dragonmist
Dragonmist.description: The dragon conjures up a sudden mist in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 120 feet. All creatures within the mist become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the mist become concealed to creatures within it. The dragon can use this action again to dismiss the mist—anyone else attempting to remove the dragonmist (via gust of wind or similar) must succeed at a counteract check. A young dragon can have up to three clouds of dragonmist active at a time.

Humiliating Mark.name: Humiliating Mark
Humiliating Mark.description: On a critical hit, the dragon's claws inflict @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse} on the target as if they had rolled a success.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Graceless Domain.name: Graceless Domain
Graceless Domain.description:
90 feet. A creature who enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the graceless domain aura for 1 minute. The dragon can exclude creatures from this aura.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success For 1 round, the first time the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Failure For 1 minute, the first time each round the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Critical Failure For 1 minute, every time the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of any Tiny, Small, Medium, or Large animal, beast, or humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Hilarious Exhalation.name: Hilarious Exhalation
Hilarious Exhalation.description:
The dragon unleashes their breath in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Hilarious Exhalation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hilarious Exhalation]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Laughing Gas (emotion, mental) The dragon breaths a cloud of mood-altering gas in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. This has the effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlSE7Ly8vi1Dgddv]{Laughing Fit} (@Check[will|dc:32|traits:emotion,mental]) with a duration of 1 round.

  • Slippery Puddle The dragon expels a glob of viscous goo at a solid surface at a range of 60 feet. This creates a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] with the area effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} (@Check[reflex|dc:32]).

Jeer at Failure.name: Jeer at Failure
Jeer at Failure.description:
Trigger A foe within 90 feet becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} or critically fails on a Strike

Effect The mocking dragon laughs dismissively at the foe, attempting an Intimidation check to [[/act demoralize]] the creature. They do not take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand their language.

Insistent Heckling.name: Insistent Heckling
Insistent Heckling.description: The dragon can [[/act demoralize]] targets within 90 feet. Targets become immune to the mocking dragon's attempts to Demoralize them for 1 minute after each attempt.

Vex.name: Vex
Vex.description:
Requirements The dragon's last action was a successful tail Strike

Effect The mocking dragon attempts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.5eNKs6738aykAhK2]{Dirty Trick} against the target of their tail Strike. This attempt neither applies nor counts toward the creature's multiple attack penalty.

Oath Dragon (Adult).name: Oath Dragon (Adult)

Binding Oath.name: Binding Oath
Binding Oath.description: The dragon forges a bond with a willing creature over an hour-long ceremony, making them a bonded companion. The dragon can always sense their distance from the companion and if they're moving closer or farther away. A bonded companion automatically critically succeeds on basic saving throws against the oath dragon's abilities and spells. This link is permanent and neither can form a new link until one member dies. If the dragon or the bonded companion dies, the survivor learns the identity of the killer, but the shock leaves the survivor @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 24 hours and prevents forming a new link for 1 month.

Castigating Breath.name: Castigating Breath
Castigating Breath.description: The dragon unleashes a pronouncement that strikes at the soul of its enemies, dealing @Damage[10d10[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[will|dc:34|basic] save). The dragon can't use Castigating Breath for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Emotion.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Emotion

Heartening Aura.name: Heartening Aura
Heartening Aura.description: 40 feet. All allies in the aura gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls. The dragon's bonded companion also gains fast healing 10.

Shielding Wing.name: Shielding Wing
Shielding Wing.description:
Trigger The oath dragon or a bonded companion within 15 feet is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises its wing to protect itself or the bonded companion, providing a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: Whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike, the dragon recharges their Castigating Breath.

Inspiring Word.name: Inspiring Word
Inspiring Word.description: All allies within the dragon's heartening aura become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. Allies can use this extra action to Raise a Shield, Step, Stride, or Strike.

Oathbreaker’s Curse.name: Oathbreaker’s Curse
Oathbreaker’s Curse.description:
If a bonded companion willingly breaks their oath, they retain the benefit of being a bonded companion but are immediately cursed with no initial saving throw. The cursed creature can attempt saving throws as noted to prevent the curse from worsening.

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:38]

Effect The cursed creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't reduce their doomed value below 1 while they're cursed. The first time the cursed creature encounters the oath dragon each day, they must attempt a saving throw. In addition, each time the creature critically fails a Strike or spell attack against the oath dragon, they must attempt a saving throw. On a failure, their doomed value increases by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 3}.

Oath Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
Oath dragons are the embodiment of a cause that they pursue with unerring determination. They draw their power not from mere words, but from the meaning and ideals that those words carry. Their dedication has led to the widespread imagery of oath dragons fighting alongside noble champions trying to bring goodness where only corruption is thought to dwell. Yet, there is nothing more terrifying than the power of an oath dragon who swears to a violent cause or who is dragged into damnation by their loyalty.

While an oath dragon can theoretically be dedicated to multiple ideals, they usually choose a single cause that they pursue with incredible devotion. They provide aid to those who share their dedication and fight fiercely against those who oppose it, all to uphold their ideals. Regardless of the causes they embrace, these dragons do so wholeheartedly. This unwavering determination gives them an intensity that is rarely matched by other creatures, spurring even the most reluctant ally to action.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells

Divert Essence.name: Divert Essence
Divert Essence.description:
Trigger A creature within 90 feet Casts a Spell that targets the dragon

Effect The sage dragon steals energy from the spell to protect itself, gaining resistance to damage from spells equal to the triggering spell's rank until the beginning of their next turn.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Overwhelming Proclamation whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Eldritch Interference.description:
90 feet, @Check[will|dc:25].

Overlapping fields near the dragon make spellcasting unpredictable. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's eldritch interference for 1 minute.

Critical Success For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they gain a status bonus to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they take a status penalty to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect lasts 1 minute.
Eldritch Interference.name: Eldritch Interference

Mystic Facility.name: Mystic Facility
Mystic Facility.description: The dragon can activate scrolls and wands of any tradition as if the spells they contain were occult spells.

Overwhelming Proclamation.name: Overwhelming Proclamation
Overwhelming Proclamation.description: The dragon exclaims hidden truths that only they have been able to understand, dealing @Damage[10d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] save). On a critical failure, creatures are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. The dragon can't use Overwhelming Proclamation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Overwhelming Proclamation]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sanguine Knowledge.name: Sanguine Knowledge
Sanguine Knowledge.description: The first time each encounter a dragon hits and deals damage to a creature with their jaws Strike, they receive information about the creature as if the dragon had succeeded at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about that creature.

Sage Dragon (Young).name: Sage Dragon (Young)
Sage Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
A shining, rune-inscribed scale is all that most people, even adventurers, see of a sage dragon during their lifetimes. Even then, only those familiar with dragon lore will likely recognize the scale as anything other than an elaborate spell scroll. Collectors and scholars of esoteric lore, sage dragons become increasingly reclusive as they age, and, even in their youths, they're prone to work through trusted intermediaries. For those able to locate and gain the trust of such a creature, even the youngest sage dragons are fonts of difficult-to-find knowledge and rare magical techniques. The oldest sage dragons are living combinations of gargantuan libraries and endless grimoires, accumulating the secrets of the Universe, and beyond, in their isolated lairs.

Organized and methodical, with an insatiable curiosity and eidetic memory, sage dragons are the devout researchers of the dragon world. The intellectual pursuits of sage dragons demand extended periods of quiet study, one of the reasons that such dragons live in isolated, hidden locations. Young dragons tend to specialize in a particular area of research. As they age, these research interests also broaden, with an expert in a particular river expanding into topics such as the water cycle, ecology, or the Plane of Water. Sage dragons interested in religious topics often worship Nethys or a god dedicated to knowledge, such as Gruhastha, Qi Zhong, or Ydajisk. Dragons who seek grim rituals or cryptic knowledge might join the church of Abraxas or worship Norgorber in his aspect of the Reaper of Reputation.

Voidsense.description: The dragon can taste animating void energy, allowing them to sense creatures with void healing as a precise sense. It can also sense incorporeal creatures with void healing, like shadows, when they are inside solid objects.
Voidsense.name: Voidsense

Devour Undead.name: Devour Undead
Devour Undead.description: The dragon's jaws Strikes have the benefit of a ghost touch property rune and deal an additional 7d6 force damage to undead.

Hide in Shadows.name: Hide in Shadows
Hide in Shadows.description: The dragon can Hide in dim light even if they don't have cover.

Pin Shadow.name: Pin Shadow
Pin Shadow.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's claw uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Requirements The triggering creature is in bright light or dim light and has a shadow

Effect The dragon makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature. On a hit, the trigger creature also has its shadow pinned in place, restricting its movement. The creature treats the area of the dragon's aura as difficult terrain until it uses an Interact action to unpin its shadow. If the area was already difficult terrain, the creature treats it as greater difficult terrain.

Umbral Pall.name: Umbral Pall
Umbral Pall.description: 120 feet. Shadows surround the dragon. The radius of all light from light sources and the areas of light spells in the aura are halved. The shadows also cling to creatures, making areas of dim light difficult terrain.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges its Tenebrous Breath whenever it scores a critical hit with a Strike.

Drain Vigor.name: Drain Vigor
Drain Vigor.description:
When the dragon deals void damage to a living creature with its jaws Strike, the umbral dragon gains 20 temporary HP that last for 1 minute and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). Further damage dealt by the dragon's jaws Strike increases the drained condition value by 1 on a failed save (2 on a critical failure), to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wBFtXxByOza6N9hs]{Effect: Drain Vigor}

Tenebrous Breath.name: Tenebrous Breath
Tenebrous Breath.description:
The umbral dragon exhales in one of two ways. They can't use Tenebrous Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Tenebrous Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Darkness (occult, void) The dragon breathes a blast of darkness that deals @Damage[16d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic|traits:occult,void] save). Undead creatures take @Damage[16d6[force]|options:area-damage]{force} damage instead of void damage.

  • Shadows (occult, shadow) The dragon breathes a blast of shadows in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40]. Each creature within the cone must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:36|traits:occult,shadow] save.

    Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

    Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round.

    Failure The creature is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute.

Umbral Dragon (Ancient).name: Umbral Dragon (Ancient)
Umbral Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
Stories across Golarion warn children about the monsters that dwell in the shadows, but no story captures the reality of the umbral dragon. Natives of the Netherworld, these occult dragons are at home in the darkness, using it to their advantage both in and out of battle. Umbral dragons rarely worry about fighting fairly, emerging from hiding to strike unwary foes and using their magical breath without compunction. Similarly, in social situations, they often remain in the shadows, operating through other creatures. Even in direct conversation, they frequently obscure their true intent, preferring to avoid ever being pinned down with a solid answer.

While umbral dragons are rarely altruistic, their preferred diet creates a strange dichotomy that attracts other creatures to them as a potential source of safety, especially in the Netherworld. While much of the multiverse sees undead as a dire threat, for umbral dragons, undead are a tasty snack. Umbral dragons find the flavor of necrotic flesh irresistible and the void energy of incorporeal undead a potent spice, making them one of the few creatures in existence known to hunt the unliving as a source of food.

Fed by Metal.name: 由金而生 Fed by Metal
Fed by Metal.description:
当海龙被具有金特征的法术或生物的无武装打击，或金属武器伤害时，其鳞片会发生变化，这会赋予他在AC上+1物品加值直到其下个回合开始。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.OMJnZspk5YHai8yn]

Black Water Breath.name: 黑水吐息 Black Water Breath
Black Water Breath.description: 龙向40尺内射出一个对@Template[burst|distance:20]范围造成@Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害的水球（@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。半径内所有非魔法火焰会被熄灭。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4轮}内再次使用黑水吐息。

Countered by Earth.name: 为土所克 Countered by Earth
Countered by Earth.description: 如果海龙成为具有土特征的法术的目标，液化将会结束，他不能使用之直到其下个回合结束。

Liquefy.name: 液化 Liquefy
Liquefy.description:
触发 龙受到火焰伤害

效果 龙瞬间变成水同时维持其形状。他获得火焰伤害抗力10（包括对抗触发效果时），直到其下个回合结束。

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和尾扫打击，每次对抗相同目标。如果任意一次打击命中，龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]目标。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当龙在一次打击中造成重击时，它充能其黑水吐息。

Hyponatremia.name: 低血钠症 Hyponatremia
Hyponatremia.description: 一个受到来自海龙颚咬打击伤害的活物必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:26]豁免，否则会因为体内激增的水量而陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

Sea Dragon (Young).name: 青年海龙 Sea Dragon (Young)
Sea Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
海帝龙与水元素相连，掌管着雨水、风暴、江河与海洋。他们栖息于天夏文明的附近，随时准备协助凡间事务以证明自身价值。对某些海龙而言，在天气与奥术知识方面提供帮助是职责所在。对另一些则不过是获取珍贵贡品或美味佳肴的动机。前来求见者皆热切献礼，因传说海龙欢愉时，雨水便会柔和丰沛。反之，若他们愤怒时，风暴将肆虐无情。

尽管天夏人普遍如此认为，但文明绝非受制于海龙的摆布，因为大多数海龙都是王国的臣子，宣誓协助凡人。绝大多数海龙都是四海龙王之一的臣子，这些龙王的领地或联合王国分别坐落于因拜罗洋（Embaral Ocean），象牙海（Ivory Sea），御海洋（Okaiyo Ocean），颂寂海（Songil Sea）。鉴于水元素位面本无原生海龙，有理论认为这些王国可能是从无际之海（Boundless Sea）大规模迁徙的残余势力。海龙自身的传说记载，远古之王曾为逃避元素领主凯利赞德里的迫害而立下誓言。尽管尚不确定咸水帝王是否仍在追杀海龙，但多数海龙仍恪守誓约作为其文化传承，或为纪念先祖荣光。

Sage Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Sage Archdragon (Spellcaster)

Endless Spellscales.name: Endless Spellscales
Endless Spellscales.description:
1 to 3

The dragon expends a spell inscribed on one of their scales, casting a common spell of 7th rank or lower from any tradition, using the spell's typical number of actions and their spell DC.

Overwhelming Proclamation.description: The dragon exclaims hidden truths that only they have been able to understand, dealing @Damage[22d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:44|basic] save). On a critical failure, creatures are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. The dragon can't use Overwhelming Proclamation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Overwhelming Proclamation]]{1d4 rounds}.
Overwhelming Proclamation.name: Overwhelming Proclamation

Reflexive Understanding.name: Reflexive Understanding
Reflexive Understanding.description:
Frequency once per hour

Requirements The dragon was targeted by a spell of 9th rank or lower in the last round

Effect The dragon analyzes the spell's inner workings. For the next 10 minutes, the dragon can cast the spell at the same rank as if it were one of their innate occult spells.

Reveal Shame.name: Reveal Shame
Reveal Shame.description:
Requirements The dragon has successfully Recalled Knowledge about an enemy within 90 feet

Effect The dragon utters an embarrassing secret about the creature, unnerving them and their allies. Every enemy within 90 feet that can hear the secret must attempt a @Check[will|dc:44] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}. Sanguine Knowledge As young sage dragon.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells

Divert Essence.name: Divert Essence
Divert Essence.description:
Trigger A creature within 90 feet Casts a Spell that targets the dragon

Effect The sage dragon steals energy from the spell to protect itself, gaining resistance to damage from spells equal to the triggering spell's rank until the beginning of their next turn.

Eldritch Interference.name: Eldritch Interference
Eldritch Interference.description:
90 feet, @Check[will|dc:40].

Overlapping fields near the dragon make spellcasting unpredictable. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's eldritch interference for 1 minute.

Critical Success For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they gain a status bonus to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they take a status penalty to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Mystic Facility.name: Mystic Facility
Mystic Facility.description: The dragon can activate scrolls and wands of any tradition as if the spells they contain were occult spells.

Sanguine Knowledge.name: Sanguine Knowledge
Sanguine Knowledge.description: The first time each encounter a dragon hits and deals damage to a creature with their jaws Strike, they receive information about the creature as if the dragon had succeeded at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about that creature.

Sage Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
A shining, rune-inscribed scale is all that most people, even adventurers, see of a sage dragon during their lifetimes. Even then, only those familiar with dragon lore will likely recognize the scale as anything other than an elaborate spell scroll. Collectors and scholars of esoteric lore, sage dragons become increasingly reclusive as they age, and, even in their youths, they're prone to work through trusted intermediaries. For those able to locate and gain the trust of such a creature, even the youngest sage dragons are fonts of difficult-to-find knowledge and rare magical techniques. The oldest sage dragons are living combinations of gargantuan libraries and endless grimoires, accumulating the secrets of the Universe, and beyond, in their isolated lairs.

Organized and methodical, with an insatiable curiosity and eidetic memory, sage dragons are the devout researchers of the dragon world. The intellectual pursuits of sage dragons demand extended periods of quiet study, one of the reasons that such dragons live in isolated, hidden locations. Young dragons tend to specialize in a particular area of research. As they age, these research interests also broaden, with an expert in a particular river expanding into topics such as the water cycle, ecology, or the Plane of Water. Sage dragons interested in religious topics often worship Nethys or a god dedicated to knowledge, such as Gruhastha, Qi Zhong, or Ydajisk. Dragons who seek grim rituals or cryptic knowledge might join the church of Abraxas or worship Norgorber in his aspect of the Reaper of Reputation.

Destructive Wish.name: Destructive Wish
Destructive Wish.description:
Requirements An illusion from Wish Come True is currently active

Effect The wish dragon Dismisses the illusion of Wish Come True, which shatters into magical fragments, dealing @Damage[6d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] of the illusion.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Best Wishes.name: Best Wishes
Best Wishes.description: 20 feet. Being near a wish dragon gives other creatures a greater sense of what they truly wish for, bolstering their sense of purpose while also distracting them from the task at hand. Creatures in the aura take a –1 status penalty to Perception but gain a +2 status bonus to Will saving throws against mental effects. The wish dragon can't gain the benefit of their own aura or other actions that use the aura, and they can choose to exclude any creatures from any benefit of the aura or action that uses the aura.

Wished Away.name: Wished Away
Wished Away.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect The dragon wishes not to be hurt by this attack, gaining resistance 15 to all damage against the triggering attack.

Breath of Loss.name: Breath of Loss
Breath of Loss.description: The dragon breathes a warm, gentle breeze of mist that creates the feeling of when deepest desires are achieved. As the breeze dissipates, the feeling of loss overwhelms creatures' senses, dealing @Damage[11d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:29] save). A creature that critically fails its save is also consumed with the memory of the moment and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. The wish dragon can't use Breath of Loss again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath of Loss]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Breath of Loss whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Wish Come True.name: Wish Come True
Wish Come True.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon creates an illusion in an unoccupied square within 60 feet that appears to all other creatures that can see it to be the manifestation of their deepest material desire. This has the effects of illusory object (though the illusion might appear to be a creature to certain people) that last for 10 minutes. The wish dragon can Dismiss the illusion. Each non-wish dragon creature who begins their turn within 200 feet in line of sight of the illusion must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save. If any creature within reach of the illusion Interacts to touch it, the illusion ends and that creature is invigorated, gaining 2d4 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature disbelieves the illusion and becomes temporarily immune to Wish Come True for 1 hour.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Wish Dragon (Young).name: Wish Dragon (Young)
Wish Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
What is a wish? A wish dragon would call it the truest expression of self—each individual wish reveals something of deep importance to the wisher, and no two wishes are ever quite the same. Whether the wish is one of creation or destruction, justice or vengeance, love or hate, wish dragons seek to understand what makes it important to the wisher and view their ability to make it a reality as a gift that helps them make sense of the world.

To a wish dragon, learning what someone wishes for is the beginning of a conversation, granting them that wish is a gift, and watching what they do with it is a reward. They take each part of this journey seriously and spend much of their lives moving among other ancestries to better understand what others want and need, especially during their younger years. While they view this mission as a righteous one, it can become all-consuming, and some have been known to lose all sense of themselves in their quest to bring about the dreams and desires of those around them.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Emotion.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Emotion

Heartening Aura.name: Heartening Aura
Heartening Aura.description: 50 feet. All allies in the aura gain a +2 status bonus to attack and damage rolls. The dragon's bonded companion also gains fast healing 15.

Shielding Wing.name: Shielding Wing
Shielding Wing.description:
Trigger The oath dragon or a bonded companion within 15 feet is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises its wing to protect itself or the bonded companion, providing a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.

Binding Oath.name: Binding Oath
Binding Oath.description: The dragon forges a bond with a willing creature over an hour-long ceremony, making them a bonded companion. The dragon can always sense their distance from the companion and if they're moving closer or farther away. A bonded companion automatically critically succeeds on basic saving throws against the oath dragon's abilities and spells. This link is permanent and neither can form a new link until one member dies. If the dragon or the bonded companion dies, the survivor learns the identity of the killer, but the shock leaves the survivor @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 24 hours and prevents forming a new link for 1 month.

Oathbreaker’s Curse.name: Oathbreaker’s Curse
Oathbreaker’s Curse.description:
If a bonded companion willingly breaks their oath, they retain the benefit of being a bonded companion but are immediately cursed with no initial saving throw. The cursed creature can attempt saving throws as noted to prevent the curse from worsening.

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:45]

Effect The cursed creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't reduce their doomed value below 1 while they're cursed. The first time the cursed creature encounters the oath dragon each day, they must attempt a saving throw. In addition, each time the creature critically fails a Strike or spell attack against the oath dragon, they must attempt a saving throw. On a failure, their doomed value increases by 1, 2 on a critical failure, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 3}.

Castigating Breath.name: Castigating Breath
Castigating Breath.description: The dragon unleashes a pronouncement that strikes at the soul of its enemies, dealing @Damage[13d10[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[will|dc:41|basic] save). The dragon can't use Castigating Breath for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Inspiring Word.name: Inspiring Word
Inspiring Word.description: All allies within the dragon's heartening aura become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. Allies can use this extra action to Raise a Shield, Step, Stride, or Strike.

Oath Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Oath Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Oath Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Oath dragons are the embodiment of a cause that they pursue with unerring determination. They draw their power not from mere words, but from the meaning and ideals that those words carry. Their dedication has led to the widespread imagery of oath dragons fighting alongside noble champions trying to bring goodness where only corruption is thought to dwell. Yet, there is nothing more terrifying than the power of an oath dragon who swears to a violent cause or who is dragged into damnation by their loyalty.

While an oath dragon can theoretically be dedicated to multiple ideals, they usually choose a single cause that they pursue with incredible devotion. They provide aid to those who share their dedication and fight fiercely against those who oppose it, all to uphold their ideals. Regardless of the causes they embrace, these dragons do so wholeheartedly. This unwavering determination gives them an intensity that is rarely matched by other creatures, spurring even the most reluctant ally to action.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge Scattershot.

Force Pulse.name: Force Pulse
Force Pulse.description:
1 to 3

The dragon emits pulses of energy that radiates outward in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10], dealing @Damage[(1d6+1)[force]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save).

For each action spent, a new pulse of energy is created and each subsequent pulse after the first is 5 feet larger than the previous one.

Ironsense.name: Ironsense
Ironsense.description: The dragon can detect the presence of iron and other ferrous metals as a precise sense at the listed range.

Arcane Whirlwind.name: Arcane Whirlwind
Arcane Whirlwind.description:
15 feet.

A vortex of fist-sized balls of pure magic swirls around the dragon. Air within the emanation is difficult terrain for Flying creatures other than the dragon. A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn within the aura takes @Damage[4d6[force]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save).

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Shrapnel Splash.name: Shrapnel Splash
Shrapnel Splash.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit with a melee weapon or unarmed attack

Effect The dragon's blood forms into hard spheres as it erupts from the wound, battering the attacker. The creature who dealt the triggering damage takes @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save.

Scattershot.name: Scattershot
Scattershot.description: The dragon exhales a cloud of small balls of pure energy that deal @Damage[(5d4+5)[force]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] with no save. The dragon can't use Scattershot again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Scattershot]]{1d4 rounds}.

Barrage Dragon (Young).name: Barrage Dragon (Young)
Barrage Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
To the uninitiated, spellcasting is an art for those with iron wills, people who reach out and grab hold of the fundamental laws of the universe and bend them to their whim. It takes discipline, study, and above all else, it takes control. Fail to control the very building blocks of reality and everything could fall apart.

Those who have even dabbled in the arcane arts know that this is nonsense. Magic is chaos, and channeling arcane forces is less akin to exerting one's will over the world and more like surfing on a bolt of lightning through a world-shaking storm and hoping to steer it without falling off. Spellcasting is barely contained panic, a lance of adrenaline, the constant danger of burning oneself out of existence. And the more powerful someone becomes, the more real this danger is.

Horned Archdragon.name: Horned Archdragon
Horned Archdragon.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. primal

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: The dragon can Hide in natural environments even if they don't have cover.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Miasma.name: Miasma
Miasma.description:
20 feet.

After the dragon uses their Poison Breath, a cloud of poison gas continues to emanate from their body for 1 round. Any creature that ends its turn in the miasma takes @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:43|basic] save).

Any creature in the miasma is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} and treats other creatures as concealed. The dragon can see through this concealment.

Poison Breath.name: Poison Breath
Poison Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a toxic cloud that deals @Damage[22d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:70] (@Check[fortitude|dc:43|basic|options:area-effect] save).

They can't use Poison Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Poison Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Trackless Journey.name: Trackless Journey
Trackless Journey.description: The horned dragon always gains the benefits of Cover Tracks in natural surroundings, even while moving at full speed.

Twisting Tail.name: Twisting Tail
Twisting Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon makes a tail Strike at the creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the dragon disrupts the creature's action.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horn Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Poison Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Forest Passage.name: Forest Passage
Forest Passage.description: The horned dragon ignores any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don't impede their progress.

Impaling Charge.name: Impaling Charge
Impaling Charge.description:
Requirements The dragon doesn't have a creature impaled on their horn

Effect The dragon attempts to gore a foe. They Stride, then attempt a horn Strike. On a hit, the target becomes impaled on the dragon's horn. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} while on the horn (and can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} as normal). The dragon doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the impaled creature grabbed. If the dragon moves, they bring the grabbed creature along with them.

Horned Archdragon.publicNotes:
The magic that flows through primal dragons can manifest more animalistic or bestial features in a given type of dragon. Notably among these are the massive paired horns of the horned dragon. While their bulky frames, natural coloration, and prominent ridged scales are all remarkable in their own way, it's the horns that are most obvious and striking at first glance. Horned dragons use their horns to impale their prey in a quick and brutal display of their might. They are generally contemplative and have a fixation on knowledge and self-discipline, traits belied by their bestial appearance. As a result, horned dragons are generally more open to speaking with outsiders.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Time Dragon (Ancient).name: Time Dragon (Ancient)

Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。
Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy

Temporal Eddies.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon Strides or Flies up to their Speed, leaving behind afterimages of their past and future selves in each space they move through. Until the end of the dragon's next turn, they can use any of these spaces as the origin of their Strikes, spells, and other abilities. Observers also perceive the dragon in all these spaces simultaneously and must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:15] to target the dragon or fail to affect it. A creature can take a concentrate action to attempt to identify the dragon's true location with a successful @Check[will|dc:40] save.
Temporal Eddies.name: Temporal Eddies

Decelerating Dodge.name: Decelerating Dodge
Decelerating Dodge.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with a ranged Strike or spell attack

Effect The dragon slows time to evade, gaining concealment against the triggering attack.

Immortal.name: Immortal
Immortal.description: Time dragons age, but don't die from old age.

Starflight.name: Starflight
Starflight.description: A time dragon can survive in outer space and fly at incredible speed, taking [[/r 3d20]] hours to reach a destination within the same solar system or [[/r 3d20]] days for destinations beyond. They can carry up to six passengers of at least one size category smaller than themself, protecting them from the void of space.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge their Timeshift Breath.

Second Chance.name: Second Chance
Second Chance.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger A creature within 60 feet (including the time dragon) fails a saving throw or skill check

Effect The target rerolls the check, but must use the second result. The target is then temporarily immune to Second Chance for 24 hours.

Timeshift Breath.name: Timeshift Breath
Timeshift Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a blast of temporal energy, warping time in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60]. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:42] save. The dragon can't use Timeshift Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Timeshift Breath]]{1d4 rounds}. Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature shifts briefly forward in time, vanishing and reappearing at the beginning of the time dragon's next turn in the same location (or an adjacent space if their former location is occupied), unaware that any time has passed. While timeshifted, time pauses for that creature, and it cannot take actions or be affected by anything else.

Time Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
Some time dragons would say time is a deep well, with those who explore it dipping cups into the waters at varying depths. Others might say that time is a shattered mirror, each shard reflecting discrete points that can be viewed simultaneously. None would say time is a firm onward march of linear progress, moving inexorably to a predetermined result. Time is fluid and ever-shifting, and time dragons dedicate themselves to protecting its flow.

Although safeguarding the natural temporal order is a mission all time dragons devote themselves to, they go about it in different ways. Staunch traditionalists oppose any meddling with the timestream whatsoever, even to repair damage caused by prior attempts to influence it, viewing this as doing more harm than good. They believe mortals are too short-sighted to responsibly use time magic and might appear without warning to slay those they believe pose a threat to the timestream. Other time dragons attempt to guide the course of events along the path they believe correct while preventing external tampering, often focusing on particular regions, areas of interest, or even individuals

Magma Dragon (Adult).name: Magma Dragon (Adult)
Magma Dragon (Adult).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Wing Deflection.name: Wing Deflection
Wing Deflection.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises a wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is Flying, they descend 10 feet after the attack.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Pyroclastic Blast whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Magma Burrow.name: Magma Burrow
Magma Burrow.description: A magma dragon's burrow Speed functions only when the dragon is Burrowing through magma or molten lava.

Pyroclastic Breath.name: Pyroclastic Breath
Pyroclastic Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of magma that deals @Damage[7d6[fire],4d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] in a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|basic|dc:33|options:area-effect]). They can't use Pyroclastic Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4#Recharge Pyroclastic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}

Volcanic Purge.name: Volcanic Purge
Volcanic Purge.description:
If the next action the dragon uses is Pyroclastic Breath, the magma clings to those it damages. Each creature that fails its save against Pyroclastic Breath takes @Damage[4d6[persistent,fire]] damage, and as long as it has this persistent fire damage, it also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7qoZauizAKfPIXeu]{Effect: Volcanic Purge}

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of a Medium humanoid. This does not change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horn Strike in any order.

Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
Snow Vision.description: Snow doesn't impair the rime dragon's vision; they ignore concealment from snowfall.

Blizzard Breath.description: The dragon breathes out a gust of frost and ice that deals @Damage[9d8[cold]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save). They can't use Blizzard Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Blizzard Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
Blizzard Breath.name: Blizzard Breath

Piercing Ice.name: Piercing Ice
Piercing Ice.description:
Requirements The dragon has temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield

Effect The dragon launches the collected ice shards from its scales in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], dealing @Damage[4d6[piercing],3d6[cold]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save). The dragon then loses the AC bonus and temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield.

Rime Shield.name: Rime Shield
Rime Shield.description:
Requirements The rime dragon's last action was to Fly at least 40 feet

Effect Water vapor collected on the dragon's scales quickly freezes over. The dragon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and 10 temporary Hit Points that last until the end of the dragon's next turn.

Arctic Hunter.name: Arctic Hunter
Arctic Hunter.description: A rime dragon's natural camouflage allows them to [[/act hide]] in arctic terrain without cover. A rime dragon also ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from ice and snow and doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Radiate Cold.name: Radiate Cold
Radiate Cold.description:
10 feet. The adult rime dragon's presence lowers the temperature around them. A creature who enters or begins their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature begins to shiver as the biting cold affects it. It takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn.

Failure The creature's body temperature begins to drop. It takes a –10-foot status penalty to their Speeds and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure Ice begins to form on the creature. It's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} ([[/act escape dc=26]]) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until the end of their its turn.

Rime Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Rime Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Rime Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Rime dragons are the embodiment of the frigid cold and ice. These hardy creatures have adapted to harsh arctic climates, able to survive indefinitely in sub-zero temperatures. Rime dragons are shades of white and pale blue that perfectly camouflage them in their natural habitat, resembling glaciers or mounds of snow when curled up. They can break through large slabs of ice and dive into frozen waters in search of prey. Due to their natural lower body temperature, they can slow their digestive tract, which allows them to live a long time on little food. Large prey—such as whales, caribou, or moose—offer the best sustenance, but they aren't picky when it's time to eat.

Rime dragons have a deep curiosity for things hidden and lost in the ice. The ocean's currents bring all kinds of artifacts from across the world to their frigid waters. Self-described caretakers and scholars, rime dragons search the arctic regions for ancient antiquities. Rime dragons with an academic interest in archaeology peer into glaciers for pieces of civilizations both recent and ancient, which they preserve in their lairs. Others might search for fossils or preserved corpses. Rime dragons also have an interest in more biological aspects of the world. As preservers of life, some of these dragons collect flora to log and study, and they protect endangered species by using low temperatures to conserve them. They also act as paleopathologists, studying ancient diseases that could cause havoc if they were brought back to a populace unknowingly. These they carefully contain while researching mitigation strategies should the pathogens be reintroduced to the world.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Graceless Domain.name: Graceless Domain
Graceless Domain.description:
90 feet. A creature who enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the graceless domain aura for 1 minute. The dragon can exclude creatures from this aura.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success For 1 round, the first time the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Failure For 1 minute, the first time each round the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Critical Failure For 1 minute, every time the creature rolls an Athletics, Acrobatics, or Performance skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

Jeer at Failure.name: Jeer at Failure
Jeer at Failure.description:
Trigger A foe within 90 feet becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} or critically fails on a Strike

Effect The mocking dragon laughs dismissively at the foe, attempting an Intimidation check to [[/act demoralize]] the creature. They do not take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand their language.

Vex.name: Vex
Vex.description:
Requirements The dragon's last action was a successful tail Strike

Effect The mocking dragon attempts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.5eNKs6738aykAhK2]{Dirty Trick} against the target of their tail Strike. This attempt neither applies nor counts toward the creature's multiple attack penalty.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of any Small, Medium, or Large humanoid, or any Tiny animal. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes, but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Hilarious Exhalation.name: Hilarious Exhalation
Hilarious Exhalation.description:
The dragon unleashes their breath in one of two ways. The dragon can't use Hilarious Exhalation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hilarious Exhalation]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Laughing Gas (emotion, mental) The dragon breaths a cloud of mood-altering gas in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. This has the effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlSE7Ly8vi1Dgddv]{Laughing Fit} (@Check[will|dc:26|traits:emotion,mental]) with a duration of 1 round.

  • Slippery Puddle The dragon expels a glob of viscous goo at a solid surface at a range of 60 feet. This creates a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] with the area effect of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} (@Check[reflex|dc:26]).

Insistent Heckling.name: Insistent Heckling
Insistent Heckling.description: The dragon can [[/act demoralize]] targets within 90 feet. Targets become immune to the mocking dragon's attempts to Demoralize them for 1 minute after each attempt.

Countered by Fire.description:
如果天龙受到火焰伤害，他们体内的金元素魔法会被回火。直到其下个回合结束，其在攻击骰和AC上承受-1环境减值，且颚咬打击不再造成电击伤害。如果天龙使用了钢电吐息，则限制结束。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.a4bZrBNL17zPjDiH]
Countered by Fire.name: 为火所克 Countered by Fire

Fed by Earth.name: 由土而生 Fed by Earth
Fed by Earth.description: 如果天龙成为土法术或效果的目标，他会将鳞片中的矿物质结晶化，形成折射或散射光线的外层以进行伪装。在1分钟内，天龙在飞行时处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]。

Mist Vision.name: 迷雾视觉 Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: 雾与浓雾不会削弱天龙的视觉；其忽视由雾和迷雾造成的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态。

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当天龙在一次打击中造成重击时，他充能其钢电吐息。

Perfected Flight.name: 完美飞行 Perfected Flight
Perfected Flight.description: 天龙不花费动作便可悬停在原地，并且他在用于空中机动的所有特技检定上自动成功。

Steel Lightning Breath.name: 钢电吐息 Steel Lightning Breath
Steel Lightning Breath.description: 天龙向40尺内射出一个电球，对@Template[type:burst|distance:20]范围造成@Damage[5d12[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic]豁免）。其不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Steel Lightning Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用钢电吐息。

Sky Dragon (Young).name: 青年天龙 Sky Dragon (Young)
Sky Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
当帝龙初临物质宇宙时，每条龙都与自身诞生的元素位面紧密相连。随着元素领主之间的战争愈演愈烈，仁慈的领主们接连陨落，金元素位面与木元素位面相继自我封闭。对于源自腐蚀核心（Corroded Core）的龙族而言，它们的生存根基已然岌岌可危。这些龙类在山巅间辗转流亡，逃离妖怪征战的彼时危险的天夏。最终，当它们抵达沉沦山脉（Chenlun）、罗网山脉（Gossamer）、格桑山脉（Kelsang）、金山（Kimu）、库兰山脉（Kullan）、巨人山脉（Kyojin）与天境之墙（Wall of Heaven）时，天界生灵回应了它们的求救。当龙族失去金元素的支撑，天族便以神圣赐福与精粹相补。随着本质蜕变，这些龙从而得以延续。久而久之，它们因贴近苍穹、侍奉神明而得名。昔日的金元素龙的岁月，终成褪色的记忆与创世神话，唯有天龙自身仍铭记于心。

天龙以永恒的侍奉来感恩。部分天龙吸收了所侍奉神祇的位面能量，变得庞大而强大；其中许多成为现代圣天龙的始祖。其余天龙则留在物质宇宙中，终生修习信仰，臻于生命与灵魂的神术技艺。真正能独立行动，运用非神术力量执行无关伟大意志任务的天龙实属罕见。即便如此，这些少数天龙仍保留着隐居沉思的本性，至少在年轻岁月里如此。

随着金元素位面的回归，关于天龙与该位面关联的谨慎探询悄然展开。有人猜测是否能寻得幸存的远亲。这些探询并非出于好奇，而是迫于现实需求。虽然天龙因天界生灵的加持获得了自保之力，却未能解决元素匮乏的问题。更糟的是，即便腐蚀核心已然回归，这种匮乏仍在持续。无论是从蛋里孵化还是自然分娩，天龙雏龙降生时都脆弱不堪，鳞片稀疏甚至全然不长。即便置身于大型矿藏或盐脉（作为金元素能量的磁体与蓄能库）之中，幼龙的鳞片也需历经数十年淬炼，方能坚韧到足以离开巢穴的程度。如果金元素位面存在这些问题的答案——无论是适合作为安全的产崽或育雏的场所，还是恢复龙类吸收环境元素能量的能力——确保所有天龙掌握此法并把握机会，实为当务之急。

Thundercloud Breath.name: Thundercloud Breath
Thundercloud Breath.description: The dragon breathes a thundercloud that deals @Damage[15d6[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic] save). They can't use Thundercloud Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Thundercloud Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Mist Vision.name: Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: Fog and mist don't impair a cloud dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from fog and mist.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Master of Clouds.name: Master of Clouds
Master of Clouds.description:
Trigger The dragon rolls initiative

Effect A cloud dragon controls their element as easily as they breathe. The dragon uses Dragonmist.

Dragonmist.name: Dragonmist
Dragonmist.description: The dragon conjures up a sudden mist in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 120 feet. All creatures within the mist become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the mist become concealed to creatures within it. The dragon can use this action again to dismiss the mist—anyone else attempting to remove the dragonmist (via gust of wind or similar) must succeed at a counteract check. An adult dragon can have up to four clouds of dragonmist active at a time.

Shapes in the Fog.name: Shapes in the Fog
Shapes in the Fog.description: With a cloud dragon's mastery of their element, creating shapes and images in a fog is child's play. All creatures within or adjacent to one cloud of dragonmist must attempt a @Check[will|dc:34] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round (on a critical failure, they are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}).

Cloud Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Cloud Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Cloud Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Wailing Archdragon.name: Wailing Archdragon

Echolocation.name: Echolocation
Echolocation.description: A wailing dragon can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

Subsonic Drone.name: Subsonic Drone
Subsonic Drone.description:
120 feet, A creature who enters or begins their turn in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's subsonic drone for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。
Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Resounding Roar whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Natural Mimic.name: Natural Mimic
Natural Mimic.description: The dragon can imitate any sound or voice that it has heard. This has the effect of 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.yV7Ouzaoe7DHLESI]{Ventriloquism} (DC 40) but is a nonmagical effect.

Resounding Roar.name: Resounding Roar
Resounding Roar.description:
The dragon unleashes a thunderous call that deals @Damage[19d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic] save). On a critical failure, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute.

In addition, if the area overlaps with an area of magical silence or includes a creature affected by magical silence, the roar attempts to counteract the silence effect (counteract rank 9, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+32 #Counteract]]{+32}).

The dragon can't use Resounding Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Resounding Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

Reverberating Rush.name: Reverberating Rush
Reverberating Rush.description: The dragon Flies three times. The dragon gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. Any creature that is adjacent to the dragon at any point during its movement takes @Damage[9d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 hour. A creature can be affected only once per Reverberating Rush.

Steal Sound.name: Steal Sound
Steal Sound.description: A creature struck by the wailing archdragon's melee Strikes must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:40] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} and silenced for 1 round. A silenced creature can't use sonic attacks, auditory actions, or Cast Spells (with the exception of subtle spells).

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and Sonic

Destructive Interference.name: Destructive Interference
Destructive Interference.description:
Trigger A foe within 90 feet uses an auditory or sonic effect

Effect The young wailing dragon releases a burst of noise, attempting to drown out the triggering sound. It makes a counteract check against the effect (counteract rank 9, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+32 #Counteract]]{+32}).

Eerie Call.name: Eerie Call
Eerie Call.description:
Requirements The dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or undetected

Effect The dragon's wail draws in unsuspecting opponents. Anyone that can hear the Eerie Call must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the sound. A fascinated creature must spend at least 1 action Seeking the dragon each turn, and the dragon can Sustain this affect for up to 1 minute

Wailing Archdragon.publicNotes:
Canny, patient, and creative, wailing dragons are adepts of sound and psychology. With both their physiology and innate connection to arcane magic allowing them to produce and shape sound waves, these reclusive creatures are heard much more often than seen. Named for their tendency to use uncanny keening vocalizations to communicate across long distances and startle prey, wailing dragons haunt locations that create interesting or useful echoes, such as canyons or caverns. Though ruthless predators when needed, most wailing dragons devote their energy toward investigating the effects sound has on the environment and the bodies and minds of creatures.

Minstrels, divas, and tunesmiths seek out these creatures during their mating season, when two dragons sing courtship ballads full of intricate harmonies. While this might be the performance of a lifetime, it's a dangerous concert, as incautious audience members frequently become meals for the nuptial couple. (The famous Chelaxian composer, Gretezi Valtros, disappeared on such an expedition in 4275 ar, after he set out to teach a wailing dragon High Azlanti and "instruct it in the decorous art of opera.") Most creatures also find the close-range subsonic vibrations emitted by wailing dragons extremely uncomfortable, reinforcing the idea that it's best to observe them from a distance.

Omen Archdragon.name: Omen Archdragon
Omen Archdragon.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Destiny Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Impending Fate.name: Impending Fate
Impending Fate.description: The dragon's attacks bring their foes closer to their eventual fates. When the dragon critically hits with a Strike or a creature critically fails against the dragon's Destiny Breath, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}, or increases its doomed value by 1 if it was already doomed.

Prophetic Wings.name: Prophetic Wings
Prophetic Wings.description: The dragon or any ally can glimpse into the future in their wings in a process that requires 10 minutes of concentration. This casts a 10th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury} spell, except that the wings can predict results up to 1 day into the future and the dragon always speaks a few cryptic words related to the result of the prediction. The dragon can use their wings in this way only once per hour and a given creature can seek a future in the wings only once per week. In addition, a creature can choose to predict events up to 1 year into the future—the dragon can view a year ahead in their own wings only once per day.

Walk the Timelines.name: Walk the Timelines
Walk the Timelines.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The dragon splits themself into two versions with different fates. Each copy Strides or Flies from the dragon's current space, then takes a single action. If the actions are both attacks, they use the same multiple attack penalty and count as one attack toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty.

After both actions, the dragon chooses one of the two locations as their actual destination and the other version of themself disappears.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Challenge Fate.name: Challenge Fate
Challenge Fate.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack;

Effect This fate is not set in stone. The attacker rolls the triggering attack twice and uses the worse result.

Untethered to Fate.name: Untethered to Fate
Untethered to Fate.description: The dragon can choose to negate any fortune or misfortune effects that would affect them; other creatures remain affected normally.

Destiny Breath.name: Destiny Breath
Destiny Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a translucent mist of potentialities that overwhelms creatures with visions of possible features, dealing @Damage[19d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:50] (@Check[will|dc:44|options:area-effect] save). A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) as it struggles with the visions.

The dragon can't use Destiny Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Destiny Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

Omen Archdragon.publicNotes:
Fate is a fickle matter on Golarion. Even with prophecy broken on the world, there are ways to look to the immediate future or acquire a vague sense of long-term events. Omen dragons are bound to see the future—nebulous though it might be—at all times. Visions of the future hound them like a quiet song that never stops playing in their minds. While an omen dragon can focus on or ignore the music of fate at any time, the song plays all the same. At a glance, omen dragons resemble other occult dragons in appearance, save for the mirror-like interior membrane of their wings. An omen dragon's wings offer glimpses into the future. These glimpses are cloudy and vague, but generally correct, if only technically. Omen dragons have a natural compulsion to share the futures they see. These dragons have no compunctions about what the visions show and share their knowledge equally with innocent villagers as they do with wicked tyrants.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Frightful Presence.name: 恐怖威压 Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description:
90 feet. @Check[will|dc:46]

On a critical failure, a creature is also paralyzed until the start of their next turn.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Vitality Transfer.description:
Trigger The wyrmwraith succeeds at a saving throw to resist vitality damage but still takes damage

Effect The wyrmwraith transfers all vitality damage from the effect to a single undead creature of their choice within 120 feet that they control or that's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.v66R7FdOf11l94im]{Friendly} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.v44P3WUcU1j0115l]{Helpful} to them.
Vitality Transfer.name: Vitality Transfer

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description:
When a wyrmwraith deals damage to a living creature with a spectral jaws or spectral claw Strike, the wyrmwraith gains 20 temporary Hit Points and the target's maximum Hit Points (but not current Hit Points) are reduced by 20. The target's maximum Hit Points are restored after a full night's rest.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LRIYUFQ7FE9H4RWD]{Effect: Drain Life}

Phase Lurch.description:
Requirements The wyrmwraith is in their ectoplasmic form

Effect As the Stride action, but the wyrmwraith can pass through walls or material obstacles as though they were incorporeal. They must begin and end their movement outside of any physical obstacles, and passing through solid material is difficult terrain.
Phase Lurch.name: Phase Lurch

Void's Embrace.name: Void's Embrace
Void's Embrace.description:
If a victim succeeds at a saving throw against this curse while in sunlight, the curse ends. While a creature has this curse, they bypass the resistances of the wyrmwraith that cursed them

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:46]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} in any light (1 hour)

Stage 2 gains lifesense 30 feet but is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} in any light (1 hour)

Stage 3 as stage 2, but also has void healing (1 hour)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and can't awaken (1 day)

Stage 5 dead and becomes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.Gu0cJHGwPd547OtC]{Wraith}, its body crumbling to ash.

Wings of Shadow.name: Wings of Shadow
Wings of Shadow.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The wyrmwraith spreads its spectral wings wide covering all near it in shadow. Each living creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] is exposed to void's embrace.

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: An elder wyrmwraith in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Consume Souls.name: Consume Souls
Consume Souls.description:
The elder wyrmwraith inhales sharply, sucking in the souls of nearby creatures. Each creature in a @Template[cone|distance:60] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:46|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save.

The elder wyrmwraith can't Consume Souls again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Consume Souls]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} and takes @Damage[100[void]|options:area-damage] damage.

Critical Failure The creature is slain. As long as the wyrmwraith still exists, the slain creature can't be returned to life through any means.

Decaying Breath.name: Decaying Breath
Decaying Breath.description: The wyrmwraith unleashes a torrent of void energy that deals @Damage[24d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:90] (@Check[reflex|dc:46|basic] save). They can't use Decaying Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Decaying Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Divine Dispelling.name: Divine Dispelling
Divine Dispelling.description: An elder wyrmwraith's claws rend divine magic. Whenever an elder wyrmwraith hits a creature with a spectral claws Strike, the elder wyrmwraith can attempt a @Check[religion] check to counteract an ongoing divine spell effect on the creature.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The elder wyrmwraith makes two claw Strikes and one jaws Strike in any order.

Ectoplasmic Form.name: Ectoplasmic Form
Ectoplasmic Form.description: An elder wyrmwraith can push through the ectoplasmic veil to temporarily assume a physical form made of ectoplasm. The elder wyrmwraith loses the incorporeal trait for [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Physical Form]]{1d4 rounds}, though they can return to their incorporeal form as a free action before then. Once this ability ends, the elder wyrmwraith can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Ectoplasmatic Form]]{1d4 rounds}. While in their ectoplasmic form, the elder wyrmwraith's AC increases to 52 and they gain 125 temporary Hit Points. They lose their immunity to precision damage and all of their resistances. Their melee Strikes deal slashing and piercing damage, respectively, instead of void damage.

Elder Wyrmwraith.name: Elder Wyrmwraith
