Elder Wyrmwraith.publicNotes:
TDahak's defiance and his hatred for all of creation brought loss to dragonkind. It is said that the first wyrmwraiths rose from the souls of dragons hurled into the Void by Dahak, but whether this is true or not is still a matter of debate. What is undeniable is that the wyrmwraiths are unliving conduits of the Void, shaped but unshackled by the plane's hunger for indiscriminate destruction.

Wyrmwraiths dwell in remote areas marred by catastrophes and death, where they can better hide their undead nature or indulge in their grim research. Their lairs often have a single, hidden and highly defensible antechamber where the wyrmwraith confers with its agents as it engages in a war with distant rivals through expendable proxies. This dimly lit antechamber is usually filled with death and many undead servants, some raised from the bodies of those whose usefulness has come to an end.

Wyrmwraiths might enter temporary alliances with other undead, cults, or necromancers, especially when it comes to unearthing powerful secrets or striking a blow against a common powerful threat. While wyrmwraiths take great pleasure in acting against those who wield the power of the gods, often targeting them first in battle to rend their flesh and protective spells with their claws, they are often very cautious, striking only after stacking the odds in their favor.

Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Hallucinatory Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.
Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum

Aura of Isolation.description: 60 feet. The mirage dragon warps the light around them, confounding their foes' vision. A creature who enters or begins its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:42] save or treat all its allies as undetected by sight for 1 round (though it can use its other senses to ascertain their whereabouts).
Aura of Isolation.name: Aura of Isolation

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: The dragon can Hide in natural environments even if they don't have cover.

Illusion Sense.name: Illusion Sense
Illusion Sense.description: When the dragon moves within 30 feet of an illusion that can be disbelieved, they automatically attempt a secret check to disbelieve, even if they didn't spend an action to Interact.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Scintillating Defense.name: Scintillating Defense
Scintillating Defense.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon flashes their iridescent scales at the triggering creature to throw off the attack. The dragon gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} against the triggering attack.

Captivating Display.name: Captivating Display
Captivating Display.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon opens the fins on their head, creating a radiant display of enthralling colors. Each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:46] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) for 1 round. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to Captivating Display for 1 minute.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Hallucinatory Breath.name: Hallucinatory Breath
Hallucinatory Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a cloud that assaults the senses and deals @Damage[21d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[will|dc:46|options:area-effect] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure) and is then temporarily immune to being confused by Hallucinatory Breath for 1 hour.

The dragon can't use Hallucinatory Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hallucinatory Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Lunging Bite.name: Lunging Bite
Lunging Bite.description: The dragon lunges their head forward, making a jaws Strike with an extended reach of 25 feet.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The dragon's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Mirage Archdragon.name: Mirage Archdragon
Mirage Archdragon.publicNotes:
Mirage dragons are masters of illusion magic and use their powers to deceive others and further their own agendas. In addition to their magical prowess, mirage dragons possess a number of additional features to help them on hunts or mislead attackers, such as their camouflaging scales and a hallucinatory breath that can confound multiple foes at once. Mirage dragons are vain and egotistical figures. They ultimately care more about themselves than others.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Mirage Archdragon.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Lustrous Lunge.description: The dragon strikes a pose that makes its hide sparkle in the light. Each creature within 20 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:27|inflicts:dazzled] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.
Lustrous Lunge.name: Lustrous Lunge

Ornamental Breath.name: Ornamental Breath
Ornamental Breath.description: The dragon exhales a torrent of shattered rocks and minerals in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] dealing @Damage[11d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|options:area-effect,inflicts:clumsy] save). A creature who fails the save is weighed down by the stones, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure).

+2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal

Cobblegems.name: Cobblegems
Cobblegems.description: 10 feet. The dragon constantly sheds crystalline scales onto the ground around it. The area is uneven ground (DC 27).

Shielding Stone.name: Shielding Stone
Shielding Stone.description:
Trigger A creature at least 10 feet away from the dragon targets them with an attack

Requirements The dragon is on the ground and there is at least one unoccupied square between themself and the attacker

Effect The dragon conjures a thin slab of stone in an unoccupied square between themself and the attacker. The dragon gains standard cover against the triggering attack. The stone falls on the first person other than the dragon who enters that square, dealing @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:27|basic] save. Otherwise, it crumbles harmlessly after 1 round.

Crystal Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Crystal Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Crystal Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Ornamental Breath.description: The dragon exhales a torrent of shattered rocks and minerals in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] dealing @Damage[19d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:41|options:area-effect,inflicts:clumsy] save). A creature who fails the save is weighed down by the stones, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure).
Ornamental Breath.name: Ornamental Breath

Shard Spray.name: Shard Spray
Shard Spray.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The crystal archdragon makes 2 tail Strikes, both using its current multiple attack penalty, then spins in a circle, releasing crystalline projectiles. All creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] take @Damage[9d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature who critically fails the save is also exposed to crystallize. This counts as two attacks when calculating the dragon's multiple attack penalty.

+2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal

Cobblegems.name: Cobblegems
Cobblegems.description: 10 feet. The dragon constantly sheds crystalline scales onto the ground around it. The area is uneven ground (DC 38).

Shielding Stone.name: Shielding Stone
Shielding Stone.description:
Trigger A creature at least 10 feet away from the dragon targets them with an attack

Requirements The dragon is on the ground and there is at least one unoccupied square between themself and the attacker

Effect The dragon conjures a thin slab of stone in an unoccupied square between themself and the attacker. The dragon gains standard cover against the triggering attack. The stone falls on the first person other than the dragon who enters that square, dealing @Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save. Otherwise, it crumbles harmlessly after 1 round.

Shimmering Armor.description: When the dragon takes a critical hit from any attack that deals physical damage, its hide chips, releasing sharp slivers. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] take @Damage[16d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:38|basic|options:area-effect] save.
Shimmering Armor.name: Shimmering Armor

Crystallize.name: Crystallize
Crystallize.description: The claws and tail of a crystal archdragon embed shards that slowly turns the flesh of those they Strike to crystal. The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:38|options:inflicts:petrified,inflicts:slowed] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. Further failed saves against crystallize increase the slowed condition. Once a creature's actions are reduced to 0 by crystallize, that creature becomes petrified, turned into crystal instead of stone.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Ornamental Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Lustrous Lunge.name: Lustrous Lunge
Lustrous Lunge.description: The dragon strikes a pose that makes its hide sparkle in the light. Each creature within 20 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:38|inflicts:dazzled] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Crystal Archdragon.name: Crystal Archdragon
Crystal Archdragon.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Fortune Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Fortune Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Fortune Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Aura of Disruption.name: Aura of Disruption
Aura of Disruption.description:
120 feet.

The dragon radiates disruptive energies that allow them to feed on magic. When a spell is counteracted or disrupted within the aura, the dragon regains one expended spontaneous spell slot and gains 45 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute.

Treasure Dive.name: Treasure Dive
Treasure Dive.description:
Requirements The dragon's body isn't covered in riches and the dragon is adjacent to their hoard

Effect The dragon Strides or Burrows through their hoard using their land Speed. They coat themself in coins, magic items, and other treasures. This contact with magical items revitalizes the dragon, causing them to regain one expended spontaneous spell slot.

The dragon can move through other creatures while moving in this way. Creatures in the dragon's path, or above it if the dragon Burrows, must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:43] save or be pushed 10 feet (or pushed 20 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a critical failure).

Treasure Tsunami.name: Treasure Tsunami
Treasure Tsunami.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Requirements The dragon is within 120 feet of their hoard

Effect The dragon exerts their pull on their hoard, creating a wave of treasures 60 feet wide and 60 feet tall that emanates at a place of their choosing within their hoard and within 120 feet. The wave moves in a straight line toward them, ending where they stand and crashing over them, covering the dragon in riches. Creatures struck by the wave must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:43] save or take @Damage[15d10[bludgeoning]] damage and are pulled 20 feet toward the dragon (on a success they take half the bludgeoning damage and are knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} instead of pulled).

Capture Spell.name: Capture Spell
Capture Spell.description:
Trigger The dragon succeeds or critically succeeds on a saving throw against a spell

Effect The dragon attempts to capture a portion of the spell's magic to feed themself. They attempt to counteract the spell (counteract rank 10, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+42 #Counteract]]{+42}). If successful, the dragon is unaffected by the spell and regains one expended spontaneous spell slot; other subjects are affected by the spell normally.

Disruptive Breath.name: Disruptive Breath
Disruptive Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a spray of magic-disrupting energies that deals @Damage[22d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:80] (@Check[reflex|dc:50|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute.

The dragon can't use Disruptive Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Disruptive Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Drain Hoard.name: Drain Hoard
Drain Hoard.description:
Requirements The dragon is within 60 feet of their hoard

Frequency once per day

Effect The dragon draws power out of the magic items in their hoard, regaining all their expended spontaneous spell slots.

Share the Wealth.name: Share the Wealth
Share the Wealth.description:
Requirements The dragon's body is covered in riches (this is typically the case when the dragon is first encountered)

Effect The dragon shakes their body aggressively, sending coins and other riches flying in every direction, dealing @Damage[22d10[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:45|basic|options:area-effect] save to all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:60]. The dragon's body is then no longer covered in riches.

Fortune Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Fortune dragons have the innate ability to draw upon the raw magical energies that surround them. They constantly use these magical energies to empower their magical abilities and even their bodies, as the energy can heal wounds. A fortune dragon has a typical build for an arcane dragon, but their bodies sport a striking feature: their treasure. The dragon's nature of drawing upon magic causes coins, gems, and, most notably, magical items to cling to their body like iron drawn to magnets. A dragon constantly pulls magical energies from the items attached to their body and makes use of these energies to cast spells. The magical energies that flow through a fortune dragon constantly flow through the dragon's items as well, and in many cases, the items melt from the heat produced in this process. Fortune dragons are seekers of novel experiences. This desire for originality leads fortune dragons to approach visitors of other ancestries with curiosity, though this initial interest quickly wanes if a visitor lacks exciting qualities.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

Draconic Spellcasters

Each dragon features a sidebar on spellcasting dragons of that type. To make a dragon spellcaster, remove the dragon's Draconic Frenzy and Draconic Momentum abilities, and give them the spells outlined in their sidebar. You can swap out any number of these with other spells, provided you keep the same number of spells for each rank. You might also want to increase the dragon's Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier by 1 or 2 to reflect their mastery of magic.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Emotion.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Emotion

Heartening Aura.name: Heartening Aura
Heartening Aura.description: 50 feet. All allies in the aura gain a +2 status bonus to attack and damage rolls. The dragon's bonded companion also gains fast healing 20.

Dread Promise.name: Dread Promise
Dread Promise.description:
The dragon's roar shakes the resolve of all those who oppose them. The roar can be heard up to 1 mile away under the open sky. Any enemy who hears it is cowed by the dragon's resolve and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for as long as it's frightened.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for as long as it's frightened.

Inspiring Word.name: Inspiring Word
Inspiring Word.description: All allies within the dragon's heartening aura become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. Allies can use this extra action to Raise a Shield, Step, Stride, or Strike.

Oathbreaker’s Curse.name: Oathbreaker’s Curse
Oathbreaker’s Curse.description:
If a bonded companion willingly breaks their oath, they retain the benefit of being a bonded companion but are immediately cursed with no initial saving throw. The cursed creature can attempt saving throws as noted to prevent the curse from worsening.

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:50]

Effect The cursed creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't reduce their doomed value below 1 while they're cursed. The first time the cursed creature encounters the oath dragon each day, they must attempt a saving throw. In addition, each time the creature critically fails a Strike or spell attack against the oath dragon, they must attempt a saving throw. On a failure, their doomed value increases by 1, 2 on a critical failure, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 3}.

Binding Oath.name: Binding Oath
Binding Oath.description: The dragon forges a bond with a willing creature over an hour-long ceremony, making them a bonded companion. The dragon can always sense their distance from the companion and if they're moving closer or farther away. A bonded companion automatically critically succeeds on basic saving throws against the oath dragon's abilities and spells. This link is permanent and neither can form a new link until one member dies. If the dragon or the bonded companion dies, the survivor learns the identity of the killer, but the shock leaves the survivor @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 24 hours and prevents forming a new link for 1 month.

Shielding Wing.name: Shielding Wing
Shielding Wing.description:
Trigger The oath dragon or a bonded companion within 15 feet is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises its wing to protect itself or the bonded companion, providing a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.

Castigating Breath.name: Castigating Breath
Castigating Breath.description: The dragon unleashes a pronouncement that strikes at the soul of its enemies, dealing @Damage[15d10[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[will|dc:45|basic] save). The dragon can't use Castigating Breath for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Oath Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Oath Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Oath Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Oath dragons are the embodiment of a cause that they pursue with unerring determination. They draw their power not from mere words, but from the meaning and ideals that those words carry. Their dedication has led to the widespread imagery of oath dragons fighting alongside noble champions trying to bring goodness where only corruption is thought to dwell. Yet, there is nothing more terrifying than the power of an oath dragon who swears to a violent cause or who is dragged into damnation by their loyalty.

While an oath dragon can theoretically be dedicated to multiple ideals, they usually choose a single cause that they pursue with incredible devotion. They provide aid to those who share their dedication and fight fiercely against those who oppose it, all to uphold their ideals. Regardless of the causes they embrace, these dragons do so wholeheartedly. This unwavering determination gives them an intensity that is rarely matched by other creatures, spurring even the most reluctant ally to action.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Radiate Cold.name: Radiate Cold
Radiate Cold.description:
10 feet. The adult rime dragon's presence lowers the temperature around them. A creature who enters or begins their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature begins to shiver as the biting cold affects it. It takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn.

Failure The creature's body temperature begins to drop. It takes a –10-foot status penalty to their Speeds and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure Ice begins to form on the creature. It's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} ([[/act escape dc=26]]) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until the end of their its turn.

Blizzard Breath.name: Blizzard Breath
Blizzard Breath.description: The dragon breathes out a gust of frost and ice that deals @Damage[9d8[cold]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save). They can't use Blizzard Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Blizzard Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Arctic Hunter.name: Arctic Hunter
Arctic Hunter.description: A rime dragon's natural camouflage allows them to [[/act hide]] in arctic terrain without cover. A rime dragon also ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from ice and snow and doesn't risk falling when crossing ice.

Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
Snow Vision.description: Snow doesn't impair the rime dragon's vision; they ignore concealment from snowfall.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Blizzard Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Piercing Ice.name: Piercing Ice
Piercing Ice.description:
Requirements The dragon has temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield

Effect The dragon launches the collected ice shards from its scales in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], dealing @Damage[4d6[piercing],3d6[cold]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save). The dragon then loses the AC bonus and temporary Hit Points from Rime Shield.

Rime Shield.name: Rime Shield
Rime Shield.description:
Requirements The rime dragon's last action was to Fly at least 40 feet

Effect Water vapor collected on the dragon's scales quickly freezes over. The dragon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and 10 temporary Hit Points that last until the end of the dragon's next turn.

Rime Dragon (Adult).name: Rime Dragon (Adult)
Rime Dragon (Adult).publicNotes:
Rime dragons are the embodiment of the frigid cold and ice. These hardy creatures have adapted to harsh arctic climates, able to survive indefinitely in sub-zero temperatures. Rime dragons are shades of white and pale blue that perfectly camouflage them in their natural habitat, resembling glaciers or mounds of snow when curled up. They can break through large slabs of ice and dive into frozen waters in search of prey. Due to their natural lower body temperature, they can slow their digestive tract, which allows them to live a long time on little food. Large prey—such as whales, caribou, or moose—offer the best sustenance, but they aren't picky when it's time to eat.

Rime dragons have a deep curiosity for things hidden and lost in the ice. The ocean's currents bring all kinds of artifacts from across the world to their frigid waters. Self-described caretakers and scholars, rime dragons search the arctic regions for ancient antiquities. Rime dragons with an academic interest in archaeology peer into glaciers for pieces of civilizations both recent and ancient, which they preserve in their lairs. Others might search for fossils or preserved corpses. Rime dragons also have an interest in more biological aspects of the world. As preservers of life, some of these dragons collect flora to log and study, and they protect endangered species by using low temperatures to conserve them. They also act as paleopathologists, studying ancient diseases that could cause havoc if they were brought back to a populace unknowingly. These they carefully contain while researching mitigation strategies should the pathogens be reintroduced to the world.

Cloud of Giggles.name: Cloud of Giggles
Cloud of Giggles.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The delight dragon transforms into a Huge sparkling cloud of gas for 10 minutes. During this time, the dragon gains resistance 20 to physical damage and is immune to precision damage, but they can't cast spells, activate items, or use Strikes or actions that have the attack or manipulate trait. They can only use their fly Speed, can slip through tiny cracks, and occupy the same space as other creatures. If the dragon ends their turn sharing the same space as other creatures, each of those creatures must attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} from a fit of giggles until the end of the dragon's next turn. The dragon can Dismiss this action as long as it has space to take its original size.

Lover of the Arts.name: Lover of the Arts
Lover of the Arts.description: Checks by or against the dragon to change a creature's attitude using Diplomacy can be attempted with Performance instead.

Whimsysense.name: Whimsysense
Whimsysense.description: Delight dragons can sense the presence of laughter, games, celebrations, and sweets within the listed range.

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine

Play Scape.name: Play Scape
Play Scape.description:
15 feet. Delight dragon magic alters their surroundings, turning weapons into toys and spells into stage effects. All Strikes and other damaging effects used in the aura gain the nonlethal trait and are accompanied by magical sound effects. A creature entering or beginning their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save.

Failure The creature's first damaging effect (such as a Strike) this round does half damage.

Critical Failure All the creature's damaging effects this turn do half damage.

Reactive Tail.name: Reactive Tail
Reactive Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon attempts an Athletics check to [[/act trip]] the triggering creature. This check doesn't count toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this check.

Breath of Fresh Air.name: Breath of Fresh Air
Breath of Fresh Air.description: The dragon unleashes a stream of magical bubbles in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50]. Each creature within the area takes @Damage[14d8[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:41|basic] save). A creature who fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as they give in to the joyful urge to dance, sing, laugh, or admire the world around them. On a critical failure, the creature is slowed 1 for 1 minute and can't use reactions for as long as they are slowed; they can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turn to end the slowed condition early.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge their Breath of Fresh Air.

Let's Play!.name: Let's Play!
Let's Play!.description: The dragon conjures up a magical arena to play a game, making up rules on the spot. Up to six target creatures inside the dragon's aura take @Damage[12d6[mental]] damage from the dragon's baffling explanation (@Check[will|dc:41|basic] save). Creatures who fail the save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure). Regardless of result, all targets are immune for 24 hours.

Delight Dragon (Ancient).name: Delight Dragon (Ancient)
Delight Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes:
Some would say delight dragons are like children. They would be correct. At least, as correct as if they said a puff of chimney smoke resembled a massive storm cloud or compared a toddler's drawing of a horse to a prized thoroughbred. Which is to say, they are completely and utterly incorrect. Of course, having a smoke cloud or child's drawing running around one's home might be vastly preferable to a delight dragon.

As residents of the Outer Plane Elysium, delight dragons are embodiments of the plane's proclivity toward joy, mischief, passion, and spontaneity. Their massive gossamer wings refract the light of a thousand rainbows between translucent layers. Purple-green scales shimmer in opalescent splendor, while a long, sinuous tail flicks in spiral figures, darting to catch the feet out from under distracted observers. A pair of feathery antennae direct the delight dragon to their next source of amusement—whether play, treat, or general amusement, all surely to become a great time in the dragon's presence, whether a plane's denizens know it or not.

As self-proclaimed defenders of games, whimsy, and the freedom to sow a little chaos, delight dragons are often found on the front line against those that would strip such choice away from others. Demonic forces deployed at the Worldwound whispered of the "lights of doom," massive rainbows that heralded the approach of a delight dragon. The winged crusader would descend upon these fiends with claws and fangs, cackling all the while.
Delight Dragon (Ancient).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Sovereign Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: 至古君龙施法者 Sovereign Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Sovereign Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
据说曾有纯粹的土元素龙类存在。这些帝龙如同其他元素龙一样来到物质宇宙，生老病死，其躯体最终化作大陆的一部分。正如火元素化作熔岩，木元素化作森林，水元素汇成海洋湖泊，金元素化作珍贵矿脉，土元素终成大地、岩石与山岳。依循逻辑推演，若当今世间尚存此类环境与存在，那么土元素龙必然存在。抑或曾在远古时代存在过。

然而如今帝龙之中，唯有君龙在死亡时会留下蛇形骸骨，而非岩石、石块或泥土。龙的内在施法能力，对未加热铁器的弱点等特征，强烈暗示它们与元素之土存在关联。其余能力则几乎与土元素无关，反而聚焦于玄学上的精魂与心灵的奥秘。

关于君龙为何演变至此，尚无明确解释。有人推测这或许是某种为实现个人野心的交易，他们从选拔统治者的角色变为了统治者本身。也有人猜测天夏大地曾在过去遭受腐化，土元素龙为自保而背弃了元素本性。或许它们也曾化作圣天龙，却因凡间未现合格统治者而重返尘世。

Sanctified Sight.name: 祝圣视觉 Sanctified Sight
Sanctified Sight.description: 君龙能够自动侦测出一个生物，效果或物品是否受祝，以及其为圣洁还是邪秽。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Mentalist Counterspell.name: 反制心灵法术 Mentalist Counterspell
Mentalist Counterspell.description:
触发 君龙成为他能意识到的心灵法术的目标

效果 君龙立即尝试反制触发效果（反制调整值[[/r 1d20+32 #Counteract]]{+32}，反制环级10环级）。

Violent Retort.name: 以牙还牙 Violent Retort
Violent Retort.description:
触发 一个君龙触及范围内的生物对龙造成了重击

效果 在应用了对龙的所有重击效果之后，君龙对该生物进行一次爪抓或尾扫打击。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
君龙可以变为任意大型或更小体型类人生物的外貌。这不会改变其速度或打击的攻击和伤害加值，但可能会改变其打击造成的伤害类型（通常为钝击）。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Gleaming Armor.name: 耀目宝甲 Gleaming Armor
Gleaming Armor.description:
频率 每小时一次

效果 君龙的护甲散发出金光。君龙在AC上获得+2状态加值，并获得对酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰和音波伤害的25点抗力。@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]范围内每个敌人都必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:46]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]。所有这些效果持续到龙的下个回合结束。

Inspire Envoy.name: 激励特使 Inspire Envoy
Inspire Envoy.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 君龙选择一名凡人并赐予其威严的祝福，以换取该生物去完成一项特殊指令，例如击败暴君或保护圣地。如果该生物同意，直到其下次每日准备，它在由龙选择的以下一项上获得+3状态加值：攻击骰，AC，或以下全部：察觉，意志豁免和基于魅力的技能检定。龙可以解消此增益，如果凡人胆敢违抗龙的指令，他就会迅速这么做。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.YDJnC3Bdc2GI6hX5]

Sovereign's Rebuke.name: 君王训诫 Sovereign's Rebuke
Sovereign's Rebuke.description: 君龙释放一道充满精神能量的吼叫，对@Template[type:cone|distance:60]范围造成@Damage[24d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:46|basic]豁免）。豁免失败的生物还将陷入1轮@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]（或大失败时被龙@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]1轮）。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sovereign's Rebuke]]{1d4轮}内再次使用君王训诫。

Sage Archdragon.name: Sage Archdragon

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Spells

Divert Essence.name: Divert Essence
Divert Essence.description:
Trigger A creature within 90 feet Casts a Spell that targets the dragon

Effect The sage dragon steals energy from the spell to protect itself, gaining resistance to damage from spells equal to the triggering spell's rank until the beginning of their next turn.

Eldritch Interference.name: Eldritch Interference
Eldritch Interference.description:
90 feet, @Check[will|dc:40].

Overlapping fields near the dragon make spellcasting unpredictable. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's eldritch interference for 1 minute.

Critical Success For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they gain a status bonus to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For 1 round, when the creature Casts a Spell that either deals damage or restores Hit Points, they take a status penalty to the spell's damage or healing equal to the spell's rank.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Reveal Shame.name: Reveal Shame
Reveal Shame.description:
Requirements The dragon has successfully Recalled Knowledge about an enemy within 90 feet

Effect The dragon utters an embarrassing secret about the creature, unnerving them and their allies. Every enemy within 90 feet that can hear the secret must attempt a @Check[will|dc:44] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}. Sanguine Knowledge As young sage dragon.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Overwhelming Proclamation whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Endless Spellscales.name: Endless Spellscales
Endless Spellscales.description:
1 to 3

The dragon expends a spell inscribed on one of their scales, casting a common spell of 7th rank or lower from any tradition, using the spell's typical number of actions and their spell DC.

Mystic Facility.name: Mystic Facility
Mystic Facility.description: The dragon can activate scrolls and wands of any tradition as if the spells they contain were occult spells.

Overwhelming Proclamation.name: Overwhelming Proclamation
Overwhelming Proclamation.description: The dragon exclaims hidden truths that only they have been able to understand, dealing @Damage[22d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[will|dc:44|basic] save). On a critical failure, creatures are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. The dragon can't use Overwhelming Proclamation again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Overwhelming Proclamation]]{1d4 rounds}.

Reflexive Understanding.name: Reflexive Understanding
Reflexive Understanding.description:
Frequency once per hour

Requirements The dragon was targeted by a spell of 9th rank or lower in the last round

Effect The dragon analyzes the spell's inner workings. For the next 10 minutes, the dragon can cast the spell at the same rank as if it were one of their innate occult spells.

Sanguine Knowledge.name: Sanguine Knowledge
Sanguine Knowledge.description: The first time each encounter a dragon hits and deals damage to a creature with their jaws Strike, they receive information about the creature as if the dragon had succeeded at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about that creature.

Sage Archdragon.publicNotes:
A shining, rune-inscribed scale is all that most people, even adventurers, see of a sage dragon during their lifetimes. Even then, only those familiar with dragon lore will likely recognize the scale as anything other than an elaborate spell scroll. Collectors and scholars of esoteric lore, sage dragons become increasingly reclusive as they age, and, even in their youths, they're prone to work through trusted intermediaries. For those able to locate and gain the trust of such a creature, even the youngest sage dragons are fonts of difficult-to-find knowledge and rare magical techniques. The oldest sage dragons are living combinations of gargantuan libraries and endless grimoires, accumulating the secrets of the Universe, and beyond, in their isolated lairs.

Organized and methodical, with an insatiable curiosity and eidetic memory, sage dragons are the devout researchers of the dragon world. The intellectual pursuits of sage dragons demand extended periods of quiet study, one of the reasons that such dragons live in isolated, hidden locations. Young dragons tend to specialize in a particular area of research. As they age, these research interests also broaden, with an expert in a particular river expanding into topics such as the water cycle, ecology, or the Plane of Water. Sage dragons interested in religious topics often worship Nethys or a god dedicated to knowledge, such as Gruhastha, Qi Zhong, or Ydajisk. Dragons who seek grim rituals or cryptic knowledge might join the church of Abraxas or worship Norgorber in his aspect of the Reaper of Reputation.

Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy
Coiling Frenzy.description: 森龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，森龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当森龙在一次打击中造成重击时，他充能其蔚蓝虫群吐息。

Draining Blight.name: 流失枯萎 Draining Blight
Draining Blight.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 森龙从周围的活物身上吸取水分来治愈自己的伤口。@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内的所有活物受到@Damage[12d10[void]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。完全由水和植物构成的生物使用比掷骰结果更差一级的成功度。森龙恢复等同于对该效果本次造成的所有伤害里最高的伤害数值的一半的生命值。区域内所有非生物植物枯萎死亡，清除所有非魔法灌木和所有因此产生的困难地形，掩蔽和隐蔽。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Metal.name: 为金所克 Countered by Metal
Countered by Metal.description: 如果森龙受到来自金属物品或具有金特征效果的伤害，他将失去林地通行和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zlnXpME1T2uvn8Lr]直到其下个回合结束。

Fed by Water.name: 由水而生 Fed by Water
Fed by Water.description:
频率 每小时一次

触发 森龙成为一个水法术或效果的目标

效果 森龙获得60点临时生命值，持续1分钟。

Frightful Presence.name: 恐怖威压 Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description:
90尺，@Check[will|dc:45]。具有动物，真菌和植物特征的生物在豁免时承受-2环境减值。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Azure Swarm Breath.name: 蔚蓝虫群吐息 Azure Swarm Breath
Azure Swarm Breath.description: 森龙放出一群昆虫对@Template[type:cone|distance:60]范围造成@Damage[20d6[piercing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）随后消散开来。豁免大失败的生物受到@Damage[4d6[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage]伤害。森龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Azure Swarm Breath]]{1d4轮}内再次使用蔚蓝虫群吐息。

Forest Shape.name: 森林形态 Forest Shape
Forest Shape.description: 当施放@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]时，森龙可以变成体型和年龄与他们自身相同的树木，使用其自己的AC。

Lignifying Bite.name: 化木噬咬 Lignifying Bite
Lignifying Bite.description: 当由血肉构成的生物被森龙的颚咬打击削减至0点生命值，该生物必须尝试一次@Check[fortitude|dc:45]豁免。如果失败，它就会死亡，它的血肉，玄学上视为土属相，将转变为木质。这块木头还是活着的，随着时间推移可能会长成树，但它不能视作尸体或尸体的部分以用作@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG]或其他能使得生物复生的魔法。

Ultimate Remedy.name: 济世良方 Ultimate Remedy
Ultimate Remedy.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 森龙能治愈大部分病痛。森龙尝试一次@Check[nature]检定来反制影响30尺内一个生物的一种疾病或毒素。

Woodland Passage.name: 林地通行 Woodland Passage
Woodland Passage.description: 森龙忽视由非魔法植物和真菌形成的困难地形和高等困难地形，例如灌木，藤蔓和林下植被。

Forest Archdragon.name: 至古森龙 Forest Archdragon
Forest Archdragon.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+2状态加值

Stormcrown Archdragon.name: Stormcrown Archdragon
Stormcrown Archdragon.publicNotes:
Heralds of—and heralded by—the primal forces of thunder and lightning, stormcrown dragons meld the majesty of fierce storms and mighty dragons. Driven by emotion and curiosity, these mercurial dragons can change from friend to foe or threatening to thoughtful in mere moments.

While no strangers to the personality traits for which dragons are well-known—pride, imperiousness, desire for lovely things, and so on—stormcrown dragons are by nature gregarious, even jovial. Indeed, these dragons often mingle with local communities or extend invitations for everything from raucous feasts to elegant soirees. To offend a stormcrown dragon, however, is most unwise. Insults to the dragon's hospitality or friendship, assertions of authority, and demands on them are all likely to elicit a tempestuous response, in every sense of the word. Cursed metamorphosis is a personal favorite of older stormcrown dragons for the disrespectful and demanding, forcing shapes on them more befitting their insignificance. A stormcrown dragon's fury often passes as suddenly as it arises, however, particularly when dulled by a suitable display of contrition.

Motionsense.name: Motionsense
Motionsense.description: A stormcrown dragon can detect the movement of nearby creatures through vibration and air movement. This precise sense works only against creatures and objects that moved in the previous round.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Superconductor.name: Superconductor
Superconductor.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted by an attack or spell

Effect The dragon uses the displaced air or magical trajectory of the attack as a channel for its electrical energy. The dragon attempts a storm bolt Strike against the attacker, regardless of range.

Command Lightning.name: Command Lightning
Command Lightning.description:
Requirements The dragon's last action was to use Draconic Frenzy or Cast a Spell with the air or electricity trait and they're in an area of stormy weather

Effect The dragon directs a bolt of lightning at a creature within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[5d12[electricity]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save.

Coronal Cloak.name: Coronal Cloak
Coronal Cloak.description: When the dragon spends an action to Hover while in stormy weather, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} until they move or until the beginning of their next turn, whichever comes first.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges Galvanic Barrage whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Furious Cloudburst.name: Furious Cloudburst
Furious Cloudburst.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The dragon must be outdoors and aboveground

Effect The dragon exhales a massive bolt of lightning directly upward to create a terrible storm centered on the dragon. Strong winds blow in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:120] that lasts for 10 minutes; this creates greater difficult terrain for both flying creatures and creatures on the ground. Creatures in the area except for the dragon take a –2 circumstance penalty to Acrobatics and Perception checks and a –4 circumstance penalty to ranged attacks due to the wind and rain. This counts as stormy weather for the dragon's Command Lightning and Coronal Cloak, and the dragon can Command Lightning once per turn as a single action (instead of a free action that requires using Draconic Frenzy or Casting a Spell).

Galvanic Barrage.name: Galvanic Barrage
Galvanic Barrage.description: The dragon exhales a massive bolt of lightning at one creature within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[12d12[electricity]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save. The lightning then arcs to a creature of the dragon's choice within 60 feet of the previous target with the same effect. The dragon can't target the same creature more than once, and they must have line of effect to all targets. The bolt can continue to arc this way until the dragon runs out of targets or until a target critically succeeds at their save. The dragon can't use Galvanic Barrage again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Galvanic Barrage]]{1d4 rounds}.

Smooth Flying.name: Smooth Flying
Smooth Flying.description: The stormcrown dragon doesn't fall if they don't Fly during their turn, and they're unaffected by strong winds or similar effects unless they choose to be.

Storm Howl.name: Storm Howl
Storm Howl.description: Whenever a creature critically fails a save against one of the stormcrown dragon's abilities that deals electricity damage, that creature is also permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}.

Violent Retort.name: 以牙还牙 Violent Retort
Violent Retort.description:
触发 一个君龙触及范围内的生物对龙造成了重击

效果 在应用了对龙的所有重击效果之后，君龙对该生物进行一次爪抓或尾扫打击。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
君龙可以变为任意大型或更小体型类人生物的外貌。这不会改变其速度或打击的攻击和伤害加值，但可能会改变其打击造成的伤害类型（通常为钝击）。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Coiling Frenzy.description: 君龙对一个目标以任意顺序进行一次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。如果任意一次打击命中，君龙立即以自由动作尝试用该肢体擒获目标。龙可以同时至多使三个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]；两只前爪各擒获一个，尾巴擒获一个。
Coiling Frenzy.name: 盘绕狂暴 Coiling Frenzy

Sanctified Sight.name: 祝圣视觉 Sanctified Sight
Sanctified Sight.description: 君龙能够自动侦测出一个生物，效果或物品是否受祝，以及其为圣洁还是邪秽。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 当君龙在一次打击中造成重击时，他充能其君王训诫。

Gleaming Armor.name: 耀目宝甲 Gleaming Armor
Gleaming Armor.description:
频率 每小时一次

效果 君龙的护甲散发出金光。君龙在AC上获得+2状态加值，并获得对酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰和音波伤害的10点抗力。@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]范围内每个敌人都必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:30]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]。所有这些效果持续到龙的下个回合结束。

Sovereign's Rebuke.name: 君王训诫 Sovereign's Rebuke
Sovereign's Rebuke.description: 君龙释放一道充满精神能量的吼叫，对@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围造成@Damage[12d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:30|basic]豁免）。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Sovereign's Rebuke]]{1d4轮}内再次使用君王训诫。

Sovereign Dragon (Young).name: 青年君龙 Sovereign Dragon (Young)
Sovereign Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
据说曾有纯粹的土元素龙类存在。这些帝龙如同其他元素龙一样来到物质宇宙，生老病死，其躯体最终化作大陆的一部分。正如火元素化作熔岩，木元素化作森林，水元素汇成海洋湖泊，金元素化作珍贵矿脉，土元素终成大地、岩石与山岳。依循逻辑推演，若当今世间尚存此类环境与存在，那么土元素龙必然存在。抑或曾在远古时代存在过。

然而如今帝龙之中，唯有君龙在死亡时会留下蛇形骸骨，而非岩石、石块或泥土。龙的内在施法能力，对未加热铁器的弱点等特征，强烈暗示它们与元素之土存在关联。其余能力则几乎与土元素无关，反而聚焦于玄学上的精魂与心灵的奥秘。

关于君龙为何演变至此，尚无明确解释。有人推测这或许是某种为实现个人野心的交易，他们从选拔统治者的角色变为了统治者本身。也有人猜测天夏大地曾在过去遭受腐化，土元素龙为自保而背弃了元素本性。或许它们也曾化作圣天龙，却因凡间未现合格统治者而重返尘世。

Breath of Fresh Air.description: The dragon unleashes a stream of magical bubbles in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Each creature within the area takes @Damage[7d8[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:29|basic] save). A creature who fails the save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as they give in to the joyful urge to dance, sing, laugh, or admire the world around them. On a critical failure, the creature is slowed 1 for 1 minute and can't use reactions for as long as they are slowed; they can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turn to end the slowed condition early.
Breath of Fresh Air.name: Breath of Fresh Air

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Lover of the Arts.name: Lover of the Arts
Lover of the Arts.description: Checks by or against the dragon to change a creature's attitude using Diplomacy can be attempted with Performance instead.

Whimsysense.name: Whimsysense
Whimsysense.description: Delight dragons can sense the presence of laughter, games, celebrations, and sweets within the listed range.

+2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves Vs. Divine

Play Scape.name: Play Scape
Play Scape.description:
15 feet. Delight dragon magic alters their surroundings, turning weapons into toys and spells into stage effects. All Strikes and other damaging effects used in the aura gain the nonlethal trait and are accompanied by magical sound effects. A creature entering or beginning their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save.

Failure The creature's first damaging effect (such as a Strike) this round does half damage.

Critical Failure All the creature's damaging effects this turn do half damage.

Reactive Tail.name: Reactive Tail
Reactive Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon attempts an Athletics check to [[/act trip]] the triggering creature. This check doesn't count toward the dragon's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this check.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon scores a critical hit with a Strike, they recharge their Breath of Fresh Air.

Delight Dragon (Young).name: Delight Dragon (Young)
Delight Dragon (Young).publicNotes:
Some would say delight dragons are like children. They would be correct. At least, as correct as if they said a puff of chimney smoke resembled a massive storm cloud or compared a toddler's drawing of a horse to a prized thoroughbred. Which is to say, they are completely and utterly incorrect. Of course, having a smoke cloud or child's drawing running around one's home might be vastly preferable to a delight dragon.

As residents of the Outer Plane Elysium, delight dragons are embodiments of the plane's proclivity toward joy, mischief, passion, and spontaneity. Their massive gossamer wings refract the light of a thousand rainbows between translucent layers. Purple-green scales shimmer in opalescent splendor, while a long, sinuous tail flicks in spiral figures, darting to catch the feet out from under distracted observers. A pair of feathery antennae direct the delight dragon to their next source of amusement—whether play, treat, or general amusement, all surely to become a great time in the dragon's presence, whether a plane's denizens know it or not.

As self-proclaimed defenders of games, whimsy, and the freedom to sow a little chaos, delight dragons are often found on the front line against those that would strip such choice away from others. Demonic forces deployed at the Worldwound whispered of the "lights of doom," massive rainbows that heralded the approach of a delight dragon. The winged crusader would descend upon these fiends with claws and fangs, cackling all the while.
Delight Dragon (Young).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 水波感知（模糊）60尺 Wavesense (Imprecise) 60 feet

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Countered by Earth.name: 为土所克 Countered by Earth
Countered by Earth.description: 如果海龙成为具有土特征的法术的目标，液化将会结束，他不能使用之直到其下个回合结束。

Fed by Metal.name: 由金而生 Fed by Metal
Fed by Metal.description:
当海龙被具有金特征的法术或生物的无武装打击，或金属武器伤害时，其鳞片会发生变化，这会赋予他在AC上+1物品加值直到其下个回合开始。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.OMJnZspk5YHai8yn]

Liquefy.name: 液化 Liquefy
Liquefy.description:
触发 龙受到火焰伤害

效果 龙瞬间变成水同时维持其形状。他获得火焰伤害抗力20（包括对抗触发效果时），直到其下个回合结束。

Vortex.name: 涡流 Vortex
Vortex.description: 60尺。灵光范围内，与龙处于同一水体的水对于没有水特征的生物游泳时来说视作困难地形。

Black Water Breath.name: 黑水吐息 Black Water Breath
Black Water Breath.description: 龙向60尺内射出一个对@Template[burst|distance:30]范围造成@Damage[18d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害的水球（@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。半径内所有非魔法火焰会被熄灭。龙不能在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4轮}内再次使用黑水吐息。

Hyponatremia.name: 低血钠症 Hyponatremia
Hyponatremia.description: 一个受到来自海龙颚咬打击伤害的活物必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:38]豁免，否则会因为体内激增的水量而陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}。

Tidal Wave.name: 潮涌 Tidal Wave
Tidal Wave.description:
频率 每10分钟一次

效果 龙拍打自己的身体，向外发出一道滔天巨浪。这道波浪对@Template[type:emanation|distance:90]范围造成@Damage[10d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害。区域内每个生物必须尝试一次@Check[reflex|dc:38]豁免。区域内的构造物和无主物体无需豁免承受全额伤害。

大成功 该生物不受伤害但被推离龙30尺。

成功 该生物受到一半伤害并被推离龙60尺。

失败 该生物受到全额伤害并被推离龙120尺，并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。

大失败 同失败但受到双倍伤害。

Sea Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: 古海龙施法者 Sea Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Sea Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
海帝龙与水元素相连，掌管着雨水、风暴、江河与海洋。他们栖息于天夏文明的附近，随时准备协助凡间事务以证明自身价值。对某些海龙而言，在天气与奥术知识方面提供帮助是职责所在。对另一些则不过是获取珍贵贡品或美味佳肴的动机。前来求见者皆热切献礼，因传说海龙欢愉时，雨水便会柔和丰沛。反之，若他们愤怒时，风暴将肆虐无情。

尽管天夏人普遍如此认为，但文明绝非受制于海龙的摆布，因为大多数海龙都是王国的臣子，宣誓协助凡人。绝大多数海龙都是四海龙王之一的臣子，这些龙王的领地或联合王国分别坐落于因拜罗洋（Embaral Ocean），象牙海（Ivory Sea），御海洋（Okaiyo Ocean），颂寂海（Songil Sea）。鉴于水元素位面本无原生海龙，有理论认为这些王国可能是从无际之海（Boundless Sea）大规模迁徙的残余势力。海龙自身的传说记载，远古之王曾为逃避元素领主凯利赞德里的迫害而立下誓言。尽管尚不确定咸水帝王是否仍在追杀海龙，但多数海龙仍恪守誓约作为其文化传承，或为纪念先祖荣光。
Sea Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Volcanic Purge.name: Volcanic Purge
Volcanic Purge.description:
If the next action the dragon uses is Pyroclastic Breath, the magma clings to those it damages. Each creature that fails its save against Pyroclastic Breath takes @Damage[4d6[persistent,fire]] damage, and as long as it has this persistent fire damage, it also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7qoZauizAKfPIXeu]{Effect: Volcanic Purge}

Pyroclastic Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of magma that deals @Damage[7d6[fire],4d12[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] in a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|basic|dc:33|options:area-effect]). They can't use Pyroclastic Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4#Recharge Pyroclastic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}
Pyroclastic Breath.name: Pyroclastic Breath

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Wing Deflection.name: Wing Deflection
Wing Deflection.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon raises a wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is Flying, they descend 10 feet after the attack.

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of a Medium humanoid. This does not change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Magma Burrow.name: Magma Burrow
Magma Burrow.description: A magma dragon's burrow Speed functions only when the dragon is Burrowing through magma or molten lava.

Magma Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: Magma Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Magma Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Wailing Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Canny, patient, and creative, wailing dragons are adepts of sound and psychology. With both their physiology and innate connection to arcane magic allowing them to produce and shape sound waves, these reclusive creatures are heard much more often than seen. Named for their tendency to use uncanny keening vocalizations to communicate across long distances and startle prey, wailing dragons haunt locations that create interesting or useful echoes, such as canyons or caverns. Though ruthless predators when needed, most wailing dragons devote their energy toward investigating the effects sound has on the environment and the bodies and minds of creatures.

Minstrels, divas, and tunesmiths seek out these creatures during their mating season, when two dragons sing courtship ballads full of intricate harmonies. While this might be the performance of a lifetime, it's a dangerous concert, as incautious audience members frequently become meals for the nuptial couple. (The famous Chelaxian composer, Gretezi Valtros, disappeared on such an expedition in 4275 ar, after he set out to teach a wailing dragon High Azlanti and "instruct it in the decorous art of opera.") Most creatures also find the close-range subsonic vibrations emitted by wailing dragons extremely uncomfortable, reinforcing the idea that it's best to observe them from a distance.
Wailing Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Wailing Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)

Echolocation.name: Echolocation
Echolocation.description: A wailing dragon can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Auditory and Sonic

Destructive Interference.name: Destructive Interference
Destructive Interference.description:
Trigger A foe within 90 feet uses an auditory or sonic effect

Effect The young wailing dragon releases a burst of noise, attempting to drown out the triggering sound. It makes a counteract check against the effect (counteract rank 8, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+28 #Counteract]]{+28}).

Subsonic Drone.name: Subsonic Drone
Subsonic Drone.description:
90 feet, A creature who enters or begins their turn in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's subsonic drone for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

Eerie Call.name: Eerie Call
Eerie Call.description:
Requirements The dragon is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or undetected

Effect The dragon's wail draws in unsuspecting opponents. Anyone that can hear the Eerie Call must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the sound. A fascinated creature must spend at least 1 action Seeking the dragon each turn, and the dragon can Sustain this affect for up to 1 minute

Natural Mimic.name: Natural Mimic
Natural Mimic.description: The dragon can imitate any sound or voice that it has heard. This has the effect of 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.yV7Ouzaoe7DHLESI]{Ventriloquism} (DC 36) but is a nonmagical effect.

Resounding Roar.name: Resounding Roar
Resounding Roar.description:
The dragon unleashes a thunderous call that deals @Damage[16d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic] save). On a critical failure, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute.

In addition, if the area overlaps with an area of magical silence or includes a creature affected by magical silence, the roar attempts to counteract the silence effect (counteract rank 8, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+28 #Counteract]]{+28}).

The dragon can't use Resounding Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Resounding Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

Reverberating Rush.name: Reverberating Rush
Reverberating Rush.description: The dragon Flies three times. The dragon gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. Any creature that is adjacent to the dragon at any point during its movement takes @Damage[8d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 hour. A creature can be affected only once per Reverberating Rush.

Master of Clouds.name: Master of Clouds
Master of Clouds.description:
Trigger The dragon rolls initiative

Effect A cloud dragon controls their element as easily as they breathe. The dragon uses Dragonmist twice.

Shapes in the Fog.description: With a cloud dragon's mastery of their element, creating shapes and images in a fog is child's play. All creatures within or adjacent to one cloud of dragonmist must attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round (on a critical failure, they are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}).
Shapes in the Fog.name: Shapes in the Fog

Thundercloud Breath.name: Thundercloud Breath
Thundercloud Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a thundercloud that deals @Damage[20d6[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic] save). They can't use Thundercloud Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Thundercloud Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

The cloud remains in the area for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, with the effects of Dragonmist.

Mist Vision.name: Mist Vision
Mist Vision.description: Fog and mist don't impair a cloud dragon's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from fog and mist.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horn Strike in any order.

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Thundercloud Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Dragonmist.name: Dragonmist
Dragonmist.description: The dragon conjures up a sudden mist in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 120 feet. All creatures within the mist become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the mist become concealed to creatures within it. The dragon can use this action again to dismiss the mist—anyone else attempting to remove the dragonmist (via gust of wind or similar) must succeed at a counteract check. An ancient dragon can have up to five clouds of dragonmist active at a time.

Mist Step.name: Mist Step
Mist Step.description:
Requirements The dragon is within a cloud of dragonmist

Effect The dragon dissolves into wisps of cloud, reforming within another cloud of dragonmist within 1 mile.

Cloud Dragon (Ancient).name: Cloud Dragon (Ancient)
Cloud Dragon (Ancient).allSaves: 对魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Crystal Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Crystal Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Crystal Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

+2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal

Cobblegems.name: Cobblegems
Cobblegems.description: 10 feet. The dragon constantly sheds crystalline scales onto the ground around it. The area is uneven ground (DC 38).

Shielding Stone.name: Shielding Stone
Shielding Stone.description:
Trigger A creature at least 10 feet away from the dragon targets them with an attack

Requirements The dragon is on the ground and there is at least one unoccupied square between themself and the attacker

Effect The dragon conjures a thin slab of stone in an unoccupied square between themself and the attacker. The dragon gains standard cover against the triggering attack. The stone falls on the first person other than the dragon who enters that square, dealing @Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save. Otherwise, it crumbles harmlessly after 1 round.

Shimmering Armor.name: Shimmering Armor
Shimmering Armor.description: When the dragon takes a critical hit from any attack that deals physical damage, its hide chips, releasing sharp slivers. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] take @Damage[16d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:38|basic|options:area-effect] save.

Crystallize.name: Crystallize
Crystallize.description: The claws and tail of a crystal archdragon embed shards that slowly turns the flesh of those they Strike to crystal. The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:38|options:inflicts:petrified,inflicts:slowed] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. Further failed saves against crystallize increase the slowed condition. Once a creature's actions are reduced to 0 by crystallize, that creature becomes petrified, turned into crystal instead of stone.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Ornamental Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Lustrous Lunge.name: Lustrous Lunge
Lustrous Lunge.description: The dragon strikes a pose that makes its hide sparkle in the light. Each creature within 20 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:38|inflicts:dazzled] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Ornamental Breath.name: Ornamental Breath
Ornamental Breath.description: The dragon exhales a torrent of shattered rocks and minerals in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] dealing @Damage[19d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:41|options:area-effect,inflicts:clumsy] save). A creature who fails the save is weighed down by the stones, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure).

Shard Spray.name: Shard Spray
Shard Spray.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The crystal archdragon makes 2 tail Strikes, both using its current multiple attack penalty, then spins in a circle, releasing crystalline projectiles. All creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] take @Damage[9d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature who critically fails the save is also exposed to crystallize. This counts as two attacks when calculating the dragon's multiple attack penalty.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.description: The dragon can Hide in natural environments even if they don't have cover.

Captivating Display.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The dragon opens the fins on their head, creating a radiant display of enthralling colors. Each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:46] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) for 1 round. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to Captivating Display for 1 minute.
Captivating Display.name: Captivating Display

Hallucinatory Breath.name: Hallucinatory Breath
Hallucinatory Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a cloud that assaults the senses and deals @Damage[21d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:60] (@Check[will|dc:46|options:area-effect] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure) and is then temporarily immune to being confused by Hallucinatory Breath for 1 hour.

The dragon can't use Hallucinatory Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hallucinatory Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Lunging Bite.name: Lunging Bite
Lunging Bite.description: The dragon lunges their head forward, making a jaws Strike with an extended reach of 25 feet.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The dragon's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} targets.

Illusion Sense.name: Illusion Sense
Illusion Sense.description: When the dragon moves within 30 feet of an illusion that can be disbelieved, they automatically attempt a secret check to disbelieve, even if they didn't spend an action to Interact.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Scintillating Defense.name: Scintillating Defense
Scintillating Defense.description:
Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack

Effect The dragon flashes their iridescent scales at the triggering creature to throw off the attack. The dragon gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} against the triggering attack.

Aura of Isolation.name: Aura of Isolation
Aura of Isolation.description: 60 feet. The mirage dragon warps the light around them, confounding their foes' vision. A creature who enters or begins its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:42] save or treat all its allies as undetected by sight for 1 round (though it can use its other senses to ascertain their whereabouts).

Mirage Archdragon (Spellcaster).name: Mirage Archdragon (Spellcaster)
Mirage Archdragon (Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Mirage dragons are masters of illusion magic and use their powers to deceive others and further their own agendas. In addition to their magical prowess, mirage dragons possess a number of additional features to help them on hunts or mislead attackers, such as their camouflaging scales and a hallucinatory breath that can confound multiple foes at once. Mirage dragons are vain and egotistical figures. They ultimately care more about themselves than others.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Mirage Archdragon (Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

Crystal Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: Crystal Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Crystal Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Ornamental Breath.name: Ornamental Breath
Ornamental Breath.description: The dragon exhales a torrent of shattered rocks and minerals in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] dealing @Damage[16d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:37|options:area-effect,inflicts:clumsy] save). A creature who fails the save is weighed down by the stones, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure).

+2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal.name: +2 Status To All Saves vs. Primal

Cobblegems.name: Cobblegems
Cobblegems.description: 10 feet. The dragon constantly sheds crystalline scales onto the ground around it. The area is uneven ground (DC 34).

Shielding Stone.name: Shielding Stone
Shielding Stone.description:
Trigger A creature at least 10 feet away from the dragon targets them with an attack

Requirements The dragon is on the ground and there is at least one unoccupied square between themself and the attacker

Effect The dragon conjures a thin slab of stone in an unoccupied square between themself and the attacker. The dragon gains standard cover against the triggering attack. The stone falls on the first person other than the dragon who enters that square, dealing @Damage[8d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:34|basic] save. Otherwise, it crumbles harmlessly after 1 round.

Shimmering Armor.name: Shimmering Armor
Shimmering Armor.description: When the dragon takes a critical hit from any attack that deals physical damage, its hide chips, releasing sharp slivers. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] take @Damage[13d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect] save.

Crystallize.name: Crystallize
Crystallize.description: The claws of an ancient crystal dragon embed shards that slowly turns the flesh of those they Strike to crystal. The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:34|options:inflicts:petrified,inflicts:slowed] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute. Further failed saves against crystallize increase the slowed condition. Once a creature's actions are reduced to 0 by crystallize, that creature becomes petrified, turned into crystal instead of stone.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Ornamental Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

Lustrous Lunge.name: Lustrous Lunge
Lustrous Lunge.description: The dragon strikes a pose that makes its hide sparkle in the light. Each creature within 20 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:34|inflicts:dazzled] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Executor Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: Executor Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Executor Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes:
Legends state the first executor dragons formed from the rage-filled screams of Sarenrae during her struggle against the Rough Beast. In the face of an enemy even she had no hope of redeeming, the ever-compassionate Dawnflower allowed her divine fury to escape from her lips as she struck down the primordial god, and from this act of anathema, the first executor dragons were given form. Since that moment, executor dragons represent the full wrath of the gods. Divine in nature, executor dragons typically appear to punish those who have strayed so far from the path of their deity's edicts as to begin embracing the anathema. Due to their potent nature as weapons of the divine, executor dragons are generally drawn to target not a single misbehaving follower, but entire villages, cities, or towns that have turned their backs on their gods. Many of the gods prefer not to use executor dragons as part of their punishment of mortal transgressors, and instead keep them reserved for the days of apocalyptic battles.

Though many believe executor dragons are spawned from divine magic, they are fully biological creatures. Compelled by faith and devotion and disgusted by hypocrisy and base cruelty, executor dragons tend to live near human settlements, but rarely within them. They form small familial groups when young, but grow more independent as they age, seeking to claim territory uninhabited by other dragons. Their chosen lairs tend to be locations secreted away, either in the ruins of mountaintop monasteries or in the cavernous depths beneath abandoned places of worship. For the few executor dragons that live actively among non-draconic peoples, even fewer do so in their natural forms. They are sometimes found living disguised as traveling lay priests who bring healing and alms for the needy, choristers singing hymnals, wandering monastic scholars who ask challenging and conflicted questions about faith, or quiet church custodians who protect and beautify their chosen houses of worship. It's said that one or more executor dragons might have even taken up the defense of Kenebres after its near destruction at the hands of the Khorramzadeh, Storm King of the Worldwound.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Rage of the Divine.name: Rage of the Divine
Rage of the Divine.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect Raw divine power flashes through the executor dragon harming anyone who dares strike it so brazenly. The creature who dealt the triggering attack takes @Damage[4d8[spirit]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:25|basic] save.

Divine Utterance.name: Divine Utterance
